Review: plot two teen couples go church party drink and then drive they get into an accident one of the guys dies but his girlfriend continues see him in her life and has nightmares what is the deal watch the movie and sorta find out critique mindfuck movie for the teen generation that touches on very cool idea but presents it in very bad package is what makes this review an even harder one write since generally applaud films attempt break the mold mess your head and such lost highway memento but there are good and bad ways of making all types of films and these folks just did not snag this one correctly they seem have taken this pretty neat concept but executed it terribly so what are the problems the movie well its main problem is that it is simply too jumbled it starts off normal but then downshifts into this fantasy world in you as an audience member have no idea what is going on there are dreams there are characters coming back from the dead there are others who look like the dead there are strange apparitions there are disappearances there are looooot of chase scenes there are tons of weird things that happen and most of it is simply not explained now personally do not mind trying unravel every now and then but when all it does is give me the same clue over and over again get kind of fed up after while is this films biggest problem it is obviously got this big secret hide but it seems want hide it completely until its final five minutes and do they make things entertaining thrilling or even engaging in the meantime not really the sad part is that the arrow and both dig on flicks like this so we actually figured most of it out the halfway point so all of the strangeness after that did start make little bit of sense but it still did not the make the all that more entertaining guess the bottom line movies like this is that you should always make sure that the audience is into it even before they are given the secret password enter your world of understanding mean showing melissa sagemiller running away from visions for about minutes throughout the movie is just plain lazy okay we get it there are people chasing her and we do not know who they are do we really need see it over and over again how about giving us different scenes offering further insight into all of the strangeness going down in the movie apparently the studio took this away from its director and chopped it up themselves and it shows there might have been pretty decent teen mindfuck movie in here somewhere but guess the suits decided that turning it into music video little edge would make more sense the actors are pretty good for the most part although wes bentley just seemed be playing the exact same character that he did in american beauty only in new neighborhood but my biggest kudos go out sagemiller who holds her own throughout the entire and actually has you feeling her characters unraveling overall the does not stick because it does not entertain it is confusing it rarely excites and it feels pretty redundant for most of its runtime despite pretty cool ending and explanation all of the craziness that came before it oh and the way this is not horror or teen slasher flick it is just packaged look that way because someone is apparently assuming that the genre is still hot the kids it also wrapped production two years ago and has been sitting on the shelves ever since whatever skip it where is joblo coming from nightmare of elm street blair witch the crow the crow salvation lost highway memento the others stir of echoes

the happy bastards quick movie review damn that yk bug it is got head start in this movie starring jamie lee curtis and another baldwin brother william this time in story regarding crew of tugboat that comes across deserted russian tech ship that has strangeness it when they kick the power back on little do they know the power within going for the gore and bringing on few action sequences here and there virus still feels very empty like movie going for all flash and no substance we do not know why the crew was really out in the middle of nowhere we do not know the origin of what took over the ship just that big pink flashy thing hit the mir and of course we do not know why donald sutherland is stumbling around drunkenly throughout here it is just hey let us chase these people around some robots the acting is below average even from the likes of curtis you are more likely get kick out of her work in halloween sutherland is wasted and baldwin well he is acting like baldwin of course the real star here are stan winstons robot design some schnazzy cgi and the occasional good gore shot like picking into someones brain so if robots and body parts really turn you on heres your movie otherwise it is pretty much sunken ship of movie

it is movies like these that make jaded movie viewer thankful for the invention of the timex indiglo watch based on the late television show the same name the mod squad tells the tale of three reformed criminals under the employ of the police go undercover however things go wrong as evidence gets stolen and they are immediately under suspicion of course the ads make it seem like so much more quick cuts cool music claire danes nice hair and cute outfits car chases stuff blowing up and the like sounds like cool movie does it not after the first fifteen minutes it quickly becomes apparent that it is not the mod squad is certainly slick looking production complete nice hair and costumes but that simply is not enough the is best described as cross between an hourlong cop show and music video both stretched out into the span of an hour and half and it comes every single clich it does not really matter that the is based on television show as most of the plot elements have been recycled from everything we have already seen the characters and acting is nothing spectacular sometimes even bordering on wooden claire danes and omar epps deliver their lines as if they are bored really transfers onto the audience the only one escape relatively unscathed is giovanni ribisi who plays the resident crazy man ultimately being the only thing worth watching unfortunately even he is not enough save this convoluted mess as all the characters do not do much apart from occupying screen time the young cast cool clothes nice hair and hip soundtrack it appears that the is geared towards the teenage mindset despite an american rating the content does not justify the is way too juvenile for the older mindset information on the characters is literally spoonfed the audience would it be that hard show us instead of telling us dialogue is poorly written and the plot is extremely predictable the way the progresses you likely will not even care if the heroes are in any jeopardy because you will know they are not basing the show on s television show that nobody remembers is of questionable wisdom especially when one considers the target audience and the fact that the number of memorable films based on television shows can be counted on one hand even one that is missing finger or two the number of times that checked my watch six is clear indication that this is not one of them it is clear that the is nothing more than an attempt cash in on the teenage spending dollar judging from the rash of really awful teenflicks that we have been seeing as of late avoid this at all costs

quest for camelot is warner bros first featurelength fullyanimated attempt steal clout from disneys cartoon empire but the mouse has no reason be worried the only other recent challenger their throne was last falls promising if flawed th century fox production anastasia but disneys hercules its lively cast and colorful palate had her beat handsdown when it came time crown best piece of animation this year it is no contest as quest for camelot is pretty much dead on arrival even the magic kingdom at its most mediocre that would be pocahontas for those of you keeping score is not nearly as dull as this the story revolves around the adventures of freespirited kayley voiced jessalyn gilsig the earlyteen daughter of belated knight from king arthurs round table kayleys only dream is follow in her fathers footsteps and she gets her chance when evil warlord ruber gary oldman an exround table membergonebad steals arthurs magical sword excalibur and accidentally loses it in dangerous boobytrapped forest the help of hunky blind timberlanddweller garrett carey elwes and twoheaded dragon eric idle and don rickles that is always arguing itself kayley just might be able break the medieval sexist mold and prove her worth as fighter on arthurs side quest for camelot is missing pure showmanship an essential element if it is ever expected climb the high ranks of disney there is nothing here that differentiates quest from something you would see on any given saturday morning cartoon subpar animation instantly forgettable songs poorlyintegrated computerized footage compare kayley and garretts runin the angry ogre hercs battle the hydra rest my case even the characters stink none of them are remotely interesting so much that the becomes race see one can outbland the others in the end it is tie they all win that dragons comedy shtick is awfully cloying but at least it shows signs of pulse at least fans of the earlys tgif television lineup will be thrilled find jaleel urkel white and bronson balki pinchot sharing the same footage few scenes are nicely realized though am at loss recall enough be specific and the actors providing the voice talent are enthusiastic though most are paired up singers who do not sound thing like them for their big musical moments jane seymour and celine dion but one must strain through too much of this mess find the good aside from the fact that children will probably be as bored watching this as adults quest for camelot most grievous error is its complete lack of personality and personality we learn from this mess goes very long way

synopsis mentally unstable man undergoing psychotherapy saves boy from potentially fatal accident and then falls in love the boys mother fledgling restauranteur unsuccessfully attempting gain the womans favor he takes pictures of her and kills number of people in his way comments stalked is yet another in seemingly endless string of spurnedpsychosgettingtheirrevenge type movies are stable category in the industry both theatrical and directtovideo their proliferation may be due in part the fact that they are typically inexpensive produce no special effects no big name stars and serve as vehicles flash nudity allowing them frequent latenight cable television stalked wavers slightly from the norm in one respect the psycho never actually has an affair on the contrary he is rejected rather quickly the psycho typically is an exlover exwife or exhusband other than that stalked is just another redundant entry doomed collect dust on video shelves and viewed after midnight on cable stalked does not provide much suspense though that is what it sets out do interspersed throughout the opening credits for instance serioussounding narrator spouts statistics about stalkers and ponders what may cause man stalk it is implicitly implied that all stalkers are men while pictures of boy are shown on the screen after these credits snapshot of actor jay underwood appears the narrator states that this is the story of daryl gleason and tells the audience that he is the stalker of course really this is the story of restauranteur brooke daniels if the movie was meant be about daryl then it should have been called stalker not stalked okay so we know who the stalker is even before the movie starts no guesswork required stalked proceeds then as it begins obvious obvious obvious the opening sequence contrived quite bit brings daryl and brooke the victim together daryl obsesses over brooke follows her around and tries woo her ultimately rejected her his plans become more and more desperate and elaborate these plans include the alltime psychoinlove cliche the murdered pet for some reason this genres films require dead pet be found the victim stalked stalked is no exception it is cat this time found in the shower events like these lead the inevitable showdown between stalker and stalked where only one survives guess who it invariably always is and you will guess the conclusion this turkey stalkeds cast is uniformly adequate not anything write home about but also not all that bad either jay underwood as the stalker turns toward melodrama bit too much he overdoes it in other words but he still manages be creepy enough pass as the type of stalker the story demands maryam dabo about the only actor close being star here she played the bond chick in the living daylights is equally adequate as the stalked of the title even though she seems too ditzy at times be strong independent businessowner brooke dabo needs be ditzy however for the plot proceed toward the end for example brooke has her suspicions about daryl ensure he will not use it as another excuse see her brooke decides return toolbox he had left at her place his house does she just leave the toolbox at the door when no one answers of course not she tries the door opens it and wanders around the house when daryl returns he enters the house of course so our heroine is in danger somehow even though her car is parked at the front of the house right the front door daryl is oblivious her presence inside the whole episode places an incredible strain on the audiences suspension of disbelief and questions the validity of either characters intelligence stalked receives two stars because even though it is highly derivative and somewhat boring it is not so bad that it cannot be watched rated mostly for several murder scenes and brief nudity in strip bar it is not as offensive as many other thrillers in this genre are if you are in the mood for good suspense though stake out something else

capsule in on the planet mars police taking into custody an accused murderer face the title menace there is lot of fighting and not whole lot of story otherwise john carpenter reprises so many ideas from his previous films especially assault on precinct that the new comes off as his homage himself john carpenter apparently believes that action scenes in people fight something horrible are the same as horror scenes for writer and director of horror films supposedly an expert on horror it is very bad mistake make ghosts of mars is called horror movie but it is more just drawn out fight between humans and surprisingly lowpowered alien menace in addition if anybody but john carpenter had made ghosts of mars carpenter would have grounds sue this is just chock full of pieces taken from assault on precinct the thing and prince of darkness it is in fact surprising that carpenter managed fit so many pieces of his previous work into this in such an admittedly novel way but that still does not make for really good science fiction experience ghosts of mars takes place in the year mars has been mostly terraformed so that humans can walk on the surface without breathing gear is good for the films budget it is never mentioned but the gravity on mars has been increased somehow earthnormal again making it easier society has changed bit that time but it has advanced surprisingly little apparently the culture has changed so that women are much more in positions of control and from carpenters view women have really made mess of things society has stagnated under female control so that beyond some minor technological advances society has changed less in years than we might expect it change in ten the basic plot of ghosts of mars has much in common that of assault on precinct except that precinct yes precinct has been replaced somewhat tacky looking rundown martian mining colony instead of having the criminal napolean wilson this has the criminal desolation williams instead of facing hoodlums automatic weapons the police face well ghosts of mars because the ghosts are somewhat alien in nature they should behave in some alien manner but they essentially behave as human savages in another lapse of imagination the story is told in flashback flashback within flashback and flashback within flashback within flashback ghosts of mars takes place entirely at night and is filmed almost entirely in tones of red yellow and black carpenter manages give us powerful opening scene showing mining train rushing through the martian night the sound of music heavy beat sadly what follows is not really up the buildup the terror he creates looks little too much like fugitive wannabes from the rock band kiss his idea of building suspense is having bunch of sudden jump scenes that sucker the viewer into thinking something scary is happening and then prove be just something boring these are standard haunted house shock effects that require no great talent give the audience somewhat newer but also unimpressive are the cgi digital decapitations in some of the fights within short stretch of time we have seen the release of mission mars red planet and ghosts of mars after mission mars was panned too many reviewers it looks better and better and better as time goes rate ghosts of mars on the scale and on the scale following the movie showed my wife who liked ghosts of mars moderately more than did carpenters classic assault on precinct her comment is that it was seeing the same twice

so ask yourself what mm eight millimeter is really all about is it about wholesome surveillance man who loses sight of his values after becoming enmeshed in the seedy sleazy underworld of hardcore pornography is it about the business itself how bubbling just beneath the surface of bigtown americana there is sordid world of sick and depraved people who will not necessarily stop short of murder in order satisfy their sick and twisted desires or is it about those who can those who are in position influence the making of the kinds of films sick and demented people want see am not talking about snuff films supposed documentaries of victims being brutalized and killed on camera am talking about films like mm and its director joel schumacher recent run of big budget movies his credit batman robin time kill batman forever the client schumacher certainly has that kind of influence is mm something you really want see probably not the first twothirds of mm unwind as fairly conventional missing persons drama albeit particularly unsavory core then as it is been threatening all along the explodes into violence and just when you think it is finally over schumacher tags on ridiculous selfrighteous finale that drags the whole unpleasant experience down even further trust me there are better ways waste two hours of your life nicolas snake eyes cage plays private investigator tom welles who is hired wealthy philadelphia widow determine whether reel of found in her late husbands safe documents young girls murder welles goes about his assignment rather matteroffactly and the pieces of the puzzle fall into place rather neatly almost as if you do not need any specialized skills or training do this welles certainly makes it look easy and cops obviously never look in toilet tanks for clues the deeper welles digs into his investigation the more obsessed he becomes like george scott in paul schraders hardcore occasionally little flickering sound whirs in his head like sprockets winding through projector reminding him of his unpleasant task there are hints that this is taking its toll on his lovely wife played catherine keener who is frustrated her husband spending all of his time in cleveland rather than in their ugly splitlevel home in harrisburg pa mm does not condemn or condone its subject matter it just exploits it the irony of course is that schumacher and seven scribe andrew kevin walkers vision of life in the snuff lane is limited what they can show in an rrated firstrun product so we only see snippets of snuff and lot more footage of nicolas cage covering his face in horror later it is the turn of joaquin phoenix who is quite good and far the films most interesting character as adult bookstore flunky max california cover his face as the horrid thing is screened over and over again all this get the familiar yet offensive revelation that sexual deviants are not indeed monsters but everyday people like you and me neither super nor standard mm is shocking only in its banality

that is exactly how long the movie felt me there were not even nine laughs in nine months it is terrible mess of movie starring terrible mess of man mr hugh grant huge dork it is not the whole oralsexprostitution thing referring grant not me that bugs me it is the fact that grant is annoying not just adam sandlerannoying we are talking jim carreyannoying since when do eye flutters and nervous smiles pass for acting but on the other hand since when do really bad slapstick fistfight in the delivery room culminating in grants head in joan cusacks lapa scene he paid have included in the movie and obscene double entendres robin williams the obstetrician tells grants pregnant girlfriend she has big pussy referring of course the size of the cat hairs on her coat but nonetheless grant paid have the exchange included in the movie pass for comedy nine months is predictable cookiecutter movie no originality in humor or plot hugh grant plays successful child psychiatrist why child psychologist so the scriptwriters could inject the following unfunny exchange kid my dads an asshole grant flutters eyelashes offers nervous smile then responds in his annoying english accent and ithinkiactuallyhave talent attitude could you possibly elaborate on that kid my dads _huge_ asshole more like hugh asshole but that is beside the point is nine months includes too many needlessly stupid jokes that get laughs from the ten year olds in the audience while everyone else shakes his or her head in disbelief so anyway grant finds out his girlfriend is pregnant and does his usual annoying friend is played tom arnold who provides most of the cacophonous slapstick none of is funny such as scene where arnold beats up costumed arnie the dinosaur you draw your own parallels on that call it road trip for the walking wounded stellan skarsg rd plays such convincingly zombified drunken loser that it is difficult spend nearly two hours of screen time in his smelly boozedout presence yet this everreliable swedish actor adds depth and significance the otherwise plodding and forgettable aberdeen sentimental and painfully mundane european drama playwright august strindberg built his career on families and relationships paralyzed secrets unable express their longings until the hour is far too late that is an accurate reflection of what aberdeen strives for focusing on the pairing of an alcoholic father tomas skarsg rd and his alienated openly hostile yuppie daughter kaisa lena headey gossip they have not spoken in years and would not even be making the long trip from norway aberdeen scotland automobile if it were not for kaisas mother charlotte rampling under the sand rotting away in hospital bed from cancer in soap opera twist mother has only few days live only in the movies right too blitzed even step foot on plane tomas hits the open road kaisa loathing each other all the while they make periodic stops for tomas puke on the dashboard or pass out whenever he is not muttering what rotten kid she turned out be despite his sloshed viewpoint tomas recognizes that the apple has not fallen very far from the tree kaisa gets nosebleeds from snorting coke sabotages her personal relationships through indifference and is unable restrain her quick and vindictive temper as not they pair unable find true notes of unspoken familial empathy in the onenote and repetitively bitchy dialogue screenwriters kristin amundsen and hans petter moland fabricate series of contrivances propel events forward lost money roving street hooligans looking for drunks kick around nosy cops and flat tires all figure into the schematic and convenient narrative the time they reach the hospital it is time unveil the secrets from dark past that are not only simplistic devices that trivialize the fatherdaughter conflict they are also the mainstays of many bad strindberg wannabe this revelation exists purely for its own sake aberdeen does not know where else go weak unimaginative casting thwarts the pivotal role of kaisa if lena headey were stronger actress perhaps aberdeen could have been able coast on the performances and moody haunting cinematography rendering norway into its own pastoral ghost world the reference certain superior american indie flick intentional headeys too busy acting using her face and furrowed brow convey every last twitch of insouciance if she were paying any attention skarsg rd maybe she would figure out that doing less can reveal so much more it is worthwhile compare aberdeen an earlier released in jonathan nossiters captivating signs wonders it is not just because skarsg rd and rampling played disturbed parental figures in both films they are not bound ceremonial wedlock in aberdeen the differences in the way their characters were presented is significant in aberdeen rampling is luminous diva preening and static in her hospital bed despite skarsg rds solid performance as tomas his pathetic drunk is never given much of chance emote anything besides catatonic sorrow there is genuine ferocity and sexually charged frisson during their understated confrontations in signs wonders allowing them suggest gray zone of complications that accompany torn romance and years of stifled curiosity nossiters thoroughly explores this neurotic territory in addition delving into the americanization of greece and the use of mysticism as an illusion deflect pain if signs wonders sometimes feels overloaded ideas at least it is willing stretch beyond what we have come expect from traditional drama aberdeen is never half so ambitious content sleepwalk through the rhythms and timing of other movies when did character driven stories stop paying attention the complexities of real life the depressing answer can be found in lawrence kasdans trite but occasionally useful grand canyon where steve martins mogul pronounces all of lifes riddles are answered in the movies even foreign films are taking that advice heart

plot young french boy sees his parents killed before his eyes tim roth oops mean an evil man he vows revenge on that man and is taught the ways of the musketeer some old dude who used be one himself anyway fourteen years go and arrgh well you know the rest swishswishzzzzzzz critique this is pretty bad movie let us see where should start okay first of all the story is just plain boring it is not original is entirely predictable and lacks energy okay what is next acting you say hmmmm well the main actor justin chambers is basically an uncharismatic version of chris odonnell but less range think about that and mena suvari is just plain off not as bad as thora birch was in dungeons dragons but entirely miscast bad deliveries awful sequences and pisspoor accent that comes and goes now am not sure if this was ms suvaris fault or the directors but have definitely seen her at much higher level than in this the only semisaving grace actorwise is tim roth as the irrepressible bad guy but once again it is not something that we have not seen before thousand times the same guy tim please for the love of god beg your agent ask the marketplace for some modern day american roles for you as nice guy in romantic comedy or something stretch dude stretch we all know that you can do much better than this gunk alright what else was bad in this oh yeah the score yikes how is about taking it down few notches there fellas this thing blares in your ear whenever it feels the need accentuate certain scene but actually does little more than annoy think it is important for the man behind the music recognize that this is not real epic any stretch of the imagination it is fluffy rehashed cakewalk created some shrewd studio heads who decided take advantage of the whole kungfu phenomenon in films and test it out on an old classic dudes you failed all around keep reading the editing is also pretty shoddy in this movie the dialogue banal and stilted and the plot problems plentiful why does the guy on top of the horse carriage just stand there when his opponent takes forever scampering his way back the top why do not they just cut the mouseketeers rope at the top of the tower instead of jumping down on their own chords and fighting him while hanging why does not anybody look day older when the sequence says years later at least change your shirt man keep in mind that have never strayed away from championing certain movies that are created simply for the sake of fun time but this flick just did not cut it for me it was boring for stretches the acting was atrocious at times the romantic scene between suvari and chambers next the lake reminded me of plays in high school made you cringe there was little reason care for anyone and since when were the musketeers fat will give the movie this much and that is that its main reason for being its raisondetre as the french would say its fight sequences do come through despite the lack of their numbers in the was hoping that the movie would be packed cool stuntwork as promoted in its trailer but what you see there are essentially the snippets from the two major and cool swashbuckling sequences from the the first comes right at the beginning of the movie while the other essentially finishes the off hanging from the tower and juggling off ladders the ladder sequence itself is definite keeper but unfortunately the rest of the movie is just regurgitated crap and can anyone please tell me how catherine deneuve got her name placed at the top of this films credits hullo the is called the musketeer and stars dude name justin chambers deneuve is barely in this movie ugh just another small thing that annoyed me about this trash now say it together gang all for one and one for all we vow stay away from it all thank me later where is joblo coming from knights tale american outlaws crouching tiger hidden dragon the matrix the replacement killers romeo must die shanghai noon

best remembered for his understated performance as dr hannibal lecter in michael manns forensics thriller manhunter scottish character actor brian cox brings something special every movie he works on usually playing bit role in some studio schlock he dies halfway through the long kiss goodnight he is only occasionally given something meaty and substantial do if you want see some brilliant acting check out his work as dogged police inspector opposite frances mcdormand in ken loachs hidden agenda cox plays the role of big john harrigan in the disturbing new indie flick i lot picked up at sundance when other distributors were scared budge big john feels the love that dares not speak its name but he expresses it through seeking out adolescents and bringing them back his pad what bothered some audience members was the presentation of big john in an oddly empathetic light he is an eventempered funny robust old man who actually listens the kids problems as opposed their parents and friends both caught up in the highwire act of their own confused lives he will have sexforpay them only after an elaborate courtship charming them temptations from the grownup world i stands for long island expressway slices through the strip malls and middleclass homes of suburbia filmmaker michael cuesta uses it as pretty transparent metaphor of dangerous escape for his year old protagonist howie paul franklin dano in his opening voiceover howie reveals morbid preoccupation death on the road citing the i highway deaths of filmmaker alan pakula songwriter harry chapin and his own mother on exit he is both fascinated and disturbed the i and those feelings are projected onto big john who follows howie around in his bright red car but never makes move force the boy do something he does not want do this makes him much more complex than the usual child molesters seen in movies he is beast but ashamed of it i would have worked best as halfhour short about howies illadvised foray into big johns haven there is unnecessary padding howies miserable dad bruce altman in the hot seat for whitecollar crime degenerate youngsters who get their kicks from robbing middleclass houses and some homoerotic shenanigans wiseass gary terrio billy kay handsome artful dodger rather than add the themes of suburban ennui not that we needed another movie on that subject these awkward subplots pad out the running time adequate feature length concurrently the relationship between howie and big john is evenly paced and exceptionally well acted cox sporting baseball cap and faded marine tattoo is all bluff and bluster dano is quiet and at first glance seems so withdrawn as be transparent we are so used child actors whose dramatic choices are broad and obvious calling haley joel it is surprising see one who actually listens throughout any given scene the restraint is admirable but i s screenplay does not always give them the best material when howie reads big john walt whitman poem the moment feels bit too precious director michael cuesta lingers on an ecstatic reaction shot of big john who may as well be hearing glenn gould performing bachs goldberg variations it is too much there are also some obvious dramatic contrivances involving big johns other boy toy walter masterson jealous over the newbie this plot thread predictably leads violence not content be haunting observational portrait of teen alienation in royally screwed up world like terry zwigoffs superb ghost world cuesta lacks the confidence in his own work end on an ambivalent note it is typical of unimaginative cinema wrap things up bullet sparing the writers from actually having come up complex philosophical note in this regard i and countless other indie films share something in common blockbuster action films problems are solved when the obstacle is removed how often does real life work this way extend the question if movie is striving for realism do dramatic contrivances destroy the illusion

janeane garofalo in romantic comedy it was good idea couple years ago the truth about cats and dogs but is almost excruciating in the matchmaker this is bythebooks movie that plods along on predestined course no surprises and very few laughs it also jumps on the everpopular political satire bandwagon and manages fall flat there too garofalo plays campaign aide massacusetts senator jay sanders running for reelection denis leary plays the stereotypical strategist no ethics who decides the only way for the scandal plagued senator win is play up his irish roots and cash in on that boston roman catholic democrat contingent that is made the kennedy family so popular so leary orders garofalo go ireland and dig up some relatives exploit she soon learns why easier said than done is the mantra of movies like this the matchmaker falls for every cliche of things that can go wrong garofalo has take tiny plane ireland almost misses the bus town cannot get hotel room ends up in the smallest trashiest one around has dog piss on her luggage and so on then comes what roger ebert calls the meet cute it happens in every romance the man and woman have meet each other for the first time in some unconventional cinematic way in the matchmaker it happens when garofalo walks into her hotel bathroom and finds nude sean david ohara in the bathtub his dog sitting at his side no points for guessing it is the same dog that just made water on her luggage also no points for guessing garofalo hates ohara on sight that is how it works in movies like these know from the instant saw that irishman in the bathtub that she would hate him for awhile then succumb his charms live happily for reel or so before allowing some superficial detail throw the relationship into turmoil after they would reconcile in time for happy irish tune play over the end credits have not mentioned the movies twist yet garofalo comes the small ireland town during the annual matchmaking festival during lonely folks from around the county pair off into future of bliss milo oshea who looks like an irish tom snyder is the matchmaker who pops onscreen occasionally spew his words of wisdom and bring lonely souls together rest assured he will do all he can match up garofalo and ohara oh and in keeping the matchmakers utter predictability he dies toward the end what the message here sometimes even the most respectable person of comedic distinction like garofalo will sell out weak script was excited see garofalo and leary in the same movie but they actually only have two or three scenes together leary stays stateside for the most part yelling at garofalo over the phone and generally being an asshole he even undoes himself the old microphones still on after he is done giving the speech cliche both of them should have known better

and now the highflying hong kong style of filmmaking has made its way down the classics and it is not pretty this time out the nod asia goes way of france in the excruciating bland and lukewarm production of the musketeer version of dumass the three musketeers bringing in popular asian actorstunt coordinator xing xing xiong whose only prior american attempts at stunt choreography have been the laughable van damme vehicle double team and the dennis rodman cinematic joke simon sez our musketeers are thrown into the air do their fighting the end result is tepid and dull actionadventure ripoff that stinks of indiana jones and bad asian kung fu the story is so simple my grandmother could have adapted the screenplay dartagnan justin chambers is the vengeful son of slain musketeer he travels paris join the royal musketeers and find the man that killed his parents in paris he meets the cunning cardinal richelieu stephen rea who is trying overthrow the king and richelieus maninblack associate febre tim roth the killer of his folks he finds the musketeers in paris disbanded and drunk so he rounds up aramis nick moran athos jan gregor kremp and porthos steven spiers free the musketeers wrongfully imprisoned leader treville from the kings prison dartagnan and his new frisky love interestchambermaid francesca mena suvari play footsy and coo at each other as the cardinal hunts down the musketeers until finally the queen catherine deneuve ends up being captured the menancing febre forcing the musketeers regroup dartagnan leading the charge and save the day director peter hyams end of days obviously wanted blend eastern and western filmmaking styles but here it is disaster one problem is that in reality most eastern films have taken their lead from western ones jet lis high risk is ripoff of die hard not the other way around ironically there is awfully little swordplay or action in the at all maybe ten minutes of swashbuckling spread over five scenes most asian action films carry the bulk of their production minute action sequences because they know the scenes have carry the picture the musketeer instead weighs itself down predictable and monotonous screenplay gene quintano sudden death horrible acting stephen rea and tim roth and the prosaic attempt of justin chambers the wedding planner deliver his mousy self as leader chambers dartangnan is not musketeer he is mouseketeer and hyams use of candles and torches light the grime and filth of th century paris are wellnoted but that is the only standout in an overall flat production

a movie like mortal kombat annihilation works and must be reviewed on multiple levels first there is the rampant usage of randian subtext that pervades the entire movie but occasionaly almost as if making an ironic selfdepreciating remark the movie tosses in clearly marxist imagery no no just kidding had you going there for moment did not in all seriousness however and be fair the movie it is necessary provide two viewpoints that of movie watcher unfamiliar or only marginally familiar the whole mortal kombat phenomenon and that of fan of the first movie andor fan of the games the first movie mortal kombat concerned itself martial arts tournament that would decide the fate of earth and it is billion inhabitants the mortals won and in theory this should have prevented the emperor shao khan from taking over the earth unfortunately shao khan was poor loser and the very final scene in mortal kombat showed him arriving anyway ready take over the planet as our heroes assumed fighting stance the first movie was extraordinarily entertaining for those like myself who are fans of the game would even go so far as say that many folks who did not know about the game probably enjoyed the movie the writers and directors knew the limitations of both their cast and of the basic story itself and they did not try overachieve there were lot of really cool fight scenes really cool accompanying music intersperesed some distracting but ultimately nonintrusive bits of fluff passing itself off as plot and as we know the movie was smashing success at the box office mortal kombat annihilation picks up precisely where that movie left off some introductory exposition clue in those who may not have seen the first movie shao khan has decided that he is going take over the earth anyways and hell some silly rule about mortals winning the tournament thereafter follows approximately minutes of that alternates between being confused being trite being silly and being just plain stupid one gets the general impression that the producers of the movie thought hey that last movie was such success that we can get more money and make real movie now too bad they did not simply stick the formula from the first movie could write volumes about the things that are wrong this picture but here are the high points the acting is truly bad sandra hess playing the sonya blade character is particularly execrable especially in scenes where she tries convince us that she loved johnny cage character from the first movie who gets greased at the beginning of this movie in one of the worst pieces of miscasting think have ever seen james remar plays raiden the god of thunder in the first movie christopher lambert played raiden and played his character as though he was in on the joke french actor playing japanese thunder god being revered chinese mystics generally like it when actors are cast against type tim tiny lister jr being cast as the president of the s in the fifth element for example and remar has always been one of my favorite utility actors but he is so totally wrong for this part that he does not even have the luxury of amused selfawareness there are too many characters that are introduced as being potentially important but then never seen again there are number of completely meaningless story sidetracks including muddled scene where liu kang robin shou seeks out nightwolf litefoot has mystical hallucination and then wanders off jade irina pantaeva for these reasons and many others can only give the movie unless you are huge fan of the games andor the first movie in that case the following critiques also apply sandra hess while being an even worse actress than bridgette wilson who played sonya blade in the first movie is much more convincing as fighter wilson looked like she was simply mimicing some movements taught her the fight choreographer hess looks like she actually knows some martial arts and puts together much more believable fight scene in the fights each of the characters does at least one thing they do in the game and often more sonya does her kiss of death jax does his earthquake liu kang does his animality and so on big bonus for those of us who were looking for similar moves in the first movie and found them only rarely there are not as many fight scenes in this movie as there were in the first because the folks making the movie mistakenly try hang more robust plot in between silly silly folks and the lamest fight involved two of the women in what turns into mudwrestling match lame and so obviously sexist even politically incorrect for the most part noticed and remarked upon it the special effects are generally better except for the final fight scene between the emporer and liu kang in both perform their animalities motaro and sheeva are both more convincing and lifelike than goro was in the first movie for folks like myself who loved the first movie and enjoy the games give this you will probably like it but not nearly as much as you liked the first one

she was the femme in la femme nikita he was the baldwin in backdraft sliver and fair game cindy crawford together anne parillaud and william baldwin conspire make shattered image the biggest piece of hooey since the stallonestone thriller the specialist the poses the question what if the life you are living now is really dream and your dreams reality it is either about woman who is haunted recurring and recurring and recurring nightmare that she is hired assassin or it is about hired assassin who is haunted recurring and recurring and recurring nightmare that she is honeymooning william baldwin in jamaica it does not much matter and believe me the time shattered image runs its painful and pedestrian course you will not care these two lives parillaud looking like siouxsie sioux black wig black emotionless eyes and black leather clothing in the seattlebased assassin scenes and moping around like karen carpenter in the jamaica scenes play out endlessly throughout the and the result is it is now twice as boring as it might have been it is not that complicated plots cannot be entertaining of course it helps if you have interesting characters crisp dialogue and modicum of style shattered image is not complex it is just stupid and boring parillaud and baldwin who are not exactly shakespearean material begin are saddled such leaden dialogue that their characters have zero chance of breaking free of their cardboard confines lines like you do not beg you insist like that in woman that is parillauds character talking her cat and you are not the reason could not care less about you huh and this wonderful bathroom interchange early in the if you give me couple of minutes you know will charm the pants off you do not have that kind of time talking of pants parillaud has her clothes off faster than you can say point of no return we have come expect this from billy baldwin but it might have been nice have learned something about their characters first but there is nothing learn karen is as interesting as cereal box someonesouttogetme crybaby who imagines the voice at the other end of the phone the stranger who sends her flowers maybe even her husband himself is her wouldbe killer siouxsie is the chromium cool toughasnails crack killing machine who shoots out couple of mirrors in order justify the films meaningless stock title baldwin seems more interested in parillauds nest egg so that he can pave paradise and put up parking lot than he does in her each time graham greene shows up he gets killed barbet schroeder reversal of fortune coproduced and should be ashamed of himself every now and again it is fun watch really bad movie and every now and again as shattered image makes agonizingly clear it is not

john carpenter makes bmovies always has halloween escape from new york the thing and the looks of it they live escape from a vampires always will carpenters latest horror opus science fiction bent or science fiction outing schlock horror bent is the aptlytitled john carpenters ghosts of mars in case suppose you went looking for someone elses ghosts of mars like all those films prefixed the very possessive john carpenters ghosts of mars is an unashamed bmovie punctuated bmovie plot bmovie actors and bmovie special effects in category one above we have storyline that borders on idiotic and at times chaotic dormant martians e swirling red gases awakened meddling humans possess the souls of hapless mining colonists rendering them testy marilyn manson lookalikes all this explained in flashback some grand poohbah counsel martian police official melanie ballard natasha henstridge from the sub species films the only returnee on sillylooking train officer ballard went in bring back incarcerated felon james desolation williams what she found was not pretty picture in the second category we have ms henstridge her blonde hair pulled back tightly and awkwardly into ponytail ice cube as the appropriatelynamed desolation pam grier briefly oddlywho wanted work whom wonder and host of extras all assuming that the story and special effects were going carry this and therefore they did not need try too hard in category number three we have in addition those swirling red gases and the sillylooking train couple of birdseyeview shots of sprawling martian metropolis reddish also stateoftheart special effects have never been carpenter trademark and once again the writerdirector who seems have no problem finding work however does not waste any of the films budget in that department ghosts of mars is lock laughing stock and barrel all your standard carpenter fare dingy interiors cluttered exteriors inane dialogue lots of leather scarred crazedlooking aliens and lots and lots of weaponry the often and always explodes into warfare without warningspontaneously stupidly carpenter might like think he is made western here but it is western without any real heroes villains or border conflicts it is just the shootouts minus hissing snake plissken never thought would miss the guy but do it is not all the same however dubbed the onenote wonder for his minimalist music soundtracks carpenter seems have graduated from simplistic yet effective scoring highlighting his action loud screeching guitar work fortunately this drowns out lot of the dialogue the final exchange between henstridge and er cube though is both audible and priceless mars has proven an infertile breeding ground for in the last year or so what the stillborn mission mars and red planet val kilmer ghosts of mars sadly adds those disappointing returns in its opening weekend it was overshadowed bunch of sequels among them american pie and rush hour the irony is that the mars in carpenters feels sadly absent there are occasional references the red planet of course but the might as well have been set in perth amboys than on earths closest neighbor two things keep john carpenters ghosts of mars from getting huge slap upside the head henstridge keeps her top on miraculously and the does not pretend be anything it is not what that means however is that fans of superior intelligent grade scifihorror are singularly out of luck

i am really starting wonder about alicia silverstone sure she is one of the most beautiful creatures on gods green earth second only that movie critic at large guy but when it comes choosing what movies she stars in she always strikes out the crush was slowmoving predictable piece of fluff hideaway was horrific novel adaptation alicia had only minor role in clueless was an annoying unfunny waste of time and people have emailed me too saying clueless is good movie and that am the only one who does not like it one girl said if would seen the movie an open mind would have enjoyed it nothing could be further from the truth went into the theater expecting love the movie the preview looked good and of course am crazymadinlove alicia but the movie was bunch of bad jokes coming from whiny unlikable characters almost everyone saw the movie felt the same way when we were walking out of the theater one guy and it was not me yelled out that was the worst fin movie have ever seen and the rest of us had laugh in agreement so last night walked into the video store and saw alicias pretty face on the cover of some madeforvideo thriller called the babysitter knew it would be bad but some inner compulsion will probably never understand made me rent it anyway what got was minutes of regretthe worst alicia silverstone movie ever and you already know from the last paragraph what the competition is like where begin in criticizing this movie the plot is thin shred that moves slower than glacier the writing could have been done and for all we know it was ten year old alicia is the star and she is still wasted in movie that has no appeal whatsoever there is zero humor zero suspense zero drama and zero action until the last ten minutes when the story is needlessly and pointlessly concluded violent sequence zero plus zero plus zero plus zero equals zero so why does this movie get one star out of me well alicia spends twenty minutes of the movie in the bathtub and if it was not bubble bath the babysitter would have instantly joined the ranks of our other four star features but you settle for what you can get alicia plays babysitter who is spending friday night looking after two kids whose parents are out getting drunk at cocktail party and of course anyone as beautiful as alicia automatically spends their friday nights at home at least that movie critic at large guy does as the movie trods along we discover she is not only the mostlysilent star of the movie but also the object of every male characters fantasies and probably every male viewers too the drunken father thinks she is just the thing recapture his lost youth her boyfriend lets his imagination run wild while spying on alicia from outside even the prepubescent boy looks in on alicia through the bathroom keyhole while she is taking her bubble bath they even throw in the middle aged wifes fantasies about male counterpart at the party not that any of us asked or ever even thought about seeing this pound woman in black silk teddy at least none of the sex fanatasies ever leave the realm of the pgrated in fact could imagine the babysitter becoming cinemax latenight staple if not for the fact that there is absolutely no nudity in it so you cannot call it sex flick have already pointed out that it cannot fall under drama comedy thriller or action so what do you classify the babysitter as bad

so what do you get when you mix together plot elements from various successful scifi films such as close encounters of the third kind space odyssey apollo and contact well whatever it is you would sure as hell hope that it would be thousand times better than this shoddy attempt at such melange considering the disastrous results we are left here this is that takes little bit of everything but ultimately adds up lot of nothing it is like said this movie sucks plot rescue crew of astronauts is sent down mars in the year after an unknown energy force leads loss of contact the previous gang of space aviators visit the red planet critique extremely underwhelming is the best way describe this movie uneven would be another the trailer for this movie actually showed some promise the buzz around it had been soso and even the itself starts off decent first twenty minutes all leading you believe that it is actually going go somewhere but it is not long before the entire movie downshifts into neutral features more space walks than anything interesting on the cherrycolored planet tries too hard get us into the pain of some its characters and unsuccessfully tosses some romance into the mix in scifi movie well do not know much of it just seemed like bunch of nerdies talking techie jargon for about an hour and half only figure out some big secret in the end secret practically had me yawning excitement ultimately this is movie that starts off decent premise joins the crew in their misadventures in space for the main crux of its journey and eventually settles down for one of the most anticlimactic endings this side of contact mind you if you enjoyed that films shrugoftheshoulders ending you might just enjoy this frivolous ditty as well of course do not remember contact having such obvious and painfully distracting computer generated effects at its end of story ugh what friggin mess films like this generally get me wondering about the brass in again did not anybody recognize the crappiness in this script did not they read the bad dialogue the cheezy lines the obvious derivative nature of the work mind you director like depalma at the helm that as not saying much of course you cannot really blame the brass for the inclusion of jerry oconnell in this fine crew of thespians nuff said neither can you blame them for depalma cranking up the juice on the films musical score during the last fifteen minutes presumably in order wake the audience up okay we get it brian this scene is supposed be powerful wow yawn my ears hurt so is anything salvageable in this movie sure gary sinise does another great job as does cheadle the does not completely bore you as much as it just moves along slowly without anything really interesting happening and yes the sandtwister effect that you see in the commercial is well done other than that guess could say that admire how filmmakers have become so much more devious in their product placement strategies oops did say admire meant am disgusted all in all this movie delivers very little in actual substance offers twobit dialogue masked in lot of scifi mumbojumbo pretends be deep when really it is just sappy and eventually just settles into an ending other than presenting us pathetic computer graphic as part of the story gives us little more think about than how we might be able get our money back for sitting through this rehashed dreck go see the ninth gate now there is great movie and on personal note think it is time for depalma stop worrying so much about his proverbial minute uninterrupted sequences and start worrying more about how crappy his movies are getting

the law of crowd pleasing romantic movies states that the two leads must end up together films end if you are not familiar this law then maybe you have seen the trailer for this shows that the two leads are together films end now if you are regular reader of mine you have heard me say this countless times you know how drive me crazy is going end but is the journey get that ending worth it no it definitely is not melissa joan hart from abcs sabrina the teenage witch likes hunky stud on the basketball team adrien grenier is her grungy neighbor who is just broken up his activist girlfriend apparently he wants make his exgirlfriend jealous enough take him back and she wants someone take her the big year end dance so the two pretend date for some reason but only after hart gives grenier bath turn him into hunky stud will grenier like his new popularity and turn on his friends will this crazy scheme work do care the teen comedy resurgence of late has been surprisingly good in terms of comedy what makes movies like cannot hardly wait and things hate about you work and lesser extent she is all that and never been kissed is because the writers of those films seem realize that high school is joke and write their scripts accordingly do not know what the writers intention was drive me crazy there was some smart comedy in those films make the obvious endings worth getting here there is nothing just teens whining about who is going take them the big dance do me favor kids go get job or something just shut the hell up in all honesty the best part of this is the end credits now normally when say that it is followed the joke because the movie is finally over in this case though the end credits really are the most entertaining part of the after the obligatory second playing of britney spears titular song there is quick commercial jingle for burger joint the kids in the hang out in and brief rendition of the school song for their high school nothing great but more entertaining than anything in the minutes preceded them scifi fans take note there are brief appearances from stephen collins star trek the motion picture and faye grant the tv miniseries and the final battle pg

mighty joe young blunders about for nearly twenty minutes before we actually get see great big gorilla his entrance however is grand one out from the trees he leaps gargantuan and imposing sporting hands big enough crush volkswagen bug and pair of feet much larger than any pro basketball player will ever have joe bellows at the poachers before him angry that they would like kill him and sell him for millions of dollars during this scene turned my friend and said wow that is some ape joe is quite gorilla big digital gorilla he runs around the fields chasing cars and people he picks things up and stares at them pensively he breaks things on accident because he is just too big avoid clumsiness joe as special effect is an image that might hold your interest for five minutes as character he does not quite register and the story he is been put in is as limp as they come the words family entertainment have never been stamp of quality but might joe young is just silly special effects movie pretending have heart the picture is remake of the it is mostly just about the big gorilla but strictly as formality the movie also has few human characters the main one is jill young poor charlize theron forced waste her talent lover of gorillas as child she witnessed group of poachers murder her mother now she lives in the jungle protect the wildlife specifically she is out protect joe giant gorilla who has been her friend since her childhood soon zoologist gregg ohara bill paxton discovers joe he quickly realizes that poachers want get joe and sell him big game hunter named strasser rade sherbedgia who just happens be the same guy who killed jills mother so in an effort save joe jill and gregg take the big gorilla preserve where it is instantly clear that he is not safe from poachers in addition the space is way too small for him after all he is really big gorilla and add the complications strasser shows up under benevolent pretext he tells jill that he has preserve big enough for joe and joe recognizes strasser as the guy who killed jills mother jill of course does not recognize strasser even though he did kill her mother this is just one of the many examples of stupidity in mighty joe young that fulfills every stereotype that comes special effects the movie is not really offensive it has some competent actors few nifty sets and lot of scenes big digitized gorilla but the story is really dumb there are not any characters and the is not satisfying on any level beyond its visuals the movie also has bad dialogue if critic says that has bad dialogue it is only fair quote some of it but most of the words spoken in this picture are phrases like joe is not happy and joe is not safe here we need get joe out of here joe is way too big for that cage do not know if these phrases are word for word but they are close as said the characters here are only present as formality they do little more than state the obvious of course joe is too big for that cage paxton and theron are talented performers who deserve work on script that provides characters for them sadly mighty joe young wastes them both there are few clever moments although none of them are surfacing in my memory at the moment and as said the digital effects held my attention for at least five minutes it is certainly not bad for kids doubt joe will give them nightmares but adults in the audience are not likely find much of anything interesting about the big gorilla big gorilla is only interesting for little while after that something needs be done the big gorilla nobody ever figures out what do the big gorilla

spawn features good guys bad guys lots of fighting bloody violence leatherclad machine gun chick gooey selfhealing bullet holes scatological humor and maneating monster it not only appears have been tailor made for swarm of and yearold boys it appears have been made them in classic example of telling and not showing spawn opens truckload of mumbo jumbo about forces of darkness forces of light and how men are the ones who create evil on earth so much for message the movie then lurches forward into the plight of al simmons michael jai white government assassinoperative who is murdered diabolical boss jason wynn martin sheen who plays all of his scenes like an oscar clip while on top secret mission in north korean biological weapons plant simmons goes hell and back after making deal satan himself if he agrees command the devils army overtake the world he will be allowed return earth see his wife wanda underused theresa randle and little girl cyan sydni beaudoin of course seeing as how five years has passed wanda has fallen for and married simmons partner b sweeney his uh shoulder cry on comes in the form of clown john leguizamo disgustingly disproportioned minion of satans clown manipulates simmons now in superhuman spawn form into stand off wynn wynn who thinks he is in league the doubledealing clown recognizes spawn as threat and undergoes an operation where bomb is placed on his heart when it stops beating major cities around the world will detonate causing the leak of disease that makes the ebola virus look like skin rash phew got all that it would be easy dismiss spawn as just another one of those heavyonfx shortonsubstance action pics but it does not even work on that level the computergenerated sequences are often and plenty and the problem is that they look too computergenerated the several scenes set in hell present devil that looks and acts like video game graphic the movies healthy budget you would think they could have afforded make his mouth move when he talks other elements of the movie are soso spawns enormous red flowing cape is wonderful sight but it is too obvious when he is being played costumed actor or an image in movies like contact the special effects serve the story in spawn they are the story and spawn himself is not even an interesting character the films reliance on razzledazzle would be acceptable if we were given somebody root for but both simmons and his funky alterego are completely underdeveloped what we need is batman luke skywalker even watching the adventures of kleenex man would be more interesting than spawn poor leguizamo he starred in februarys the pest movie that still think is the years worst so far although this one does give it run for its money as clown he overacts the extreme never missing an opportunity for poortaste punchline leguizamo farts green mist munches pizza slice covered maggots and even dons miniskirt and performs cheerleader routine all before turning into giant grey demon the guy was brilliant in wong foo thanks for everything julie newmar what is he doing wasting his talent in this and the pest am one of the few people that liked batman robin this summers other bigbudget comic book yet after catching this movie and making the inevitable comparison can only hope people will change their minds and think of batman as the superior adaptation there is compelling story somewhere in spawn including strong religious overtones and the debut of the first africanamerican superhero ever but it is just not found anywhere near here as it is spawn is just awful it stinks worse than dead trout

in dreams might keep you awake at night but not because of its creepy imagery bizarre visual style or story about clairvoyant madman who lures young girls their untimely deaths no the source of potential sleeplessness here lies within the movies brutally squandered potential the least of is an admittedly nifty premise even tired serial killer genre standards the big letdown however comes upon the realization that this minute headscratcher was masterminded neil jordan the man behind the crying game he is no stranger cinematic weirdness but this nutty nonsense really pushes the envelope things start out strong enough cinematographer darius khondjis stunning camera work guiding viewers into the bowels of underwater ghost town during creepy prologue that establishes notably grim tone right off the bat this eerie opulence remains dazzling display of showmanship throughout the entire there is even something macabre about the way khondji photographs rustic seemingly innocent new england autumn but if there ever was that did not deserve so good polish it is this one do not knock the look but say what you will about the foolish plot underdeveloped characters and flat dialogue annette bening another asset in dreams should not be so lucky boast gives an increasingly effective performance in role that does not do much for her in return she plays claire cooper massachusetts childrens book illustrator who is plagued terrifying nightmares involving kidnaped children she thinks these visions are warning knell for horrible soontobecommitted crimes but neither her hohum husband aidan quinn nor the hohummer police can muster up the sense take her seriously this being thriller we know that she is in fact on the money and it is credit benings acting that she delves equally into claires madness and compassion but as soon as body turns up and claire has given the authorities reason enough believe her claims in dreams trades in its nifty supernatural chills for long series of allegedly spooky jolts that simply refuse make sense scenes pile up like car wreck little or no explanation or exposition subplots appear and disappear when claire finally comes facetoface our evil murderer robert downey jr it turns out his name is vivian he is clairvoyant and he is got some major issues mama la norman bates in dreams reaches its absurdist zenith here and the climax drags mumbled revelations and laughable twists some questions then what is the garbage disposal retching applesauce are the drawings on the wall blood or paint who cranked up the andrews sisters on the cd player and caused the swing move on its own what about the computer does vivian possess the gift of telekinesis in addition his other powers why would he continually endanger claire if she was necessary for his ultimate plan is the woman in australia integral anything and the aforementioned flooded city what function does that _really_ serve sigh at least in my own dreams can imagine better movie where certain talent did not go waste

knock off is exactly that cheap knock off of an action movie it is also the worst movie have seen thus far this year figured it would be at least couple of months before saw the worst of but alas it has already been found jeanclaude van damme stars as think designer jeans executive who discovers his halfbrother has been supplying him cheaper goods rob schneider plays van dammes partner and rochon plays actually have no idea who rochon was supposed be she just sort of popped up halfway through without an explanation as why she was there many things are not explained in this but do know that for some bizarre reason van damme seemed be doing jackie chan impression throughout the flick where chan comes off as endearing in his normal guy character seen in many of his films van damme just comes off as wimp we are never given any clear explanation as the basis for many of his actions be more clear did not even know who he was supposed be until about an hour into the movie and even then it was not made too clear the has been directed in the style of some strange experiment gone horribly wrong tsui hark who directed van dammes last movie the bad but not nearly as bad as this double team never lets the camera rest for second and that is no exaggeration we are even treated five second shot from the point of view of van dammes foot entering shoe fabulous seriously though have no problem directors who want play around conventions as long as they do not get carried away for example look at sam raimi army of darkness one of his best movies features some of the most inventive camera work have ever seen but raimi never lets the special effects get in the way of story that is concept that tsui cannot seem grasp the special effects and outrageous camera angles rule knock off the point where the audience does not have clue as what is happening any more another problem the is that it looks cheap the stock used is of such low caliber that thought was watching one of those chinese films shown really late at night and for some inexplicable reason everyones voice seems have been dubbed even the stars and even the special effects seemingly the only aspect of the the director actually cared about are inconsistent for example there is scene in van damme drives car out of window the car slams into the ground and the left wheel is completely destroyed seconds later the car drives off at full speed hey have no problem suspending my disbelief in an action movie but line must be drawn somewhere finally the acting nobody gives good performance in this van damme an actor usually like is way off the mark playing everyman and schneider here provide comic relief assume is totally unfunny and over acts his way through every scene even the usually solid paul sorvino gives terribly overthetop performance as once again have no idea who he was supposed be in case have not yet made it clear enough knock off is the worst movie of van dammes career and possibly the worst movie of the decade and it is not even one of those movies that is so bad it is funny it is too inept be funny there are no redeeming factors in knock off and seriously hope that every print of this is burned crisp and that somehow my memory of watching the can be erased

snake eyes is the most aggravating kind of movie the kind that shows so much potential then becomes unbelievably disappointing it is not just because this is brian depalma and since he is great director and one who is films are always greeted at least some fanfare and it is not even because this was starring nicolas cage and since he gives brauvara performance this is hardly worth his talents it is worse than that it is aggravating for the sole reason that its story could be so much more could be totally intelligent and it opens up absolutely no subtlety that it will be handled complexly and intensely then at one point in the movie makes on wrong turn that leads it the hall of fame of halfassedness or more deservedly the hall of fame of the eighthassedness in certain circles snake eyes was being advertised as kind of modern day version of kurosawas classic rashomon where crime is told from the four different and mean different perspectives and it looks as though it may actually be just like this the opening might add is superb in one very very very long steadicam shot we meet the protagonist crooked atlantic city detective rick santoro cage and follow him before boxing match as he talks on his cell phone his wife interupts payperview event on tv chases down gambler enters the arena all pumped up for the fight sits down and talks his bud kevin dunne gary sinise who is character should not be confused that of actor kevin dunn who is also in this and watches as it happens there is big name in the crowd and that is the secretary of defense charles kirkland joel fabiani who is sitting behind rick and who gets shot second after the heavyweight champion lincoln tyler stan shaw is knocked out this all happens in the opening shot and it creates so many red herrings and possibilities of what happened that it opens this scene up for close examination and total deconstruction what really happened this asks and it sets this up extremely well for when rick begins question people and get different perspectives on the scene and discovers there is very good possibility it was conspiracy as we follow rick trying learn of more information we also meet woman who was talking kirkland before he was shot carla gugino and who flees the scene in panic and tries hide from the cops in the arena and the adjacent casinohotel since the cops have blocked off the doors so they can get witness takes on what happened this is all going pretty fine and dandy and it is extremely interesting watch then it takes one wrong step we follow the wrong character and we learn of the answer the mystery too early on and way before rick can find it out but that is not the worst part of it it is that it is the one person you did not think it would be because he was too obviously supposed be the red herring the one you did not think did it because it would be stupid and cliched of that person be behind it it only gets worse the turns into chase about half way through the and since we already know what happened we cannot rely on ricks investigation be all that interesting it is as if the ran out of the guts be really complex and original about third of the way in and decided just fall back on an easy way out and that just happens mean that it has become less and less credible events become more and more proposterous and the end the has decided rely on the worst offender in mysteries like this the deux ex machina that is where some outside intereference brings the sudden conclusion and makes everything okay this time it is hurricane an outofcontrol police car and big round ball that adorned the arena what went wrong depalma and the screenwriter david koepp are extremely credible people in their respective fields and have been known for bringing life and complexity mysteries such as this depalma who idolizes hitchcock death has done many like this such as his masterpiece blow out where movie soundman uses movie elements uncover conspiracy piece piece but granted depalma at least makes it intriguing watch what his overthetop shot setups notably the beginning and sequence where the camera pans over top of bunch of rooms in the hotel forgetting anything about boundaries at least his direction makes up partly for it then there is koepp who showed such great ability at making characters flaws come life like he did in depalmas earlier carlitos way that dove right into the life and past of its character and examined him extremely well he can write flawed character but his rick santoro seems be just halfassed effort he is flawed and we can see redemption if the story was not so formulaic scene towards the end where he has make fatal decision is cheapened the fact that his answer has no emotional buildup he may as well have said the opposite of what he says it would have at least gone what the character was like this is the most disappointing kind of because it promises intelligence and complexity because it promises disection of flawed character and perhaps even redemption then pulls the rug from under us just as we were about be convinced it would be able go all the way as was watching the first half hour could not wait see how the mystery would be unearthed how many different perspectives he would be given and perhaps he would have make choice between who is he has believe now there is unfortunately the has two major deux ex machinas one in the disasterous ending the other about half hour in when the goes into autopilot and becomes stale and recycled piece of crap we have seen all too much before but never from someone like depalma

forgive the fevered criticism but the fervor of the crucible infects set in at salem massachusetts the crucible opens group of teenage girls passionately singing and dancing around boiling cauldron in the middle of forest under the glow of full moon they beckon the names of men as the targets of their love spells then one of the girls lets her hair down and sheds her clothes not be outdone in her quest regain the attention of john proctor daniel day lewis abigail winona ryder suddenly seizes chicken beats it against the ground and smears her face and lips the fresh blood taking even adolescent hormone surges into account surely this chickenbashing bit is bit excessive especially for prim puritan sensibilities surely the puritan eye this is as close coven of witches as it gets the crucible
