errs from the beginning and arthur millers name should be summoned for blame here for the addition of the above scene his screen adaptation of his play this is far from harmless event bad start an already shaky morality tale the play describes the films opening scene during tense exchanges that makes one wonder about the veracity of both accusation and reply and this adds the plays charged atmosphere in the the opening scene becomes an unintentional pandoras box not only is credulity stretched but abigails obsession is unfortunately spotlighted it positions the crucible more as cautionary fable about obsessive and malevolent women than against witch hunts it will bring back the memory of rabbit boiling away in pot not surprisingly the nighttime forest frenzy does not go unnoticed and when two girls fail wake the following morning witches are invoked those eager blame when the girls are questioned their confession of guilt is accompanied an announcement of their return god and they are thereafter converted immaculate witnesses led lustfully abigail alarming synchronicity our hormonallyadvantaged girls zealously gesture and point accusing fingers at innocents constant reminders that abigails passion sets all this into inexorable motion abigail seizes on this opportunity rid herself of her rival for john proctors love his wife elizabeth joan allen including her among those accused of witchcraft appropriately narrowwaisted and equipped distractingly white smile watch his teeth deteriorate much too quickly murky yellow day lewis plays the dashing moral hero an overearnestness that longs be watched director nicholas hytner is guilty of encouraging day lewis foamingmouth fervour shots where we stare up at proctor as if he was mounted on pedestal for our admiration otherwise hytners direction is unremarkable ryders performance as abigail is as consistent as her mood swings her fits of frenzy are energetic enough but the quieter moments are less successful abigail supposedly revels in her newfound power but ryder fails at being convincingly haughty although there is much haughtiness spare here paul scofield is fine as the overzealous judge danforth but the incessant moral posturings of all the characters along the recurrent histrionics of the young girls pricks at the nerves probably because she is the only refuge of restraint amidst all the huffing and puffing allens elizabeth comes out as the most sympathetic character scene near the end featuring private conversation between the imprisoned elizabeth and john is undeniably powerful because for once we are given reprieve from the moral bantering and the human consequences are revealed unfortunately when johns audience again increases more than one his urge pontificate returns and the human urgency of his situation is lost it is clear that miller meant well but do wish he did it more delicacy and fewer diversions his screenplay is an imperfect creature the distractions coming out as loud as the message the result is clumsy muddle felt like the chicken from the opening scene head ceaselessly banged piousness too heavyhanded be wholly believable when the gallows beckoned it was sweet release indeed far from bewitching the crucible tests the patience

one might expect cathartic viewing experience walking into new jeanluc godard after all he was founding member of the highly influential french new wave he is also an esteemed critic lending intelligence and historical perspective us in much of his writing however his latest creation in praise of love is possibly the most exasperating experience of the year the abstract concept on the is based had merit dissect love into the following four categories meeting physical passion quarrels and reconciliation these four universal truths would be revealed through three different couples young adult and elderly it is edgars bruno putzulu selfappointed task capture these moments after recent breakup define central idea it is only when things are over that they make sense whether this project will end up play or opera remains undecided the thesis is simple enough that if played right it could really hold sympathetic value for anyone instead what ensues is an hour and half of repetitive vignettes the next scene no more engaging than the last only once does any character utter something worthwhile but the time it happens you are so thoroughly bored you can easily miss it but do not fret it will surface again you could easily sleep through whole sections of the as some fellow critics did and wake up in scene exactly like the one you nodded off in not having missed anything worthwhile but you hold hope for some time the background music keeps you in state of urgency and even suspense for the first few conversations it is only after repeated failures pay any of this off that you lose all hope and speeches like am thinking of something but can only think of that something when am thinking of something else how can you expect hold anyones interest godards credit he certainly knows how frame scene the black and white footage used for the first half of the is starkly beautiful watching edgar read while walking along train track on mountain makes you wish you had something ponder along him and if this had anything poignant say you would have makes you all the angrier at the numerous missed opportunities the environments be it city or country are impeccably captured in crisp detail but the script never complements them unfortunately godard also manages pillage his photographic eye randomly cutting black numerous times within any given scene sometimes these breaks are used for chapter headings but these are even more cryptic than the spoken words the second half is composed of nauseating hypercolor that often blurs the image you suddenly feel like doomed character straight out of scanners the only scene that makes any sense is one that complains about the united states bastardizing history in the making of movies steven spielberg is picked on in particular while will grant that this does happen and tend shy away from watching such garbage it is still pointless focus for that purports articulate the specific qualities of couplehood it just goes show an intelligent person is not necessarily an admirable storyteller the days of breathless are no more

america loves convenience after all we are the culture that invented the cell phone the hour atm and my most beloved the remote control yet perhaps this time ghosts of mars we have taken our love of convenience far ghosts of mars stars natasha henstridge as tough as nails pillpoppin martian cop sent her squadron retrieve demolition williams ice cube from remote mining town for trial back home when she and her comrades appropriately dubbed the commander the rookies and the guy the cool accent discover the towns residents slaughtered they are forced team up williams escape from the remaining residents headchopping alienpossessed clutches filled lovely overuse of storytelling flashbacks flashessideways and viewpoint changes ghosts of mars is hapless mishmash of poorly constructed dialogue and illconceived action sequences the only thing keeping this from becoming an incomprehensible mess is the sheer idiotic simplicity of its story ripped straight from the pages of s zombie movie ghosts leaps from one convenient moment the next stopping only kill the characters are most convenient lose attempts at character interaction and development are rare and forced most of these moments come off as kwikemart wisdom dispensed heartily around the slushee machine of life the eventempered streetwise hand of ice cube gun in one hand and dynamite cap in the other cube reminisces about his street life comparing the zombiestomping fun me and my brother when we was kids apparently crime in the bronx has gotten so bad that the residents have actually taken ritually decapitating one another for entertainment but even in the films darkest moments fate conveniently lends hand supplying heavily armored transportation and easily accessible rifles and dynamite yes in the future man may travel space and conquer mars but nothing beats good stick of tnt and as we all know every police station past present or future keeps healthy supply on hand characters die heads are lopped off but they were only supporting roles anyway so why should we care as long as you have plenty of narcotics immunity is guaranteed eventually though even the most welltrained zombie alien gets bit uppity and needs be taught lesson what better way than sacrificing few minor characters convenient nuclear detonation killing anything the machine guns cannot handle explosions are fun and even if the nukes do not get them the conveniently placed dynamite packs on the train stolen from the set of the road warrior certainly will in the end this defines itself when our cops tribunal pronounces is that all you have tell us for indeed john carpenter has run out of things say and has instead decided use whatever is convenient tell ridiculously bad story

reindeer games is easily the worst of the three recent films penned ehren kruger scream and arlington rd are the others each derivative in their own special way the guy cannot seem write believable dialogue sample from reindeer games rule never put car thief behind the wheel create multifaceted characters or even engineer coherent plots but he sure knows how pile on numerous nonsensical twists and turns no matter if each one deems the actual story increasingly unlikely his screenplay for reindeer games turns the tables on the audience so many times that watching the becomes something of punishment no reward anywhere in sight can just envision kruger laughing behind his keyboard oh you thought my movie was gonna go here ck you jack ass take that twist decipher this mother cker it is almost as if the writer were angry at us for shelling out money see his stupid movie and why the hell would anyone want invest time in movie when the screenwriter keeps changing his own rules for no reason other than congratulate himself on how damn clever he is auteur theory be damned it is krugers style not the directors that winds up on screen kruger has obviously never paid much mind the old chestnut sometimes less is more and his numerous twists cannot even claim be originals arlington rds ending is direct steal from the much better alan pakula thriller the parallax view and in reindeer games we get this ol gem character incriminates themself saying something they should not know pronouns used protect the gender of the character grammar be damned how did you know that the stunned protagonist asks suddenly realizing that the character was in on the whole thing all along since twist endings are currently so in vogue and seeing as how krugers screenplays usually come equipped about three twists per ending guess it is no wonder why he works so frequently he is quickly becoming miramaxs mickey mouse the company has already signed him work on several of their upcoming projects this is appropriate considering that miramax used place their label on some of the most artistically daring films has quickly become grindhouse for coddling foreign imports life is beautiful and freddie prinze jr vehicles their companys current logo could be we ride the trends reindeer games stars ben affleck as rudy supposedly hardened criminal spending his days and nights behind bars fantasies of pecan pies dancing atop his head although affleck is given some barbed wire tattoos insinuate bad assness he plays the role like steve guttenberg preciously mugging through police academy flick affleck is such puppy dog that it is impossible believe he could survive in harsh prison environment without becoming nearly everyones bitch the role itself is so badly written the character only grows balls when the plot calls for it the twists so outrageous and the directing so self consciously gritty that this is about as close self parody as can recall recent serious movie getting it may have been wiser had the makers simply went all the way in that direction casting jerry seinfeld as the hardened criminal and howard stern as the sniveling bad guy who is played here gary sinise in yet another over the top villain performance james frain is nick rudys cellmate manslaughterer who is found pen pal in the gorgeous ashley mason charlize theron ashley is prison groupie who sends nick many cheesecake photos of her though she is never seen one picture of him works out fine since the character is killed in nearriot and rudy who was be paroled on the same day as nick takes his place leads sudden and very frenzied sex scene between ashley and rudy so frenzied it kinda looks like rape and surprise visit from ashleys brother gabriel gary sinise who waltzes into their shabby hotel room flanked his thuggish cohorts he plans rob an indian casino on christmas eve the assistance of rudy who he thinks is nick who according what he wrote in the letters ashley used work as guard in the indian casino though the end the pulls the rug out from under us so frequently that everything have described might as well be irrelevant this is what you can expect should you chose take this reindeer on several scenes in after catching his prey the bad guy proceeds stall interminably until the good guy has chance kill his captor and crack stupid oneliner included two scenes of two different bad guys explaining their motives the hero when they should be killing him one following the other no less though it is an action the ending is more talkfest where we get the whole movie explained us one flustered character actor after another while affleck looks on incredulous as the audience the flick was directed john frankenheimer straightforward action director who lucked into the manchurian candidate early in his career fell off the alist following string of flops and now in his old age is slowly climbing his way back up it would be success story if he were choosing better scripts but his last major was ronin one of those almost but not quite movies followed the island of dr morneau you remember the one marlon brando in mime makeup and not so flattering moomoo and now this he films action sequences minimum of quick cutting like considering that nowadays action scenes are commonly comprised of millisecond flash cuts strung together and laid out for brainzapped mtv audience pick apart problem is these action scenes nearly all failed escapes serve no purpose in the story other than further pad out the running time and remind the audience that their watching an action movie rather than filmed radio play character problems abound rudy is made shift between sweet boy next door earnestness and hard edged wiseacre the latter of is not at least at this point something ben affleck is capable of pulling off the former he can do ease and often the actor coasts on his lackadaisical charm while those around him growl and swear but then suddenly affleck starts growling and swearing alongside them like the class clown imitating tarantino gangster charlize theron an extraordinary talent is like affleck playing whatever part the script requires her play whether it be vulnerability at one moment anger at the next she never has chance evince any charm or make much of an impression beyond her obvious physical attributes frankenheimer has her needlessly pop her top further italicize this gary sinise has played this role frequently and here as in snake eyes he does the snarling bad guy thing such over the top vitriol the guy must be so incredibly bored of stomping through the same paces that going out of control is the only thing that keeps him interested any more that it becomes more of an annoyance oh there he goes again than threat these are talented people who made the mistake of jumping on script little but stock characters and bag of tricks that it dully springs on its audience

a followup disneys liveaction dalmatians that is better more entertaining than the first just as unlikely dalmatians the disney studios have proven that when it comes going the dogs more is definitely not the merrier dalmatians certainly was not the greatest moviegoing experience of all time but it did feature glenn close in an outrageous largerthanlife performance in addition we had two amiable leads in the form of jeff daniels and joely richardson and lots and lots of adorable spotted puppies this time around there seem be fewer puppies on the screen and closes facial and physical gyrations are starting feel as old as the yearold actress under that startling black and white wig of hers but that is only half the problem kevin limas laborious what makes dalmatians such collosal bore is its embarrassing attempts at humor here almost singlehandedly foisted on wisecracking macaw who thinks he is dog voiced eric idle its rabid plotlessness cruella goes after puppies again winds up in goo again and most of all the incredibly wooden actors who plays the romantic heroes of the piece welshman named ioan gruffudd and the blanderthanbland alice evans as parole officer named chlo gruffudd is cute and harmless perhaps but evans cannot even aspire that the dogs upstage them both of course but in the case of evans even closes split ends are more animated bad acting however seems be requirement for this sequel since rard depardieu shows up as french furrier haircut like robert de niros in men of honor jean pierre le pelt is flamboyant fashion designer penchant for fine furs and depardieus overthetop antics mimic those of the campy close flail for flail and wail for wail frances most popular export besides brie has long since turned into caricature of himself and in dalmatians the producers milk that realization for all it is worthle pelt likes refer the furry little critters as poopies par example and ad nauseum the finesses of the script attributed four screenwriters no less and far removed from anything dodie smith ever dreamed up are quickly dispensed since all it takes for paroled cruella be shaken from her years of successful aversion therapy in the slammer is the tolling of big ben that done it is back the mansion roll around in her heretofore offlimits sables and minks and plan skin those little dahlings for the sake of hooded designer gown the dogs are pretty cutetry making puppy look otherwisebut that is pretty much all they are there is always the feeling that there is trainer off in the wings coaxing the dogs open doors or pick up their food bowls in unison or pop tape into the videocasette recorder savvy holiday goers should skip dalmatians and pop the original animated classic into their vcrs instead it is one dalmatian less but more satisfying

onesided doom and gloom documentary about the possible annihilation of the human race as foretold the bible orson welles narrates and appears in the in he along bestselling author hal lindsey discusses various prophecies from the bible and relates them recent well for anyway events the is dated badly as many things that are supposed happen in the future never do for example the planets of the solar system were supposed line up in the year and cause chaos here on earth we are still here the arms race between the soviets and america was supposed kickoff the apocalypse we are still here some of the more ludicrous moments come when it is alluded that people like jimmy carter and henry kissinger may actually be the antichrist also there is ten minutes of stock footage at the end of the meant give us an idea of what the battle for armageddon might be like if it is anything like it is depicted as here then it is going be incredibly boring the late great planet earth is available on dvd from vci home video it contains the in standard form aspect ratio of although some moments of stock footage are letterboxed also included are brief bios on orson welles and hal lindsey as well as trailer for another recent vci home video release chariots of the gods audio is mono dolby digital and the video is fair good for like this believe this is the first appearance of this on any home video format so any condition at all is fine me certainly never expected remastered print curiously the menu screens on this dvd look nothing like the menu screens pictured on the back of the case but they are menu screens so who really cares pg

play it the bone the newest addition ron sheltons sports themed repertoire fails in numerous ways like most of sheltons other great films bull durham white men cannot jump this dud unsuccessfully attempts use athleticism as method of connecting characters and creating interesting subplots sheltons films are not considered sports films but they do heavily revolve around specific game tell story shelton has been so good in the past at using sports analyze the structure of society that from his collection of films we are given an examination of different classes and races living in various different regions play it the bone is unsuccessful because not only is the boxing theme dull but the side story of the two guys and girl travelling across the country is even worse the has no social message like its predecessors the relationship between the friends two failed boxers who must face off against each other in the ring for thousand dollars is very confusing for number of reasons the whole since it is primarily buddy picture depends on the strength of the friendship the two characters have for each other unfortunately it is very weak bond for the reasons listed below we never see how cesar antonio banderas and vince woody harrelson meet the two are so different from each other that scene of how this odd friendship developed should have been mandatory vince and cesar argue every moment possible on their trip las vegas there is not one convincing moment dedicated seeing the characters laugh together or actually agree on something the third character on the trip grace lolita davidovich stands in the way she is in nearly every scene them making it impossible understand the difficulty the two male characters are going have when they fight each other there are two many interfering irrelevant side stories vince is convinced that he sees jesus on regular basis cesar yells at the sky in spanish when he is angry and grace tries sell her inventions hotel owner robert wagner these boring tales only hurt the central plot when it comes time for the two men fight they do not even hesitate pound each other was not the whole point of the road trip show that these two are friends who could never hurt each other the time the road trip part of the movie is over the wants be over shelton on the other hand continues tell his story forty five painful minutes remain the boxing scene between cesar and vince starts out very powerful and interestingly different from other boxing movies however the fight goes on for way too long and becomes very repetitive and predictable after awhile kind of like the whole

some movies should just skip my daughter and had really vile time at my favorite martian few weeks back and here comes another disney effectsfilled liveaction flick based on an old tv program true the probgram is only years old this time and it is cartoon but it is cartoon liked and was understandably reluctant see what disney had done it on the big screen but my daughter really wanted go and how bad could it be turns out was right mostly inspector gadget oddly enough follows almost exactly the same format as my favorite martian down the jivetalking sidekick at first thought it was done the same people but imdb informs me that ig was directed david kellogg and written dana olsen and kerry ehrin where mfm was directed donald petrie and written sherri stoner and deanna oliver this odd similarity between the two movies may best be explained the studio that produced it where formula is not just business it is way of life the producers who obviously micromanaged the two projects should get prominant screen credits in some parts you can just hear them saying more zany want more zany here and here let us have really painful sexual reference for no reason right here make it really painful want the audience squirming in their seats ok that is fine but want you add bug guts what does this scene do character depth but where is the zaniness do not see zany here if you cannot make it zany cut it the latter is the only explanation can come up for the absence of the thoroughly charming michelle trachtenberg for most of the movie michelle who plays penny gadgets niece shines in every scene she is in but unfortunately she only gets about nine minutes of screen time my guess is that the rest is on the cutting room floor dabney colemans comedic talents are utterly wasted as chief quimby kept expecting him say or do something really funny and somehow save the but instead he does the best he can some really poor lines in few unexceptional scenes he is thoroughly upstaged cheri oteri as the gidget bitch from hell town mayor oteris overly enthusiastic and continually selfcongratulatory speech patterns and mannerisms were so much like portland oregons own manic mayor vera katz that had wonder if the studio was not poking fun at our fair town or maybe all career politicians are like that must say matthew broderick does not stroll through inspector gadget as he did godzilla he appears have some fun the especially as the evil gadget rupert everett is entertaining as the maniacle claw joely fisher does fine as the zany scientist and even better as the zany carbon copy of herself her performance is one of the few things worth watching in the l hughley plays the shuckinandjivin vehicular sidekick in role that firmly sets emancipation back years the dialog is let us face it it is pretty bad the tagline after major setpiece battle is faux pas that makes no sense in context lot of the lines especially hughleys appear be made up as they go along people little gift for adlib about threequarters of the is somewhat unnecessary origin story for both gadget and claw gadget then spends the latter third of the movie trying locate claw and having various altercations not really battles the evil gadget penny does about minute and half of the detective work her character did every week in the cartoon let me rage here just for minute michelle trachtenberg was an excellent choice for the penny character she is utterly charming and has excellent experience harriet the spy for the part of the pintsize detective why she is so underutilized in this is real mystery the loses star for casting brilliance coupled scripting or editing stupidity inspector gadget is missing the long long stretches of potty humor that among other things made my favorite martian so unbearable but it is very short movie so perhaps something was cut at the last moment probably the best scenes in the occur during the end credits the evil sidekick support group is especially worth seeing and has an amazing number of cameo appearances for the few seconds it is onscreen all in all another bad live action from the premere studio for bad live action films wonder if disney uses the revenues for it is generally moneymaking cartoons produce these losers but if true why if they are trying for another mary poppins they need find team that can produce one and then give them chance do it

hong kong cinema has been going through bad spell the last few productions have been effect laded action adventures that combine both the best and worst of american filmmaking the same qualities of hong kong films in nutshell the current crop of films from hong kong has been maddeningly convoluted and visually sumptuous the one time british colony reverting back mainland ownership lot of hong kongs best talents have crossed the pacific work on s productions such talents as jackie chan rush hour chow yunfat anna the king the corrupter and yuen wooping the matrix have all moved into the budget bloated world of filmmaking mixed results now we can add two other hong kong filmmakers the mix star jet li and director and fight choreographer corey yuen kwai unfortunately romeo must die bears all the trademarks of typical action and none of hong kongs rhythms the opens in nightclub as an asian couple is necking enter group of chinese gangsters led kai sing russell wong kai confronts po sing jon kit lee the son of kais boss and leader of the local chinese family battle breaks out between the bodyguards of the club and kai who handily kicks and punches his opponents down it is not until club owner silk rapper dmx bears down on kai and his henchmen that the fight ends the following morning po sing is found dead suspicions escalate as issac oday delroy lindo is told of the murder his concern that the war between his and the chinese family may explode and ruin his plans move out of the business of corruption and into legitimate venture issac implores his chief of security mac issiah washington watch after his son and daughter the scene shifts prison in china where han sing jet li learns of his brothers murder he fights the guards and is dragged off be disciplined hung upside down one foot han recovers and battle his way out of custody in blistering display of fight choreography and stunt work escaping the s han sets out find the person responsible for his brothers death romeo must die is in many ways fun it is both absurd and assured the basic plot of gangster wanting become legitimate echoes the godfather the relationship between jet lis han and aaliyahs trish oday reminds us of abel ferreras china girl except that romeo must dies couple never once exchange more than loving glance towards one another their romance is much more puritanical than any other romance in history the performances are adequate if not fully acceptable li of course has the showiest part having express both an innocents and steadfast determination allayah in her feature debut manages carry what little is asked of her certain style and grace it is obvious that the camera loves her and she is very photogenic but still the part is under written in such way that even poor performance would not have affected it delro lindo as issac oday carries himself well in the an unsung and under appreciated actor mr lindo turns out the films best performance the other performers are all adequate in what the script asks of them except for b woodside as issacs son colin the performance is undirected the character changing his tone and demeanor in accordance whatever location he is in an unfocused performance that should have been reigned in and or better written first time director andrzej bartkowiak does workmanlike job in handling the having career as one of the industrys best cinematographers bartkiwiak knows how set up his shots and romeo must die does look good but the pacing of the is lethargic only coming semblance of life during the fight scenes the script eric bernt and john jarrell is not focused in such way that we can care about the characters or the situations they are in the big gambit of buying up waterfront property facilitate the building of sports center for nfl team is needlessly confusing and of course the common practice of one character being the comic relief of the becomes painfully obvious here as anthony anderson as allayahs bodyguard maurice has no comic timing whatsoever the best things about the are its fight scenes jet li is master of these intricate physical battles one needs only see his fist of legend understand that the man is without peer in the realm of martial art combat here jet is given the opportunity show off in way that lethal weapon jets s debut did not allow unfortunately lot of jets fights are aided computer effects that detract from his ability and precision also romeo must die must be noted as having the most singularly useless effect ever committed and that is an xray effect that appears three times during the course of the showing the effect of bone crushing blows on an opponent obviously homage the famed xray scene from sonny chibas streetfighter the scenes here are just pointless and interfere the pacing of the it is as if the has stopped and video game has been inserted one problem though about the fight scenes those that are familiar hong kong action know that even though the films are fantasies and are as removed from reality as any anime or cartoon they do have an internal rhythm them heartbeat so speak in their choreography the fight scenes in hong kong breath an emotional resonance this is created the performance the direction and the editing here in romeo must die there is no staccato every fight scene even though technically adroit and amazing becomes boring as the editing both cuts away from battle at hand and simple follows set pattern the rhythm is monotonous hong kong has tempo that changes heightening its emotional impact rmd is limited standard tempo not allowing for any emotional content whatsoever fine example of this difference can be found examining couple of jackie chans films watch the restaurant fight from the rush hour and notice that the context of the fight while technically amazing is rather flat the framing and cut always do not help now look at the warehouse fight from rumble in the bronx there you have heartbeat and emotional draw that does not let the audience catch its breath the stops and pauses for dramatic effect work perfectly causing the viewer be both astounded and flabbergasted here in romeo must die the fight scenes have no more emotional content or character than any john wayne barroom brawl jet li is grand and personable screen presence it is shame that his full talents were not used full effect here one day filmmakers here in the s will stop making films the numbers and start embrace the style and emotion that has made hong kong action pictures such commodity until then we will be left emotionally hollow product like the replacement killer and currently romeo must die

i wish could have been in the pitch meeting for this ridiculous notion of sports bet it was some hotshot warner brothers agent an dark armani suit and manicured fingernails saying it would be very light comedic version of any given sunday and we could throw in the hoosiers angle the casting of gene hackman as the tough but determined coach throw in that hunk of guy keanu reeves and cast of wacky characters and poof we will have hit on our hands the replacements is hokey mistake of football mishmash collage of onedimensional characters rampant stereotypes of cultures and races cliched emotional statements of purpose and keanu reeves wishing for the matrix sequel start principal photography the story is loosely based around the pro football players strike in and ragtag team of replacement football players taking up the reins of professional play for variety of teams names like the washington sentinels keanu reeves stars as shane falco hasbeen football college player looking for redemption gene hackman dons fedora like tom landry and speaks gusto like certain coach in hoosiers rounding out the cast includes swingers jon favreau up pitchman orlando jones gruff owner jack warden and cast of wacky and unknown actors who do amazing jobs of portraying perfectly stereotyped characters the drunken welshman the overweight sumo wrestler the black convict the violent cop and the dumb dumb cheerleaders this bunch of nobodies try make something of themselves taking the team the season playoffs unbelievable football plays gene hackman yelling and asking himself where the hell dennis hopper is keanu reeves looking for his body double making him look good on the football field and cheerleaders hired from the local strip club making the girls from coyote ugly look like waitresses from dennys the usual things happen like clockwork the hero rises from the ashes of failure the team comes together in unity the hero falls in love conventional love interest the football games are won enough schlock value make the most ignorant of audiences cheer and clap and the cheerleaders make you want go home and watch late night movies on cinemax it is also shame when decent directors good movies under their belts go seed and become television and sequel hacks howard deutch who was behind the camera for two of the best films of pretty in pink and some kind of wonderful has since been doing grumpier old men and caroline in the city episodes obviously the problem is that without good script any director will fail in the end sports films are strong vehicles for cinematic glory gritty tales involving the honor of men and the valiant efforts taken for the ultimate goal of victory in the face of insurmountable odds the rise and fall of gallant heroes and stories of dramatic gusto painted blood and sweat on the battlefield of life the replacements offers none of this

if you are into watching near on two hours of bored foulmouthed florida teens having sex doing drugs having sex listening eminem having sex playing video games having sex and killing one of their peers then bully for you based on jim schutzes novelization of truelife event bully charts the story of handful of disenchanted teenagers who in murdered their high school bully in cold calculated blood the could have provided fascinating insights into what turned these aimless kids into premeditated killers in the hands of controversial director larry clark kids however it has less say about its subject matter and more say about the filmmakers pornographic proclivities in terms of the incident and what provoked it bully stirs up nothing new the high schoolers are presented as uniformly screwed up lotbored life not much ambition promiscuous profane the bully in question bobby kent nick stahl is certainly an unpleasant piece of work but he does not exactly tower over his colleagues in the pathological department he hounds and harries and humiliates his best friend marty played brad renfro and martys girlfriend lisa rachel miner does not care for it at all and comes up the idea of killing bobby simply remove him from the equation marty and lisa and handful of their promiscuous profane and stoner friends plus recruited hit man lure bobby swamp one night stab him beat him over the head baseball bat and dump him into the canal where the sand crabs and the gators presumably finish him off there is no remorsethe next day they are talking about it as openly as homework assignment they did it because they wanted and because they could what is most troubling about the however is not the unsettling subject matter and the matteroffact way these young people go about eliminating one of their own but the way in clark is constantly distracted his own material not only is the nudity plentiful and graphic in bully but there is also an uneasy exploitative feel it gratuitous crotch shots abound one of makes the zipper cutaway in there is something about mary look like the height of subtlety clark is so preoccupied his female predominantly leads that you forget at times what this movie is supposed be about the stripping bare literally and figuratively of these actors who are after all playing underage teenagers becomes harder watch over time as you begin feel for them and question the motives of the man behind the camera the conclusion of bully offers up literal snapshots of information about the sentences imposed on each of the protagonists for their involvement in the crime it is short sequence of stillsheather years ali years lisa life imprisonment for examplebut it is infinitely more telling than the minutes of rampant unpleasantness that precedes it bully aims for truth exploits it shamelessly then bludgeons it death

sean connery stars as harvard law professor who heads back into the courtroom way of the everglades defend young educated black man blair underwood the guy is on death row for the murder of white girl and says that his confession was coerced from the regions tough black cop lawrence fishburne watching connery and fishburne bump heads for two hours is amusing enough but the plots joke there is no logic at work here tone is also an issuethere is none director arne glimcher never establishes exactly what his is trying say is it statement on human rights is it knockoff of silence of the lambs glimcher never tells instead he forces his characters jump through hoop after hoop over drawbridge after drawbridge hoping that the audience will not notice what is missing just awful the madness of king george min not rated still wondering who nigel hawthorne is then check out his oscar nominated work in the madness of king george still playing in both raleigh and chapel hill stage director nicholas hytner in remarkable screen debut has adapted alan bennetts tragic comedy fine effect sumptuouslooking and only mildly stuffy the charts the madness that plagued king george iii hawthorne almost years into his reign man of no importance min rated in suri krishnammas man of no importance albert finney disappears so deeply into the role of lovable dublin bus conductor that it is shame when the gets so serious around him his character is conductor passion for oscar wilde he reads his riders and once year their help he tries stage one of the authors plays this year it is salome for about an hour there is sweet magic behind finney and his troupe of workingclass stiffs conflict arises but it is small stuffan administrator from the bus company here an outraged catholic pork butcher michael gambon there but finney at the wheel so speak the rolls smoothly over these plot pointsjust like the gorgeous leland doubledecker bus in the story where things get serious is toward the end of the when the plot takes turn that the bus never would and the story heads down very dark alley that marks the end of an enjoyable ride the twist makes senseand helps paint complete picture of finneys characterbut the trip get there betrays the light airy atmosphere of what had come before it is not fatal misstep mind you and it does not send the story soaring into the realms of incredulity it is just turn off dr strangelove min not rated mein fuhrer the most fun that had last month was in durham at the carolina at midweek screening of stanley kubricks pitchblack comedy dr strangelove or how learned stop worrying and love the bomb the stars peter sellers in three roles george scott sterling hayden and slim pickens their antics brought the house down my surprise was packed an audience younger than the

among multitude of erotic thrillers that had been released in the early woman of desire is interesting only because it was directed robert ginty star of the bgrade action films of the previous decade those who tend not be nostalgic about can find very good reason in the type of movies that made ginty the star as director ginty did very little improve that impression the protagonist of the movie is jack played jeff fahey yacht skipper that falls madly in love christina ford played bo derek however she has relationship rich and powerful jonathan ashby steven bauer one stormy night the tragedy occurs and jack is accused of rape and murder however his good friend walter hill robert mitchum happens be very good lawyer so jack might even prove his innocence in the end belonging more the genre of courtroom drama than erotic thriller woman of desire distinguishes itself from similar films having almost all characters behaving like total idiots unfortunately this is not comedy and any laugh is unintentional the characters are totally antipathetic and irritating and soon we stop caring what would happen them the actors that play them do not help either that is especially the case jeff fahey whose jack is so stupid that even the character played fahey in lawnmower man looks like genius in comparison his partner bo derek on the other hand shows that she did not age enough cease being the sex goddess but that is small compensation for her apparent lack of acting talents ginty on the other hand tries bring some life in the movie using many flashbacks and strange angles of shooting but in the end it gets only irritating the already bored and dissatisfied viewer

lake placid marks yet another entry in the series of predator pics that were screen staple in the late post jaws and were revived recently the godawful anaconda placid claims be horrorcomedy it is directed the same guy who did house but its attempts at humor are actually less funny than deadpan seriousness of anaconda paleontologist kelly scott bridget fonda is sent up maine examine tooth removed from body that had been bitten in half on the lake discovering that the tooth belongs crocodile should not even be in this hemisphere kelly goes crochunting game warden jack wells bill pullman and sheriff hank keough brendan gleeson they are joined an unwelcome guest hector cyr oliver platt scholar who worships crocs and searches all over the world for them along the way the merry band meets mrs delores bickerman betty white weird old lady who lives out on the lake you know what expect from this movie lots of shots where the camera is the eyes of the predator croc cam swimming toward someones dangling legs while jaws like music plays one character hector who is obsessed the croc and stupidly endangers the rest another character who insists that the predator cannot possibly exist unlike its slippery cousin anaconda lake placid wants present its formulaic plot tongueincheek is selfdefeating the result is neither scary nor funny it is just tedious while director steve miner has several horror films on his resume including two installments of friday the th and halloween screenwriter david kelley best known as the creator of tv series like ally mcbeal and chicago hope does not seem have the stomach for chomp em up flick the body count is surprisingly low and does not include any of the major characters and most annoyingly kelly and hector insist that they capture the crocodile alive rather than killing it lake placid manages have it both waysi will let you discover how for yourself the croc itself is mostly computergenerated of course like the snake in anaconda the thirtyfoot monster crocodile does not seem real it moves too quickly and in ways that seem unnatural lake placid also offers little explanation for why giant crocodile is in maine there is lot of semimystical mumbo jumbo about how we really do not know much about crocodiles they would have been better off going something like the urban myth about alligators in the sewers movie like this does not have offer much of an explanation radioactive mutant creature from outer space but it does have give the audience something hang their disbelief on pullman and fonda seem be plodding through the movie on autopilot most of the time they are probably thinking about killing their agents or wondering if making this movie marks the end of their careers platt and white on the other hand seem be giving their best efforts and they manage squeeze few chuckles out of this sorry script

capsule where are you tonight leni rienfenstal starship troopers is an expensive hateful and unenjoyable piece of violent pornography and bad pornography at that it is not good cinema not good storytelling and not even stupid fun it is so cynically calculatedly boneheaded that even the least demanding members of the audience was were alternately bored and revulsed it is one of the worst movies have seen in long time why am calling this movie pornography pornography in the abstract is anything is calculated appeal the baser instincts remember reading review of full metal jacket described the climact moment at the end of the movie where private joker has shoot the downed vc sniper as nearpornographic eternity did not agree that assessment but could see what was being implied the reviewer felt as if the audience was being incited stand up and pump their fists and shout do er man do er that sentiment is echoed ad nauseam throughout starship troopers it is literally like giant recruitment that has gone berserk it tries frantically enlist our emotions but it winds up only being dull or sickening the takes place in our future when earth has come under attack some alien species that does not appear have intelligence counterattack humankind does the single stupidest thing imaginable instead of nuke the planet from orbit they are clearly capable of they send down grunts rifles this is not heinlein it is bad wwii movie one where all the most obvious points of satire are ever poked and prodded in combat scenes that are noisy repetitive and ultimately tiresome one scene has journalist on battlefield filimg soldiers being slaughtered and ends groaning predictability said cameraman gets skewered too the soldiers and their commanders are consistently idiotic they do not possess germ of tactical intelligence or even common sense they do not even behave like soldiers in bad movie and therefore we do not care about them we hated the tom berenger character in platoon but he mattered and therefore we were curious learn about his fate here we do not even hate the bugs what is there hate hating them would be like cursing hurricaine if there is anything really hateful there the movie does not know how give it us the screenwriter ed neumeier perhaps better appelation would be screen typist and director the increasingly talentimpaired paul verhoeven have not found any way make the characters or the story serve each other one of the subplots concerns woman pilot who is great at getting out of tight situations and does it again and again and again once or twice is fine the fifth or sixth time it is worn out its welcome there is never any sense that these people are really thinking their way out of anything or really being tested show their mettle also the movie is irritatingly selective how effective the bugs are earthling weaponry if bug has one of the humans screaming in its grasp then five guys can stand around it and blast away on full auto without doing damned thing but if one human gets cornered he lays waste whole platoons of bugs one clip uhhuh the very worst feature of the movie is its repulsive quasifascist flavor say quasi because while the movie uses many of the trappings of fascism ot eroticize its action the gear the uniforms etc the movie does not have the nerve or the brains be genuinely fascist or intelligent about the subject the bumpers between scenes are apparently intended parody wartime recruitment propaganda are propaganda just so clumsy and oafish that they wind up making the bugs look relatively innocuous in comparison like the rest of the movie there is more suppose but it is not worth it the acting is bland neither arsenic nor gravy the music disposable the camerawork turgid the heartbreaking thing is that it makes independence day look like masterpiece

the classic story the production ruined it marking the centennial anniversary of the g wells classic new line cinema armed stellar cast and expert makeup effects man stan winston alien predator terminator etc churns out yet another based on the classic novel of course the production is no doubt much more superior compared the earlier movies one of was made back in the and the other in the under the title the island of lost souls sounds like much better title the story begins edward douglas thewlis un representative sent oversee peace treaty somewhere in the south pacific who is saved from the brink of death montgomery kilmer after his plane crashes into the sea douglas soon learns that montgomery is working for dr moreau who incidently owns the island and also reputable geneticist who has been awarded the nobel prize his hosts reluctance allow him freely move around the island becomes clear when he stumbled into moreaus lab when monstrous birth was in progress even worse the other workers in the lab are not exactly normal people douglas stumbles across yet another shocking discovery when he is led the beastpeople community considers dr moreau their maker using shocktherapy and the law dr moreau has long been able keep his beastpeople civilised some extent but there are few animalmen who are just too savage be controlled the island of dr moreau questions the ability of men playing god dr moreau is man obsessed creating race of beings is free from hate and violence but the savage within every beast is not something one can suppress for long moreau has no doubt very interesting premise within its grasp even so the production has failed make the most out of it there are too many characters put your attention and the worst thing is the characters are not prioritized so when the audience is led believe that particular character is important before they know it he or she or it perishes rather ungloriously at times too perhaps there is some redemption in the development of the beast people especially aissa balk the most human of moreaus creations the two very important characters montgomery and dr moreau himself receive no development at all and it is in this area that the script fails miserably more screen time could have been used for character interaction and development really would have liked it better if say they delved more into dr moreaus obsession montgomerys purpose in the story and justification as why the beastpeople had rebel maybe the nature of the screenplay incidently does not incorporate much action sequences in the forced the filmmakers cut long story short and make it more of an action than anything else it is still summer and movies have be marketable the special effects too are really nothing for anyone shout about at most would say the beastmen looked just bit more realistic than those apes in planet of the apes this g wells classic really has potential be good unfortunately after adaptations they still could not decide on how and what focus their attention on really bring out that important message makes up the entire essence of the story as third outing the island of dr moreau accomplishes little and is nothing more than an inferior version of the planet of the apes the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

lengthy and lousy are two words describe the boring drama the english patient great acting music and cinematography were nice but too many dull subplots and characters made the hard follow ralph fiennes strange days schindlers list gives gripping performance as count laszlo almasy victim of amnesia and horrible burns after world war ii in italy the story revolves around his past in flashback form making it even more confusing anyway he is taken in hana juliette binoche the horseman on the roof boring wartorn nurse she was never really made into anything until she met an indian towards the end developing yet another subplot count almasy begins remember what happened him as it is explained stranger willem dafoe basquiat his love kirstin scott thomas mission impossible was severely injured in plane crash and eventually died in cave he returned find her dead and was heartbroken so he flew her dead body somewhere but was shot down from the ground do not get the wrong idea it may sound good and the trailer may be tempting but good is the last thing this is maybe if it were an hour less it may have been tolerable but hours and minutes of talking is too much handle the only redeeming qualities about this are the fine acting of fiennes and dafoe and the beautiful desert cinematography other than these the english patient is full of worthless scenes of boredom and wastes entirely too much

out of sight director steven sorderbergh baffles the hell out of us all in the limey cold uninvolving confusing new thriller though the plot description may at first seem like it came from the pen of elmore leonard author of out of sight as well as jackie brown get shorty and pulp fiction after you watch it you realize that it is not nearly good enough in an aggressively nonlinear fashion the limey li mey noun an english gentleman tells the story of wilson terrence stamp british excon just released from year stint in prison for armed robbery he has come the us seek vengeance for the death of his daughter jenny he does not know much about the circumstances of her demise all he has is name terry valentine valentine was jennys former boyfriend wealthy and corrupt record executive he is played peter fonda in his first major role since the terrific ulees gold in seeking valentines reclusive place of residence turns out be no easy task for wilson he finally finds the impressive abode high in the mountains and sneaks in just as valentine is having big party he winds up breaking his cover eventually setting off valentines head of security and valentine himself who decides run for it what mess have no problem when films refuse be constricted the linearity of time pulp fiction twisted time every way was masterpiece but do take exception movies that decide play around it for no reason other than confuse the viewer the limey does exactly that the plot is permeated flashbacks flashforwards and what can only be described as random timetravel without any evident purpose there is no method this movies madness it uses fancy way tell story that would be better off told more conventionally and more comprehendably the plot is not particularly interesting in the first place traditional mildly hackneyed and not very involving this is sort of brooding our protagonist does not speak much and the action sequences are done an annoyingly perfunctory attitude felt like the director was not very interested in the proceedings himself almost like he made this for paycheck ditto for the editing seems be deliberately sloppy and unpleasant sixties icon terrence stamp manages at least be menacing as the aging criminal he is not much in the way of stature but he has surprisingly imposing physical presence that works his advantage here peter fonda is an unbelievably underrated actor he is shy quiet but always effective he is adept at conveying emotions through speech rather than expression his feelings do not always show on his face you can always tell what they are this is basically conventional thriller told in pretentiously bizarre fashion why soderbergh could not just parrot down and tell story do not know but what he does do certainly does not work the result is wild cornucopia of images that amount precisely nil even the action scenes do not work may have signified the death of the traditional act one act two act three storyline but obviously some movies have not yet transcended it shall we go back basics

a pseudointellectual about the pseudointellectual world of art magazines high art is as wasted as its drugaddled protagonists in the only notable part of the movie ally sheedy and radha mitchell deliver nice performances in the two leading roles not that lisa cholodenkos script or direction makes you care much about either character living in world of heroin induced highs they float along until they fall in love each other this uninviting picture full of pretentious minor characters has receptionist that reads dostoevski and woman in the restroom line who is certified genius having recently been awarded prestigious mcarthur grant yearold syd radha mitchell who has rather bland livein boyfriend was just promoted assistant editor at the artistic photography magazine frame although the receptionist is impressed syd is mainly gofer for her boss until she meets famous photographer lucy berliner ally sheedy for her do photos for frame lucy demands that syd be promoted editor and assigned her since lucy fancies her lucy lives her current lover washed up german actress named greta played frequently indecipherable series of mumbles patricia clarkson the two of them and their friends wile away their time snorting and shooting up dope usually heroin this does not happen in single episode but becomes more commonplace than sleeping in the picture syd who lives in the apartment below them joins in on the fun and becomes member of the zombie club lucy seems pretty happy her life of drugs apparently is funded her mother lucy quit working professionally years ago since she thought she was being pigeonholed and since her mother has money we can only assume that that is how lucy supports her habit and procures her living expenses typical scene has the editors arguing about whether potential photographers work is transcendental or merely classical that no one has clue as the dogma they are spouting becomes obvious but not particularly funny your work has cultural currency that is important now is the artistspeak that the frames manager uses convince lucy show her pictures in the magazine when the big scene comes in lucy puts the moves on syd her idea of romantic line is want get high you in lucys world sex and drugs come handinhand and the movie except for the obligatory scene of someone almost overdosing shows drug usage as being hip and natural part of the art scene this vacuous picture throws in standard downer ending in an attempt manipulate our emotions in another movie it might have worked but in this one the reaction is likely be decidedly muted high art runs it is rated for explicit sex pervasive drug use and language and is not appropriate for those younger than college age

party camp is one of the most mindnumbingly brainless comedies have seen in awhile late ripoff of the meatballs series the follows group of young camp counselors at camp chipmunk that is really about all that can be said about the plot because nothing much happens except that the main character wisecracking jerry andrew ross has the hots for cute blonde kerry brennan and there is big contest in the climax how fun since party camp has practically no screenplay and there is no talent at all involved the least the makers could have done was make it raunchy and exploitative it is not that think exploitation is necessarily good quality but when you are talking about dull turkey like this the least that could have been done would be fill it lot of mindless sex even psychopathic slasher at the camp would have done the trick at least then it would not have been such chore sit through never before have seen so many jokes fall astoundingly flat the comedy was easy spot but it was not the least bit funny it was groaninducing constantly throghout was asking myself if director gary graver actually thought this movie was worth anything so what saves party camp from the dreaded zero star rating well that is simple jewel shepard as flighty bimbo was admittedly fun watch although nothing could have saved this from the lowest depths of motion picture trash at least if the had centered on shepard she might have been able add little spice an otherwise rancid lowbudget teen comedy

i am currently accepting all future names for drew barrymore characters in _the wedding singer_ she was julia gulia in _never been kissed_ she is josie grossie future db character names include janet granite janey grainy and for that nc project in the works jojo aw forget it will stick my day job this is teen movie all right except the main characters are not teens drew barrymore is copy editor at the chicago sun times who gets her big break as reporter only it is very clear from the onset that she lacks the toughness and the pushy extravertedness that marks the best of reporters the story she is covering is not really story but story in the making she is return high school as student and explain what is really going on the irony is that drews character was such dweeb first time around that she is terrified at going back when she does she says the wrong things wears the wrong clothes and projects the know the answer in class that popular kids or at least popular kids in the movies reject at least she befriends nerdy aldys joan of arcs leelee sobieskiwatch for her who turns out be more beautiful than those who are supposed be more beautiful than her what works drews geeky oldself after start in films that was headline driven and nadir of roles that had her play the sluttish character it is surprise see her bad hair big glasses and braces it is very funny what does not work drews geeky newself come on nobody dresses as bad as she does could not she just go _the gap_ and take suggestions had she dressed like princess leia it would have been better the comedy is supposed progress when drews younger brother played zest david arquette reenlists jumpstart his baseball career now how in the world can somebody as nerdy but in funny way as he can be the most popular kid in the school in day the dialogue in the is well an embarrassment her coworkers molly shannon john reilly and gary marshall are in terminal hyperdrive her teenage peers except sobieski are so inept and stupid that there is little bite from them could not the filmmakers watch _heathers_ first lastly am proud say that caught significant gaffe in the if you see the you would know what am talking about drew walks into bar has her hand stamped and over the night associates some rastafarians some delicious um cake she goes wild sleeps in late when she wakes she rushes off school without showering without noticing that her head lying on her stamped hand all night has transferred part of the stamps image her forehead spelling loser funny eh except that the hand would have transferred that image backwords

when it comes the average teenage romantic comedy expect negative reviews from critics left and right predictable unoriginal and forgettable will most likely be the three adjectives haunt the down yous and the drive me crazys released the dozens these last couple of years what really look for in this kind of movie is the entertainment value while am sitting in the theater am enjoying myself is this comfortable break from my week of finals this is why have given films like final destination or road trip high marks had party of time wasting my money on something will not remember next week so last week opened up the new york times and no surprise boys and girls got negative review daily news negative reelviews negative epinions com negative this was nothing new american pie final destination road trip did not get such hot reviews and loved those guilty pleasures same goes for she is all that formulaic but enjoyable pygmalion adaptation that got unjustly pounded since boys and girls reunites she is all that director robert iscove and actor freddie prinze jr predicted j vu al over again but still curious asked around my school and from the one or two people who had seen it the reactions were far from positive had made up my mind will catch it on video or cable in couple of years but soon after following series of unexpected events we could not get into shaft because it is rated i found myself watching boys and girls whoops boys and girls is about nerdy smart boy named ryan prinze jr and popular flirt girl named jennifer claire forlani briefly meeting as preteens and now attending the same college the two bump into each other so many times that eventually they become best friends but in the movies male and female cannot be friends without having that nagging feeling of attraction for each other advice from their roommates amanda detmer jason biggs ryan and jennifer attempt discover the true meaning of their relationship the definitely lives up the dreaded three adjectives and mindless entertainment is nowhere be found could hardly sit through the minute running time for several reasons the dialogue is probably the worst have ever seen in any movie mainly because the whole movie depends on the boring script and the ridiculous words these characters use is what thinks kids can relate it is almost offensive an example of an insightful conversation you are dumb dumb dumb dumb dumb no followed mandy mooreesque tune background well it is not as bad as wing commander guess the supporting cast is also painfully useless detmer and biggs stand in the way for anything interesting happen their own boring pointless subplots and although this is supposed be from both perspectives of the human sex prinze jrs ryan dominates the screen while forlanis jennifer simply acts as dilemma for him work we never learn anything about jennifer is shame too because forlani is the only actor bring any life into her character teenager or not you will hate this movie guarantee it maybe should rent she is all that again is it really as good as think it is

all through its production and into the early days of its initial aborted prerelease publicity hard rain bore the appropriate moniker of the flood ultimately however paramount pictures nervous that this movie would be confused other underperforming disaster films dantes peak volcano changed the title and shifted the release date nearly year but paraphrase the bard swill any other name would smell as rank no number of name changes can help this picture it is not just about disaster it is disaster hard rain is the case of movie that gets progressively worse every passing minute the best shot occurs during the opening credits as the camera pans over the streets and byways of huntingburg indiana as the water level slowly rises the community protected an overworked dam is being evacuated as the rain continues pour relentlessly from the cloudchoked skies from that moment on it is all downhill whatever initial entertainment value the possesses has long since drained away the halfway point it takes forever get the end credits this is one of the longestseeming minute motion pictures have recently endured basically hard rain is one extended dull chase sequence punctuated occasional shootouts there is lot of water broken glass gunfire and explosions it is all very routine and uninteresting because there are not any real characters and the plot only occasionally makes sense the films conclusion is so preposterous that it is almost worth watching for the sheer masochistic enjoyment of seeing the monumentally idiotic way that the makers decide resolve the myriad subplots that are floating around action films are supposed become progressively more invigorating as they rush towards conclusion graham yost the writer of both speed and hard rain surely understands that principle unfortunately neither he nor cinematographerturneddirector mikael salomon far off place applies it the action in hard rain grows tedious through repetition we see the same kinds of things speedboat chases flood damage shootouts etc over and over again the movie constantly recycles about twenty minutes worth of material pad the running time out an acceptable movie length the storyline gives us number of paperthin characters in contrived circumstances there is tom christian slater the one dimensional action hero who works as security guard driving an armored car full of cash he and his partner charlie edward asner tvs lou grant get stuck on street that is rapidly turning into river group of men led jimmy morgan freeman arrive on the scene not as rescuers but as robbers after charlie is killed in shootout tom hides the money then runs as he swims and boats his way through huntingburgs roads he encounters some of the locals karen minnie driver wouldbe love interest bickering old couple richard dysart and betty white who are on hand provide comic relief and the easilycorrupted sheriff randy quaid whose seeming helpfulness hides sinister ulterior motives there is not any real acting in this christian slater utters few lame oneliners and does lot of mugging for the camera tom is easily one of the most lifeless characters the actor has brought the screen randy quaid sneers lot and is totally unconvincing morgan freeman and minnie driver both attempt give legitimate performances but they are defeated the script freeman one of the best cinematic thespians working today looks suitably embarrassed be here but suppose everyone needs good paycheck from timetotime following in the wake of twister this is yet another natural disaster movie that does not trust natures fury as the chief engine of conflict as result we are saddled an idiotic good guysbad guys story that effectively ruins any potential that the flood tale could have had titanic proved that there can be wealth of drama in movie where everything goes under water hard rain successfully demonstrates that the opposite is equally possible thus far this year has already subjected us its unique brand of moronic mayhem fire firestorm and water hard rain fortunately there are only two elements left

instinct is the kind of movie that inexperienced moviegoers will undoubtedly label as powerful or touching have name for it myself gross this is the sort of where somebody stands up bully the bully looks at the rebel threateningly about hurt him and then everyone else whom the bully has heretofore controlled stands up too how that scene is still present in so many movies today appalls me are not present day moviegoers beyond being inspired something like that this is one example there are actually some more in instinct alone of filmmakers insulting the audiences intelligence instincts plot is brimming potential worldrenowned anthropologist ethan powell anthony hopkins disappeared for two years whilst doing research in the jungles of africa he was found and is coming back the united states convicted killer he murdered african policemen who were allegedly trying capture him after committing few more brutal acts of violence in the airport the authorities stick him in prisons psychotics ward assigned do an evaluation on powell is bright or so we are told young psychiatrist theo caulder cuba gooding jr caulder starts out doing the evaluation merely for the purpose of furthering his career of course and no mainstream filmmaker would ever have it any other way he starts really caring for powell and he becomes fixed on helping powell prove that he is not psychotic and that he should not be in prison and then there is the inevitable heartless meanie character in the form of donald sutherland who plays caulders mentor he cares for caulder but does everything he can discourage him from helping powell let us get one thing straight dr theo caulder is the most blatantly incompetent psychiatrist have ever seen on screen or off any good shrink will listen what his patient has say no matter the subject because any good shrink will learn great deal about his patient that way not good old theo no he asks purposefully pointed questions and when powell dares venture another subject caulder says we need talk about this right now this is flaw only in the sense that it detracts from instincts already dubious credibility unfortunately it is also the least of its problems director jon turteltaub who made the delightful john travolta vehicle phenomenon as well as the surprisingly abovepar cool runnings decided make this movie so shamelessly sentimental that contrary what this movies promotion would have you believe it has much more in common patch adams than the silence of the lambs it is not the kind of sentimentality that can almost bring tears your eyes what dreams may come aptly demonstrated that but the kind that brings vomit up your esophagus excuse the graphic depiction it aims inspire rather than touch hearts as yoda would say inspire it does not it is the ultimate sign of futility when screenwriter the very experienced gerald di pego has resort literally telling the audience movies story indeed somewhere in the beginning of instinct one of the characters actually reads aloud the films plot another character this like the instance mentioned in the first paragraph of this review is horrid insult our intelligence am forced wonder whether turteltaub and di pego did not think that we could figure out what instinct is about simply from regular conversation think that anthony hopkins is one of the greatest screen actors and he chews the scenery in this movie brilliant as ever oscar winner cuba gooding jr on the other hand is dreadful his performance is at least part of what makes his character seem so incapable of being shrink liked the guy in jerry maguire as well as in as good as it gets but here he fails project any shred of credibility or real feeling love animals and instincts prominent save the gorillaslive in harmony nature theme is certainly something could sympathize however this movies execution is completely unacceptable tone down the violence and this will be chick flick eugene novikov

sydney lumet is the director whose work happens be of varied quality he is praised for some of the most important films of the previous decades like twelve angry men serpico or the verdict but in the same time almost any of such pearls is followed stinkers that hamper lumets reputation stranger among us ripoff of peter weirs witness belongs the latter category the heroine of this movie is emily eden melanie griffith tough lady cop who sometimes shows too much enthusiasm in battling bad guys on the streets of new york during one of such actions her partner nick jamey sheridan got hurt and as result she becomes depressed in order help her recover bosses give her rather easy task of locating missing jeweller who belonged hassidic jew community emily starts investigation and soon realises that the case involves murder concluding that the perpetrator belongs community she decides go undercover that is not easy because her modern manners are colliding traditionalist ways things get even more complicated when she develops feelings for young cabalistic scholar ariel eric thal using peter weirs formula is not the greatest flaw of this even the lame and unispiring crime mystery subplot works the certain extent but the worst insult viewers audience is terrible miscasting of melanie griffith the author of this review never liked this actress very much but she was at least tolerable in some of her roles role of emily eden unfortunately is not one of them first of all she cannot pass for tough nypd street fighter and her attempt pass for orthodox jewish woman is not much better screenplay robert avrech makes things even worse some formulaic red herring subplots scene involving two italian gangsters was almost too painful watch but on the other hand other actors are more convincing lee richardson as an old rabbi thal as ariel and charming mia sara as his intended bride and the photography andrzej bartkowiak very effectively creates atmosphere of warmth when the scenes take place in hassidic community also the might educate viewers about hassidic culture that is the only thing that prevents it from turning into total waste of time

the world on land it is just too big for me starring tim roth pruitt taylor vince bill nunn clarence williams iii rated the legend of is the years most absurd movie rambling nonsensical piece of seafaring garbage that goes nowhere fast it stars thespian extraordinaire tim roth looking wistful as ever as guy named you heard right his name is in all actuality he was born on an ocean liner on uh hence the name abandoned and adopted danny ship crewman spends most of his early years hiding in the bowels of the ship because of dannys fear that he might be taken away from him because of visa matters well when is about or so he starts wondering all around the ship one day he discovers grand piano he sits down and starts playing miraculously what comes out is beautiful group of onlookers gathers watch this stunning prodigy make such amazing music at such young age when one of the people who knows tells him that his playing the piano like that without permission is totally against regulations replies ck the regulations ho ho ho grows up never setting foot on dry land when he is about ish and can play the piano like nobodys business onboard comes another musician his name is max
