pruitt taylor vince and he plays the trumpet after catches max barfing everywhere during storm he sits him down on the piano next him takes the pianos braces off and plays while the piano flies all around the hall taking them it how the chair they are sitting on and the piano do not separate do not know but this apparently is not the kind of thing we are supposed ask after that and max become friends max is determined get off the ship and discover what he is missing on land but has no intention of doing so what is more he does not even want his music go anywhere without him when record company hears about his talents they come on board make record of his music but after finding out that gasp they are going make millions of copies he breaks the record the conflict of the movie is that after max unsuccessful in his endeavor get off the ship gets off himself he stumbles upon record of music in store the record should not exist because never stepped on dry land and the one record that was made on the ship was broken ladies and gentlemen it is mystery the story itself is ludicrous and uninteresting and so are its elements we are supposed be roused climactic piano duel there is not anything in this movie the potential compel comes off as whiny brooding extremely unlikable man cannot recall single word he said that was not some sort of depressing pseudo meditation on life ditto for max who does not seem have life outside his friendship tim roth plays about as much panache as fig leaf there is no spirit no gusto the character he insists that he leads happy life on the ship but us he is dead pruitt taylor vince is little more palatable at least providing moment of comic relief here and there liven things up bit the highlight of the movie would have be the eminently amusing clarence williams the iii as the arrogant leering king of jazz who challenges the aforementioned piano duel the legend of was made giuseppe tornatore whose cinema paradiso is considered masterpiece many this effort is utterly limp and lifeless at once ridiculous boring narrowsighted and pointless this is one movie that should be and will be quickly forgotten

my giant is two movies for the price of one but neither is worth the cost of admission even if you get in free as lamely directed michael lehmann the picture tries be comedy using and reusing every giant joke in the book without goliath david is just some punk throwing rocks languidly paced throughout the movie becomes increasingly lugubrious as the screenplay david seltzer the omen meanders toward its sad ending since it is rarely funny or convincingly dramatic what the filmmakers thought they were doing remains mystery other than few nice visuals there is nothing recommend the picture great comedies under his belt from when harry met sally the original city slickers billy crystal has shown that he is more than the worlds best oscar host he does however have propensity for choosing hopeless material as in last years fathers day and this years my giant one wonders if he reads the script before agreeing go ahead project surely reading the one for my giant would have shown that there was nothing there perhaps he thought he could ad lib it into success or maybe he wants be dramatic actor and thought he could do something serious the movies somber tone the most charitable thing that could be said about it is that it is so ineffectual that people will probably forget they saw it the next day this onejoke movies single idea is place reallife basketball player gheorghe muresan who stands seven and half feet tall into as many visually striking situations as possible sammy crystal an agent currently without clients is rescued after car accident sweet romanian giant named max muresan after throwing out constant oneliners either god is in the salvage business or big foot just took my car sammy decides get serious seeing max as his meal ticket and although he does not like it he is willing sign max up do disgusting events like wrestling match halfdozen dwarfs the movie itself knows no bounds as it contains one of the most putrid and lengthy vomiting scenes ever after series of missed opportunities the comedic part of the movie is over and it turns into cheap and maudlin disease movie we learn that maxs condition is terminal and he will soon die be fair the movie does contain few good scenes all of you can see in the trailers let us hope billy gets himself pair of reading glasses before he signs up for another movie my giant runs too long even at just it is rated pg for violence and profanity and would be acceptable for kids around ten and up my son jeffrey and his friend matthew both gave the movie single star and had nothing good say about it matthew pointed out that it is not as good as it could have been or should have been amen he went on comment that he did not like the way the movie changed completely in the middle jeffrey complained particularly about how gross the movie was

talk about movie that seemed dated before it even hit the theaters spice world is the feature debut of the prefabricated pop band the spice girls it is intended as sort of hard days night but ends up simply hard watch when watching the spice girls am reminded of an old saturday morning cartoon trick such as from the smurfs the snorks or teenage mutant ninja turtles in identically animated creatures are differentiated into characters merely one personality quirk and different name the spice girls are themselves as interchangable as pringles and about as talented there is ginger geri halliwell the brainy one sporty melanie chisholm the athletic one baby emma bunton the childish one posh victoria adams the fashionconscious one and scary melanie brown the one tongue pierced back so far you are almost certain the post sticks out her throat the itself does not really have plot it follows the girls as they travel here and there culminating at their first live performance at albert hall the action however seems more like hodgepodge of mismatched ideas the various misfires include an alien encounter fiendish tabloid editor scheming wreck the spice girls the shooting of spice girls documentary movie producer george wendt trying pitch various ideas for spice girls movie nearly all of though incredibly far fetched seem more plausible than the mess they ended up meeting pregnant friend whose sole purpose seems be maintain the maxim that all pregnant characters must give birth before the movie ends boating adventure bus race clubhopping wherein apparently no one notices the famous spice girls among the crowd even when they start sing and an assorted number of musical performances press conferences and general allaround celebrity stuff whew for some reason the is littered star cameos from elton john elvis costello from bob hoskins meat loaf heck even roger moore shows up though he cannot decide if he is parodying himself as james bond or if he is lobbying be the reincarnation of ernst stavro blofeld richard grant has the largest secondary part thankless role of the bands manager clifford the celebrity spotting is partially amusing and decent way pass the time when confronted the rest of the neither amusing or spontaneous when the spice girls are between songs they are deadly boring their songs are alright but they play like lifeless adaptations of the music videos my advice fans is stay home and watch that video collection or at least spin that cd couple of more times either option will be more enjoyable than the nonfans should know stay well away from this one

this feature is like double header two sets of clich for the price of one not only do we get the usual tired sports chestnuts but the banal rich girlpoor boy love story is tossed in for good measure an original moment in this loser is as rare as chicago cubs world series appearance the screenplay kevin falls and john gatins based on story falls merely lobs its plotline at the audience this is story that needed sent down for seasoning and more coaching summer catch centers around ryan dunne freddie prinze jr cape cod youth chosen participate in the prestigious cape cod baseball league supposedly showcase for the best young amateur and college players in the country ryan is bluecollar kind of guy he works his dad taking care of the lawns of cape cods rich and famous he also as we are informed early his own worst enemy he has the potential and the talent but always seems selfdestruct at the crucial moment so ryan tries remained focused on baseball then he meets tenley parrish jessica biel daughter of one of the blue bloods whose lawn he manicures tenley name only hack screenwriter could invent is unlike her snobbish counterparts and falls for ryan if you cannot figure out where all this nonsense leads then you need remedial course in viewing as always prinze is pretty look at but his performance mainly consists of facial expressions puppy dog love heartbreak frustration selfloathing or determination biel cries lot while bruce davison merely acts smarmy as her classconscious father the only beacon is matthew lillards funloving billy brubaker the teams catcher summer catch borrows situations and stylings from other baseball movies such as bull durham and the natural no curve balls here no sliders every pitch is predictable blind umpire could call this movie summer catch is strictly rookie league moviemaking it has as much chance of making the movie hall of fame as the dodgers have of moving back brooklyn

one of the responses those that enjoy detroit rock city probably kiss fans mostly might have upon first glance at the rating have given the might be something like oh that caseys gone and become jaded critic on us just what did he expect out of dumb teenage rock roll movie like this am wondering the same thing feel like should have had grand time detroit rock city it is the sort of movie wish could have had lot of fun but did not just did not surely this is not trying win any major awards so should have expected an oscarcaliber no but expected something funny joke clever prank plot development anything the movie never delivers you have got marvel at how the filmmakers managed come up movie that is truly about nothing detroit rock city is one of those films that you walk out of after the credits have rolled and realize that you just spent minutes watching movie in absolutely nothing happened justify the films existence and it is not very satisfying realization the is about four teenage boys all huge kiss fans from cleveland trying get into kiss concert in detroit michigan that is it there is no big plot description in this review because the movie has very little plot the characters are hawk edward furlong lex giuseppe andrews trip james debello and jam sam huntington they have garage band they are pathetic like all garage bands but they like kiss and they like rock roll so guess that means we root for them they have tickets they lose them they get more tickets they lose those too they come up crazy schemes get tickets most of backfire there is not much more it frankly it becomes little less than exciting see them try get kiss tickets about halfway through the when total of eight tickets have already graced the boys hands only be lost because of their sheer stupidity oh and jam real name jeremiah has really really annoying ultrareligious mother who ought be reported the child welfare agency she does not want them see kiss if you had not figured that out already it is really quite disheartening see such fine soundtrack go waste in pointless movie like this we have got plenty of kiss along some acdc ramones and thin lizzy then again maximum overdrive had an awesome soundtrack me being the big acdc fan that am but is probably one of the worst movies of all time detroit rock city does not quite reach that level of ineptitude but it gets dangerously close in fact the music is the only thing that keeps this movie from being complete failure in my mind basically the soundtrack has earned the full halfstar means all the bands involved can pat themselves on the back except for marilyn manson whose halfhearted cover of acdcs highway hell sounds like something my neighbors cat coughed up it is also really sad see the talents of the cast go waste because it evident that they are all trying really hard squeeze some life out of this dead turkey of movie edward furlong has done far better work than this and so has natasha lyonne and so has lin shaye but hey they have got make living in people wanting see kiss and lots of it will probably be disappointed considering the band appears for about five minutes and plays one song too bad they might have provided some energy this mess director adam rifkin knows he has not got much material work so he takes chapter from the michael bay book of directing and keeps his camera spinning we get an endless parade of quickcuts splitscreens zoomouts zoomins and rotating cameras all in an effort cover up the sheer stupidity of the script it is fun for while but eventually it becomes disorienting would recommend that those who felt seasick at the blair witch project stay far away from detroit rock city because the witch has got nothing on this baby have not felt such an urge reach out and hold the camera still since armageddon and what about that script it is written carl dupr sounds like as madeup name as have ever heard if it is cannot say blame the writer for distancing himself as far from this script as possible plotless pointless rock roll movie can be fun if the jokes and gags are actually funny the jokes in detroit rock city rarely are in fact the only time really laughed was when priest gets stoned on marijuanalaced pizza and that was just because it was so surreal the rest of the movie just seems like they just threw bunch of vulgar stuff up on screen and called it comedy there is no setup just succession of punchlines that do not provide for much in the way of chuckles precisely because there was no setup it is as if they just whacked someone on the head pointed at him and said see funny look that woman was so shocked hearing loud kiss music that she spilled her drink see funny look that guy just got clocked telephone receiver twice see funny look that kid has been vomiting for minutes after drinking an inordinate amount of alcohol and is now about perform an exotic dance for money see funny word of advice mr dupr no these things are not funny all themselves they must be preceded clever setup so the audience hasn predicted them five minutes in advance that is it have said enough about this movie it is waste of time and money liked the music but do not bother buying the soundtrack hear it just modern bands doing inferior versions of the songs that are actually in the movie you want see this concept executed well go rent roger cormans classic rock roll high school it features another lateseventies rock band the ramones and far more interesting story about girl trying get tickets their show yes go rent that and skip detroit rock city will probably bomb and deservedly so

has it really been two decades since walter matthau coached the bad news bears nineteen years and two mighty ducks later the formula is still going strong police academy graduate steve guttenberg stars as smalltown deputy sheriff corralled into cocoaching the schools hastily formed soccer team his partnerincrime is the new british exchange teacher olivia dabo lively lass who has obviously seen dangerous minds and knows that the best way gain the respect of disinterested outercity audience is teach them something neat like soccer most of the goodnatured gags are of the fastmotion variety such as runaway cows and outofcontrol lawnmowers kids will laugh at the occasional belching bit while their parents peacefully doze beside them other than letting supporting character named newt go unscathed what is missing from the big green is better integration of music and comedy instead of peppy pop score would arguably work better effect most of the action is set bombastic orchestral score that belongs somewhere else comedy needs music just watch any old bugs bunny short the marx brothers knew it mel brooks knows it unfortunately the current trend is overscore lush strings and booming brass in every scene at every moment remember the simple strains of bizets habanera in the original bad news bears these days it is usually bellowing fanfare that threatens smother every scene in its path much like adding frosting already frosted cake an awfully big adventure the reteaming of director mike newell and star hugh grant is about as far removed as you can get from the lightsome comedy of four weddings and funeral their second collaboration is downbeat theatrical drama about young intern georgina cates struggling survive in postw ii liverpool hugh plays the gay director an extremely unappealing character who may alienate whatever fans are left after the nonsense of nine months bleak makeup and thick accents conspire make this difficult story settle into an awful adventure is not without some rewards tho the peter pan subtext is intriguing as is the diverse ensemble cast that includes peter firth alan rickman and prunella scales basil devil in blue dress the comparisons chinatown are easy enough except for the fact that this is not nearly as gripping writerdirector carl franklin one false move is the force behind this accomplishedbutstiff adaptation of walter mosleys crime novel denzel washington is as sturdy as ever but he is burdened miscast supporting cast tom sizemore and scenestealer don cheadle are both fine the problems start jennifer beales who never registers as the plots femme fatale she is pretty face and nothing more also underweight are maury chaykin and terry kinney they play opposing mayoral candidates in los angeles and neither actor commands enough authority stifle giggles john huston we miss you fine period detail and strong sense of humor are plus they help overcome pace that is too polite for mosleys jazzy swingin story steal big steal little cannot say much about this one director andrew davis follows the fugitive wildly unfunny farce about twin brothers andy garcia opposing moral codes they are fighting over their adoptive mothers estate acre ranch worth millions and supporting dozens of migrant farm workers so many different plots are trying come togetherfeuding brothers reconciling husbands loanshark hired hitmenthat you have admire the directors ambition too bad that almost every single person or plotline is out of sync that is the exception of alan arkin he is the best thing in movie thatdespite the work of four credited writers still manages waste such diverse talents as david odgen stiers kevin mccarthy and joe pantolinao and what the heck does that title mean

funny how your expectations can be defeated and not in good ways the ghost and the darkness promised at least it seemed me promise hemingwayesque showdown between men and nature what it delivered was mystery science theater level material an inadvertently hilarious story that made me scream advice at the characters get new jobs was one line if remember correctly at the end of the th century col patterson val kilmer whose irish accent comes and goes like an african zephyr is an engineer who has been hired build british railway bridge across the tsavo river in uganda he is having immensely stereotypical problems the natives are restless his boss is jerk and now two maneating lions are stalking the work camp and killing people off patterson tries handle the situation himself incompetently and then turns charles remington michael douglas hunter of world reknown or something like that the movie stacks the deck so heavily in favor of the lions they should have gotten top billing and costarred siegfried and roy they are nighinvulnerable as one comic book put it and this is of course just the excuse the movie needs have one native after another stepping forth solmenly recite lines about the power of nature give me break the movie has not got the wherewithal even begin exploit such ideas it is just trying find convenient ways stall us even the lion hunts themselves are idiotic get this remingtons big plan is build large scaffoldlike structure in the middle of the savannah sit on it and wait for the lion show up he does this and then gets knocked off bird the end of the movie the blood vessels in my palm were all broken open from me pounding my forehead my hand the acting is forgettable douglas does good job of portraying relatively cracked fellow but it is nothing he has not done before kilmer looks like he wishes he were someone else somewhere else and the rest vanish into the cinematography the camera the way sometimes behaves so stupidly all itself that most of the lion attacks are incoherent what did expect from this movie dunno some real excitement suppose sense that there were formidable forces on both sides of this equation no such luck dug out my tattered copy of hemingways the short happy life of francis macomber and read that get the taste of this movie out of my mind

unfortunately it does not get much more formulaic than one tough cop there is the renegade cop the loser partner who has many problems explain the renegade has prove his good name and is trapped between the good guys the bad guys and some woman who really has nothing do the story other than being there for the purpose of providing sex for the hero in the middle of the bo dietl pronounced deedle baldwin is one tough cop guy who is being investigated hardass fbi agents due his association the ny mafia on top of that problem he has drunk gambling addicted partner penn who has penchant for collecting parking tickets guess cops are not immune then throw into the mix the femme fatale gershon right there you have plenty of ammo for decent cop drama but right in the middle of the they throw in completely unrelated plot point dietl and his partner duke try solve case that they have been warned stay away from the spends over half an hour tracking the case of nun who was beaten and raped near death once the case is solved the shifts focus back the mafia issue whatever neat mesh the screenwriter wanted create between the two stories failed miserably aside from being asked accept michael mcglone as mafioso an insult if you ask me the performances were pretty good baldwin though he occasionally slips into an impression of his brother alec does fine job as one tough cop penn who also slips into an impression of his brother sean is even better as loser tough guy cop what one tough cop lacks is originality this offers nothing new nothing that you cannot get from any cop it screams sidney lumet all over the place perhaps because it was produced marty and michael bregman producers of lumets dog day afternoon and serpico but even the masterful sidney would not have been able make one tough cop into good too much else is lacking also saw the boom mic pop into the top of the frame twice early on in the picture something that almost never notice but once saw that had it in the back of my mind every time saw medium or long shot at times was hoping see it one tough cop is not laughable nor is it terrible but it just is not unique it is classic example of that did not need be made but one thing is for sure it could really use better title

supposedly based on true story in the british drive build rail bridge deep in africa grinds halt after pair of lions start killing off the workers in john patterson val kilmer the bridge building expert set oversee the operation tried rid his operation of the lions but fails world renound hunter remington michael douglas is called in and the battle man against lion begins this has great soundtrack and wonderful scenery the acting is not too bad except the characters are all so thin we only see one side of each character kilmer is bridge builder and that is all we see him as these lions kill dozens of his men and he does not even appear be too upset about it and the plot it is jaws but lions again we are presented an animal that behaves not at all as it should it appears kill men because it just likes too why who knows guess there would not be much of story if it did not the problem is that there is not much of story even though it does

of course knew this going in why is it that whenever tvstar makes movie it is always romantic comedy and then they say on entertainment tonight or something that they were attracted the characters they were really original original let me give you runthrough of picture perfect character kate jennifer aniston from tvs friends smart beautiful professional woman wants two things she cannot have new jobtitle and the love of her coworker kevin bacon her boss will only give her the job if she gets married and gets mortgage and gets lease on german sportscar and kevin bacon pnly sleeps married or involved girls what does she do she invents fiance then when everyone wants meet him she tells some poor schmoe she met at wedding that she will pay him pretend be in love her for company dinner and pick fight her at the end thus breaking the engagement but still being able keep her job since the guy ends up looking like jerk and she is the poor defenceless female he of course goes along it gee wonder if they get together in the end have seen more original stuff on the wb and better stuff too picture perfect also makes the mistake of being _wayyyyy_ too long at minutes and expecting us like anistons character who comes off as cold spoiled bitch

louie is trumpeter swan no voice in order woo his lady love serina louie makes friends young boy sammy who persuades teacher mrs hammerbottom carol burnett allow louie attend class louie learns read and write and returns his flock but is laughed at once again when no other swans can understand his message of love for serina make matters worse louies father feels he is lost his honor because of the trumpet he stole for his son in this animated version of b whites trumpet of the swan as jane austen and henry james have become popular sources for adult filmmakers over the past decade or so b white is being returned for childrens films the animated charlottes web has become minor classic since its release in and brought us live action version of stuart little trumpet of the swan directed richard rich animated the king and the swan princess series is unlikely be remembered along those two trumpet of the swan is receiving regional theatrical release but is sure quickly appear on home video boston is one of the targetted cities because our hero louie becomes famous playing his trumpet in beantown he encounters gypsylike con man in the public gardens who pitches louie and his trumpet as an added attraction bostons swan boats louie stays at the ritz carlton before giving concert at the hatch shell along the banks of the charles river at this point louies earned enough money so that dad can pay for the trumpet and become musically capable enough win over serinas father trumpet of the swan features flat background art some poor sound syncing and insipid sugary songs this effort would be better suited saturday morning television than the big screen but may be ok for the real small set

one of the most respected names in american independent filmmaking is john sayles he has built strong reputation films like matewan and the secret of roan inish and one of his best was his last lone star after sayles gave us this complex and unconventional look at ethnic tensions on the usmexico border expectation ran high for his next unfortunately his men guns is not the anyone was hoping for we are essentially told in the first reel where the is going go and what it is going do then the does exactly what it promised painful as that is the plot of men guns can be summarized in central or south american country things are really bad for everybody in the mountains where the army clashes the guerrillas dr fuentes did not believe how bad things were so he went and he found out again and again and again of course it is perfectly true that in many places in that region armed conflicts have turned life into living hell guerrilla war is always bad for civilians but the talks down the viewer dr fuentes played federico luppi teaches medicine in the capital city of his country he has as great humanitarian gesture trained and inspired some of his best students go into the mountains and make the world little better for the poor indios fuentes believe the students be up there doing humanitarian service then he discovers one of his best students has instead returned the city and runs squalid private pharmacy in shame and disappointment fuentes asks the student what has happened the others the student tells him the others are still in the mountains but suggests that it may not be good place be fuentes goes off find and visit the doctors ignoring the advice of his family and patient who happens be an army general the results are little different than one would expect dr fuentes starts out incredibly naive even some american tourists present in the mostly for comic relief seem know better than dr fuentes that things have gotten pretty bad in the mountains but fuentes has go from one scene of barbarity another and discover how wrong he was sayles certainly could have used minute of screen time tell us something more profound than that nasty things are happening down there and most of the worst happens the unarmed civilians the cast is mostly unknowns american audiences federico luppi is the good mexican actor who played the antique dealer torn mysterious forces in cronos damian delgado makes late appearance as an army deserter mandy patinkin has small role made look bigger in the trailer

product look ten times worse than it would any other time because do not want hear your sob stories oliver stone you apparently thought you needed break from making important films cool so you found this hinky little book and decided make it movie that is cool too but ollie old sage do not take good story and hot cast and make one of the most pointless and worthless films of the decade am just eager meet you one day so can buy you stoli look you in the eye and say what in the wide world of sports were you thinking uturn and will stand there staring til get straight answer sean penn stars uturn as bobby drifter who is had some troubles while back he is heading cross the desert minus two fingers when his mustang ragtop blows radiator hose stranding him in superior arizona held there an ignorant inbred turtleneck hick of mechanic named darrell while darrell puts new hose on the ride bobby walks into town see what is cooking is it needless of me say that superior arizona is not exactly the shiny scrubbed home of all things lovely probably not bobby meets up grace jennifer lopez who invites him back her place for drapehanging and other domestic issues just as those issues are starting up graces husband jake storms in looking like checkout day of the elks lodge convention just beats bobby silly bobby takes the road only meet up jake again and jake asks bobby kill grace little while later grace asks bobby kill jake them murderous arizonians gotta love em if any of this sounds familiar congratulations you win kewpie doll the story is straight shoplift of red rock west horny and sweaty we get the town from bad day at black rock minus the train plus busty women who can speak look at any schwarzenegger and you will see our hero bobby as bobby has mudhole stomped in his keister dozen times has his ribs stove in at least fifteen times gets bit tarantula gets shot at and ends up vultures circling overhead all the while getting up like he just got shaving nick bobby as terminator stretch it bit and we have fivefinger discount from doc where the whole story occurs because of car trouble forcing the main character stay at the mercy of the town and the mechanic okay he is working from book so maybe ollies not totally blame for blatantly copping these ideas just expect man who can make up an alternative history of the united states be able craft few original ideas before exposing the negative just wish he had not brought cast like this together for what amounts group toestub sean penn gives great performance and jennifer lopez and nick nolte are as on target as they can be playing overthetop caricatures of stereotype characters the best thing about the movie is watching penn react the madness around him and try figure out exactly what the blanketyblank is richardson is his usual cinematographer and rob and ollie know how shoot flick great camera angles shifting viewpoints wicked colors nice looking pictures but pictures of what think would rather stare pocket and expect us accept it as an oliver stone movie and not question why it stinks like weekold snook there is right way have fun and wrong way have fun this was as wrong as you can get without going jail

there are two things the american industry should avoid at all costs one is letting an ambitious actor convert one of his or her favorite novels into feature two is never greenlight scifi starring john travolta wit we present the disaster that is battlefield earth sciencefiction opus starring the barbarino of the actors guild battlefield earth should be shown only at maximumsecurity prisons when prisoner is tossed in solitary for bad behavior scifi is always tricky beast tight script good director an ensemble cast of decent actors and the ability suspend even the most difficult of disbeliefs battlefield earth fails at achieving even one of these attributes heres the plot the year is mankind has been become an endangered species thanks the conquest of race of aliens called the psychlos sounds like either the latest clown act from cirque de soleil or white rap group small band of humans dwell in radioactive caves located in the rockies in fear of the demons who dwell in the cities below the psychlos are stripmining the earth for its resources and terel played travolta is the head of security for the miningslave base located in denver young rogue named jonnie goodboy tyler played dramatic flair barry pepper ventures from the safety of the caves into the city uncover the truth about the demons he is promptly captured and taken the alien base after several attempts at escape johnnie is placed in the middle of an underhanded subplot of terels involving circumventing gold from an exposed vein in the rockies his own end jonnie assumed leader of the mining slave group then manages attain all psychlo and human intelligence through learning machine terel forces him use then the story just runs along until jonnie teaches the rest of the humans the basics of trigonometry the bill of rights how use machine gun and how fly harrier jet the whole mess concludes big loud obnoxious gunandplane battle that had me praying for the end credits roger christian the director of this lumbering beast must have rented dune blade runner planet of the apes independence day stargate beastmaster the airwolf episodes the v miniseries the matrix and the omega man and decided steal every scene he could for battlefield earth christian even shoots every scene in weird dutch angle titled left or right for every frame of the movie and every scene in the movie ends middle wipe really the psychlos reminded me of cross between jamaican basketball players bad teeth and bloated hands and klingon extras working the star trek convention circuit travoltas acting has not been this bad since the experts or maybe perfect jonnie goodboy tyler evolves into william wallace lines like you can have your freedom if you fight then there is the script the just never convinces you that the plight of jonnie in teaching his fellow humans fight and take back the planet would be difficult task achieve why because terel provides all the necessary tools incite revolt for no particular reason beside the fact that humans are stupid terel may be right you know humans made this movie

would you believe in real life mean that if you were julia roberts that you would be the ugly underdog your sister the creepy catherine zetajones let me tell you what reality is reality is that you are megastar julia fricking roberts and your brother is eric roberts and he picks up whatever crumbs of stardom fall off your coattails as you blaze across the sky in golden chariot that is reality americas sweethearts is the opposite of reality train wreck that tries sell julia as scruffy alsoran presumably because she wears hornrimmed glasses and used be overweight uhhuh the plot follows two married megamovie stars gwen and eddie zetajones and poor poor john cusack whose material gets worse every year on the eve of their new star vehicles release called time over time the only problem gwen and eddie have gone through nasty separation and the press and public have not been forgiving think meg and dennis gosh and the director has vanished the holding the only print hostage veteran pr agent lee billy crystal is called upon clean up the mess throwing press junket in the nevada desert woo them the story of possible reconciliation between the gwen and eddie presumably distracting the stupid stupid critics into forgetting they have not seen the movie at all note sony any studio executive that thinks this plot is going win points the reviewing press needs check into rehab and did mention gwens sister kiki roberts is along for the ride and that she and eddie just might fall in love along the way oh billy you are scamp the script you have cowritten peter tolan what planet are you from and bedazzled need say more is roast of and celebrity sure but it is not funny one yes crystal tells us is lying our faces if you are surprised this you might want check on your subscription people magazine it is about expire aside from scant few zingers yeah se or winces rules americas sweethearts jokes are not funny its pace is choppy and the whole affair comes off as vanity project not for headlining star julia roberts but for billy crystal deliver bunch of lame punch lines that he wrote himself did not time it the movies not that bad but it is crystal who really has the most screen time and is the unequivocal focus of the bad move billy your jokes suck the crotch humor is outpaced only the meanness of the movies gags and unsubtle sexual innuendo dripping from every scene how this movie earned pg rating is mystery me julia overcame lot of spiteful writing and acting make my best friends wedding into winning but not even that tooth smile can save her here obviously aware of the ugliness before him director joe roth turns goofy supporting characters like hank azaria as lisping spaniard christopher walken the insane time over time director and alan arkin new age guru in fright wig crack wise none of the stereotypes is successful except for walken azaria comes off as preening queen when he is supposed be macho as for roth in case you do not know went from direcing revenge of the nerds ii launching his own movie studio revolution produced this work he is back behind the camera for the first time in years it will probably be another before he is back again could drone on about how americas sweethearts will only appeal the mouthbreathing morons who talk on their cell phones during the movies but that would get old instead will settle for discussing the movies worst sin that sweethearts is painfully contrived and wholly unbelievable not just in its plot but in its sentiment every single character in this the arguable exception of kiki is simply hateful and putting them in romantic comedy is waste of bunch of villains when you leave the theater you will ask yourself too why would want any of these jerks be happy

rated for strong violence language drug use nudity and some sexuality starring wesley snipes anne archer michael chaykin donald sutherland marie matiko running time minutes directed christian duguay have never fully understood wesley snipess career he has his ups and downs but mostly the downs his best movie was one of the best of and that movie was entitled blade he has had his typical action movies boiling point passenger but his new movie the art of war should just be called rising sun the art of war cause basically it is semiremake of the same plot different cast and forced be ridiculously unbelievable thriller that is high on style and low on substance wesley snipes plays james bondish type secret agent working for the n after chinese ambassador is killed he is on the track of the killer trying find out who it is how it happened where the killer was and what do anne archer plays his boss type person of the n and she has hired snipes track down the killer well snipes is mistakenly framed as the killer and is now an outlaw kidnapping chinese woman him and having her help him along the way all this leads finale that is so dumb and so stupid that is it unbelievably dumb and the stunts dialogue and acting all ruin this movie wesley snipes is not one of my favorite actors because of the fact that the character he plays in every movie is the same character he plays in the movie before the only good role snipes has really had was in blade walked into the art of war expecting good high octane thriller and all got was pile of mush the only real good thing the movie has is action and plenty of it but noticed it is badly filmed the camera is so shaky you cannot even tell what is going on the ending finale is so worthless and pitiful that it even tries mock the matrix laughably funny it is undeniably stupid christian duguays direction is also not that great his camera angles and sense of style are all in place but sadly his lighting and editing are all badly done even the whole matrix ending was not even good the stunts and action are badly filmed and badly choreographed his placing of the characters and the assination of the chinese ambassador and the plotting of the movie are so predictable and laughable that it just takes all the fun out of the entire movie anne archer who is usually good in her roles turns in horrible job here she is sour downbeat and dreadfully dull her forced dialogue and dumb moves even donald sutherland as costar cannot save this movie from being bust so for an overall opinion the art of war is total waste of time it is not entertaining nor exciting or even action packed it is pointless movie and makes absolutely no sense at all if you really want see good version of the art of war rent the wesley snipes and sean connery action vehicle of the same kind rising sun it is not great either but at least it is better than this

movie reviewers have an obligation see the good the bad and the despicable originally wrote this review for my college newspaper back in but wanted rewrite it because not all retro reviews should be about the classics we need be warned about some truly awful films too this picture was so bad it inspired the description for my rating see ratings chart below the only thing saving it from rating is that being able rent movie like this is slightly less embarassing than renting porno so it does indeed have some plusses in fairness elizabeth berkley is certainly worth seeing in the buff and her ability whine and irritate us even while nude was appropriate in her role as selfish temptress nomi malone this character is not smart not interesting and deliberately far too annoying far too often like in bulworth when the movie was over did not care one little iota about the main character at least warren beatty tried make statement his dreary and overrated though showgirls is too stupid make statement some people claim that the story is based on the legendary all about eve of all things if exploitation expert joe eszterhas was half the screenwriter that joseph mankiewicz was he would be well he would be good screenwriter instead this project may have sunk his career he wrote the ha ha script and the usually reliable paul verhoeven directed the same team who created good sexfilm in basic instinct struck out here their occasional violence gratuitous xrated sex scenes and numerous and quite unnecessary lesbian overtones the predictable storyline revolves around nomi streaking into las vegas make it big as dancer after the supposed streetsmart young lady gets conned out of her suitcase slackjawed yokel in the opening sequence she befriends tailor of the glamorous stage production at the stardust hotel nomi does not take advantage of this contact break into the bigtime of dirty dancing right away first she becomes lap dancer at scummy strip club she sells her hot little wares at the cheetah for short time turning on the fictitious customers and the actual theatre audience hey never said she was not hot number maybe it is that her body gets her into the bigtime when the star of the stardust hotel crystal connors gina gershon stops into the strip club it certainly is not her brains or pleasant disposition crystal requests private lap dance for her boyfriend kyle maclachlan he also happens be the pleasureseeking worm who runs the big show crystal gets nomi onto the stardust team and after an interminable amount of time nomi earns the role of crystals understudy the slut then deliberately injures and hospitalizes crystal it was almost laughable that nomi had the guts claim that she is not whore that is phrase we hear few different times and it is completely ludicrous of course she is she sells her soul make it big but in the end we are supposed believe that she is better person than that we are supposed root for her no way she is tramp and backstabber who deserved nothingleast of all vindication in the ahem climax she is not good person and they take over two hours explain that the audience should think that she is the subplot male dancer glenn plummer who claims see talent in nomi is just gratuitous opportunity let her dance naked little bit more it sure as not character development plummer also appeared in speed in in smaller yet better role this subplot goes absolutely nowhere except maybe deliver an unsubtle hint that fornicators should practice birth control kyle maclachlan must have been promised big payday or his standards have dipped since appearing in blue velvet that picture was weird but some critics claim it is one of the best movies of the now ol kyle can say that he acted in one of the worst of the too his sleazy character is important showgirls but we do not learn anything about him he uses people get what he wants but that only means that he fits in well the other characters in this movie is he villain who cares ultimately this movie is as tiresome as it is explicit everyone must know now about the softcore acts of copulation especially the riotous romp between berkley and maclachlan in his pool what few reviewers take issue is how meanspirited this movie is everyones either having sex exacting revenge or wishing they were having sex or exacting revenge it is just too hard take especially for over two hours if we must be exposed the evils of the vegas world why could not verhoeven have also made point of highlighting the whispers grunts and other sounds during the dance numbers it is hard care about these people if we cannot even appreciate what they are capable of doing onstage berkley may have future in because she can dance and she has great body after all the world of porn is still an active dishonourable profession perhaps berkley could join their ranks and leave the real acting pauly shore and cindy crawford oops they are bad actors too well at least they are not selfish and contemptable like good ol slutty nomi malone useless triviaironically elizabeth berkley played virtuous and holier than thou jessie on the teenybopper tv show saved the bell before breaking onto the big screen

mr nice guy is the latest jackie chan so you should know what expect weak plot terrible dialogue very little acting ability but some jawdropping action sequences that nearly make the rest of it worthwhile however mr nice guy lacks the sparkle of jackies best efforts and its weaknesses are more glaring than ever jackie chan plays who else jackie this time out he is famous chef who hosts an australian cooking show not that it ever makes difference in the plot there are only two scenes of him cooking for the rest of the somehow he mutates into jackie chan supercop it never does explain why his character has such superb martial arts skills perhaps he was in the same cooking class as steven seagal in under siege tv newswoman diana gabrielle fitzpatrick covertly tapes drug deal involving kingpin giancarlo richard norton and local gang of toughs the demons although she only has one camcorder somehow the result is full of closeups and multiple angles hmmm shades of broadcast news anyway the goons discover diana and will do anything recover the tape here lies another crucial flaw in the story does not anyone realize you can copy tape oh well no one ever said jackie chan movies had make sense as luck would have it diana runs across jackie and would not you know it jackie accidentally ends up the tape this leads countless chase andor fight scenes look like they could have been lifted from rumble in the bronx or nearly any other jackie chan movie in move apparently designed woo american and other englishspeaking audiences the uses english as its primary language however that does not mean an end the atrocious dubbing that has afflicted jackies recent americanized releases strangely many of the characters speaking english are overdubbed english and poorly too whether this is just very bad case of looping an effort minimize accents or simple case of nostalgia it does achieve the same level of distraction present in all of jackies dubbed films the plot in mr nice guy is negligible merely an excuse have jackie on the run from various goons but even though plots have always been second the action in jackies films it seems odd that the filmmakers have stuck us this tired retread look if you have jackie chan playing chef why not use that your advantage watching jackie doing his stuff in kitchen beating the bad guys foodstuffs sounds like the perfect setup for innumerable comic stunts the action is mixed bag here there is really only one no holds barred fight scenes that have become the trademark of jackies films it takes place in the arbitrary location of construction site apparently for the sole reason that there are lots of nifty things lying around that can be useful ala jackie chan the action in the is neither jackies best nor worst but you long for some more inspiration in the scenes the films gratuitous use of slow motion is distracting once or twice it may be useful highlight spectacular stunt sequence but slomo jackie running either this is nod the sixmillion dollar man or pathetic attempt disguise the fact that jackie may be slowing down if you have seen all of jackies films and are in need of another fix go ahead and see mr nice guy however if you are just in the mood for some good action you would be better off hitting the video store for some of his better work such as supercop

first rule of fight club is do not talk about fight club this quote deals directly my opinion of this because quite frankly it is not even worth mentioning director david fincher seven has completely gone over the edge crude humor an intolerable script and hours and minutes of pure torture am surprised did not walk out this just goes show that hype kills it is very rare that so hyped up as fight club turns out be noteworthy and this is no exception the story goes like this edward norton is an insomniac trying enlighten his dull life going variety of disease therapy sessions until he meets marla helena bonham carter norton claims that she is wrecking his pleasurable lifestyle when he spots her at session that he also attended apparently the disease sessions help them see what life is like literally living in pain why any person would think of such thing is beyond me but things do get worse norton is soon assigned job that calls for traveling and it is on plane that he meets tyler durden brad pitt the two men develop bond and go out bar and golly after they get drunk the two pitiful characters fight how do they come up this stuff anyway their fighting catches other pathetic losers attention and club is formed out of all this mess there manages lie message fincher shows us that society is like robots we work in our jobs doing things step step and want out our insanity gets our brain and makes things worse than they really are and we blame it on others call me crazy but this is common knowledge think fincher was acting as if the is moodier and more poignant than it really is is probably one of the reasons it fails miserably even two good actors and solid actress they only manage weaken the story could not help but hide my face in shame when norton beats himself up into bloody pulp it just shows how desperate the script is for attention guess brad pitt was right for this role because felt like beating him up myself his bothersome and depressing character made me disgusted at his million fee it only showed me that he was in it for the money and nothing more helena bonham carter however really had no purpose she just popped up on screen mumbled some lines smoked and left this continues for what seems like hours the drags on and my headache gets bigger while fight club nears what think might be the end unfortunately then the hits rock bottom though the conclusion kept my interest for mere minutes it backs down again and continues move at snails pace on side note the trailer shows the only redeeming elements of the that coincidentally lasts the same amount of time that they did on the trailer fincher will hopefully regret making this or at least learn lesson concentrating on the atmosphere or particular key moment will not do any good if everything else is in need of support also am afraid that immature men might respond the films violence the last thing the world needs is people praising leader of pointless cult when the ends am just glad get home and take some advil you will either enjoy what the has offer or agree ed norton when he says this is so ing stupid

note screenwriters and self when you hit the big time and the studios come knocking for those scripts that are sitting in your bottom drawer tell em all hit the road gilligan wrote the arbitrarilytitled home fries ten years ago it was shelved until he found success as one of the took second look at gilligans comedy they read it again wearing rosetinted glasses drew stars as sally dim but sweet pregnant waitress at small town burger joint located somewhere in the southern united states the father of her child is dead the victim of severe heart attack brought on sadistic torture from his two stepsons these flyboys scared him their lowflying helicopter dorian wilson and angus busey were getting even for his philandering ways on behalf of their anguished mother ohara trouble is sally picked up some interference on her drivethru headset and angus worries she may have heard conversations that took place in the helicopter prior the accidental killing so dorian goes undercover as burgerflipper before you can say cheese he falls for the mothertobe too bad mom and angus have homicidal plans for sally does this sound like movie you want see without doubt the best thing about home fries is barrymore at the risk of sounding sexist she is never looked better than here as curly redhead twinkling eyes she is winning in role that requires her do absolutely nothing except look applecheek cute and gawk at wilson her reallife boyfriend but the plot and the situations are so offputting that nothing could save it this movie desperately wants get mentioned in the same breath as the coen brothers but home fries brand of laboured hipness would be foreign geniuses like ethan and joel it is raising arizona without babies without charm without laughs without human characters and without intelligence worst of all it is creepy what is funny about threatening gun down pregnant woman machine gun unless the woman in question is spice girl take out the helicopters the quasiincestuous relationship between the mother and her sons it is absolutely illogical within the movies framework that dorian still lives his mother and brother and the scenes of murder attempted and otherwise and what are you left the story of single woman child who works at fast food joint but dreams of becoming country singer that could turn out be the most boring movie ever made but it would be better than home fries

the recent onslaught of noir that has popped up in multiplexes everything ranging from a confidential palmetto the big lebowski has proved be an artistic commodity for veteran talented directors this particular genre directors are able collate the sleazy underworld of the lowerclass and the glamorous opulent upperclass while maintaining the noirish ambiguous ambience the staple of noir wild things could be classified as black comedy sultry noir or plain ol erotic thriller but the one category it does not qualify for is that of quality motion picture overacted overwrought and overlong wild things is confused mess movie that wants have its cake and eat it too its incalculable twists turns more twists and more turns it soon becomes tedious exercise in pointlessness in spite of game efforts kevin bacon and matt dillon who manage sustain straight faces throughout the ordeal wild things not once jells in its eroticism unpredictability character motivation sense of the world plot etc there is not one redeeming quality in the picture that is not technical directed john mcnaughton henry portrait of serial killer wild things follows sam lombardo matt dillon hunkish suburban florida high school teacher who is the dream of every spruced up female in the community particularly one kelly van ryan denise richards adores him such extent that she offers wash his jeep partner soon her tiny shorts are soaked and tells the other girl take hike enabling her come into his house next thing she cries rape and the socalled rollercoaster ride ensues second accuser comes front suzie toller neve campbell boozedrinkin tattooed piece of trailer trash that charges lombardo of sexually molesting her virtually guaranteeing trial where preposterous confessions asinine occurrences and laughable courtroom procedures are bound happen even bill murray gets into the act as lombardos zany lawyer he wears fake neck brace waves the finger at the other client and infuses the script some billy murray you can tell mcnaughton knew he had nothing lose assigning murray this role as ridiculous as it sounds he is the most sane character in the movie the community is astonished reporters flee the scene there is an million settlement for libel suit against kellys mother theresa russell there is the ambiguous cop kevin bacon who also executive produced who sniffs something iffy in this concoction of deceit murder and lust we the audience sniff something not so lustful like so many thrillers these days including the usual suspects and the game wild things eschews character for plot mcnaughton knows how handle the camera and he keeps the campy fillings of the script flowing workmanlike ease as if he knows the territory he is covering is harmless appetizer accompany henry furious unsettling directorial tour deforce george clintons score is delight behold but it is the humans the characters are mere devices for the nasty twists what writer stephen peters does not grasp is this becomes tediously uninvolving almost unbearable if those who inhibit this twisted world are not interesting do not feel real or we do not care for them not even the unintentionally funny moments work the people in wild things are not so much people as they are caricatures then there is the erotic content nearly earned the an nc for sexless badly edited poorly lit menageatrois and in what has be one of the most flabbergastingly inept scenes that has graced this country kevin bacons member makes cameo appearance ten minutes go ironically the wildest elements of wild things are not wild at all

it rocksactually lots of rocks fly at us or from us in slow or fast motion at several points in the they seem like dangerous rocks because they kind of twirl through the air instead of just propelling forward and when they landonce in while when we need break from the space sequencesthey cause damage enough destroy the chrysler building and the like nary mention of these apocalyptic events is made after they occur they also just might be the most interesting element of armageddon steroid users answer deep impact bruce willis stars as harry stamper famed oildriller commissioned the white house and nasa stop giant asteroid before it travels beyond zero barrier and destroys our planet why an oil driller they require someone experience deepcore mining plant nuclear missile into said asteroid in one unintentionally hilarious sequence nasa asks harry inspect deepcore driller they built based on his blueprints it is poorly constructedharry criticizes almost every aspect of it we trust nasa build space shuttles harry assembles the obligatory ragtag bunch of cowboys including blond guy fat guy black guy wiseass and the man who is sleeping his daughter affleck once they reach space we experience sequence after sequence of something going wrongperhaps the fact that they sent bunch of nincompoops into outer space has something do it cannot count the number of times they almost fail the mission on all my fingers and toes whether or not they save the day will not reveal nor will you care will say this you know you are in trouble when deep impact dwarfs your asteroid movie in terms of emotion and scope willis has barely chance come alive ditto for affleck their big scenes are mostly reserved for the third act in last minuteand futileattempt inject warmth into the material steve buscemis characterthe wiseassis exceptionally problematic rockhound as he is called is sarcastic and foolish so they tape him chair where he spends most of the so why did they bring him up there begin rather why write him into the give his almostwitty oneliners serious willis who scowls and mopes and demonstrates psychotic tendencies at one point he chases after affleck his shotgun for screwing his daughter firing often and causing significant damage his oil rig am guessing he qualifies under nasa guidelines as someone unfit for space travel at least in my world where the sky is blue liv tyler is pretty and humourless as always suspiciously four of her fathers bands aerosmith songs grace the soundtrack director michael bay lays the visual and sound effects on thick like ketchup eventually drowning the movie onscreen the middle hour is nonsensical pyrotechnic assault on the average primates brain whenever someone dies in this movie crew member inevitably yells out we lost insert dead persons last name here must admit that not once could distinguish dead oilguycumastronaut from live one and closeups of the corpses faces beneath cracked helmets provided little assistance as their skin was often covered in fake blood armageddon is not as terrible movie as godzilla it looks nicer and has fewer plotholes within its equally ludicrous framework it has vivid soundmix but at almost twoandahalf hours could not believe how little actually happened over the course of the story the love story has been played up in the ads perhaps hoping catch people before they recover from titanicfever bollocks the lovers in the are miles apart throughouterase all thoughts of nude sketching or carsex and replace them obligatory shots of liv tyler tearing up while ben affleck dicks around in mooncrawler remember little called jaws in this three independentminded men suddenly found themselves on fishing boat in pursuit of deadly shark they did not much like each other at first eventually they started respect one another one of jaws great scenes involved the wouldbeahabs drinking and singing songs and telling stories this is the sort of malebonding foreign bay or his
