there is foot tidal wave at the end of deep impact would say it pretty accurately represents the towering flood of the last two years worth of disaster movies are getting more irwin allen esque every release the early wave of this revival while just as cheesy and laughable at least knew include thrills every five ten minutes deep impact tries disguise itself as human drama endless filler comprised of disaster prevention plans the country keeps taking the repeating cycle is as follows the president morgan freeman will go on tv and tell the country that there is remote chance comet will strike the earth but that the nations crack scientists and astronauts have some brilliant plan stop the problem then we get see the plan in action in some sequence utterly lacking suspense the mission will barely fail and freeman will tell the country that the comet is still headed toward earth and there is remote chance it will strike but that the nations crack scientists and astronauts have some brilliant plan stop the problem it goes on and on throughout the movie but every time freeman goes on tv we know his plan is going fail how do we know this because we have seen the tv ads for deep impact ads that feature freeman telling the nation that the comet is still headed right for us and show disaster shots of the comet striking earth and the giant tidal wave spreading ladies and gentlemen that is the movie successful disaster movies have the main disaster toward the beginning and more little disasters that follow but deep impact saves its one disaster for the end and discloses all in its second tv spots television is what is wrong deep impact the main character played tea leoni is lowlevel broadcast journalist for msnbc and that is the mere tip of the productplacement iceberg who stumbles upon huge government conspiracy she thinks it is an instance of an exsecretary of something or other james cromwell resigning because of mistress and that maybe he took the fall for the president in the same area when she goes nosing around cromwell he begs her keep it under wraps know you are just reporter but you used be human being she figures out what is really going on after getting roughed up some fbi men and doing an internet search where all good journalists learn the difference between mistress and an extinction level comet upon topsecret meeting president freeman leoni agrees keep the story under wraps until the president can hold press conference at she gets ask the first question and everyone knows if you get ask the first question baby you are star leoni ends up in the anchor chair broadcasting every step of the comets collision course earth and am sure it is comforting for her know that even though the worlds ending in matter of months she is cable news personality so there she is narrating the sixastronaut mission blow the comet up such personalities as robert duvall jon favreau and blair underwood cash their paychecks and go through the motions of this draggedout process but as anyone who is seen the commercials knows the astronauts fail they only end up breaking the comet into two pieces means even more destruction the earth yeah thanks nasa that is when freeman has come on tv for the last time and say goodbye all the people who are not picked live in the missouri cave site for two years they even have animals two two ready climb into the cave if the focus had been on people living inside these caves after the world had been destroyed deep impact could have been far more interesting movie instead we watch as lovestruck elijah wood defies all odds chase down his young wife while people pack the highways out of town the reasoning is of course that if comet is going strike they might as well be out in some scenic rural location and amusingly the highway is spotted people in uhaul trucks am sure it is comforting know that even though the worlds ending in matter of minutes the uhaul people are doing the most business of their lives

there will be another the ads for this sequel proclaimed and why not true brandon lee is dead but there would be no reason for him appear in followup the crow anyway the idea of spinning artist james obarrs original comic book series into sequel franchise revolves around the notion that different startled soul would come back from the dead in each movie taking its own righteous vengeance against the world given that basic framework the story could move in any number of directions of course it does not stubbornly the crow city of angels backtracks the beginning of the previous when lees eric draven found himself drawn back out of his grave do charles bronson on the thugs who tortured him and his girlfriend death remember the first primarily as harrowing exercise in brutality in flashback we see the most excruciating crimes exacted on eric and his lover and then we watch in realtime as eric pays each perpetrator back in kind it is loud and repetitive true sadists delight but it is also horrifying and fascinating city of angels gives us more of the same but less skillfully there is an audience guaranteed for like this although bad reviews and poor wordofmouth will likely ensure that it will not be much of success in fact miramax subsidiary dimension films was so fearful of the critical reaction this picture that reviewers were shut out of advance screenings have never understood the reasoning behind this tactic since good notices have never been key the success of movies like the crow so much for any confidence in the worthiness of their followup this time ashe frenchaccented actor vincent perez is retrieved from his watery death he and his young son were shackled together shot and then thrown off pier the crow who serves as his link between the worlds of the living and the dead perez might have some screen presence if he is given something do himself but here he is simply thrown in front of the camera as pretty face at first he is shivery and frightened but he quickly recovers from the shock of his own death and becomes badass biker from beyond the grave he is befriended sarah mia kirshner presumably an older version of the child who narrated the first kirshner so beguiling in exotica is here an exquisitely photographed blank tattooed angels wings sarah is just about as lovely as women come but she serves no purpose not even as seductress the gang of punks who killed ashe are ostensibly commanded judah richard brooks but far more interesting choice as leader would have been iggy pop who plays gaunt fellow named curve iggy all bones veins and drawl is the only one who seems have shared in the aesthetic of ruin that defines this like all good things here he is dispatched too soon and without much imagination in the meantime we are subjected tedious glimpses of judahs compound where bondage is the order of the day and hot wax is poured over naked bodies in sm fantasies that would seem shy of the cutting edge even if they were not distinctly secondhand even the soundtrack is tired more than anything have seen from lately city of angels smacks baldly of product it is movie lousy script but great look critics have been quick fault the direction of mtv veteran tim pope but his work is not that bad per se he is got good eye and some intriguing visual ideas if anything this movie has few too many scenes of ridiculously striking imagery his major stylistic failing is that he cannot seem direct an action scene and the quick nonsensical cutting that ensues is reminiscent of low budget kung fu movie but as director he must also shoulder the blame for the little screenplay that was not the performers who could not and an apparent lack of ideas on the parts of everyone involved who bought david goyers anemic script anyway the producers of this crow were either too dim realize their story was doomed be hollow rehash or too cynical figure their audience would know the difference

late in down you the lead female character julia stiles states her greatest fear is having an artificial conversation her boyfriend freddie prinze jr the irony of this statement will not be lost on audience members who have not yet walked out fallen asleep or otherwise given up on this pathetic attempt at romantic comedy the is multimillion dollar testament everything artificial filled characters motivation plot and dialogue that ring fake and shallow at every step this is an unquestionable disaster prinze plays college student intent on playing the field until he falls for stiles freshman coed at first the movie seems be an attempt string along scenes the sole purpose of outdoing the previous in how cute it can be the happy couple psychoanalyze each other they pick out song because as prinzes dj mother lucie arnez explains every couple needs song he smells her shampoo she scratches his chest in the morning let him know she wants make love then in standard romantic comedy style things fall apart why well because they have otherwise the couple cannot make up and live presumably happily ever after down you exists outside the realm of normal logic scenes do not connect each other and it often seems be attempting some sort of surrealism but this is handled so poorly that everything comes off random and stupid instead picnic scene involving the six key characters is just bizarre not only for the stretched logic of these people hanging out together or even knowing each other but mostly because an unusual amount of screen time is dedicated goat the supporting characters are remarkably flat and insultingly ridiculous as well stiles best friend rosario dawson is pot head prinzes roommate shawn hatosy is girl crazy fool who cannot meet women and then there are the porn stars zak orth and selma blair he is one of those famous porn stars who is frequently interviewed on television does the college lecture circuit and stars in high budget costume epic porns that are shot on you know the average porn star the costume epic idea gives him reason appear in different ridiculous outfit everytime he is on screen the porn angle exists just so there can be couple of stupid sex jokes she is porn star mostly so we know she is slutty so her very existence will make stiles jealous and prinze tempted attempts at drama means julia is going cry include pregnancy scare and the big break up these characters are so insipid only the most forgiving viewer would be manipulated these weak scenes what happened here the cast is full of likable promising young actors stiles especially seems be going places writerdirector kris isacsson has simply given them material so weak not even seasoned pros could pull it off in fact the whole feels like reworking of last years extremely unpleasant the story of us for teen audiences the direction is filmschoolgrad obvious it is stylish in hugely self conscious way throws in split screen pointless parody of cops characters walking into the flashbacks of other characters and hilariously cheesy airport meeting between prinze and stiles where all the extras move in fast motion while the couple moves in extreme slow motion plus the whole story is told flashback style narrated prinze and stiles directly addressing the camera this is the second in row following wing commander starring freddie prinze jr should have premiered on the aisles of the local blockbuster but was likely saved from that fate due the fluke success of she is all that if he does not start making better choices fast his future films will not be so lucky

for better or worse the appearance of basic instinct in the movie marketplace gave the greenlight whole slew of overheated oversexed underwritten thrillers apparently not having joe eszterhas as the writer does not change thing since body of evidence was not written him but has puzzling eszterhasish presence all over it in other words it is really dirty and really really stupid madonna first warning sign stars in body of evidence as woman who has piles of money and no apparent job she lives on houseboat and likes parade around seminaked presumably for the edification of the shrimp she is been accused of having murdered an older man who was her lover already two classic examples of sexism are in effect the first being that any woman in movie cannot be sexual unless she is under thirty or at least looks it and that they usually only exist for the sake of studs or filthy rich older men what is worse is that the movie confirms all the above and wallows in them as well madonnas character is accused of forcing sex on the old goat when she knew darned well he had heart condition and yes there are the obligatory cracks from the cops about how at least he died happy this movie leave no scummy stone unturned anyway willem dafoe very good but completely wasted also stars as the lawyer who is doomed run afoul of madonnas sexuality how do we know this because his character is set up the token wife and kids how obvious is it that he is gonna cheat on her and have fess everything up and get kicked out of the house and get welcomed back anyway do not skip the end yet we are just getting warmed up dafoe and madonna have lot of sex in this movie most of it is about as erotic as openheart surgery since it involves such goodies as hot candlewax always the kink of choice among screenwriters who do not know the first thing about really kinky sex and smashed light bulbs do not ask another thing that people are starting realize about explicit sex in movies is that unless it is critically important the story it is insanely dull what is worse is that body of evidence is dull everywhere not just in the sex scenes the stuff in the courtroom is recycled ninthhand from other bad courtroom drama scenes the thriller business itself is ridiculous it involves nasal spray bottles and drugs and juergen prochnow as surly doctor and the ending another homage eszterhas maybe is one of those endings where you can almost see the exact frame where one of the five or six various endings this mess was spliced in the director is uli edel all the more disappointing since he also directed the elegiac and powerful last exit brooklyn and christiane everyone has eat guess but this is not meal ticket it is leftovers

it was great anticipation that sat down view braveheart last week as it premiered on american cable the academy award winning had been highly acclaimed it also featured the music of one of my favorite composers james horner what was in for was disappointing and overlong was anything but the best picture of what drags braveheart down is its screenplay it abounds high production values john tolls awardwinning cinematography also graced edward zwicks legends of the fall gorgeous score horner and the sort of logistics that make you wish assistant directors were household names but this does not save misguided script the wishes paint its central character as hero but the viewers only response his heroism is intellectual william wallace producerdirector mel gibson is fighting for freedom and against tyranny so we have root for him but wallaces actions paint different story he speaks of freedom and acts of vengeance though one intellectually realizes wallace is on the right side the paints an unconvincing emotional portait in wallace is just not as bad as the english king wallace speaks of freedom but his acts point toward vengeance after kicking the english out of scotland he decides invade england this is evident of spartacus complex and this example applies both historically and cinematically the historical spartacus at one point moved from liberating slaves sacking roman cities the spartacus like braveheart has high production values and competent performaces and is dragged down an awful screenplay it is shame that such an excellent score is part of such terrible horners score tries make emotional connection but the performances and the script do not help gibson portrays wallace in such way that the audience cannot relate him or identify him this drags down any emotional connection the films plot and turns three hours into total waste of time

susan grangers review of the watcher universal just what we need another lurid trashy serial killer saga this time keanu reeves plays an elusive homicidal maniac who engages in gruesome tickingclock catandmouse game james spader burntout fbi agent who has suffered traumatic nervous breakdown after too many years on the job the lapd taunt spader who has relocated chicago reeves packs up his trusty piano wire and moves too before long he starts mailing photographs of the lonely unsuspecting young women who are his intended windy city victims challenging spader along the chicago police department stop him within hours before he strikes again in the midst of this murderous frenzy there is spaders psychologist played marisa tomei who is even less convincing as medical professional than jennifer lopez in the cell writers david elliot clay ayers and darcy meyers along firsttime director joe charbanic helmer of music videos for reeves band dogstar dwell on the warped thrill of the methodology and the chase revealing early on exactly whodunit since the killer says he and the cop need each other give meaning our lives plus as reeves explains we are all stacked right on top of each other but we do not notice each other any more after that it is all sound effects and tricky camerawork along muddled discordant soundtrack james spaders acting technique can be described as wooden deadpan while keanu reeves maintains his perpetually monotone dude persona sometimes works sometimes does not chris ellis as spaders selfimportant colleague is the only cast member who manages be convincing on the granger movie gauge of the watcher is an appallingly awful amateurish the real torture is watching it

ahh yes the teenage romance an attractive young cast is pitted into an unlikely scenario that could only happen in the movies and in the end the guy always gets the girl and the arrival of the breakout hit she is all that last year followed long catalogue of imitators including things hate about you and drive me crazy the genre previously on life support is once again hot commodity along now comes down you the folks at miramax are obviously trying capitalize on the rabid she is all that craze their latest project has the studdly freddie prinze jr attached and all only down you does not have the unlikely scenario mentioned above it is an extraordinarily ordinary romance dull unattractive teen comedy that sticks the boring game plan that we are accustomed this is the kind of romance that only giggly year old girls will find convincing in strictly textbook fashion college sophomore and aspiring chef al prinze jr meets freshman artist imogen julia stiles they hit it off like couple can only in the movies from here it is the standard boymeetsgirl boylosesgirl boydrinksentirebottleofshampooandmayormaynotgetgirlback story the plot is conveniently assembled suit the requirements of the main characters who are frequently taking part in activities that well only happen in the movies fortunately the cast of down you has certain appeal freddie prinze jr and julia stiles are an adorable couple and when on screen together they radiate the sort of warmth and charisma that the movie should have centered around zak orth as the newly realized porn star monk shows an unmistakable flair handling all of the films intelligent dialogue rounding out the impressive ensemble of young talent are shawn hatosy the faculty selma blair cruel intentions and ashton kutcher tvs that shows even the fonz himself henry winkler the epitome of teenage angst and nostalgia has welcome role as als dad the host of the popular cooking program chef ray maybe the concept of down you looked good on paper draw such crowd as feature however the finished product is bland and tasteless fluff only an occasional whiff of cuteness keep the gears from stopping entirely perhaps worst of all down you is not funny the jokes are drawn from obvious sources and the resulting humor is banal and uninspired the characters on screen often laughing at each others goofyembarrassing antics seemed far more amused than the audience even the giggly year old girls had grown restless toward the end as they waited impatiently for the formula run it is course the one mildly clever segment featured winkler and prinze jr in fantasy sequence called cooks cops takeoff in the father and son would storm houses and cook decent meal for needy families the assistance of fullyarmed swat team of course when this is the highlight reel you know the remaining could leave something be desired in order make teen comedy work you have got have characters that show something way of depth and identity things hate about you actually featured characters who were more than walking flashcards and the result was refreshing no such luck down you it is just textbook romance where despite absurd circumstances everything is bound work out in the end and at the end of the whole clich ordeal the nicest thing you could possibly say would be only in the movies

virus is the type of cliched vacuous that has been recylcled so many times before that you wonder why anyone would even bother putting work into making it strangely enough on the same midjanuary weekend last year another was released like this deep rising about an ugly monster on cruise liner prior movies the almost exact same storyline include leviathan deep star six and all four alien pictures virus in comparison is servicable thriller wellmade and produced but since it does not include one moment of even remote originality or intelligence it sinks under the weight of the water that the was shot on based on series of comic books virus concerns the crew of an ocean salvage tugboat becomes extremely damaged during violent typhoon after discovering that the boat is slowly sinking un lucky for them huge ocean vessel that appears be dead in the water turns up within the confines of their radar screen once the team reaches the russian ship they go on board find that the place is seemingly deserted after turning the power back on however there gradually are signs that something else is on the ship and the electrical equipment is oddly working itself one survivor finally does turn up nadia joanna pacula who informs the suicidal and stern captain donald sutherland and one of the crew kit foster jamie lee curtis that mysterious alien life form hit the santi mir space station then was transported down the ship taking over the minds of all of the electrical machines and thinking that humans are viruses that should be completely wiped out if virus sounds like all of the previously mentioned movies you are correct although the technical artistry is fairly impressive bring the mechanical creature life the itself does not appear have brain in its head the sticks so close the wornout conventions of the creature genre that it is amazing anyone would spend the money and time filming it when they could be making an original the actors are all very good and have all proven their acting abilities in the past but they are sorely wasted here and do not really even have characters play in her second return horror in the last year jamie lee curtis once again proves be strong and resourceful heroine but that is about it although halloween was also disappointment at least she was given few scenes develop character unlike here donald sutherland has fallen on hard times recently starring in thoroughly disposable films such as the puppet masters although just watched him in the superb scifi classic invasion of the body snatchers where he was fabulous the last of the three topbillers is william baldwin but it is fairly hard say if he is good or not in the picture since he has nothing do basically virus is another one of those films where group of people walk around and investigate space shipocean linerhaunted house until the deadly and equally grotesque and slimy creature pops up and kills them onebyone it is not the worst of its type but it is far from one of the best and when exactly are studios going give up recycling such shameless and overdone plot gimmicks such as this as long as some of them keep making money suspect the answer is never

over years ago japanese production company called toho introduced the land of the rising sun gojira reptilian creature of immense proportions created mankinds nuclear testing partly flight of fancy partly commentary on the exploitation of atomic power and weaponry gojira emerged from the ocean terrorize tokyo year later gojira was marketed the united states adding three things new name dubbed english track and raymond burr as godzilla the took on the rest of the world thirty years later toho remade the classic and once again took it the american market adding the same three things yes including raymond burr and called it godzilla now it is years after tohos remake and director roland emmerich has allowed the giant lizard make an american first run in emmerichs godzilla matthew broderick plays dr niko tatopoulos biologist who is called in join other scientists in the south pacific already studying the existence of radiationinduced super mutant leaves footprints the size of livingrooms when the mutant reptile suddenly appears out of the hudson river tatopoulos and the rest of the team relocate themselves back the states meanwhile tatopouloss college girlfriend audrey timmonds maria pitillo works in new york city as an assistant bigtime news reporter she would like be reporter herself and when godzilla comes ashore she figures this is her big break of course the big guy running amok in the city niko and audrey are bound cross paths and are joined victor animal palotti hank azaria audreys trusty cameraman friend and phillipe roche jean reno an operative for the french government whose nuclear testing started the whole problem in the first place together they attempt find and destroy the surprisingly elusive godzilla the resources of the most cutting edge special effects houses and the clout of one of the nations premiere movie production companies one would think emmerich could make truly deserving of the name godzilla he did not right up there the lost world godzilla is one of the biggest disappointments in recent cinematic history the plot is pretty much what we expect the big dinosaurlike creature comes out of the water and starts smashing new york city and it is up our heroes figure out why this thing is on its rampage and how it can be stopped while the military makes futile attempts bring the creature down the script however is painfully bad it is fraught lines so corny they do not even belong in bmovies and includes many character actions make you think you idiot or you stupid girl suppose when you have got movie giant lizard loose in new york any other semblance of reality goes out the window as well why is it that godzilla topples some buildings merely brushing against them but is conveniently able leap atop others why do helicopters have follow godzilla flying dangerously between buildings where they can lose sight of him when they could more easily keep track of him flying little higher and in straight line why do sidewinder missiles have small explosive warheads blow up entire buildings when they miss godzilla why is mission bomb madison square garden carried out three fighterbombers when flights of such aircraft are always comprised of multiples of two okay maybe the last one was bit nitpicky but hey was on roll broderick is usually good actor but in this he is weighed down an unexciting character and an atrocious screenplay seem fight against him every step of the way hank azaria does what he can but do not expect see development of any of the promise he showed in the birdcage like brodericks azarias character is quite simply lacking in color what really annoyed me was maria pitillo who actually takes the bad script and makes it worse her acting casting must have been asleep on this one the one bright spot here is jean reno who oddly enough seems fit well into role is often comedic quite unlike what we have seem him do in the past although his character is contradictory the unfolding disaster reno brings style the role of phillipe makes him enjoyable unfortunately the same cannot be said of the other incongruities the entire feel of the movie is tongueincheek and seems pay comical homage dozen or so films that have come before it this results in significant amount of parody contrasts sharply the threat of the monster and ends up just producing mess most of the characters seem be there for comic relief and almost none are smart enough for the audience take seriously although emmerich obviously wanted make fun action picture what good is it sink millions into cgi creature whose ferocity is undermined the humans he threatens if we cannot take the characters seriously the threat they face is an empty one because we simply do not care what happens them godzilla simply pulls too many punches in its attempt be more lighthearted than it should be far be it from me want see more carnage in the theaters but heres behemoth running through the city there is bound be lot of casualties but instead godzilla is afflicted the afterschool i joe cartoon syndrome where almost everyone seems get out of harms way just in time in couple of scenes godzilla briefly breathes fire none of the characters even remark upon this ability nor is it used any particular advantage the filmmakers it is as if the special effects people just wanted show that yes godzilla can do this just like in the old movie consider another punch pulled through creative script writing you can make sequel out of just about any movie but the final scene in this one does not just leave the door open it opens into hallway leading directly into room where godzilla ii is waiting patiently it made me want gag emmerich should have done away of the humor and injokes and played this one as straight action an intelligently written screenplay godzilla could have been so much more however confusing the viewer ton of addins and parodies the movie ends up being something that just does not work now if they only had raymond burr

before the remake of psycho appears we have got suffer through this remake of an earlier hitchcock dial for murder as usual has filled it glitz and big name stars and it all amounts loud sounding nothing the opens emily paltrow and david viggo mortensen having fun in an loft apartment the problem is paltrow is married stephen douglas who is not too happy when he discovers this affair if was paltrow though would definitely go mortensen less wrinkles anyhow stephen approaches david an interesting proposition he will pay him kill his lovely wife mortensen agrees but the murder goes awry and the twists keep on coming as the progresses unfortunately the dosent progress very fast in fact it moves like tortoise arthritis read very very slow the plot moves nowhere fast and only becomes exciting in very short bursts not too good for thriller also the performances apart from douglas are below par paltrow showing immense talent in seen and sliding doors is strangely stilted even unconvincing in this movie mortensen is little bit better coming across as younger douglas but his role is not meaty enough show all his talent leaves douglas waltz away the is does however doubt douglas finds it very hard play stogie smoking drinking womanizer creepy underside also popping up in the is david suchet playing shifty looking detective again it is not character we are seeing on the screen it is david suchet the director who bought us the fugitive piles on all the flash techniques such as zoomins quick cuts etc the lighting is also interesting however looks cannot save this from the depths of mediocre and the seemed work better in single set anyway the screenplay is k but there is some hackneyed subplot about douglas being ruthless player on wall street again and the ending is surprisingly stupid and cliched the characters also make incredibly dumb moves especially paltrow and stephen appears lose all intelligence in the last reel combination of no tension drama or decent characters perfect murder is failure all round and an incredible disappointment there are few bright moments but they are far and few between the last thing thriller should be is boring and although the just barely manages keep your interest thanks michael douglas you would not be missing anything if you decided not watch perfect murder overall rating review david wilcock you know for kids norville barnes

coinciding the emerging popularity of movies that deal anything related serial killers relentless low budget thriller about lapd detective sam dietz played character actor leo rossi spawned three more sequels relentless third in the row features sam dietz again but this time detective who had catch vicious serial killer in his very first case does not want deal similar line of work divorced demoralised and transferred he reluctantly returns his old post when los angeles becomes hunting ground for another serial killer and evidence indicate connection one of dietzs old cases make things even more interesting it seems that the killer deliberately stages murders in order bring dietz the investigation fans of the british tv films and miniseries like prime suspect or cracker would probably see lot of similarities relentless series of movies they both feature vicious psychopathic killers yet also give lot of usually depressive details about chief investigators private lives this one is not an exception but similarities british television are only in content the execution and style is different makes this mediocre piece of entertainment at best useless gratuitous erotica also does not help either obviously making this longer than it should be the actors are good though leo rossi is fine as usual and william forsythe plays one of more compelling villains in his career signy coleman as dietzs love interest is on the other hand quite miscast but she will not have worry about it in the future career since relentless was not supposed be anybodys finest moment anyway

edward burns tackles his third picture no looking back and like his previous two it is workingclass relationship picture however unlike his previous work the dwells on more personal story and female protagonist and in no looking back he stumbles making slow boring without the spark that enlivened his previous work claudia lauren holly is small town waitress who is feeling stifled her life she is at turning point in her life and feels as if she is going nowhere her boyfriend michael jon bon jovi is broke and in dead end job if she were marry him she would never get chance escape this town enter charlie edward burns claudias old flame he skipped town several years before without any explanations even for claudia he has come back town see her and suddenly she is torn should she stay stable michael and never escape her hometown or should she ignore her instincts and fall for charlie again part of the answer lies in the character of her mother blythe danner who fell for the wrong man and has spent her life pining for claudias father return now it seems that claudia is about make the same mistakes at only little past ninety minutes no looking back is rather short for its genre unfortunately it seems much much longer the storyline is simple and uninspired and there is lack of energy the whole proceedings makes the entire drama rather tedious edward burns makes misstep casting himself in the crucial role as the egomaniacal old flame there is no one restrain his ego reigns unchecked he walks into the room and lauren holly swoons yeah right lauren holly does what she can her central character but we never understand why her character makes such pathetically bad decisions and we never really care bon jovi is the only sympathetic character in the whole movie his acting talents are much greater than they might seem but he is given mostly bland and ineffective role work there is not much recommend in no looking back it is not that the is bad it is simply boring there is no zest in any aspect of the and no reason spend ninety minutes watching it

i do not expect much from eddie murphy these days for the past four years the gods of cinemaor the expansive payrolls of studio conglomerateshave allowed him make one bad movie after another such films as metro doctor dolittle holy man life and bowfinger have reduced once great comedic persona living and breathing washedup hack performing as studio puppet for th century fox and universal pictures the biggest shame fall on his shoulders is his newest nutty professor ii the klumps the klumps once again revisits the life of sherman klump an overweight university science professor looking for love in all the wrong places sherman has just invented new youth drink that enables man or beast become younger for short period of time janet jackson is the love interest who chooses the lovable sherman for soul mate rather than excel at her career as university professor and for the most ridiculous reasons love on his mind sherman is determined rid himself of his alter ego buddy love from the first professor who still resides vigor inside his psyche and causes sherman act like bad imitation of vince vaughn from swingers some convoluted mumbojumbo about dna extraction sherman extracts the buddy love link in his dna and smartly deposits buddy into handydandy lab beaker but one night the beaker is knocked over and buddy love is regenerated because every movie like this needs an unnecessary villain thwart the good guy then the klump family all played eddie murphy step in for some comedic relief involving old people having sex flabby breasts slew of fart and dick jokes and enough fat people jokes that lost count after the first thirty minutes and did mention the part where larry miller gets anally raped an overgrown hamster the movie finally dissolves into really bad hallmark family special about realizing who you are and what you can be in this world enough soft lighting and people on the verge of tears in every scene pure and simple the klumps is failure its script was handled not one but five screenwriters and it really shows during the awkward transitions between scenes any sense of story and plot were lost in the rewrite process it is more discerning learn that chris weitz and paul weitz the team behind one of the funniest films of the last decade american pie have their names stamped this trash hey guys quick note keep this movie off of your resumes the characterization of shermans family the klumps is one of the most ignorant stereotypes of black family have ever seen in cinema everyone member of the family is large person who wipes the bins clean at local buffet restaurant like pigs at trough the grandma is an oversexed fiend who constantly talks of ways pleasure her man and her sagging breasts the father is gruff is fired from bluecollar job is sexually inadequate and cannot communicate his family about his feelings the mother is ignorant of all the negativity around her and seems hold no opinion about anything or anyone the brother is silent and brooding and resembles the ice cube gangster character from boyz in the hood sherman himself is terribly insecure and never conveys anything for the audience become attached but the main problem the is its inability create any type of convincing conversational or situational comedy the family scenes from the first nutty professor worked so well because their conversations were short and direct and you got the feeling that these crass people could not act like this all the time the sequel does the reverse and drives the negatives of the klumps right in the hilt making brian de palma the director who bought us carrie dressed kill and mission impossible is back and has bought all his technical expertise him sadly he forget bring good story and believable characters nic cage plays rick santaro fast talking cop who is watching boxing match his friend commander kevin dunne sinise an assassination takes place and santaro tries peace together how it took place trying work out the roles of the people involved in this conspiracy the uses flashbacks and video cameras bring the mystery together however the does not keep the mystery for long and once the big secret is out concerning kevin dunne the is at dead end although there are some fantastic shots de palma including minute steadicam shot at the start of the halfway through the drops dead the problem is that de palma does not have strong story or characters work he tries offshoot this flashy camera techniques but pretty soon this has no effect on the audience and quickly got bored nic cage and gary sinise try inject some life into some poorly realised characters but it is no use they are boring faceless and completely unlikeable yes another problem the is that there is noone root for we are supposed be on cages side because his character becomes nicer throughout the however his change is sadly unbelievable poor gary sinises character is terrible who completely changes throughout the start the middle and the end in an appalling way the films use of flashback quickly gets boring while clever and interesting the first few times it quickly becomes apparent that flashbacks are being used because the has nowhere go they certainly do not increase the tension or suspense of the movie there is small thread of suspense running through the but it certainly does not make this powerhouse thriller rather just slightly below average one the script is lousy and contrived the characters flat and two dimensional certainly not good factors for passing itself off for thriller the most depressing aspect of the is that it had potential there is good story buried in snake eyes it is just bogged down in razzle dazzle and flashbacks it also gives itself away far too quickly rather than leaving the big twist for the end while the performances are intriguing especially newcomer carla gugino as sexy number cruncher wrapped up in the case there is no way of altering the fact that snake eyes is terminal case of style of substance and unless you are big fan of either cage or flash directing should be avoided david wilcock review you know for kids norville barnes

it is now the anniversary of the slayings of julie james jennifer love hewitt best friends still besieged nightmarish memories of the man responsible for it all she seems be on the verge of nervous breakdown she cannot concentrate on her schoolwork cannot get good nights sleep and is even frightened the shadows and the blinking strobe lights at local dance club everywhere she looks she sees visions of the man in rubber slicker the hook on his hand in the first movie i know what you did last summer julie and three of her friends accidentally kill man running him down while driving down dark mountain highway cover their misdeed they dump the body into the ocean however he never quite died and returned hunt down julie and her friends julie and one other ray freddie prinze jr survived only make this dismal sequal needing some desparate rest and relaxation she is elated learn that her college roommate karla brandy has won trip for four secluded tropical island accompanying these two girls are karlas overbearing boyfriend tyrell mehki phifer and potential beau for julie but was this contest too good be true the resort is filled skeleton staff that seemed like love boat rejects meanwhile the hotel is practically deserted as the storm season is about begin this presumably creates venue where they will be secluded and will have no possible means off the island eventually they will be hunted down during power outages and chased around during intense lightning storms as you might have guessed somewhere in the shadows lurk mysteriously strange figure that is wearing rubber slicker and wielding hook julie tries convince her friends that the killer is on the island an eerie touch is when she is singing will survive at the karaoke bar and the words scroll still know but her friends chalk it up paranoia but the body count soon starts rise and for julie it is going be the worst vacation of her life the funny yes used the word funny thing about this movie is that heard more chortling and giggling maybe it was my giggling than heard screaming this movie boils down mindless slashfest that never conjures up any amount of wry wit or even quirky campiness there is not even any suspense that leads up the deaths heres an appropriate example knockknock housekeeping says the diminuitive cleaning lady the door suddenly opens up slash next victim is there any reason go and see this movie not unless you want see four uninteresting college kids run around in circles for about minutes but do want say one thing about this movie that satisfied me was thoroughly irritated tyrell who incessantly ranted and raved about his sexual libido secretly wished for him get filleted did he get hooked well let us just say that if he did not would give this grade of

lucas was wise start his star wars trilogy episode episode is boring empty spectacle that features some nice special effects after the familiar long time ago opening the starts the opening yellow crawl that features in every star wars movie and computer game the plot is that the trade confederation are blocking off supplies the peaceful planet of naboo ruled queen amidala portman jedi knights quigon neeson and obi wan mcgregor are sent negotiate deal the confederation stop the blockade however this simple blockade is not all it seems and the jedi knights soon have deal many more dangers including facing the evil darth maul ray park they also meet the future darth vadar anakin skywalker jake lloyd star wars is largely failure in all the major areas of filmmaking script direction and characters the script desperately tries make an thin and boring story into two hour epic the trade confederation plot is just not as exciting as the death star and as the goes on the drama becomes more and more nonexistent there is no underlying tension and no urgent need see what the outcome is the also takes leisurely pace in telling the boring story does not help there is no snap make the work it moves at plod the script is boring all the characters speak in morals especially anakins mother there is no group spirit evident here and when all characters can speak only in profound statements or bark orders it is evident that not much is going happen the two leads are hideously boring static characters given little do and too much time do it quigon and obiwan hold no presence on and give little for the audience root for the audience will probably warm more bad guy darth maul if he had been given more screen time maul is one of the most underused bad guys in history even if he does provide the only straight plot line in the all the other plots in this are be concluded throughout the trilogy anakin is annoying and unlikeable instead of cute and huggable as lucas no doubt intended it is probably not surprising that his hateful little boy unfortunately blessed ani everyone he knows joins the dark side and kills everyone as quickly as possible the comedy relief is supposedly provided the gangly jar jar brinks although in the end none is provided in the him although his floppy features will no doubt be great for stuffed toys the lines and actions he is given are painfully unfunny the only good laugh is when his tongue is burned pod racer because knew he would not be able talk for while queen amidala is nothing in the she serves no real purpose apart from the fact that she must serve her people and go googoo over anakin again her role will become more important in the later episodes and is given little do here the actors do not help the movie much either liam neeson seems bored and embarrassed and seems desperate leave the movie as quickly as possible mcgregor comes across as posh mothers boy little charm the casting director must have chose him because he is scottish like alec guinness there is little other explanation for it natalie portman is plagued hideous costumes and poor script but she delivers spunky performance and jake lloyd looks at everyone hateful eyes and delivers his lines in bored voice there is very little talent evident him it is hard see why lucas chose him when there are better child actors out there he is not even very cute the main claim of the the special effects are okay there is nothing impressive about them yet they complement the story well the cgi takes away much of the human element however the battle droids for example the replacement for the stormtroopers are characterless little computer graphics lacking the humour and humanness that came from the stormtroopers episode is just disappointing it is got high production values but little else the music is meandering except near the end the plot gives us noone root for or even care for the effects are nice but dull the plot goes on for half an hour longer than it should there is an air of manufacturing among the whole sorry affair and many clich are catered for throughout the apart from remotely exciting pod race sequence episode is dry affair that serves little purpose except make money and get us watch episode see what happens the many unfinished plot lines in the disappointing is barely the word rating

tectonic plates is an incredibly painful motion picture experience that nearly prompted me walk out minutes into the movie the opened in canada during but was never released in the united states is based on stage play canadian auteur robert lapage and while it is evident that this could be fascinating live production the translation the screen is creative disaster enduring tectonic plates is like sitting through filmed version of performance art lifeless and tedious the qualities that make it captivating when seen in person are effaced in the motion picture medium tectonic plates has storyline although the narrative is developed in decidedly nontraditional fashion shots of the stagebound play intercut more typical cinematic sequences it is not an inherently uninteresting way present movie despite the valid complaint that it is pretentious allbutscreaming look art although it keeps the audience distanced from the characters because we are constantly made aware that we are watching play or movie it is impossible accept these individuals as anything more than mouthpieces for the writers ideas they are not real sympathetic or believable am willing give director peter mettler credit for trying something different but this particular experiment is not success tectonic plates opens introducing us madeleine marie gignac an art student studying in montreal who has fallen in love her professor jacques lapage one day he disappears and fearing that he left because she was undeserving of his love madeleine travels venice kill herself while preparing commit suicide she encounters drug addict constance celine bonnier who causes madeleine rethink her decision meanwhile jacques has moved new york city where he starts crossdressing calls himself jennifer and becomes successful counterculture talkshow host settings that shift from paris venice montreal manhattan scotland supporting characters that include topless goddess and deafmute and cultural references that point chopin george sand and jim morrison tectonic plates is unique if nothing else however as interesting as the sounds and was excited see it because the synopsis is promising it never really delivers the tone is soporific the supposedlyintellectual prattle is inane and uninteresting the plot meanders in pointless and irritating manner although it does not take long for the viewer determine that the story is largely unimportant and the symbolism is obvious tectonic plates is trying show that human interaction is as volatile as unpredictable as the shifting of the earth but it takes onehundred minutes get across this transparent point there are some worthwhile moments such as silly sword fight between jacques and the topless goddess and an entertaining discussion in both french and english about the differences between the two languages although the fine points will certainly be lost on those who are not bilingual the only people likely enjoy tectonic plates are those who feel strong need praise something this rootless and boring because it is different it is not like anything they have seen before and it is pretentious for everyone else it is not only waste of time but poor introduction the work of robert lapage

various films seen at the seattle festival it is all truethree men on raft s director orson welles recently uncovered onefourth of orson welles planned docudrama of amazing stories around the world interesting historians sadie thompson s director raoul walsh screenwriter raoul walsh from the john colton play rain based on somerset maughams story miss thompson cast gloria swanson raoul walsh lionel barrymore silent after the discussion of the newlyrestored version of frank capras lost horizon where several scenes had been restored using stills was interested see sadie thompson where the last minutes of the had been destroyed many years ago this is the silent version of the somerset maugham short story miss thompson this is one of the most skillful silent films have ever seenlittle awkwardness and very clever script the actors gloria swanson raoul walsh who also directed and wrote the screenplay and especially lionel barrymore as the hypocritical reformer who supposedly wants save sadies soul but really wants get her between the sheets is the absolute epitome of sanctimonious scoundrel swanson adds real life the character adding an worldly affectionate air the bawdy sadie unfortunately the ending is rather poorly tied up it is difficult know whether this is due the lack of liveaction or the original script the happy ending seems particularly poorly tied on cannot believe maughams short story ended sadie and our hero moving australia the stills are expected fill in conclusion we have been waiting an hour and half for still it is entertaining right up the end certainly barrymores incredibly hammy performance nonetheless works perhaps due the silent screen is must for anyone who is fed up the actions of the falwells bakkers and robertses of the religious worlds c movie worth if you can find it the pied piper czechoslovakia director jim barta screenwriter kamil piza this is an animated from czechoslovakia that is definitely not for kids it tells the old folk tale of the pied piper twist ending find highly appropriate and lot of political comment along it perhaps economic content is better wordit certainly does not show capitalism in good light nor human nature nor anything else for that matter as you may have guessed this is not tgif this is the kind of you are glad is over not that it was not interesting for technical reasons this is stopanimation that is very well done all the puppets have been carefully carved out of walnutsexcept for the animated stuffed rats boy sounds like real comedy vehicle does not it add onto that set design that makes the cabinet of doctor caligari absolutely cheerful in comparison and you have something give the wee ones and some of the mentally unstable larger folk keep them up at night some gore do not bring children this one do not bring adults this one unless they are fascinated puppetry andor hate capitalism so badly they enjoy seeing wooden puppets raped blech no fun whatsoever meier west germany directorscreenwriter peter timm cast rainier grenkowitz nadja engelbrecht alexander hauff thomas besvater subtitled this takes us back and forth over the east germanwest german border meier an east german wallpaperer whose father in the west dies and leaves him good deal of money his uncle also in the west sneaks meier out of the country unknown the east germans meier however is less than thrilled his girlfriend his friends and his job he likes all exist in east germany after roundtheworld trip his boss thinks he is on leave in bulgaria meier starts visiting east germany on day visas fake id and uses his money and his connections the west buy his girlfriend presents and bring credit his work crews workwhile everyone thinks he is still living in east germany of course something goes wrongand the ending is very funny but it takes the too long get there the humor is spread too thin and much of the plot is too obvious as is the acting still good concept for the comedy and the last five minutes are pretty funny the right hand man australia director di drew screenplay helen hodgman cast rupert everett hugo weaving arthur dignam jennifer claire catherine mcclements after lifetime of moviegoing and about four years of attending the seattle international festival have learned several rules while not absolute should certainly be given deference be wary of french comedies these people like jerry lewis ken russell is never going grow up no matter how long you wait any where siff associate director gary tucker refers the lead as old poutylips is probably not worth watching when an australian only awards credit is best cinematography watch out australia has good cinematographers up the whazoo but since weir and miller left for foreign shores finding good script or director seems be difficult not impossiblewitness malcolm last year task well ignored rules last night and sat through that should be in the golden turkey awards it is as if the director was trying do one of those classic romance stories that were done in the about tragedy among the gentry and falling in love people below your station and horses lots and lots of horses the opens stallion mounting mare under the direction of her ladyship guess is some kind of foreshadowing because the missus of the house wants have her son produce an heir unfortunately said son reckless idiot who faints at the very worst times kills his father and loses an arm during racing accident highlights include the amputation sequence the doctors daughter who has the hots for the son tasting his urine for diagnosis their tender kissing window between them while it is rainingyou would think woman studying medicine would know better the photography is good but kept wishing for bweverything seems sepiacolored anyway actually wished was watching swimming cambodia instead but that is life grade avoid like the plague unless you are looking for inadvertent yuks

capsule the weakest and least engaging of the alien movies dragged down an uninvolving story and no real tension alien the should be in superscript is sad and wan entry in what was shaping up as one of the best sf sagas ever put on screen it continues the story of ripley the spacetruckerturnedimpromptusurvivalist but seems remarkably uninterested in her in fact the movie seems lucky be interested in anything at all it is so elegaic and limp little of this would have been nice for atmosphere but the movie telegraphs its own tragedy from the beginning at the end of the last aliens ripley and two survivors were on their way home unfortunately an alien pod had been deposited in their ship and wound up triggering off their ejection in an escape pod the pod crashes on firorina prison planet designed house the incurably criminally violent ripley lives through the crash the others do not the prison is grim place even as prisons go it is been built around the remnants of an abandoned steelworks provides no end of technogothic backdrops for the actors be backlit against lice are endemic and so ripleys head is shaved another surreal touch at first it looks like she just has hold out as an unwelcome guest until company rescue ship can arrive but it does not stay that way one of the other eggs on board the wrecked escape pod hatches and soon newlygestated alien is running amuck worse it looks like ripley herself has been impregnated what is weird is how little tension this generates except near the end when the pressure is being troweled on through every cheap cinematic form of cheating imaginable loud music shaky camerawork etc sigourney weaver has become comfortable the role and she does well it but this time the role has been underwritten and left slack the supporting actors are also not given lot do the doctor charles dance and another rather religious inmate charles dutton very good hiave presence but they are not asked do anything it in light of the impending sequel apparently plays fast and loose the ending of this movie will not talk about the ending except say that they found remarkably good ending for such drab movie it is strange that some of the desperate and improvisational thinking that they found wind up this story could not have driven the rest of it

from the director of the nightmare before christmas it said in the previews am guessing was said get people go see the movie obviously it has not worked since the million dollar movie has yet break million each it is own however since monkey bone is not only bad movie all together but technically wellmade tragic waste of talent and incredible visual effects stu miley is the genius behind the new phenomena monkey bone crude comic strip that everyone wants merchandise they go great links get it as well including dollars that let out fart powder when stu and his girlfriend julie bridget fonda are in freak car accident you will see stu goes into coma and while in his coma stu travels am guessing dark town where all the characters in dreams come life people are stuck in this town their nightmares roaming around them when stu spots monkey bone whom he really cannot stand he tries keep him under control making new friend kitty rose mcgowan he learns that if he gets an exit pass from death he can go back up and live his life when monkey bone and stu steal pass monkey bone becomes trader and takes it and goes into stus body now monkey bone must get everyone buy these dolls nightmare powder so everyone has nightmares or something like that rather complex in fact more than it needs be monkey bone had potential in the script and even the story what is considerably noticeable is the gaping plot holes and lack of character development for instance we really do not get know who stu or julie are so why should we even care kitty played well rose mcgowan ha story behind her but we are not given chance know her the cast is decent however brendan fraser seems be enjoying himself in the role as stu miley but becomes awfully annoying when monkey bone takes over his body bridget fonda is dreary and seems bring the screeching halt her performance is bad and she seems miscast dave foley is not given enough do as well as will graces megan mullally who can be funny the standout performance is the voice of nick turturro as monkey bone himself he is very funny and entertaining and really keeps the from being total bust the special effects of monkey bone is what might really bring in some curious viewers these special effects are highly effective and nice look at the eyes some of them are believable and some unbelievable for monkey bone he seems be like stuart little you really do not realize that he is animated but on occasion it sneaks up on you the direction henry selick is good but at times he does not know what kind of he wants make and the ending climax falls off the cliff it is too bad really monkey bone could have been real good movie but it is heavily done hack job and lack of character development it just sinks when the end credits role for those curious however it might be worth the rental but other than that avoid this one

numerous comparisons can be made this movie past scifi suspense thrillers soldier is multi crossbreed between the likes of terminator aliens and offspring the problem such mixed genes is that the final product is real mongrel not well made and should have been put down before production got off the ground besides this the action is mediocre when compared the standard action flicks of this day and age the fight scenes between jason scott lee and kurt russell seem laboured slow and sluggish and could have done better choreography russell who is usually good actor in bgrade action flicks is unusually hampered his character sergeant todd who seems more like sergeant toad besides having almost no dialogue his character appears stunted zombielike is in line his screen persona but scores little points of empathy the audience this movie has not made me change my opinion about director paul anderson whose last epic event horizon has left an unusually bitter taste in my mouth although this movie does not come anywhere close the strangeness of former it is still long way from anything considered desirable

a documentary from the twin hughes brothers allen and albert dead presidents menace ii society about street pimps all of whom are africanamerican an offscreen interviewer questions them about their lives and profession it is mostly the pimps who do the talking for their hos and the egotistical and flamboyant way you would expect them be is what you get learned that the word bitch is their favorite word as it seemed crop up in every sentence they used it makes for no surprises or nothing fresh say but if one has sense humor for what their lifestyle is about then some of what they rap about might seem amusing they seem all want be thought of as businessmen in the business because it is the easiest way for them make big money it is also power trip accomplished manipulating the girls work for them mostly humiliating them and keeping them in place this sleazy pic soon became grating and wore out its welcome my unreceptive ears these verbose pimps had smart answer for everything and never knew when shut their face the hughes brothers used as their pimp role models the featherhatted furcoated diamond ringwearing gold chain wearing flashy cadillaccruising pimp of the late blaxploitation movieslike the mack and willie dynamite also used as reference was iceberg slims bestseller pimp the story of my life we meet pimps such as fillmore slim cnote charm kred gorgeous dre bishop don magic juan and rosebudd they readily discuss their business arrangements including percentages lifestyles knockin stealing another pimps ho and the thrill they get from women giving them money these dudes needed no prompting talk as they just love brag about about themselves priests need nuns yaps cnote san francisco pimp doctors need nurses so hos need pimps as he tries persuasively make the same case all the other pimps in the make that the girls need them show them the ropes how make money be their security blankets protectors and counselors the race issue was brought up right from the films onset as number of white interviewees regular citizens note that their impression of pimp is that he is the lowest form of human while we are told in the black community the pimp is looked upon as successful entrepenaur riding around in fancy cars flashing wads of money dressed in flamboyant style where his snakegaiter shoes might cost him grand and where he boasts style status in the community we also see that the black pimps have number of white girls in their stable and we see how they treat them like dirt as the implies that this could be payback for the days of slavery of master and slave relations the was all about pimp style and their projected image as they run hardsell riff about the virtues of their work there are different styles of pimping but the mentions them only as being macks and players or real pimps and perpetrator pimps but no further clarity is attempted it is also failed get the womens side this story of abuse primarily taking the pimp at his word the could never get the core of what makes the pimp think in such perverted way as he does as the filmmakers were taking for ride the pimps who were looking only pose in front of the camera and say their thing hungry for their minutes of fame the only laughs got out of this bleak look at an american subculture was hearing how few pimps retired and what they are now up danny brown became blues singer so he could keep his pimps wardrobe while pimp called rosebudd married his ho and turned square working support his wife and daughter as telemarketer

gord brody tom green is an aspiring animator approaching thirty who still lives in parents jim rip torn and julies julie hagerty airplane basement as dad declares all out war gord secures job in cheese sandwich factory in far off la and sets off make his dreams come true gord does not make much of go on his first attempt and lands back home fawning mom and outraged dad in freddy got fingered tom green cowrites tom green show scribe derek harvie directs and stars in what is essentially tom greens primal scream so if tom green screams in an empty theater does he make sound it is clear that freddy got fingered is at least partially autobiographical and green sure has one hell of complex about his dad mom gets off easier when sonny boy advises her go out and have sex basketball players and greeks while this may be of interest his hard core fans there is little about greens mania on display here recommend this movie anyone else the starts promisingly enough well executed skateboarding scene through shopping mall set the sex pistols problem greens put together first rate soundtrack and yes laughed few times greens flummoxing of security guard psychotic ramblings and his attempt draw make music and eat at the same time the daddy would you like some sausages scene repeatedly shown in the films trailer are inspired comedy but what is funny about paraplegic girlfriend who gets turned on having her legs caned or skateboarding injury that results in an exposed kneecap baby delivery bit shows some groaninducing promise until enough blood is splattered coagulate the laughs younger three years brother freddys internment at the institute for sexually abused children does nothing but confirm ones worst fears regarding the films title and greens infamous handling of real horse while not nearly as shocking as it would seem does not make sense the time he repeats the gag an elephant at films end the overall effect is numbness while freddy got fingered has the admirable end result of depicting the harm in demeaning childs self esteem it is essentially whole lot of tom green running around being noisy rip torn what were you thinking

much ado about nothing ah how sweet the irony it is accepted wisdom in some circles among english literature nuts mainly that whenever critic knocks shakespeare they are only doing so through ignorance he just does not understand shakespeare you will hear them say the bards work is apparently beyond criticism what load of old cobblers if these arbiters of public taste think kenneth branaughs of shakespeares comedy much ado about nothing is comedy in any modern sense of the word it is time get life get monty python get woody allen get john waters whatever just get real taste of some clever witty risky comedy and banish this nonsense where it belongs drama and tragedy was shakespeares strength my sensibilities and am no stick in the mud much ado about nothing resonates no spark whatsoever no kidding this ranks among the most embarrassing two hours have ever spent in cinema in my years of movie going the only thing that stopped me walking out was loyalty my lady friend as this was our day out and had not seen her in ages but boy does she owe me one will not spend too much time on the plot basically we follow the trials and tribulations of two wouldbe couples one young the other older there is some dark treachery amongst all this but everyone is so awfully jolly that you would hardly know it mind you there is nothing wrong the basic story good romantic comedies based on similar premises abound nothing wrong most of the cast either branaugh emma thompson and denzel washington are all talented performers the problem is the script or more accurately shakespeares original text light comedy should not be complex yet wrapped in elizabethan english the dialogue becomes difficult comprehend for this alone it will be problem for modern audiences unschooled in shakespeare and in search of nothing more than good undemanding laugh the only laughs escape my belly were brought on the gloriously inept performance of keanu reeves the actor once again miscast as jealous halfbrother or something but when dissected and understood what it all boils down is that this stuff is just so goddamn lame this is comedy so clean and nice and corny and so devoid of danger that it leaves this viewer totally cold ho ho ho boy likes girl ho ho ho men are such klutzes ho ho ho she is so awfully clumsy oh please there is wit in here somewhere am told call it pretentious something lightweight striving be something sophisticated through clever wordplay in the end it is cringeworthy watching some of the cinema patrons around me collapse laughter made much ado about nothing very weird movie going experience comedy bah humbug

another formula feel good quirky comedy from the british isles much like waking ned devine and host of other popular low budget movies that turned nifty profit off thin story line it is filled likable establishment types living in quaint town such as tolerant vicars and policemen plenty of eccentrics and of locals who stick together through thick and thin the strength of this lies in its rational theme that smoking pot should be legalized since it is even less dangerous than drinking alcohol the is tolerable until after its first hour it then falls completely apart becoming just too absurd consider as anything but sitcom fluff gone completely bananas but its long overdue message of decriminalization for certain drugs is on target and allows the at least be viewed as containing pertinent message its message is especially appropriate nowadays considering the war on drugs is about be escalated into colombia the drug war has been total failure so far and no hope of it being won law enforcement methods in the future it has so far just ended up causing americas jails be overcrowded nonviolent drug prisoners and offers zero hope of curtailing americas drug usage and drug supply billions of dollars have just been allocated congress get officially involved in the colombian civil war backing corrupt government remember vietnam the idea that military might could stop the cocaine and marijuana harvests in that country everything about this proposed action smacks of vietnam this scenario closer home so what probably awaits such an effort is more futile result than the other war the films mild theme of showing squares getting into the weed business and finding it acceptable the public something that should have been accepted some years ago is theme long overdue for public acceptance but one that is better received late than never there has be some common sense in distinguishing what drugs should be legalized and how educate the public on this rather than making it police matter altogether the opens in quaint cornish seaside village at the funeral of the husband of middleaged woman grace brenda blethyn who fell out of an airplane evidently committing suicide the widow soon finds out her husband was bigger bastard than she imagined he left her stack of enormous bills and put up without her knowledge their comfortable year old house as collateral for failed business venture taking out second mortgage the widow finds herself bankrupt and no marketable skills pay back her husbands enormous debts and prevent her from losing the house and becoming homeless she also knows that he was having an affair sophisticated woman from london honey quick what makes the affair doubly unsatisfying is that when conferring honey she finds out that he was tiger her in bed but refrained from having sex her even though the locals try help the bankrupt widow out as best they can the creditors swoop down on her like vultures her gardener and handyman matthew ferguson decides stay on her despite his last check bouncing since she is an expert amateur horticulturist he convinces her help him revive his hemp plants he grows for private use the two soon see this as possibly big business opportunity as grace works miracles the plants turn out be highquality stuff for grace this is way save her house and get her out of debt for the scotsman matthew it offers chance for him continue live in this beautiful village and earn enough money marry his fisherman girlfriend nicky valerie the locals all let the illegal activities go on undisturbed the police sergeant campbell pretends not notice what the bright lights in graces greenhouse is for the friendly vicar phillips counsels about the wisdom of not taking action over something that you cannot control and the doctor clunes enjoys smoking the weed for recreation the story becomes incredulous when grace decides go london and score bigtime drug dealer instead of having matthew go because she finds out nicky is pregnant and does not want matthew end up in jail it is interesting note that no one thinks smoking grass is bad for you only that one can go jail the scene grace on portobello road in the notting hill section of london trying find drug dealer while dressed out of place in white dress and hat one would wear tea party in cornwall but not on the streets of notting hill while looking make drug deal was completely hokey and the descended into huge black hole whereby it never recovered its dignity the moves into the formula mode whereas grace beats the odds against her failing survive as she meets an international drug dealer frenchman tcheky karyo who is first seen threatening cut off her fingers but later becomes her business partner and husband as she becomes millionaire and writes best selling fiction book about her experiences thereby becoming celebrity things work out in ridiculous way where there is total breakdown in the character development of grace where this matronly figure suddenly becomes merely cartoon figure instead of live flesh and blood there are lot of silly giggles that come forth and the has just enough of an acting performance brenda blethyn breathe air into it before it comes its belated finale as it drones on its transparently gratuitous upbeat tone until it makes the audience feel good that the sweet old lady succeeded this unhip leaves one the impression that smoking and growing pot is silly but should be tolerated as something naughty middleaged widows screwed their terrible former husbands must do in order not remain destitute ummm
