love kill starts off aimlessly and gets progressively less coherent as time passes at the outset the movie appears be about tony danza who is an illegal distributor of guns trying establish relationship an unsuspecting woman danza sets up double date her her sister and collegue of his everything seems be going well until the sister accidentally dies falling down set of stairs much confusion and mahem ensues as the death is covered up and other associates of danzas begin emerge all after one thing or another sound confusing it is think what the filmmakers were trying do is take the standard crime movie and throw in little humour and levity in some respects it works but the majority of the is convoluted and confusing mess characters keep popping up no explanation demanding money for deals that occur offscreen the only aspect of the movie that actually works is the budding relationship between danza and the dead womans sister but so little time is devoted this part of the story we never really become too familiar these characters and because of this we do not really care what happens them well did not at least one thing will give the movie is that it is complete departure for tony danza heres guy because of his many sitcom roles who is ingrained in the consciousness as nice guy who always does the right thing here he plays man who is just looking out for himself and if that means he needs kill in order save his own skin so be it was very impressed his performance and within minutes of the start of the had forgotten all about his goodguy persona michael madsen is also good as an associate of danzas who spends half the movie buddying up him and the other half trying kill him like said it is not exactly linear storyline love kill should be praised for trying do something different the well worn crime genre but it is just too bad that the story does not really add up much the stars deserved better and so did the audience

whether you like the beatles or not nobody wants see the bee gees take on some of the fab fours best known songs well maybe that is not true maybe you are curious the way you have look in your hanky after you blow your nose you just have know how bad bad can be if that is the case rejoice because it was twenty years ago today or so that sgt peppers lonely hearts club band was released unleashed the world and thanks our modern technological advances you can find this retched piece of filmmaking on vhs derived from the lyrics of various beatles songs sgt peppers tells the story of the fictitious band made popular from the song and album of the same name released in of course the movie was made eleven years later the gibbs three have become the lonely hearts peter frampton is the one and only billy shears and aside from being about rock band the story does not correlate the song at all and oh what joy we are the lovely audience they would like take home them do not think so but at least these characters are actually people in beatles song whereas other characters such as strawberry fields sandy farina gets her name from song about place called strawberry fields the debate over this is really quite futile when it comes down it because all the really has offer is feast of horrid cover tunes embarrassing cameo appearances george burns steve martin alice cooper and uuuuuuggggggglllllllyyyyy fashion and faces check please the plot is bit unclear people bad hair run around in leisure suits engaging in music video sequences that look like sick and twisted world of makebelieve from an overly demented mr rogers mean mr mustard frankie howerd somehow gets hold of all billy co instruments calling dr maxwell edison steve martin silver hammer and an outofkey singing voice the sun king marvin sunk alice cooper and couple of creepy robots his aid supposedly this is horrible thing guess in heartland the talent is pretty nonexistent meanwhile the lonely hearts are off doing the classic sex drugs and rock roll thing leaving poor strawberry fields without her true love billy she sets out find him leaving her poor dad and mom mrs fields hey wanna cookie all alone sing horrible rendition of she is leaving home accompanied those same creepy robots but is billy getting it on lucy dianne steinberg ya know the diamond possessing girl who hangs out in the sky well there is some crazy chick singing soprano on the roof of building next bus stop and assume that is who it was it is movies like this that make ya sit back and ask the unanswerable question what the hell were they thinking nobody will ever know but as novelty sgt peppers is one examine carol channing robert palmer keith carradine they are all here but why who knows it is irrelevant there is as much meaning be found here as there is be found in your bellybutton lint although the latter may be more interesting the recent onslaught of nostalgia in the movie world the ice storm boogie nights reissues of the star wars trilogy etc let us pray this does not get special th anniversary secondchance in theaters in the words of paul mccartney live and let die in fact bury this one while you still can

films adapted from comic books have had plenty of success whether they are about superheroes batman superman spawn or geared toward kids casper or the arthouse crowd ghost world but there is never really been comic book like from hell before for starters it was created alan moore and eddie campbell who brought the medium whole new level in the mid part series called the watchmen say moore and campbell thoroughly researched the subject of jack the ripper would be like saying michael jackson is starting look little odd the book or graphic novel if you will is over pages long and includes nearly more that consist of nothing but footnotes in other words do not dismiss this because of its source if you can get past the whole comic book thing you might find another stumbling block in from hells directors albert and allen hughes getting the hughes brothers direct this seems almost as ludicrous as casting carrot top in well anything but riddle me this who better direct that is set in the ghetto and features really violent street crime than the mad geniuses behind menace ii society the ghetto in question is of course whitechapel in londons east end it is filthy sooty place where the whores called unfortunates are starting get little nervous about this mysterious psychopath who has been carving through their profession surgical precision when the first stiff turns up copper peter godley robbie coltrane the world is not enough calls in inspector frederick abberline johnny depp blow crack the case abberline widower has prophetic dreams he unsuccessfully tries quell copious amounts of absinthe and opium upon arriving in whitechapel he befriends an unfortunate named mary kelly heather graham say it is not so and proceeds investigate the horribly gruesome crimes that even the police surgeon cannot stomach do not think anyone needs be briefed on jack the ripper so will not go into the particulars here other than say moore and campbell have unique and interesting theory about both the identity of the killer and the reasons he chooses slay in the comic they do not bother cloaking the identity of the ripper but screenwriters terry hayes vertical limit and rafael yglesias les mis rables do good job of keeping him hidden from viewers until the very end it is funny watch the locals blindly point the finger of blame at jews and indians because after all an englishman could never be capable of committing such ghastly acts and from hells ending had me whistling the stonecutters song from the simpsons for days who holds back the electric carwho made steve guttenberg star do not worry it will all make sense when you see it now onto from hells appearance it is certainly dark and bleak enough and it is surprising see how much more it looks like tim burton than planet of the apes did at times it seems like sleepy hollow the print saw was not completely finished both color and music had not been finalized so no comments about marilyn manson but cinematographer peter deming do not say word ably captures the dreariness of victorianera london and helped make the flashy killing scenes remind me of the crazy flashbacks in twin peaks even though the violence in the pales in comparison that in the blackandwhite comic oscar winner martin childs shakespeare in love production design turns the original prague surroundings into one creepy place even the acting in from hell is solid the dreamy depp turning in typically strong performance and deftly handling british accent ians holm joe goulds secret and richardson dalmatians log in great supporting roles but the big surprise here is graham cringed the first time she opened her mouth imagining her attempt at an irish accent but it actually was not half bad the however is all good for strong violencegore sexuality language and drug content

every now and then movie comes along from suspect studio every indication that it will be stinker and everybodys surprise perhaps even the studio the becomes critical darling mtv films _election high school comedy starring matthew broderick and reese witherspoon is current example did anybody know this existed week before it opened the plot is deceptively simple george washington carver high school is having student elections tracy flick reese witherspoon is an overachiever her hand raised at nearly every question way way high mr matthew broderick sick of the megalomaniac student encourages paul popularbutslow jock run and pauls nihilistic sister jumps in the race as well for personal reasons the dark side of such sleeper success is that because expectations were so low going in the fact that this was quality stuff made the reviews even more enthusiastic than they have any right be you cannot help going in the baggage of glowing reviews is in contrast the negative baggage that the reviewers were likely have _election good does not live up its hype what makes _election_ so disappointing is that it contains significant plot details lifted directly from _rushmore_ released few months earlier the similarities are staggering tracy flick _election_ is the president of an extraordinary number of clubs and is involved the school play max fischer _rushmore_ is the president of an extraordinary number of clubs and is involved the school play the most significant tension of _election_ is the potential relationship between teacher and his student the most significant tension of _rushmore_ is the potential relationship between teacher and his student tracy flick is from single parent home has contributed her drive max fischer is from single parent home has contributed his drive the male bumbling adult in _election_ matthew broderick pursues an extramarital affair gets caught and his whole life is ruined he even gets bee sting the male bumbling adult in _rushmore_ bill murray pursues an extramarital affair gets caught and his whole life is ruined he gets several bee stings and so on what happened how is it that an individual screenplay _rushmore_ and novel _election_ contain so many significant plot points and yet both films were probably not even aware of each other made from two different studios from genre the high school geeks revenge movie that had not been fully formed yet even so the strengths of _election_ rely upon its fantastic performances from broderick witherspoon and newcomer jessica campbell as pauls antisocial sister tammy broderick here is playing the mr rooney role from _ferris bueller_ and he seems be having the most fun he is had since then witherspoon is revelation it is early in the year it is comedy and teenagers have little clout but for my money witherspoon deserves an oscar nomination and once campbells character gets going like in her fantastic speech in the gymnasium then you are won over one thing that is been bothering me since have seen it there is an extraordinary amount of sexuality in this suppose that coming from mtv films should expect no less but the starts off light and airy like sitcom as the screws tighten and the tensions mount alexander payne decides add elements that frankly distract from the story it is bad enough that mr does not like tracys determination win at all costs but did they have throw in the studentteacher relationship even so there is no logical reason why mr has an affair when he does there is lot like in _election_ but the plot similarities _rushmore_ and the tonal nosedive it takes as it gets explicitly sexdriven mark this as disappointment

you have got mail works alot better than it deserves in order make the success all they had do was cast two extremely popular and attractive stars have them share the screen for about two hours and then collect the profits no real acting was involved and there is not an original or inventive bone in it is body it is basically complete reshoot of the shop around the corner only adding few modern twists essentially it goes against and defies all concepts of good contemporary filmmaking it is overly sentimental and at times terribly mushy not mention very manipulative but oh how enjoyable that manipulation is but there must be something other than the casting and manipulation that makes the movie work as well as it does because absolutely hated the previous ryanhanks teaming sleepless in seattle it could not have been the directing because both films were helmed the same woman have not quite yet figured out what liked so much about you have got mail but then again is that really important if you like something so much why even question it again the storyline is as cliched as they come tom hanks plays joe fox the insanely likeable owner of discount book chain and meg ryan plays kathleen kelley the even more insanely likeable proprietor of familyrun childrens book shop called in nice homage the shop around the corner fox and kelley soon become bitter rivals because the new fox books store is opening up right across the block from the small business little do they know they are already in love each other over the internet only neither party knows the other persons true identity the rest of the story is not important because all it does is serve as mere backdrop for the two stars share the screen sure there are some mildly interesting subplots but they all fail in comparison the utter cuteness of the main relationship all of this of course leads up the predictable climax but as foreseeable as the ending is it is so damn cute and welldone that doubt any movie in the entire year contains scene the evokes as much pure joy as this part does when ryan discovers the true identity of her online love was filled such for lack of better word happiness that for the first time all year actually left the theater smiling

jaws is rare that grabs your attention before it shows you single image on screen the movie opens blackness and only distant alienlike underwater sounds then it comes the first ominous bars of composer john williams now infamous score dahdum from there director steven spielberg wastes no time taking us into the water on midnight swim beautiful girl that turns deadly right away he lets us know how vulnerable we all are floating in the ocean and once jaws has attacked it never relinquishes its grip perhaps what is most outstanding about jaws is how spielberg builds the movie he works it like theatrical production first act and second act unlike so many modern filmmakers he has great deal of restraint and refuses show us the shark until the middle of the second act until then he merely suggests its presence creepy subjective underwater shots and williams music he is building the tension bit bit so when it comes time for the climax the sharks arrival is truly terrifying he does not let us get bored the imagery the first act opens police chief martin brody roy scheider new york cop who has taken an easy peaceful job running the police station on amity island fictitious new england resort town where there has not been murder or gun fired in years the island is shaken up several vicious great white shark attacks right before the fourth of july and the mayor larry vaughn murray hamilton does not want shut down the beaches because the island is reliant on summer tourist money brody is joined matt hooper richard dreyfuss young ambitious shark expert from the marine institute hooper is as fascinated the shark as he is determined help brody stop it his knowledge about the exact workings of the shark it is perfect engine an eating machine make it that much more terrifying when vaughn finally relents hooper and brody join crusty old shark killer named quint robert shaw on his decrepit boat the orca search for the shark the entire second act takes place on the orca as the three men hunt the shark and inevitably are hunted it jaws is thriller keen sense of humor and an incredible sense of pacing tension and horror it is like ten movies all rolled into one and it is no wonder it took america storm in the summer of taking in enough money crown it the box office champ of all time until it was unceremoniously dethroned in star wars even today fascination this is on par hitchcocks psycho and it never seems age although grand new technology exists that makes the technical sequences including several mechanical sharks obsolete none of it could improve the because it only would lead overkill the technical limitations faced spielberg in may have actually produced better because it forced him rely on traditional cinematic elements like pacing characterization sharp editing and creative photography instead of simply dousing the audience digital shark effects scheider dreyfuss and shaw were known actors at the time jaws was made but none of them had the draw of robert redford or paul newman nevertheless this guaranteed them all successful careers because each gave an outstanding performance and refused be overshadowed the shark scheider hits just the right notes as sympathetic husband and father caught in the political quagmire of doing what is right and going against the entire town it is your first summer here you know mayor vaughn warns him dreyfuss who had previously been seen in american graffiti and the apprenticeship of duddy kravitz gives surprisingly mature complex performance for someone who had literally only played kids and teenagers however most outstanding is the gnarled performance robert shaw as the movies captain ahab performance sorely overlooked the academy awards bordering of parody shaw plays quint as grizzled old loner whose machismo borders on masochism he is slightly deranged and shaws performance is almost caricature however there is one scene late in the when he and brody and hooper are below deck on the orca comparing scars quint is drawn into telling the story of his experiences aboard the s indianapolis navy ship in world war ii that was sunk the japanese his tale of floating in the water for more than week over other men while swarms of sharks slowly devoured them them is actually more hairraising than anything spielberg put on screen shaw delivers the story in one long take and it is the best acting in the of course we cannot leave out the shark itself its black eyes endless rows of teeth and insatiable urge eat it is basically the epitome of all mankinds fears about what is unknown and threatening in nature shark is such perfect nemesis it is real having survived sinch the dinosaurs great whites do exist they can be as large as the shark in jaws and they are threat every one of spielbergs subjective underwater shots makes us feel queasy because lets us see how we look the shark bunch of writihing dangling completely unprotected legs just ready be chomped into the shark in jaws was actually combination of actual footage and five different mechanical sharks all nicknamed bruce the crew built be shot from different angles many have forgotten but jaws was sort of precursor waterworld movies who soggy production and cost overruns had universal studios worried about bomb but as we can see now spielberg overcame all the obstacles and delivered one of the finest primal scarethrillers ever come out of

moviemaking is lot like being the general manager of an nfl team in the postsalary cap era you have got know how allocate your resources every dollar spent on freeagent defensive tackle is one less dollar than you can spend on linebackers or safeties or centers in the nfl this leads teams like the detroit lions who boast superstar running back huge contract but can only field five guys named herb block for him in the movies you end up films like spawn huge specialeffects budget but not enough money hire any recognizable actors jackie chan is the barry sanders of moviemaking he spins and darts across the screen like sanders cutting back through the defensive line watching jackie in operation condor as he drives his motorcycle through the crowded streets of madrid fleeing an armada of pursuers in identical black compact cars is reminiscent of sanders running for daylight the chicago bears in hot pursuit except that sanders does not have worry about rescuing runaway baby carriages but like the lions star jackie does not have anybody block for him almost every cent that is invested in jackie chan movie goes for stunts and as chan does his own stunts the rest of the money goes pay his hospital bills this leaves about cents pay for things like directors chan directs scripts and dubbing and supporting characters not mention the hideous title sequence this also explains why the movie was shot in odd places like morocco and spain chans first release in this country rumble in the bronx was supposedly set in new york but was filmed in vancouver and in the chase scenes the canadian rockies are clearly visible heck jackie does not even have enough money for haircut looks like much less personal hairstylist in condor chan plays the same character he is always played himself mixture of bruce lee and tim allen master of both kungfu and slapstickfu jackie is sent the un retrieve cache of lost nazi gold in the north african desert and is chased horde of neonazi sympathizers and two stereotypical arabs one of the things like about jackie chan movies no political correctness he is joined three women who have little do except scream jackie save us and misuse firearms the villain is an old nazi whose legs were broken in the secret base so that he has be carried everywhere and he is more pathetic than evil en route we have an extended motorcycle chase scene hilarious fight in the moroccan version of motel the neonazis and two confrontations savage natives once at the secret desert base there is long chopsocky sequence followed the films centerpiece windtunnel fight that is even better than the one in faceoff this is where the money was spent on wellchoreographed kungfu sequences on giant kevlar hamster balls on smashedup crates of bananas and on scorpions ignore the gaping holes in the plot how exactly if the villains legs were broken did he escape from the secret nazi base and why did not he take the key him do not worry about the production values or what exactly the japanese girl was doing hitchhiking across the sahara just go see the movie operation condor has pretentions of being raiders of the lost ark knockoff but one wonders what jackie could do the raiders franchise blocking for him lawrence kazdan screenplay john williams score spielberg directing and george lucas producing condor might be an movie however you have got go what you have got and what you have got in jackie chan is something special talent that mainstream should could and ought utilize

on june selftaught idealistic yet pragmatic young man became at age the first head of government of newly independent african state formerly the belgian congo two months later he was ousted from his powerful position and hunted government troops until he was captured and brutally murdered along two aides this littleknown story of this meteoric rise and fall is told my international filmmaker raoul peck in lumumba patrice lumumbas eriq ebouaney story has been told previously helmer peck in his award winning documentary lumumba death of prophet virtually guaranteeing that his new fictional account of patriot remains true its subject peck cowriter pascal bonitzer begins at the end of the story of the young political leader we watch as two white men perform the gruesome task of dismembering the bodies of three black men images of hatchets saws and fastemptying whiskey bottles accompany the grisly image jump back few years meeting among the black leaders in the belgianowned congo third class postal worker lumumba speaks his mind heads of the most powerful tribes proclaiming himself not tribal not regional but national leader his small mobile party the congolese national movement mnc is gaining prominence and patrice leaves his clerical job sell beer and get his face known in the bustling capital stanleyville at time when the colonial empires are falling down around the world lumumba is in the right place at the right time and through political savvy and chesslike manipulation achieves position of leadership of the mnc as the date for independence approaches he tactically positions himself be the new nations first prime minister and defense minister supporting the presidency of joseph kasa vubu maka kotto the coalition he created soon starts fall apart as the former belgian masters continue exert influence on the struggling nation as they strive maintain economic hold on the countrys vast natural resources of copper diamonds gold and more lumumba will not seek the help of the us knowing that they would try create de facto american control of the fledgling government his initial investigation into soviet assistance immediately tags patrice as communist and his integrity is overshadowed the cold war threat of russian domination the situation goes from bad worse as the army mutinies the remaining whites begin evacuate or arm themselves belgian troops violently intervene the lucrative katanga province succeeds under the leadership of rival moise tschombe pascal nzonzi and lumumba is refused access his own country when he returns from conference abroad this tumultuous and little known period of modern african history saw score of nations struggling for independence from the sometimesodious colonialists who have ruled much of the world from their european seats of power for centuries peck focuses his story on familiar material that strives give an honest portrayal of patrice lumumba his friend and foes and the independence movements that gripped africa in the and during the time the story takes place many new nations including nigeria and somalia were born varying degrees of success and failure usually dependent upon country colonized them some colonial masters were better than others the effort involved in lumumba is quite ambitious as peck and his crew before and behind the camera strive bring life this slice of world history that might have gone unexplored for decades if at all production values are first rate on what must be small us standards budget the period feel and realistic african settings are nicely maintained in production that traveled from zimbabwe mozambique the screenplay covers lot of ground and does yeomans work in providing great deal of detailed history while trying do justice the story of lumumbas life the political side of things is evenly told in linear straightforward manner that teaches not preaches it concentrates on the good deeds of the man if bit as stalwart saint but does not embellish on larger than life persona the family side of patrices life is handled in several perfunctory and brief interludes that show him talking one of his children embracing his wife or lamenting the death of his child know the intent is flesh the man out but too short shrift is given the family man side of lumumba the story as such has lopsided feel about it high marks go eriq ebouaney as the title character the actor gives convincing charismatic performance as the multifaceted politically deft patrice lumumba who has the good of his people and his country as the force driving his own ambitions in true docudrama tradition the supporting cast does not outshine the star complementing his good efforts instead lumumba is solid interesting educational and honest docudrama that should appeal buffs and politicos both it has more intelligence in its telling than anything have seen out of for months and give it b

apparently director tony kaye had major battle new line regarding his new american history i do not know the details of the fight but it seems that he is not happy the final product and nearly removed his name from the credits altogether have heard about this kind of thing happening before and it makes me wonder how much input studio has over the films they produce as it is found american history be an extremely good not just because of tony kayes focused look at the touchy subject of racism but because of powerful charismatic performance from edward norton it is hard believe that it has only been two years since nortons fantastic role in primal fear but here he is now starring in his own and making himself star norton is one of those performers who becomes his character and his work in american history is one of the very best performances this year he plays young man named derek vinyard skinhead living in venice beach his brother danny edward furlong mother beverly dangelo and sister davin jennifer lien the opens flashback in derek brutally kills two black men vandalizing his car we find out that this lands him in prison and the from that point is seen through the eyes of danny in the presenttime of the danny is in high school and eager follow the footsteps of his brother much of the is told in flashback and we see the path that leads dereks adoption of white supremacy when derek is released having served three years in prison he finds that his brother is now fullblown skinhead derek however has given up the violence and tries get his brother understand why racism and the violence that comes it are bad things what makes this all interesting is that these two young men are not stupid thoughtless people they are intelligent and articulate and voice their beliefs in disturbingly straightforward terms it is hard make controversial movie and not preach but kaye has found the right note for his material because american history is mainstream there has be redemption phase for our main character some people may think that this is the only way make him sympathetic partially disagree this because although do not advocate racism in any way it is interesting the way kaye presents derek he is loud obnoxious man but he is also very smart the reasons for why he becomes skinhead are believable his father was arbitrarily killed group of black men it is clear that he is passionate about his beliefs and that he is not just punk looking for an excuse beat people up of course it helps that kaye has an actor as talented as norton play this part it is astonishing how frightening norton looks shaved head and swastika on his chest in addition getting the look just right he is perfect for this role derek requires intelligence depth and whole lot of shouting and norton does it all ease even when he is at his meanest derek has likable quality him and that is gutsy approach when telling story about skinhead what adds depth the story is subplot in the principal of dannys school avery brooks becomes obsessed purging the hatred from danny the other performances are all terrific standouts from furlong dangelo and lien visually the is very powerful kaye indulges in lot of interesting artistic choices and most of them work nicely lots of slowmotion and strange camera angles add moody atmosphere but like lot of movies lately american history skims past greatness in the last few minutes although the climactic scene is very moving the picture ends pretentious preachy resolution featuring brief narration from character who was killed for movie so smart subtle up until that point it felt like slap in the face be handfed theme in such simplistic way it makes me wonder what exactly tony kaye disliked about the final version of his perhaps this last scene was the problem it is hard imagine any director not being at least partially pleased this good in time when so many movies are timid and weak american history manages make compelling argument for racism without advocating it any way

one of my colleagues was surprised when told her was willing see betsys wedding and she was shocked hear that actually liked it her reaction was understandable when you consider that the revolves around molly ringwald who has not made worthwhile since but the fact is betsys wedding is also an alan alda and while ringwald has been making duds for the last four years alda has been involved several noteworthy projects including crimes and misdemeanors and new life written and directed alda betsys wedding is vibrant sliceoflife mixing few dramatic moments into big bowl of whimsical humor aldas comic elixir is smooth and refreshingand welcome change of pace from the usual summer fare as bride and groom molly ringwald and dylan walsh are the pivotal characters in the but they are far the least interesting walsh is nonentity all the screen presence of door knob ringwald is simply unbearable and is easily the weakest link in the chain she looks hideous her shortcropped orange hair red lipstick and grotesque outfits she is supposed be dress designer but she looks more like clown and make matters worse ringwalds performance matches her appearance thankfully alda keeps ringwalds screen time minimum he is far more interested in the colorful periphery characters the wedding is just device bring together the brides workingclass italian family and the grooms rich gentile family ringwalds folks are homey and downtoearth alda as her freespirited father madeline kahn as her practical mother and ally sheedy as her lonely sister walshs clan on the other hand is prim proper and ostentatious when the two families meet and mingle the movie becomes story of culture clash or as one character puts it money versus values ally sheedy in wonderfully understated performance is one of the films most pleasant surprises sheedy expresses more just her eyes than ringwald does her entire body it is anthony lapaglia however who seizes the spotlight lapaglia plays stevie dee suave overly polite mafioso who is formally courting sheedy oldfashioned chivalry lapaglias sincere but dimwitted character is riot and what is uncanny is that lapaglia is dead ringer for robert de niro little bit of alec baldwin thrown in for good measure lapaglia seems have attended the de niro school of gangster acting and his inspired performance is partly tribute his rolemodel and partly ripoff do not know whether say star is born or star is reborn but do know that lapaglias overthetop performance should not be missed the scrumptious comic acting however extends well beyond sheedy and lapaglia joe pesci in particular sinks his teeth into his role as aldas unscrupulous brotherinlaw slum lord mob ties who is cheating on his wife catherine ohara alda faced challenge of both directing and acting somehow finds just the right comic touch as the brides financiallystrapped father carpenter whose dreams are bigger than his wallet the adopts aldas psychological point of view as he tries one plan the wedding and two pay for it as filmmaker aldas style of humor is remarkably restrained and tasteful and while he does not have the comic genius of woody allen alda does possess the inspiration make movies are ten times more entertaining than the slop usually passes for comedy

after bloody clashes and independence won lumumba refused pander the belgians who continued condescending and paternalistic relationship the congo their officers particularly general janssens rudi delhem in the force publique the congos army caused rebellions undermining lumumba who was outraged at the rape and murder of belgian nationals unrest building moise tshombe pascal nzonzi and the province of katanga contained percent of the countrys resources proclaimed secession lumumba replaced janssens making mobutu colonel and went on pacification tour congolese president joseph kasa vubu maka kotto but it was too late when you want drown dog you say it has rabies prophesies lumumba of his own fate peck and bonitzer do an exemplary job telling complicated tale myriad of players although they frequently succumb cliche particularly regarding lumumbas private life pecks script illuminates bantu sayings like the hand that gives rules when lumumba uses it the american ambassador pecks direction is less assured many scenes unfortunately playing like standard television fare he is served well though his casting of ebouaney in the title role ebouaney is dynamic radiating his characters fierce passion for his people and his country lumumbas intelligence and ability strategize even as he is cornered insurmountable odds are given life ebouaney pecks subject and lead actor elevate his above its mediocre production lumumba is story that deserves be told and ebouaneys performance makes the tragedy personally felt

the american action has been slowly drowning death in sea of asian wirefu copycats it is not pretty death and it is leaving the likes of schwartznager stallone and van damme wearing cement galoshes at the bottom of kung fu sea sometimes the mix results in mindblowing spectacle unlike any other quality action amazing and exciting stunt work as in the matrix can be real gem but too often gets it wrong even when they pay off chinese directors flying ninjas and floating karate masters have been replaced soaring bronx detectives and slow motion kicking scientists mostly it is laughable in hollywoods rush emulate the success of the matrix trademark asian stunt choreography has become more of joke than an art form but iron monkey the latest asian import shows us how get it right iron monkey actually reissue of is the story of th chinese vigilante rongguang yu fighting his own unique style of shaolin kung fu for the rights of the oppressed and the bellies of the hungry but it is also piece of the narrative of legendary chinese hero wong feihong most recently seen in one of the most overlooked and possibly best films of drunken master released in the s as the legend of drunken master unlike drunken master stars jackie chan as an adult feihong iron monkey finds much younger feihong szeman tsang and his father wong keiying yen chi dan thrust into the middle of iron monkeys fight against oppression iron monkey succeeds as no kung fu since drunken master at times fighting styles especially that of monkey himself do devolve into the ridiculous twinkletoed floating of films like crouching tiger hidden dragon director yuen wo ping eventually remembers bring his action scenes back earth iron monkey is at its heart hardcore kung fu action rather than any kind of drama la crouching tiger however there are brief moments of profoundness shared between characters such as those that pass between our outlaw hero and his goodhearted but misguided enemy chief fox in those moments and in others iron monkey manages transcend its mindless kung fu nature touch the hearts and minds of its audience while in no way the equal of masterpiece like drunken master iron monkey dances quite nicely the invading kung fu tune aka siunin wong feihung tsi titmalau

after watching rat race last week noticed my cheeks were sore and realized that when not laughing aloud had held grin for virtually all of the films minutes saturday night attended another sneak preview for the movie and damned if did not enjoy it as much the second time as the first rat race is great goofy delight dandy mix of energetic performances inspired sight gags and flatout silliness hands down this is the most fun of the summer the movie begins zippy retrostyle opening credits that look like they were torn straight out of s slapstick comedy featuring animated photos of the cast attached herkyjerky bodies bounding around the screen then comes the setup donald sinclair john cleese the extremely rich owner of the venetian hotel and casino in las vegas enjoys concocting unusual bets for his high rolling clients that end he places half dozen very special tokens in his slot machines gathering together the lucky token holders he explains today you have chance play game where the odds of winning are one in six the competition is simple each contestant gets key that opens locker in silver city m containing million in cash there is transmitter in every key so that sinclair and his cronies can keep track of who is ahead the race has no rules whichever contestant reaches the locker first gets the money since it would be wrong spoil any of the jokes let us use the next few paragraphs profile the racers decked out in flashy trashy clothing and sporting big hair vera baker whoopi goldberg is in town reunite the daughter she gave up for adoption as baby she finds that grownup merrill lanai chapman is erudite conservative and more than little bit wary of this stranger trying jump into her life thrown together it becomes clear that both women share fierce competitive nature owen templeton cuba gooding jr is currently the most hated man in america an nfl referee he cost gamblers all over the country enormous amounts of money blowing call in highprofile game after escaping from vengeful cab driver owen gets new mexico masquerading as the driver for busload of lucy ricardo impersonators heading convention mr pollini rowan atkinson is cheerful odd little italian man on holiday in america he also is narcoleptic and falls asleep at the most inopportune times pollini hitches ride zack wayne knight hypertense ambulance driver carrying human heart across country for transplant operation randy pear jon lovitz promised his wife beverly kathy najimy and two kids funfilled vacation in las vegas fearful that beverly will be angry over his involvement in the race he claims that he must travel silver city for job interview beverly insists the family stay together so they hop in the minivan and tear off into the desert brothers duane seth green and blaine vince vieluf cody are young crooked and stupid blaine has speech impediment due his poorly selfdone tongue piercing and duane is the only person who can come close understanding him the boys will stop at nothing reach their goal finally nick shaffer breckin meyer is nononsense lawyerintraining who recruits helicopter pilot tracy faucet amy smart for the journey at first glance they seem blandly wholesome but all that changes when tracy buzzes the home of her boyfriend shawn dean cain and spies him swimming another woman director jerry zucker airplane ghost leaps from racer racer periodically returning las vegas where sinclair and mr grisham dave thomas his personalityimpaired right hand man continue cooking up bizarre bets for the gamblers as any zucker production few jokes fall flat but the momentum of the comedy zooms past those missteps high points for me include bit involving kathy bates as roadside squirrel salesperson and an intricately set up gag that carries jon lovitz and family from bizarre museum an outdoor rally an utterly tasteless and screamingly funny payoff had been part of the filmmaking team would have ditched joke where key is dropped into babys clothes and instead had the key get lost in the cleavage of dozing society matron it would have drawn the same laugh without the squirminducing hint of child molestation also would have selected different band for concert sequence my god do we really need yet another movie smash mouth performing all star but enough carping rat race is riot terrific noholdsbarred performances from the diverse cast see it see it again and when the dvd comes out buy it because movie this hilarious will surely have outtakes die for

i have noticed something lately that have never thought of before pseudo substance faking deep meanings in their films have you ever seen movie that you really enjoyed then when you look back you realize there was something missing more and more filmmakers seem be putting out well rehearsed melodramatic films that evoke strong connotations of being great but if you step aside and reflect on your movie going experience you may just discover nothing more than elegantly presented fluff am not trying say city of angels is that bad it had lot going for it but somewhere along the way it faltered somehow underneath the seemingly poetic beauty of it all there was gigantic hole somebody covered iridescent performances and glossy cinematography the predictable ending that shattered our hopes even though we saw it coming only added the disappointment but for over an hour city of angels is well worth the time nicolas cage is seth guardian angel who like hundreds likely thousands or even millions of other angels spends eternity watching over the citizens of mortality humans never aware of how much celestial intervention occurs in their life meg ryan in her most subdued performance yet plays maggie doctor who begins ponder exactly who it is we are fighting against when we fight keep someone alive after losing patient on the surgery table these questions envelope maggie and seth the angel who was there oversee the patients transition into the afterlife is immediately captivated the doctor he begins following and observing maggie falling more and more in love her everyday angels who we quickly learn are not and never were humans can not experience human sensations such as taste and touch but they do have the ability make themselves seen anyone they desire seths adoration is too much resist and eventually he does appear maggie quite regularly although such thing seems taboo among the angelic community the angels are interestingly presented all of them dressed in black and more reminiscent of hitmen than traditional glowing white entities but it is nice touch that never seems like mere attempt at uniqueness cage is wonderfully versatile actor think faceoff raising arizona and it could happen you what combo who slips into the role of heavenly agent quite nicely but threatens sappiness more than once it is nice see ryan pick up roles like this and the one in courage under fire the two are not very comparable each other but they both deviate from her usual intelligently ditzy romantic comedy roles and it is an impressive side of ryan movie goers rarely have the chance enjoy but even though the two leads do an impressive job it is dennis franz who grabs us his interpretation of hospital patient who knows more than meets the eye it is shame that so much going for it city of angels falters so much in its final stages leaving us the realization that an emotionally incredible movie was out there they just did not know quite how get it they struggle for an impacting conclusion and wind up painful thud rather than an exhilarating high filmmakers should know your final impression will be the one you linger on remember and convey others thru word of mouth so after telling us for minutes that this is glorious masterpiece they sure leave us disheartening taste of mediocrity in our mouths based on the german wings of desire that being the english title of course city of angels is ninety percent success enough make most people forgive its shortcomings even the devastatingly disappointing ending most movie goers the noncynics anyway will be too wrapped up in the surreal atmosphere give criticism that needs be criticized nonetheless city of angels is beautifully captivating is probably enough satisfy those poetic viewers who will appreciate delve into rich emotional territories

synopsis bobby garfield yelchin lives in small town his mirthless widowed mother hope davis bobbys world revolves around his friends especially the spritely carol boorem then one day new boarder arrives at bobbys house ted brautigan hopkins is an enigmatic man whom bobby takes an immediate liking as the bond between bobby and ted deepens bobby becomes privy teds great secret an event will change both of their lives forever review small but enchanting movie hearts in atlantis easily recalls another kinginspired comingofage stand me both in terms of its setting and the sentiment it conveys hearts is tribute the magic of childhood those summers when the days seem neverending and nothing means more than your closest friends unlike stand me there is supernatural element hearts but although it is key the plot it is not prominent like stand me this is mostly characterdriven and as such it benefits greatly from superb casting yelchin is very good as bobby finding good mix of innocence and resignation more splendid still is boorem whom praised highly for her work in along came spider and who is simply radiant here as carol and then there is hopkins who despite playing such quiet introspective character as ted nonetheless commands our attention every time he is onscreen less successful is davis whose strident elizabeth comes across as overly cartoonish also found it odd that bobby and carols other friend sully whose death as an adult sets up the movies flashback framing device is paid virtually no attention but hicks direction is lovely without being cloying and despite the movies general lack of incident it never ceases weave its spell over the audience

synopsis in this movie steven spielberg one of todays finest directors attempts spice up the story of long courtroom battle over the fate of prisoner cinque djimon hounsou young angry man from sierra leone who was kidnapped into slavery and his fellow prisoners cinque and friends have landed ship on the shores of america after escaping spanish slave traders but since the americans do not speak cinques language the black men are hauled into court determine whether or not they are legally slaves technically since the international slave trade was outlawed at that time people like cinque could not be kidnapped into slavery one had be born slave be legally considered slave lawyers baldwin and adams matthew mcconaughey and anthony hopkins must prove cinque and the others were captured into slavery rather than born slaves in order get them out of prison as free men three lengthy court cases are portrayed spielbergs trademark panache flashy beginning lots of facial closeups big music and dramatic imagery final speech adams is followed an anticlimax where subtitles show what eventually happened the various characters opinion making fictional movie is easier than making one about real life in fiction one invents purposeful clearcut good guys and bad guys puts the fictional characters in conflict and takes the tale its exciting conclusion real life however consists of long stretches of boredom few dramatic moments and characters who stand around think thoughts and do nothing or come and go before events are resolved spielberg gives us visually spicy and historically accurate real life story djimon hounsou and anthony hopkins turn in excellent performances

the police negotiator is the person the entirely unenviable job of going into ground zero and attempting talk dangerous criminal out of doing whatever he or she intends do lives are often at stake and the criminal is usually armed and most likely mentally unstable prone turn on the negotiator at moments notice the negotiator must therefore be something of an actor psychologist and sham artist in addition being police officer he must be able think on his feet and either work toward the goal of ending the confrontation without violence or failing that must be prepared facilitate the conclusion of the crisis through firepower most of all the negotiator must be able enter situation as little intelligence about the scenario as possible and quickly gain control of the situation dominate the conversation and influence the perpetrator into thinking that the end of the conflict is what he really wants it takes pretty smart person do that but what if the hostageholding criminal is just as smart what if he is also able think on his feet in fact what if he also knows all the tricks turning the situation his favor it is this circumstance forms the basis for gary grays the negotiator in this police negotiator danny roman samuel jackson is tipped off his partner corruption within the chicago police force when his partner turns up shot death and internal affairs finds incriminating evidence in romans home roman becomes the prime suspect of both embezzling from the police disability fund and murder faced the scorn of most of the police department and under close scrutiny the media roman is forced turn in his badge in one of those typical scenes in the captains office do not quite remember if the captain actually said hate do this but although it would not surprise me if he did luckily the soon shakes off the conventionalism and concentrates on the interesting premise mentioned above after being offered takeitorleaveit deal the district attorney roman resolves prove his innocence walking into the office of internal affairs inspector niebaum t walsh taking him and others hostage and proclaiming he has been framed although romans actions seem forced due the compressed nature of his motivational buildup gray redeems himself involving us the negotiations between roman and fellow police negotiator chris sabian kevin spacey soon ensue jackson while superb actor is miscast in the role of roman the actor has become so popular and so often identified as protagonist notable exceptions can be found such as in jackie brown that we as an audience have difficult time believing he will carry out his threats the script also clearly sets him up as the good guy who is only trying prove his innocence how can we believe he is going shoot hostage no matter if the hostage tried kill him earlier unfortunately this preconception saps the of some of it is wouldbe suspenseful moments and anything good left in those scenes is largely attributed jacksons acting ability almost every time he is in scene jackson steals it without looking back when spacey appears the has already run about third of its course his is an interesting character made out be some kind of negotiating superman our first look at him has him hopelessly trying get his family moving set out on vacation can talk man out of blowing up the sears tower but cannot talk my wife out of the bedroom or my daughter off the phone he says when he gets the call action however he quickly changes gears and becomes the man we expect him be soon his character has negotiate not only roman but also the swat commander david morse who is itching send in team take roman out all the while keeping wary of the fbi agents who are waiting take over the operation should negotiations fail this complex set of pressures are reflected well in sabian the negotiator and spacey the actor as the second protagonist spacey measures up nicely gray really lucked out this cast david morse as commander beck ron rifkin as commander frost and john spencer as police chief al travis are all more than competent and can hold their own in scenes jackson and spacey the only problem is the bit of typecasting that results from these choices morse played similar role in the rock rifkin played the a in a confidential and spencer played police detective in cop land the level of acting however this can be forgiven also in the supporting cast paul giamatti as rudy one of the hostages is notable for the comic relief he provides his character is initially so slimy and giamatti himself just looks so shifty that you expect laugh before he even says anything fortunately this does not distract from the seriousness of the rest of the but instead provides some nice breathers from the level of tension gray manages sustain throughout t walsh as the suspicious internal affairs inspector clocks in one of his final performances sadly the talented but underrated actor passed away in late february of this year and the soon be released pleasantville will mark his last walsh appeared in dozens of movies such as good morning vietnam backdraft and nixon for one of his best performances check out sling blade in he plays mental patient sharing ward billy bob thornton when jack nicholson accepted his best actor oscar in march walsh was one of the men whom he credited his success the actors performed together in few good men the negotiator is actually dedicated walsh and while inspector niebaum may not have been his best role it certainly characterizes the type of character for walsh had become most famous for playing in the end the negotiator has plotline that parallels it is reality we are served the premise that two equally deft negotiators are battling each other resolve the conflict in the manner will suit each of them best as an audience we are also given situation where two wonderfully talented actors are thrown into movie and we would like see if one will dominate the both provide some pretty good entertainment

plot young man who loves heavy metal music and especially the band steel dragon whom he is devoted tribute band in he sings gets launched into stardom when the real group get rid of their lead singer and call on him take his place critique am sucker for movies like this young man humble background and lofty dreams works hard devotes the time the energy and the patience and ultimately hits it bigtime in the case of this our boy loves certain heavy metal band and as luck would have it yup luck always finds its way into these types of equations although generally tied very closely hard work they need new singer his entry and adaptation the whole rock roll lifestyle fills the rest of the and is really fun watch although will preface this saying that one thing that would definitely enhance your appreciation for this is your own love or past love of heavy metal music and the whole scene around it metal was one of my first loves as teen and even though the genre of music is not that prominent anymore still check out my motley crue twisted sister and anthrax cds every now and again that is not say that you will not like this if you do not like the music but the music and live performances from the band play big part in the movie and for one had blast watching and listening it all but the even greater draw in this is the standout performance given here mark wahlberg wow hand this fella some major props as he totally becomes this heavy metal geekgod incidentally metal god was the films original title and much better one if you ask me he is this movie and was quite taken his character pretty much the whole way through he came off like regular guy extremely passionate goals and work ethic who was willing do anything in order fulfill his dreams aniston was also surprisingly good as the girlfriend and the romance angle between them was sweet but she did not pull me in hard enough during their emotional scenes was also impressed some of the real musicians who played in the zakk wylde from ozzy osbourne jeff pilson from dokken stephan jenkins from third eye blind blas elias from slaughter but actor dominic west as kirk cuddy made the biggest impression among the band members it is note that this was based on reallife tale of young man who used sing in judas priest cover band and then went on become their actual singer their original singer also admitted being gay as in this just for the record am certainly not recommending this for its originality or surprise elements since most of this stuff has already been covered in some way or another in other movies but because it is fun uplifting wellpaced movie solid central showing wahlberg and energetic live performances oh yeah and for those who dig the heavier side of music the soundtrack also rocks you see dreams can come true where is joblo coming from almost famous blow boogie nights detroit rock city girlfight goodfellas

carry on matron is the last great carryon in my opinion made in it still features most of the regulars of this genre sid james plays the head of gang of crooks intent on stealing contraceptive pills from the local maternity hospital and selling them off make profit kenneth williams is sir bernard cutting head of the hospital but also hypochondriac hattie jacques retakes her role as matron and charles hawtrey is the psychiatrist dr goode the jokes come in fast and so do the laughs humorous antics between the matron and sir bernard this time williams is after matron jacques when he needs prove himself that he is man after visiting dr goode the doctor hawtrey is sworn secrecy assure you that anything you say me today will go in one ear and straight out of the other bernard thinks he is having sex change and needs prove himself there are great cameos from joan sims an expectant mother who is many weeks overdue and is eating constantly in every scene and from kenneth connor as the expectant father who still thinks he is at work at the railway station sid james gang including cyril his son kenneth cope try find out where the pills are getting cyril dress up as nurse and live in at the nurses home he has share room nurse ball barbara windsor and she soon sees through him the ends the attempted robbery of the hospitals pills panic ensuing there are good performances hattie jacques as the matron however her character seems little more subdued and quieter than her previous matrons williams is as usual on top form but sid james is not given very good part in this movie and would forgive anyone forget that he was in the movie at all the same does not go for charles hawtrey for although he only first appears in the movie after minutes gone and has scarce screen time he seems steal every scene he is in not making use of sid james and barbara windsors talent full effect the seems flounder but it certainly makes up for it it is good storyline and it is other appealing characters this is genuinely funny and could watch it again and again and not get bored

the ultimate match up between good and evil the untouchables is an excellent movie because it looks deeper into an already examined rivalry based on the television show of the same title the untouchables may be an exaggeration of the real life events that took place but it fits together perfectly some beautifully filmed action sequences some excellent acting memorable score and clever script the takes place in chicago during the prohibition era where mobsters led the ruthless al capone run an underground market of liquor the demanding public elliot ness and small force of men known as the untouchables attempt the impossible trying stop capone and trying maintain peace and order however as ness soon learns in order stabilize peace you have bend few laws the fact that capone is evil is very apparent from the first few scenes the begins capone played perfectly deniro declaring that he is not violent man and he is firm believer in following all laws the then quickly transfers the next scene in one of capones men bombs restaurant that contains many innocent people including little girl from this point we know capone is evil not only because he kills without hesitation but also because he is lying bastard right from the first five minutes of the de palma has created hatred towards capone and he shows that this man must be brought down at all costs this developed hatred is before the films hero ness is even introduced found this approach be very clever because in small duration of time there is great amount of admiration for ness and an equal amount of hatred for capone the only gets better from this point the formation of the untouchables there is group of men wearing long dark overcoats and hats they walk in unison and they only look forward as they walk down the streets they are observed and feared citizens holding shot guns and pistols in their hands stop criminals this image of vigilantes must have influenced future films one that comes mind is the matrix when neo morpheus trinity and the rest of the gang first come into the virtual world wearing more futuristic outfits of the same style the similarities between these two are countless the untouchables has some of the hippest bravest heroes in any action the four members were the only ones willing go against capones army each member of this special group also had their own characteristics that separated them from others elliot ness played perfect ingenuity kevin costner is character that surely grows during the course of the he begins as man who is determined follow all laws no matter how unfair they may be however as the develops so does ness his beliefs involving the law are shattered when he realizes that those he trusted are actually members of the other side he also begins lose his stability when his adversaries begin murder his friends his anger becomes so thunderous that he can no longer hold it in sean connery who won an academy award for best supporting actor in his role plays malone an aging cop who decides make one final run as member of the untouchables malone acts as mentor ness he teaches him the chicago way do things when they attack knife you attack gun connery plays his character the exact amount of wit and experience needed andy garcia does wonderful job as george stone young man who is just becoming police officer as ness grows he begins teach stone some valuable lessons that malone once taught him charles martin smith is also fantastic as the final member who attempts use an income tax offense against capone smith is perfect for his role as he adds some valuable comic relief the the action scenes are also some of the most beautifully choreographed have ever seen also very similar the matrix they are exciting and intense from westernlike battle the famous confrontation at the train station steps the scenes are well thought out and well executed the score during these scenes ingeniously adds the excitement its pounding drum beats act as rhythm for the actors the combination of image and music is very impressive and also very effective although the real life untouchables may have been excessively glorified this is pure entertainment and contains unique blend of great acting great directing and great action some scenes capone and the baseball bat the train station have stuck in my mind for years and seeing them again will only make them more vivid

having not seen who framed roger rabbit in over years and not remembering much besides that liked it then decided rent it recently watching it was struck just how brilliant it is aside from the fact that it is milestone in animation in movies it is the first combine real actors and cartoon characters have them interact and make it convincingly real and great entertainment it is also quite an effective comedymystery while the plot may be somewhat familiar the characters are original especially baby herman and watching them together is lot of fun the story begins in in cartoon star roger rabbit is blowing takes and having trouble keeping his mind on work so hardboiled private detective eddie valiant bob hoskins is called in studio head k maroon alan tilvern try help get rogers mind back on work maroon thinks that rogers wife jessicas possible unfaithfulness him might be the cause of distraction and tells eddie get some photos of her in the act before it costs him any more money in reshoots valiant takes some photos of jessica playing patty cake marvin acme stubby kaye the owner of toontown where all of the cartoon characters live and takes them maroon upon seeing them roger is emotionally destroyed and soon after acme is found dead and roger rabbit is the prime suspect the rest of the movie follows valiant and roger as they run around town and eventually toontown trying clear rogers good name along the way they meet judge doom christopher lloyd judgejuryand executioner type who is out get roger and has discovered the one and only way kill toon who framed roger rabbit won academy awards including special achievement award for richard williams for animation direction and creation of the cartoon characters williams and his teams went through the frame frame and hand drew the cartoon characters in director robert zemekis must be given an equal amount of praise for overseeing the entire production included hundreds of animators also bob hoskins performance should be credited he in addition the rest of the human cast finds the right note play in all of the scenes his cartoon costars according the internet movie database hoskins studied his young daughter learn how act imaginary characters and guess his hard work paid off who framed roger rabbit is rare one that not only presented great challenge the filmmakers but one that can be enjoyed the whole family although some very young viewers may be little scared judge doom do yourself favor and rent it ppppplease

there is something about ben stiller that makes him popular choice among casting directors these days stiller currently has three projects in circulation and what other actor can lay claim that he is in there is something about mary still have not seen and he is in the acerbic your friends neighbors playing talkative sexuallyfrustrated drama coach called jerri now there is permanent midnight in stiller plays another jerry this one heroinaddicted television writer last name stahl there is also something about this industry that pushes bankable stars like stiller into doing drugaddiction pictures the minute they have proved themselves commercially ewan mcgregor springs mind who after successful turns in emma and brassed off received greater respect and admiration for his mindblowing realization as renton in danny boyles transatlantic junkfest trainspotting the philosophy appears be simple one if you want em be taken seriously make em do drugs permanent midnight is based on the true life experiences of jerry stahl successful writer who in the mideighties had aweek job churning out plotlines for disposable tv sitcoms and aweek heroin habit habit in stahls own words the size of utah as stahl stiller contributes commanding performance unlike trainspotting was successful in having it both ways chronicling both the highs and the lows of heroin abuse permanent midnight instead focuses on the concept of drug addiction as maintenance one of the earliest observations in the is casual reference naked lunch author william burroughs who when asked why he shoots up first thing in the morning responds so can shave stahl rarely appears be puncturing veins for the thrill of it all in permanent midnight it is so he can talk his mother on the phone show up for work on time even pay his bills while the itself occasionally wobbles around along stahl the writing adapted from stahls autobiography director david veloz is controlled and pointed permanent midnight shows how stahl moved from new york a toagain in the authors words escape the drug scene yeah right why he entered into convenient marriage british tv exec elizabeth hurley so impossibly polite you would swear her single profanity was dubbed and that he conceived child in between his random hirings and firings stahl narrates all this in motel bedroom sympathetic lover called kitty norristowns own maria bello whom he spent some rehab time janeane garofalo is wastedand miscastas heavilybespectacled talent agent who fails get her hooks into the dopedup wordsmith and that is stahl himself playing jaded clinic counselor stiller unshaven burroughs take note and lots of mascara around the eyes has stahl stumble through the looking like train wreck but his credit never once pushes his pillpopping needlejabbing performance over the top the ubiquitous stiller is the reason see permanent midnight dark comic and strangely absorbing study of assisted living

phil curtolo mel gibson braveheart gave gripping performance as the father of young kidnapped boy in ron howards ransom gibson plays tom mullen wealthy business tycoon whose past actions are coming back haunt him as deranged psychopath played gary sinise forrest gump and his band of lowlife thugs kidnap his only son for million tom and his wife kate played rene russo tin cup were instructed not inform the police but they contacted the fbi minutes later an elite team of agents led delroy lindo broken arrow are in toms house and wiring every phone the plot sounds average just like most other kidnap movies that you have already seen and it was nothing more than that that is until about halfway through the movie suddenly tom goes the fox news room and makes live broadcast saying this is your ransom but this is as close as you will ever get it instead am offering this money as reward on your head dead or alive at this point the plot thickened and the unusually slow start of the turned into suspensefilled action great stunts the last half of the is very well done another thing that carries this are the superb performances gibson and sinise as they collide in game of wits over their cellular phones for most of the movie owen gleiberman of entertainment weekly commented on the subject it makes you wonder what kidnappers did before cell phones before this movie sinise played mostly good guys first in of mice men then in forrest gump and most recently in apollo but he was surprisingly devilish and cold in his portrayal of copgonebad gibson of course was just being gibson in an oscarworthy performance although most of the scenes were quite predictable ransom is very entertaining and suspenseful

one can not observe star trek movie and expect see serious science fiction the purpose of star trek is provide flashy innocent fun sometimes the stories are compelling sometimes they are not but the exception of the first in the series provides little more than endless shots of amazed faces have never been bored any of the enterprises numerous missions star trek insurrection is no exception the has gotten some negative reviews friend of mine actually thinks it is the worst in the series but am not really sure why it is an exciting often hilarious movie that engaged me and left me ready for the next star trek some say it is bit too light and more of long episode than others say the special effects are cheesy and that it is boring simply enjoyed the insurrection is the second feature strictly the next generation cast introduces us race of people called the baku the baku are very old most of them are about three hundred years old but they actually appear younger age due strange radiation in the rings of their planet of course these peaceful people cannot horde this fountain of youth all for themselves leave it up their archenemies the sona led ruafo murray abraham mess everything up the sona who are horribly disfigured and rely on daily reconstructive surgery be aesthetically acceptable strike deal the federation move the baku elsewhere and exploit the secret keep their race from dying that is when captain picard patrick stewart steps in he realizes that moving the baku would kill them it also helps that he falls in love baku woman donna murphy so his trusty crew picard defies the federation keep the baku in their natural habitat when dealing series as much history as this it is not entirely necessary reintroduce your characters each episode this is why believe nonfans have hard time getting into star trek in order enjoy it one has understand how approach it insurrection however does surprisingly good job of us new aspects of the characters stewart is bold as always magnetic screen presence and perfectly capable of holding an entire together jonathan frakes who also directed is funny as commander riker subplot data brent spiner discovering his lost childhood is fairly interesting and abraham makes perfect star trek villain overacting like crazy frakes showed similar aptitude for direction in first contact insurrection is an exciting some really attractive special effects and lot of good action this is apparently the first star trek utilize computer animation and the result is very pleasing the eye particularly in the climactic scenes in the sona employ giant space ship suck up the rings of the baku planet the special effects have clean impressively sharp look if have any complaint about the it is that it tries take moral stance when it is not very appropriate do so do not think it is that big of deal that the federation wanted move baku in order save the lives of thousands better yet why could not they have coexisted insurrection feels little light spring these kinds of big moral questions on the audience it is inherent camp factor the star trek series does not seem wellequipped deal issues like this prefer just enjoy the spectacle

a fully loaded entertainment review website coming in july from ace ventura truman burbank jim carrey has run the whole gamut of comic yet sympathetic characters the cable guy was supposed be his big breakthrough role from zany humor into darker more dramatic acting as most everyone knows the results were well lessthanstellar not only did the not do so hot at the box office but it was also panned critics as far as know gene siskel and are the only ones willing admit that we dug it the first time saw the cable guy in theatres was in super criticmode and did not really like it however due the fact that hbo shows the movie every single day have had time lean back relax and take in the and my surprise it grew on me the plot is rather simple broderick plays guy named steven who befriends his cable guy played carrey then is stalked him when steven tries break off the relationship see stevens been having some problems his girlfriend robin leslie mann and he does not think he has any more room in his life for new friend also some of the cable guys antics have been creeping him out carrey as the cable guy gives steven various aliases later we find out are all tv characters larry tate chip douglas ricky ricardo etc he apparently lives in his cable van and while many critics did not enjoy this newer darker lessmanic performance from carrey thought it was interesting and rather welldone for me its not the movie as whole that is enjoyable but rather several individual scenes karaoke jam at stevens apartment medieval fight at theme restaurant and bathroom beating la liar liar just name few perhaps the fact that more of carreys humorous side comes out during these scenes is what makes them so funny and if you really want see something you have got hear his version of jefferson airplanes somebody love sung at the aformentioned karaoke jam the cable guy has its bad spots like most any movie did not particularly like stevens girlfriend and felt that more focus should have been used on the relationship between steven and his best friend also the ending while having you fooled for moment is rather contrived and somewhat dissapointing still found the cable guy be worthwhile venture if you are at the video store and cannot think of anything rent suggest you try it out or if you have hbo just wait till it comes on you will not have wait long hell that is what do every day

when bulworth ended allowed myself sigh of relief it is possible for me enjoy political satire there have been several recent political films that did not do whole lot for me wag the dog for instance found be an intelligent but heartless while primary colors is unbearable and unwatchable in its awfulness bulworth is far better than these both in its execution and lasting impression it is
