tremendously funny and intelligent picture but it also has an emotional center writerdirectorstar warren beatty allows the audience identify his character and in turn we like him and actually care about the story beatty plays incumbent democratic senator jay billington bulworth the opens and we see bulworth sobbing as he watches his television spots over and over again he has not slept in days nor has he eaten and almost instantaneously he goes insane he is not stark raving mad not outright anyway but he is definitely bonkers it is the final weekend of his campaign and his assistant murphy oliver platt has written him speech feed group of black people in church in the ghetto bulworth begins the speech but suddenly goes off track and just starts being honest you mean one lady asks the democratic party does not care about the african american community well he shouts laughing is not that obvious the story is propelled device in bulworth puts out contract on his own life he muses later that it is bad thing make decisions when you are suicidal he keeps seeing man in sunglasses graham beckel whom he believes be the hitman bulworth also meets nina halle berry whom he becomes infatuated suddenly in the short span of this weekend bulworths nononsense truth in politics methods become national sensation and he shoots ahead in the polls despite the fact that he is appearing on television wearing gang clothes and spewing more profanity than coherent sentences beattys work on both sides of the camera is excellent his script and direction are both extremely sharp as is the surprisingly strong characterization of bulworth himself here is man who is reached his limit and his way of lashing back is screwing over the entire political structure like that the does not take clear shot at any of the political parties or affiliations but at politics in general and how everything is run the rich although the antirich sentiments do get bit tiresome the end of the some of the segments are simply hilarious such as lengthy rap that he delivers at luncheon dedicated him much of the is completely absurd but that is the fun part about it it is an angry serious at the core but the package that beatty has created is so much more accessible than recent attempts in the genre what adds this feeling is beattys portrayal of bulworth this is performance that deserves recognition on higher scale beatty is so much fun watch here he is always funny but he is also subtle in ways that flesh out his character without dialogue or hugely noticeable actions beatty is so good that bulworth despite his shortcomings as human being is an entirely sympathetic and likable character almost from the beginning the supporting cast is vast and colorful berry is luminous as always and adds her repertoire of solid supporting roles don cheadle has good role as drug dealer who uses guntoting toddlers do his dirty work oliver platt is an actor who should be careful for someday fear he may induce heart attack the intensity of his acting though he is very funny watch paul sorvino adds the southern accent his list of mastered inflections is bulworth offensive suppose some may see it that way was not offended the but then again hardly care about politics think that people who find this offensive will just be blindsided the honesty of the story the is not perfect of course the ending did not quite work for me and the few of the scenes between bulworth and nina feel forced although the eclectic dance sequence is fantastic but these are minor quibbles about an otherwise brilliant bulworth is smart uproariously funny picture that proves me that political satire can scratch far deeper than the surface

call for the cliche police if you must but the eyes are the window the soul the finest actors working in films are those who can command the screen gaze paul newman ralph fiennes anthony hopkins morgan freeman you look at these men on screen and you can tell without them saying word that there is something going on in their minds that the characters they play are real human beings we will never have chance discover if tupac shakur could have been great actor but he had that unique quality in his eyes in gridlockd an oddly effective combination of gritty drama and social satire shakur and his costar tim roth take sketchy characters and make them exciting watch through the pure energy of their talent and chemistry shakur and roth play ezekiel spoon whitmore and alexander stretch rome two detroit buddies who share spoken wordjazz trio an apartment and drug addiction cookie thandie newton when new years eve party ends cookie comatose after drug overdose spoon and stretch begin wonder if they are living on borrowed time they soon make new years resolution get into rehab but that proves be easier said than done as though the temptation fix were not hindrance enough spoon and stretch also find their attempts get clean hitting road block of bureaucracy confusion and red tape the government might be the least of their obstacles however as they find themselves suspects in the murder of drug dealer and on the run from nasty thug vondie curtis hall in order for you buy into gridlockd at all you have accept it as surreal odyssey rather than as urban realism unless spoon and stretch sleep through an entire day at the hospital after bringing in cookie they are going government offices on new years day in case they should be thankful they get any help at all gridlockd may actually be response the fatuous social commentary of another urban odyssey falling down found besieged middle class white male venting his righteous anger against the system during trek through inner city los angeles in falling down michael douglas dfens the characters personalized license plate echoed in gridlockd the drug lord drepers plates whips out gun because he cannot get breakfast at mcdonalds in gridlockd spoon and stretch are unarmed against the demands placed on them before they can get into rehab center and where the unhinged dfens became heroic surrogate for audiences writerdirector vondie curtis hall refuses let spoon and stretch off the hook for their own part in the situation one bureaucrat responds tirade from stretch the question do you expect the world stop just because you picked _today_ clean up the world in gridlockd is just as frustrating as the world in falling down but the cathartic moments yield no easy answers this time hall has some interesting things say about what we expect from the system but perhaps not enough of them significant chunk of gridlockd is devoted spoon and stretchs flight from dreper and from the police and those subplots serve up some thoroughly predictable moments in one scene stretch scares off dreper getting chummy police officer another presents that old chestnut of the two mistakenlysuspected heroes in public place watching television news report of the crime shows their pictures the entire sequence of events seems designed merely as an excuse get spoon and stretch running while the other primary plot has them standing in line or sitting down much of the time hall also plays gratuitous inserts of drug paraphernalia and flashbacks the day before the films main events perhaps making particular effort point out the talent the characters are wasting through selfdestructive behavior oh the irony of it tupac shakur made career in music and movies playing the hard case and living the life back it up in gridlockd shakur gets the chance play someone who has seen enough of the way his life could go know that it scares him spoon is an idea for character at best as written hall but shakur displays an intelligence and survival instinct struggle his addiction mostly it comes through those eyes eyes none of the hardness you might expect from the infamous gangsta it is spoon who plays conscience stretchs pure appetite and roth plays stretch gleeful selfdestructiveness he reveals that he is hiv positive even as he is preparing shoot up again is as much an obstacle spoons goal as any agency or enemy gridlockds most cruelly comic scene finds stretch helping spoon get into an emergency room repeatedly stabbing him tiny pocket knife and it becomes an appropriate symbol for how the company he keeps has slowly drained the life out of him friends like that spoon does not need enemies and shakur looks at stretch the tired eyes of man who has seen too much the tragedy now is that we will not get more chances see those eyes again

hilarious ultralow budget comedy from school dropout kevin smith chronicles day in the life of two convenience store slackers brian ohalloran and jeff anderson they spend most of their day ignoring customers while discussing everything from fellatio selffulfillment the premise is strictly sitcom and the photography is grainy as all getout but you could spend ten times the films budget reported and still not get dialogue half as good as this originally rated nc for language not recommended for viewers sensitive ears killing zoe remake reservoir dogs as french art and you are halfway killing zoe writerdirector roger avarys slowmoving story of failed bastille day bank robbery eric stoltz stars as an american in paris who gets in way over his head when hooks up band of nihilistic bank robbers he is the safecracker who is blissful unaware that the bank job is botch job from the word go though intriguing on all fronts the is paced at half the speed of pulp fiction avary cowrote quentin tarantino in english and french the road wellville based on the novel coraghessan boyle the road wellville does not go very far bowels bowels and more bowels are explored dr john harvey kellogg bucktoothed and bespectacled anthony hopkins who in the early advocated abstinence vegetarianism and frequent defecation he also invented the cornflake really checkingin kelloggs battle creek sanitarium are matthew broderick and bridget fonda just two of the many wellknown faces in this failed comedy leave your laughter at the door and you can marvel at the unfunny antics of john cusack michael lerner lara flynn boyle john neville and dana carvey the art direction is impeccable and some of the early sequences are amusing but the novelty quickly wears off as writerdirector alan parkers tries his darnedness turn doodoo into drama what he ends up is something that cannot print here phew stargate lawrence of arabia meets star wars this epic scifi is more sheer spectacle than anything else director roland emmerich universal solider shamelessly rips off lucas and spielberg and just about any other cosmic cliche that he can lay his hands on the is overlong the characters are cardboard and the script is filled some of the most laughable details in modern scifi history that said there is still plenty watch here scifi fans should enjoy the sculpted sands the morphing headdresses and surprisingly spunky james spader he plays the egyptologist who gets prove his theory that that somebody else built the pyramids less interesting are costars kurt russell and jaye davidson of crying game fame star trek generations trek fans may be more forgiving but for the rest of us the sluggish star trek generations is mixed bag at best the story is interesting but each scene goes too long the cast is earnest but the direction lacks punch and so on the best example of the latter is klingon comeuppance that delivers none of the impact of similar scene in star trek ii original enterprise captain james kirk appears on both ends of the story though they cut the scene where shatner turns the screen plead get life remarkably unremarkable miracle on th street in season of the specialist and pulp fiction et al maybe remake of miracle on th street is necessary john hughes certainly believes in santa claus and his les mayfielddirected production does nothing tarnish the memory of the original the romance between costars dylan mcdermott and elizabeth perkins does not work too well but the makes strong case that richard attenborough is the definitive kriss kringle his chemistry children can moisten any eye no claus for alarm junior arnold schwarzenegger pregnant sure billy crystal did it before in rabbit test but the sight of schwarz bulging belly is casting coup comparable dustin hoffman in tootsie what should be nothing more than onejoke premise actually gets better as it goes along director ivan reitman dave twins wisely keeps the farce minimum so the first hour moves slower than you might expect do not expect too many yuks from danny devito but you cannot beat those early romantic scenes between emma and arnie how is that for collision of acting styles

for those of us who were not yet born when the rock rolled around monterey pop affords an affectionate glimpse of the music that influenced our parents be hippies from otis redding jimi hendrix janis joplin the mamas and the papas and jefferson airplane the who this documentary is jampacked contagious energy but give fair warning that will reveal the ending does not do the rest of the the justice it deserves shot in at an outdoor concert that precluded woodstock the defies the stereotype of the general population at the time sure some have painted their faces and smoke joints but a pennebaker the war room moon over broadway surprisingly chooses show broad spectrum of the audience no matter who is watching it all comes back the talented musicians that stir your soul the excitement starts before the music even begins young girl is cleaning thousands of seats and when asked why an interviewer she replies that she feels lucky do so there are moments of organized craziness as john phillips leader of the mamas and the papas and one of the concert organizers tries get in touch dionne warwick and when one band is tuning up member remarks finally decent sound system you can tell just watching these first few moments that this show is not about vanity it is about playing the music you love those who have an appreciation for it twoway street this interaction between audience and performer continues throughout the and becomes infectious the audience it is impossible tear your eyes away from janis joplin as she belts out her ballad about love being ball and chain and while the lyrics wild thing may not be all that complicated watching jimi hendrix mime having sex his guitar is as captivating as otis redding singing about love even if you do not recognize every band you see on stage you can imagine being as enthralled their work as the public sitting in those seats the only drawback the is the ending unfortunately must reveal all the other bands big names then and still today got approximately minutes of screen time in contrast the last band on camera wholly forgettable one gets an entire minutes of screen time for that is only minutes long that is too large of chunk especially when previous acts are much more stimulating all in all monterey pop is precious rare look at time period that still holds sway over us the variety of music as well as the beautifully shot performances are easy become immersed in if there was ever any question as why most of these bands were so popular this is quickly dispelled it is almost depressing think that music this moving does not get made much anymore instead we are stuck nsync the backstreet boys and jennifer lopez all of whom should have stuck modeling

the most common and in many cases the only complaint against francis ford coppolas masterpiece the godfather is glamorising of mafia is presented as an institution guided ancient tradition and virtues like honour loyalty and solidarity more suitable for some gentler kinder ages martin scorsese another italoamerican moviemaker confronted that perspective his own more downtoearth vision of mafia in mean streets movie that dealt lower echelons of organised crime unfortunately for scorsese his was unspectacular and too artsy compete coppolas influence on mafia portrayals in the movies seventeen years later scorsese returned mean streets of new york another that dealt darker side of american organised crime this was goodfellas epic black comedy is today considered as one of the best and most influential films of goodfellas owes some of its initial success and popularity the fact that it was based on the true story told in bestseller book wiseguy nicholas pileggi who would cowrite the screenplay for the the book as well as the chronicled thirty years in the life of henry hill played ray liotta irishitalian criminal from new york at the age of he gets recruited in the criminal organisation of paulie cicero played paul sorvino local mob boss and gradually climbs up the ladder starting small errands after couple of years together his best childhood friend tommy de vito played joe pesci he joins the crew of expert thieves led jimmy conway played robert de niro three of them spend years as best friends and associates gathering enormous wealth from their criminal enterprises that would culminate one of the most spectacular robberies in american history wealth influence and privileges of men connected mafia are enough for henry hill seduce his future wife karen played lorraine bracco who would afterwards remain loyal her husband despite infidelities domestic abuse arrests and would even be accomplice his own private drug dealing business but the perfect world of wiseguys gradually begins fall apart tommys unpredictable outbursts of homicidal violence jimmys reluctance share his part of the loot partners and finally henrys own drug habit would lead his downfall and make him question his loyalty the friends goodfellas is an excellent example of that represents work of genius in his full glory scorsese managed create vision is effective and complete despite being full of contradictions that would ripped the apart in the hands of less talented filmmaker world depicted in this is both ordinary and fascinating scorsese spares no effort show us all the violence hypocrisy and inherent paranoia of organised crime yet it manages make it both seductive and funny after being exposed two and half hours of the and three decades of criminal history based on some notorious real life events the audience understands why the characters chose such dangerous life paths trading the superficial and shortlasting glamour and prosperity of criminal the dullness and poverty of honest citizens scorsese also manages break viewers moralistic inhibitions showing truly revolting material scenes that depict personal tragedies broken homes human depravity violence bloodshed and murder in all their uncompromising reality but in manner that would make it amusing and funny the audience the use of ironic soundtrack manipulative shots characters dialogue or narrators commentary goodfellas represents the new standards of black humour that would became very popular few years later during tarantino era even if we do not pay attention skills potentially disturbing material becomes eye pleasing and entertaining we should admit that scorsese displays his talents of truly original and creative filmmaker first we might notice unusual structure of the plot relatively minor subplot is used as movies ironic prologue then instead of single narrator scorsese switches the second character as narrator in the middle of the only switch back the original shortly afterwards this multiple points of views both in terms of narration and various subjective shots only lengthens the ironic distance towards characters and their situation same ironic distance comes extremely effective choice of soundtrack nostalgia for good old times is illustrated easylistening pop songs while depression paranoia and bad times find their expression in more neurotic rock songs of late and but the soundtrack is most effective when it is used as ironic comment almost pastoral easy listening tunes make strong and very ironic contrast the scenes of violence and bloodshed however thing most associated this is couple of continuos shots that feature characters moving through large rooms and interacting dozens if not hundreds of people such scenes although they require very great skill and patience during their shootings became very popular among other directors in fragmentary character of the screenplay does not have straight plot and instead bases on series of loosely connected vignettes gives another interesting opportunity for scorsese he uses this structure of experiment and most successful of such experiments is hilarious day in life segment near the end of the another essential element of goodfellas is large but superb collection of great acting talents the most respectable among them is robert de niro but his character who happen be most quiet and businesslike member of criminal trio gets overshadowed two of his friends and colleagues joe pesci deserved his oscar for supporting role of homicidal psychopath tommy and his lines including adlibs probably represent the most memorable element of the ray liotta although equally talented perhaps does not look as the best choice for narrator and nominal hero of the liottas henry hill looks somewhat too hollywoodised and glamorous among this bunch of lowlevel street thugs liotta on the other hand improves general impression very realistic and menacing portrayal of drug addiction lorraine bracco is on the other hand very effective and believable as karen hill wife who gradually descends into same moral cesspool as her husband paul sorvino is also very effective as patriarch mafioso and among the supporting cast most memorable is chuck low as pestering smalltime gangster who unknowingly digs his own grave as combination of clever sociological study black humour and innovative filmmaking goodfellas became something only the truly great films could do work of art and excellent popular entertainment in the same time because of this achievement and also because of the great influence on future filmmakers this cinematic gem deserves its rightful place among the best films of

the blair witch project was perhaps one of kind unique that played completely on its own merit managing scare even the most experienced horror fans out of their senses its success made sequel inevitable but this is not the sequel suspect anyone much wanted after the release of the blair witch project tourists have practically invaded the small town of burkettsville in order get glimpse of the blair witch locals have turned this mass hysteria into great business opportunity selling twigsculptures stones and dirt like those in the movie and the exasperated local sheriff patrols the woods bullhorn shouting get out of these woods and go home there is no goddamned blair witch jeff is one of those people who has used the sudden popularity of the small town his advantage after he got released from the mental institution he created mobile business that attracts thousands of customers through the internet as the movie starts he is leading one of these groups into the woods on the blair witch hunt among the five strangers is stephen and his girlfriend the pregnant tristen who are writing book on the hysteria caused the called the blair witch history or hysteria and kim who dresses in black and has some psychic powers the last member of the crew is erica young beautiful witchwannabe who constantly quotes from the wiccan lore saying the first rule of wicca is do no harm because whatever you do will come back you threefold this strange group plunges into the woods where they begin argue about their different approaches the experience on the very first night that they decide spend under the stars amidst the ruins of parrs abandoned house strange things start happening when they wake up their equipment is gone and only the tapes remain after while they discover strange markings on their bodies they are somehow lost in time as it loops uncontrollably back and forth they are all haunted hallucinations and horrible nightmares and soon they can not see the difference between dreams and reality the only thing that they are sure of is that they have brought something or someone them from the woods documentary director joe berlinger paradice lost helms blair witch leaving the creators of the first dan myrick and ed sanches in the background the opening scenesthe documentary showing the townspeople affected the first is more promising approach because instead of trying cover similar ground it goes outside the first and makes its own stand but soon the movie gets confused and sidetracked its own story that is never resolved and ends very anticlimaxic epilogue in way this is typical sequel more money has been spent and more people have worked on project that was doomed fail the horror and suspense of the original simply could not be repeated of course in these situations quantity is more important than quality and profit is more important than the artistical values from its opening scenes when the camera gracefully panes over the bloodyred forest carter burwells being john malkovich and fargo musical score in the background you realize that the exception of its title this has absolutely nothing do the blair witch project blair witch was filmed handheld videocameras and nfeatured acting that was mostly based on improvisation in the sequel the technical aspect of the is close perfection creating completely different atmosphere its graceful cinematography production design and flashy editing the has very polished look is impossible associate the first installment and though berlinger directs his an energy and pace that makes the adrenaline rush through the body couple of times he has obviously misunderstood the nature of his predecessor the key is simplicity blair witch project had story was incredibly simple that allowed the audience fill the gaps our own imagination the was practically an empty screen on we projected our most frightening nightmares the effect was incredibly powerful lasting and entir everyone but in different way book of shadows feels incredibly controlled and restrict here very little is left our imagination and the story is so complex and clever that the screenwriters are the first get lost in it there is is no book of shadows and no conclusion that we can be satisfied this is simply less artistic that does not have the talent and originality of its predecessor it resorts fancy cinematography and special effects create the right effect and does not always succeed but most importantly it stands on its own ground and has almost no connection the first movie does not allow it destroy the original in the end cannot call it bad effort it is less artistic not so scary and less original but certainly not bad it is simply different in fact if you have not seen the blair witch project you might like this for what it is cross between the blair witch project and the scream films the only element that remains constant and similar between the two films is the solid acting jeffrey donovan and tristine skyler should be mentioned and incredible sense of surrealism but it is common knowledge and experience that few exceptions every movie sequel is worse than the original and some are even not worth making me the story of the blair witch project seemed completed but there are obviously no limits commercial success that the book of shadows is certainly assured and it is already time look forward blair witch

seen may on home video rented one of the best things about the movies is that they can make you really start wonder and analyze things in your own everyday life that you might not have thought much of otherwise some films it might be just secondary issue but dark city what we get is nearly an entire committed philosophizing and theorizing about human memory and how it defines who we are is poignant theme made through an absolutely beautifullyconstructed the kind of story and setting that could only happen in movie there is an old roleplaying computer game called d ja wherein the player takes on the role of man who cannot remember who he is where he is and how he got there the goal is gather as many clues as possible figure that out and along the way overcome conflict the premise this is not unlike that game only this time we do not have control over the protagonist we begin meeting seemingly ordinary man living in an extremely dark and dirty city actually it is more than just the city it is the whole reality that is not just that neogothic look la batman blade runner but is so fully developed it is almost different genre completely later he will learn that his name is john murdoch sewell but for now he has no idea what is going on other than the fact something is not right the fact there is dead body in the corner goes enhance the feeling of paranoia and mysterious hurried call telling him leave immediately is also very chilling this opening scene alone goes long way define the setting of the and its bizarre horrific tone the man does not know who he is nor where he is going and it is interesting follow him since we the viewers have no idea either we can sympathize and identify him in fact this is the way all stories begin since it is impossible know the history of character their feelings values morals etc until after we have observed them for while but in this case the total feeling of amnesia is an excellent tool towards characterization developing the mood and outlining the story eventually some semblance of plot begins unfold as it appears that john is serial killer wanted the police we met inspector frank bumstead hurt quiet unemotional softspoken deadpan man who appears have been on the trail of the killer for some time two other important characters are also introduced dr daniel schreber sutherland neurotic psychiatrist who claims be johns doctor and emma murdoch connelly jazz singer dolled up look like caraciture right out of the old dick tracy serials or any given leading lady of the old filmnoir movies it was schreber who contacted john for reasons that are continually revealed throughout the course of the he also contacts emma further helps the reveal what is seemingly complex mysterious back story but absolutely nothing is as it appears be in dark city is what makes it so fascinating throughout its continual scenes of confusion and vertigo everything the filmmakers want us see has some significance considering how intricate the detail is every single shot its lighting art direction and overall production design they do not seem be able afford any gratuities however that might also be what is keeping it from reaching its maximum potential continuing follow john as he wanders around this strange place so much unlike the real world we know we come realize that it is all hoax everyone in the city is the subject of an experiment being conducted race of aliens understand what makes humans tick in their efforts somehow save themselves from extinction but as the films tagline says last night one of us went off for reasons that are never clearly explained it appears that john possesses telekinetic powers can do pretty much whatever his mind can conceive process known as tuning the aliens look like very old bald human men pasty skin also possess the power en masse and use it change the city every night at midnight at the same time all the humans fall asleep and after the changes are made they awake and either continue where they left off or begin new life they have no idea they did not have until then this premise certainly is interesting and director and coscreenwriter alex proyas is able keep the consistently mysterious in this regard he does provide some explanations such as that dr schreber is an assistant the strangers because he somehow could synthesize memory into chemical form the aliens mix and match the memories of the citys population see who will change and who will not in the process this creates for good deal of deep thoughtprovoking philosophies that could be applied the real world however where the errs is not playing up the idea of memory versus the human heart as what makes person who he or she is the main characters are all closely intertwined within the seemingly complex murder mystery never actually happened yet when they start go through some of the expected emotions it comes off as distant static and cold mediocre performances hurt and connelly do not help either for example john realizes emma is not and probably never was his wife so he does not feel an emotional bond her yet in some scenes crucial the films plot we are expected believe they do have genuine love for each other is also part of the films climax and ending and that is what proyas seems be inferring the but never quite manages convey in its fullest sense ironically this is what made his first the crow work so well had similar theme of struggling find hope and the human spirit within nearly identical dark twisted world dark city the messenger seems be mistaken for the message still the is no means bad and is consistently entertaining and enjoyable there is lot like here most notably the sheer visual look and style of it all accounts for at least half the reasons the is able tell the story it does the story as whole is one of the most original come out of in years dark city is what the movies are all about the escape from the real world

linda fiorentino disappeared off the radar after deservedly heralded turn in the cable pic the last seduction and her being cast as dogmas lead is nothing short of inexplicable she is still in fine form as bethany an abortion clinic worker who is lost her faith one night visitor from heaven makes fiery entrance in bethanys bedroom he is metatron alan rickman the voice of god and he needs her help she must stop two fallen angels from entering new jersey churchthe fate of the universe depends on it god would do it himherself but heshe is missing having taken up human form somewhere on earth never be heard from again bethany is joined on her road trip the garden state the prophets jay jason mewes and silent bob kevin smith doing doubleduty the slacker minstrels who have appeared in all of smiths films thus far at some point rock drops naked out of the sky as rufus the undocumented and very black thirteenth apostle and offers his assistance as does divine stripper serendipity salma hayek it is wild ride they are in pursuit of loki and bartleby damon and affleck respectivelythis is probably the sharpest either has ever been who were banished from heaven wisconsin and have discovered dogmatic loophole that will enable their return loki decides wreak havoc along the way the knowledge that his sins will be absolved at the pearly gates at one point he terrorizes boardroom full of suits an angry combination of words and bullets it is nasty guiltily enjoyable little scene that asks how corrupt are you wings of desire this as not since debuting clerks smith has grown as director particularly in terms of working actors chris rock is this films only weak linkbetween jokes he is wooden his nofrills visual style has not changed much over the years though dogmas widescreen compositions at least have blockbuster affectations nor has his writinghis characters still sit around delivering one caustic hilarious speech after another dogma chips away at big religious issuesnamely the hypocrisy that accompanies any organized system of beliefseloquently and articulately but few of the monologues sound too much like blatant exposition as well the verbal introduction of each new person seems take forever any movie this much weighty talk would have hard time maintaining momentum hurlyburly anyone and eventually dogmas pacing goes slack long diatribe from bartleby late in the game in he laments the destiny of celestial beings comes at point when we have heard enough because his change of heart bartleby is initially the good cop lokis bad drives the climax said rant is given great deal of screen time sure affleck deserved big moment damon steals their scenes together prior but it ultimately makes the and us feel bloated like tarantino smith was videoage sponge who became samplemad indie filmmaker dogma pays welcome homage an eclectic batch of movies including indiana jones and the last crusade silent bob doing his best harrison ford and weird sciencea shit demon attacks our heroes smith also has kitchen sink brand of humour his dexterous maneuvering between the satirical cardinal played george carlin attempts mount publicity campaign the slogan catholicism wow and the scatalogical ensures that no lover of comedy will leave dogma feeling malnourished bust ed gut on several occasions proceedings also get off on the right foot the opening the funniest disclaimer ever it is disclaimer unlikely put protestors at ease for read it one actually has see dogma the prerelease ballyhoo is in the tradition of the last temptation of christs martin scorseses adaptation of nikos kazantzakis controversial novel in that it is not directly linked the pictures content but rumours and heresy there is famous anecdote about fletch director michael ritchie inviting picketers of the last temptation of christ into screening on his dime just so they could know for certain what they were rallying against not one of them had watched it every single person refused smith and scorsese have lot in common and so do the two films in question because both smiths bethany and scorseses jesus are hollow shells without their faith in fact dogmas denouement follows thrilling showdown that is worth the wait is catholic lovein veritable recruitment poster felt sentimental about religion do not belong now that is powerful filmmaking smith is nothing if not sincere about his own devotion god and that spirituality shines through it is enough make me forgive dogma for its editorial sins my religion is movies when the catholic league beats on dogma for imaginary crimes against doctrine in roundabout way they are attacking what live for freedom of expression through celluloid therefore feel that although am no biblethumper am at least as qualified criticize dogma as william donohue and his followers

you have heard all the hype you have seen all their faces natalie portman the professional as queen amidala liam neeson schindlers list as quigon jinn ewan mcgregor trainspotting as obiwan kenobi and jake lloyd jingle all the way as young anakin skywalker if you have read any reviews you have also probably heard that this movie fails live up the magic and humanity of the first trilogy you also may have heard that this ones too kiddiefriendly and does not have enough content for adults believe the hype the effects are stunning the digitalized creatures are amazingly realistic the lightsaber duels are amazing and queen amidalas sumptuous robes are fit be worn queen elizabeth but there is something missing here and it is not budget or effects it is everything money cannot buy the actors struggle as best they can flesh out broadstroked and flat characters the most successful at this is liam neeson who as quigon jinn jedi master young obiwan kenobi has quiet dignity and wise commanding presence he is the anchor this movie as he is the one character who george lucas apparently spent some time fleshing out portmans queen amidala and mcgregors obiwan kenobi do not fare nearly so well amidala the future mother of luke and leia and the queen of peaceful planet being invaded the trade federation comes off as stoic stilted and caricatured it appears as though she was vulcan geisha in former life and obiwan although mcgregor makes him very endearing has so little screen time that he is nothing but robin quigon jinns batman however mcgregor does struggle manfully infuse this surprisingly small supporting role spark of genuine insight and humanity and he does good job he also absolutely nails alec guiness obiwan in episode scottish accent and that really makes his presence in the more profound than it might have been otherwise in fact lucas seems bank on that preexisting knowledge quite bit and that is one of the problems this would never call myself star wars fan especially not considering what it means be fanatic these days but have always enjoyed the films along everyone else in america however if you are the one person in america who has not seen the films at all or even recently or who does not bother brushup on the names of obscure characters you may be hopelessly lost for example one of the films main nefarious characters is senator palpatine for those of you not recently steeped in star wars trivia emperor palpatine is that scary hooded apparition who was darth vaders master in return of the jedi and empire strikes back so obviously his appearance in phantom menace is meant stir some echoes of his later role in the series thus making his role here more meaningful lot of the movie is like that rd and cpo make token appearances and it is obvious that lucas is banking on the audiences preexisting fondness for them because he does not do much add it in any way same goes for jabba the hutt who does not look as much mean here as he does corpulent and lazy even planets make foreshadowing guest appearances in this tatooine the desert world where luke grew up coruscant the cloud city from empire strikes back and alderaan leias home planet we never actually see that gets blown up in star wars show up or are mentioned briefly in passing what is the result of tying so many plot points and characters future films the answer is that this one seems surprisingly empty there is no meat no substance that makes you want love the characters as they are not as they will be another problem is that there are actually too many alien characters in the was distracted the fact that two of the main evil characters strange looking aliens who looked like gila monsters had mouths that barely moved making them look more like muppets than actual characters and jar jar binks silly roger rabbitish amphibious character is intended as comic relief but what he really becomes is annoying and fast unlike chewbacca and cpo who got their humanity if you will pardon the expression from their interactions the human characters jar jar is often left interact mostly others of his kind at times making the movie seem like nothing more than very expensive teenage mutant ninja turtles furthermore the dialogue is often stilted and corny and sometimes downright infantile thereby rendering some characters into nothing more than bystanders the plot oddly this is not just my judgment lucas has said that he designed this for kids well he is done good job the hero of this of course is young anakin but it was very hard for me feel any kinship or identify an eightyearold boy that is not jake lloyds fault though he does good job of being cute kid is apparently all lucas asked of him that is another mistake of course because the cute tyke becomes darth vader warning spoilers ahead in my opinion there was not nearly enough foreshadowing of anakins future evil in the the boy is all blond flowing hair and rosy cheeks and there is nothing more than spark of aggression in him throughout the entire movie he has doting mother pernilla august making her first english language and is slave gross flying gnome on tatooine but the only indication the audience gets that this kid is not all hearts and roses is yodas hesitation in allowing him train as jedi under quigon jinn his explanation his future is clouded warning major spoiler ahead enter at your own risk of course the noble quigon dies at the hand of darth maul scarylooking sith lord who excels at the jedi arts but has turned the dark side this dude has maybe two lines in the entire movie but he establishes his presence through his amazing moves his doublesided lightsaber and his scary facial makeup because quigon never gets chance train the young anakin in the ways of the force obiwan quigons young padawan apprentice one level below knightdom must take over the training himself so at the end of the movie we end where the saga actually begins obiwan kenobi and his young apprentice anakin darth vader skywalker did this story need be told would say no but is it worthwhile movie see absolutely if you do not enter the theater jedisize expectations and you simply want be treated an enjoyable visual spectacle then this is your movie the tatooine pod races are triumph of effects and computer animation the digitalized backgrounds on some of the planets are an astonishing sight and yoda and young obiwan are worth seeing for their origins in simpler happier time above all this is fun movie not deep not meaningful and not profound but fun maybe next time lucas will hire lawrence kasdan cowrite the script and the guy who directed empire will direct because if lucas does the next one himself it will be lacking the one thing it needs the most potential

as african american detective vergil tibbs questions suspected white murderer inside jail cell there is wonderful eyecatching shot instantaneously presents the main message of the entire the shot has tibbs face completely covered the shadows of the prison bars see these bars blocking his face we see how separated tibbs is from the rest of the characters in the as black detective conducting an investigation in southern town full of violent white bigots no matter how innocent tibbs is he is still seen these bigots as threat simply because of the color of his skin the bars show that tibbs has not been given fair chance show exactly who he is instead others have chosen him as different and dangerous this one shot amazes me because it captures whole theme in matter of seconds it perhaps may be the most powerful image have seen in in the heat of the night was the first and the best of the three films norman jewison directed concerning racism in america jewison has very keen style of displaying various cases of racism as he is neither pedantic nor overly sentimental in these three films he does an excellent job creating very detailed equal analyses of characters from the abused the abusers he is also not afraid tell the absolute truth about how corrupt society was in the past and is in the present preceding the very original soldiers story and the recently released the hurricane in the heat of the night contains some classic lines and some very memorable characters the won best picture in focuses on vergil tibbs played superbly sidney poitier as fearless african american police officer from philadelphia who refuses give up on an investigation in white town where is he not wanted tibbs is man who rarely loses his temper and that is worth mentioning because he is constantly facing abuse from those around him as hero who is not afraid face off against five men chains tibbs is the perfect protagonist poitier also gives an excellent noteworthy voice his character never nervous and always commanding his speech patterns are very manipulative as they range from stentorian soothing however unlike the hurricane where denzel washington dominated over the rest of the cast poitier shares the spotlight rod steiger who won best actor for his excellent performance as sheriff who helps tibbs and warns him of the dangers around him steiger shows great amount of skill in his role he starts off as racist and blind as the other townspeople he would refer tibbs as boy and would always suspiciously keep an eye on him as the progresses though there is very gradual change in the sheriff he begins see the hardships tibbs faces and he sees the foolishness of his own neighbors what really enjoyed about steigers character was that he did not completely abandon his friends or connect tibbs at the end of the he still could not refer tibbs as mister tibbs or officer tibbs but rather settled for virgil instead it was apparent that he was eventually going see the world differently in the future most movies would have character reversing all of his beliefs and influences in matter of minutes this action would not have been realistic at all since it is nearly impossible for someone believe something one day and believe something else the next day jewisons determination make this as realistic as possible is very obvious here and also very appropriate in the heat of the night shows the difference between the north and the south or major city and small town in the united states during the it displays this perfectly however the actual investigation although it is not the main focus of the lacks interest it seemed rushed especially towards the end as if jewison had given his message about racism and did not feel like giving credible explanation involving the murder victim there were way too many characters added during the last fifteen minutes and some of the scenes during this time period were inane police officer sam being suspect was not needed also it is given that tibbs is vigilant homicide detective who is the best at what he does but some of his discoveries came out of nowhere and how he found out some of the important case details towards the end were never answered the rushed ending was the only mistake of this otherwise memorable jewison classic congratulations has be given actor scott wilson he managed be in the two best movies of in the heat of the night and the even better in cold blood

in wonder boys michael douglas plays an aged writer professor such livedin naturalism that believe it may be his best performance ever since wall street douglas has spent the greater part of his career playing variations on the shark in suit gordon gecko character he personified in the mids in those performances he tended exaggerate the vehemence of cutthroat businessmen much frothing at the mouth while projecting all his bad intentions the world you would think such man would keep his evil wrapped tightly underneath goodnatured veneer but from gordon gecko nicholas van orton douglas played the role straight and out in the open in wonder boys his performance is not showy or tour de force it is simple yet truthful he embodies grady craggy old writer predilection for pot and pink bathrobes grady instructs writers workshop while working tirelessly on follow up the novel that put him on the map when we first encounter this curmudgeon in the midst of his workshop we hear his sardonic narration on the soundtrack as students bombard one of their own unfair criticisms grady points out in his narration that they only do so out of jealousy their target is the very writerly named james leer played the always understated tobey maguire student full of potential and one whom grady develops mild affection for leer is the kind of youth who seems mechanically block out emotions he speaks in an intellectualized monotone just hint of dry wit around the edges he is portentous and gloomy as if modeling himself after the great depressed writers though his act is little too calculated he reminds me of the selfimposed outcast director jim jarmusch dead man ghost dog whenever happen catch jarmusch in an interview see the man speaking in toneless manner the monotonous drawl supposedly masking depth or contempt for his interviewer exclusively dressed in black and his spiked hair dyed snow white leer is similar guy who equates quirks depth tobey maguire fits well in the role his round sweeteerie face he resembles bud cort from harold and maude but unlike cort maguire is easier warm up he is messed up kid reaching for artistic credibility katie holmes plays hannah beautiful talented writing student just itching get in gradys pants this is plot line had trouble douglas in his old age is beginning resemble jerry springer man who has actually paid for sex on numerous documented occasions at first found it extremely difficult believe that someone as beautiful as hannah would desire grady maybe it is because am jealous and wish holmes was throwing herself at me after all may just be lowly internet critic but at least still have all my teeth then think of douglass real life companion the breathtaking catherine zeta jones seeing those two together looks lot like kidnapping suddenly my mind has shifted from the task at hand that being reviewing this completely wonderful movie and am pontificating on why the hell jones would desire douglas there is movie in there somewhere grady rather chivalrously if you ask me resists the charms of hannah for sara gaskell droll frances mcdormand who is his age but also married another professor okay maybe not so chivalrous there is great line in the spoken douglas about sara where he says she was junkie for the printed word lucky for me manufactured her drug of choice robert downy r plays bisexual editor who makes his entrance towering transvestite on his arm downy has mastered the gleefully dry hyper articulate wit of many hipster intellectual he is arrogant but completely likeable in his utter arrogance the actor is perfectly cast here and remains joyous movie presence somewhere between typical tom hanksian comic leading man and edgy character actor wish wonder boys had more of him searching for plot among the elements of wonder boys would be pointless for it meanders through its running time but that is part of its charm and maybe am bit biased towards the because it takes place in haven of literary academia place am greatly fond of and place rarely explored in american cinema everyone has subgenre be it war films westerns dance movies that they happen be privy am privy films about literary types e those individuals enthralled the written word and if you are not so inclined it may be wise knock my above grade down about half notch the direction curtis hanson is more akin european its leisurely pace and situations that grow from the characters rather than generic mapped out story points sometimes the dialogue is too clever but that is problem wish found films more often another minor quibble is that early on the seems bit too introverted like its characters but as the story progresses it begins open up for me wonder boys works as subtle drama because of its insight into artistic types and as lowkey comedy for its chuckleworthy throwaway gags the gags are like those in the great robert altman a h the long goodbye movies where jokes exist as asides on the fringes like jokes in life often do the broader comedy such as the killing of blind dog and incessant smoking of marijuana is not ineffective but not nearly as memorable as the little things curtis hanson who before his last la confidential toiled about exploitation fare like losin it an early tom cruise sex comedy and the hand the rocks the cradle has graduated more meaningful films he directs wonder boys in an appropriately dour style the comedy coming from the false gloom his characters put up the morose crooning of leonard cohen would seem an odd song for the background of any party but in wonder boys party it fits the is like piece of literature put up on the big screen it is the cinematic equivalent good read novelistic in its approach themes rarely found in american movies many will find it slight but found much savor among its subtleties

plot derek zoolander is male model he is also very dumb and impressionable for that reason he is secretly hired and trained so secret that even he does not know about it an underground fashion syndicate assassinate the prime minister of malaysia who wants abolish child labor in his country will zoolander fulfill the dirty deed will zoolander ever grace the world his new look is this funny movie find out below critique there is place in our world for stupid comedies films do not pretend take themselves seriously are based on idiotic premises and filled dumb jokes there is also time for them and many would argue that this difficult period of our history might be an ideal circumstance during relax watching something so completely frivolous well if you are in the mood for some seriously mindless entertainment ben stiller and his cast of many have assembled one of the more original dumb comedies in some time of course comedies as such are usually very subjective and could see how some will see this simply as stupid and unfunny while others will grant them the stupid but consider it funny instead personally enjoyed it for the most part cracked up loudly during couple of specific sequences and loved the derek zoolander character and the unrestrained whipping they released upon the fashion industry snap it was also nice see several reallife models small roles in the movie not taking themselves too seriously and if you are the type of person who likes celebrity cameos in films well do not look any further because dozens of famous faces show up here including vince vaughn billy zane winona ryder christian slater david duchovny natalie portman and many many others especially liked andy dicks complete makeover as the masseuse hilarious but all films of this type there is bound be some stuff that simply does not work few particulars did not strike my fancy included the bulimia and orgy sequence christine taylor the breakdance fighting and also never get why they use real countries in plots like this why not just make up country instead of zeroing in on certain people also could have done less of the taylor character in general since she was not all that interesting and seemed slow things down every now and then more zoolander dude but those few missteps were nothing compared some of the more memorable scenes definitely did work for me almost pissed myself during the gas station disaster absolutely adored the walkoff contest david bowie as the judge no less and appreciated many of zoolanders moronic oneliners was merman merman and dare you get his monkey photo shoot out of your head after seeing this movie you are monkey derek monkey also really liked the soundtrack and the pace of the both of zipped and zagged and established nice rhythm it all again it is note that this movie is dumb and not for everyone but my guess is that if you laughed at the trailer you will likely enjoy many of the quips in the actual picture as well if you thought the trailer was dumb skip this dodo bird and go rent austin powers again or something from there is an obvious influence here blue steel baby yeah where is joblo coming from austin powers austin powers deuce bigalow dude where is my car freddy got fingered jay silent bob strike back joe dirt meet the parents say it is not so

unzipped is cinematic portrait of isaac mizrahi an artist whose palette is fabric ostensibly the is documentary but use of that term requires stretching its meaning many scenes appear staged and great deal of cuttingandpasting has been done in the editing room the cinema verite effect is conceit genuine spontaneity is at premium and everyone is aware of and playing the camera especially wouldbe actresses like cindy crawford director douglas keeve who was mizrahis lover at the time freely admits that he could not care less about the truth but was more interested in capturing the spirit and love in isaac and in fashion despite violating nearly every rule of legitimate documentary making however unzipped is remarkably enjoyable piece of entertainment while it sheds only little light on the behindthescenes world of the fashion industry it presents fascinating if incomplete picture of designer mizrahi this man is the perfect subject for this kind of study he is funny energetic and eminently quotable he has unusual views on just about everything from fashion it is about women not wanting look like cows mary tyler moore between her and jackie kennedy they shaped this country style it is almost impossible have style nowadays without the right dogs unzipped also gives glimpse into the creative process mizrahi turns an idea into dress it is almost certainly different that anyone would imagine the designer draws on variety of sources for his look including nanook of the north and old bette davis movies then enlists the aid of ouija board help form the collection in particular unzipped traces mizrahis development of his fall line from its inception in the spring the final fashion show highlights number of prominent models including cindy crawford naomi campbell kate bush and linda evangelista on the technical side number of interesting choices were made in filming unzipped variety of stocks were used super mm blackandwhite and mm color there is purpose this beyond simple artiness the stock often serves as an emotional key the movie and during the climactic fashion show color is used show the audiences perspective while blackandwhite is for the behindthe scenes sequences nevertheless some viewers will be put off this treatment while unzipped is not an expose on the fashion industry per se keeve has enough clips of petulant models make the viewer realize how tame robert altman was ready wear overall however this movie is far more about mizrahi than anything else and only when viewed from that perspective does unzipped succeed when the designer declares that everything is frustrating except designing clothes that is beautiful and liberating it fits perfectly the image of him that unzipped has constructed

dora fernanda montenegro sits behind makeshift desk at rios major train station she in her colorful demeanor offers service that is unheard of in the states she writes letters for the illiterate who pass through try find lost relatives find love or search after lost debts shes quirky shes elderly shes caring totally trustworthy right not chance once home she never sends these letters saving money on postage and relishing in the drama contained therein her neighbor irene mar lia ra one of the letters is sent young mother her nineyear old son looking for their father shortly thereafter she gets hit bus and the son is orphaned days go and the boy named josu roams around the station hungry desperate and somewhat clueless his predictament through series of circumstances too precious elaborate upon dora somehow takes responsibility in trying find josu father this means leaving the security of rio traveling the outskirts of brazil where unpaved roads religious devotees and the povertystricken become commonplace films like this remind me as what enjoy about some foreign films it is an opportunity for me get fresh breath in another part of the world so distant from my own it does so entertainingly and so heartwrenchingly and yet its backdrop is merely that the focus is on the minute transformation of dora of how she learns love this little kid without being cloying or sentimental the most interesting backdrop is the amount of religious dedication is in the dora being an amoral scamartist could care less about the amount of bickering between the candlelighting of the catholics versus the bumpersticker mentality of the evangelicals but neither side is trivialized she even begins develop an affection for nondrinking evangelical who sees the problems dora if not initially fernanda montenegro surprisingly got an oscar nomination for this very delicate performance but the true marvel is that of vinicius de oliveira who plays josu he like the discoveries of r mie renier _la promesse_ and giorgio cantarini _life is beautiful_ prove that the true acting discoveries may be outside of the united states he is natural and never once grating send memo jonathan taylor thomas

the event of events is upon us people have waited twentytwo years for the prequel star wars and diehard fans have been camping out at theaters for months get tickets see it do not think that america will ever actually recover from what this hurricane of has caused it is not bit of an exaggeration say that this is the most highly anticipated movie in history anyone who tells you it is just movie is either lying or clueless it is clearly obvious that after the waiting and the hype actually seeing the movie will be anticlimactic the second coming of the lord could not live up the kind of buzz is far too weak word that star wars epsode the phantom menace so effortlessly generated but that does not mean that the itself is bad in fact it is terrific strongly suspect that many of the people who were dissappointed it have simply surrendered the media machine and the inevitable backlash it is set some decades before the events of the original star wars took place the focuses on the fledgling republic of planets and the conflict that is raging the trade federation angry at some tax raise that was recently put in place has invaded the small peaceful planet of naboo the republic sent two jedi knights people that can actively communicate what is affectionately known as the force quigon jinn liam neeson and obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor negotiate unable stop the tide of events that was about occur the jedi and the queen of naboo natalie portman escape naboo and head for coruscant try and get the republic senate intervene on the way they get sidetracked planet called tatooine where they meet the movies real focal point young anakin skywalker jake lloyd he is an innocent slave boy but the force is strong him so qui gon is determined take him them the jedi counsel and get him trained as jedi as any selfrespecting star wars fan should know anakin will grow up be darth vader and give birth luke skywalker from the beginning it is evident that this is not an actors movie around of the characters if not more are computer generated in one form or another and though the effects are seamless the movie lacks soul think that although the computer has played an incredibly instrumental part in moviemaking this decade cinema should still be human art and the phantom menace nearly defies this this is the lightest installment in the star wars saga thus far plenty of broad comic relief go around much of it courtesy of an irritating knew character named jarjar binks he is essentially computeranimated sidekick who says things like exqueeze me and mesa go now okeday and although it is often amusing it is also inherently annoying the visual effects are astounding although director george lucas often chickens out cutting away from them and the movie is thrilling triumph if it lacks in plot and in acting it makes up for it through imagination and excitement the climactic lightsaber battle oh come on as if you did not already know among other things is outrageously entertaining and defines the term popcorn movie what made me surrender and give this movie stars was the score john williams even though it does seem like the man scores every single movie that comes out these days his work here is nothing short of brilliant his use of opera during the climax really does add punch and his ingenious way of utilizing the imperial march as sort of prophecy is chilling the phantom menace is probably most effective as pop nostalgia when you see long time ago in galaxy far far away when the familiar music plays when the words star wars appear on screen you will feel tingle even if you did not see the movie when it first came out in it feels oddly exciting be introduced young anakin boy whose innocence we know will be taken away and who will soon cross over the dark side it is the perfect example of dramatic irony see the jedi masters aspire get him trained in the jedi arts we know that it will do more harm than good but they do not we not only feel more involved in the story but we feel like we are seeing the beginning of saga that we have cherished for years the phantom menace although lacking in human aspects of the story is very worthy installment in the star wars it works as an action flick visually eyepopping and often paralyzingly exciting it also works as an elicitor of memories piece of exquisite nostalgia eugene novikov

sometimes movie comes along that falls somewhat askew of the rest some people call it original or artsy or abstract some people simply call it trash life less ordinary is sure bring about mixed feelings definitely generationx aimed movie life less ordinary has everything from claymation profane angels karaokebased musical dream sequence whew anyone in their or above is probably not going grasp what can be enjoyed about this it is somewhat silly it is somewhat outrageous and it is definitely not your typical romance story but for the right audience it works lot of hype has been surrounding this due the fact that it comes us from the same team that brought us trainspotting well sorry folks but have not seen trainspotting so cannot really compare whether that works in this films favor or not is beyond me but do know this ewan mcgregor whom had never had the pleasure of watching definitely charmed me he was great cameron diazs character was uneven and bit hard grasp the audience may find it difficult care about her thus discouraging the hopes of seeing her unite mcgregor after we are immediately sucked into caring about and identifying him misguided you bet loveable you bet life less ordinary was delight and even had bonus for me when realized it was filmed in my hometown of salt lake city utah this was just one more thing did not know about this movie when sat down five dollar order of nachos and three dollar coke maybe not knowing the premise behind this made for pleasant surprise but think even if had known would have been just as happy life less ordinary is quirky eccentric and downright charming not for everyone but definite change of pace for your typical night at the movies

that thing you do tom hankss screenwriting and directorial debut that thing you do has all the qualities you would associate the most beloved screen actor of the moment fun lively and ohsonice it is the latter quality however that becomes hindrance for this nostalgia trifle is so nice and sweet that it teeters on becoming bland milquetoast that thing focuses on the wonders teen rock band from erie pennsylvania that is suddenly thrust into the national spotlight in when they score major dance hit called of course that thing you do the groups members are naturally diverse group there is brooding lead singer and songwriter jimmy johnathon schaech girlcrazy lenny steve zahn the lead guitarist goofy geeky type known only as the bass player ethan embry and the films center guy tom everett scott the drummer who has aspirations in jazz along for the wonders ride success is jimmys perpetually neglected galpal faye liv tyler hanks proves be capable writerdirector deftly recreating the innocent spirit of hanks calls the last innocent year the spirit is not only reflected in the period clothes and settings but also in the music like the other recent period music grace of my heart was expressly written for the hanks himself had hand in writing four of the tunesbut not the infectious title cut adam schlesinger is guaranteed stay in your head long after the end credits have rolled it is still playing in my mind as write this it should come as no surprise that hanks the director works well the actors eliciting charming likable work from the entire cast most notably hanks lookalike scott and tyler who is remarkable in delivering the films biggest and best dramatic moment the work of the young ensemble is so natural that they truly convince as teens of the early they do not appear be grungers playacting retro yet for all the light frothy charms of that thing you do it is nearly nice fault while this unbridled innocence in is refreshing change from all the sinful cinema around these days there is not enough conflict keep things consistently interesting everyone is so happy basking in the glow of overnight success marvelling at it allexcept toward the end but even then the tone quickly reverts sweetness ending on an appropriately feelgood note there is not much of an edge throughout that thingthe only thing that is remotely edgy is hankss turn as the wonders managerand thus becomes in danger of being so nice it is bland but little niceness goes long way these days and there is no denying the entertainment value of that thing you do it is just about impossible hate it is an inoffensive enjoyable piece of nostalgia that is sure leave audiences smiling and humming if not singing that thing you do quite possibly for days paraphrase passage from the song though try and try forget that song it is just so hard do every time they play that thing you do

he is back and it is about time was the motto for this television series pilot call it pilot do not care what fox network says revival of the cult classic british tv show doctor who that spawned no series means there are no smart network execs out there not exactly news lot of people know the motto was well chosen the series was simple it was about this time lord scientist called the doctor thirteen lives who traveled around in type forty spaceship called tardis outsmarting all kind of alien baddies including the evil daleks and the master who appears in this feature played very badly eric roberts as good as this revival was there is something missing from it make sure it was really doctor who is it the acting hell no paul mcgann is just as good as any of the other seven guys who have played the doctor including his predecessor and offscreen friend sylvester mccoy who appears once more for the regeneration scene he looks right for the role is brilliant actor and slips effortlessly into the role the way my two favorites jon pertwee and tom baker would daphne ashbrook brings class her role as dr grace holloway the doctors first companion that he kisses on screen she is not your typical female companion who screams and spends her free time making coffee for the doctor she is tough spunky american and ashbrook shows this well young yee jee tso shows promise as chang lee and have seen him in other stuff in he usually plays the punk kid who dies at the end this included imho wastes his talent the only problem the acting is eric roberts one time he had say mcganns doctor always dress for the occasion but he broke it up and said it so slowly that it wounded up sounding like song lyric always dress for the occasion you need an actor less slow and less reliant on moving his hands act and who is also british like mcgann is as the doctor executive producer phil segal said he was casted because fox insisted on having one american star in the role dunno who thought of casting him but if they are reading this news flash eric roberts is not star he rides on his sisters coattails and any hit movie he makes has nothing do him is this problem the kisses the past they have references the show so subtle that non fans would not notice them only whovians would and they are good is it the script or the movie as whole the script is classy piece of work featuring master who can spit slime out of his mouth and nice dialogue and the movie as whole is one fans will love and it is good stand alone viewing for nonfans enjoy the series so what is it simple no plot the master on his last legs sends for the doctor rescue him after the daleks put him on trial on their planet skaro and exterminate him the doctor attempts take his remains back gallifrey but they accidentally land in san francisco december where the master young street hood chang lees help opens the eye of harmony will suck the earth through it at midnight if the doctor the help of female surgeon dr grace holloway does not close it then virtually no plot was told the movie would have featured the daleks on screen and started more of courtroom drama between the master and the daleks but lot of rewriting went on on the set that shows how smart people are as it would have made the movie hell of lot more interesting and that would have gotten four star rating out of me

dreamworks pictures presents jinks cohen company production kevin spacey annette bening american beauty thora birch allison janney peter gallagher mena suvari wes bentley and chris cooper coproducers stan wlodkowski alan ball music thomas newman costume designer julie weiss editor tariq anway chris greenbury production designer naomi shohan director of photography conrad hall s produced bruce cohen dan jinks written alan ball directed sam mendes both my wife and daughter think am this gigantic loser and they are right have lost something did not always feel this sedated that piece of dialogue we are fully introduced lester burnham kevin spacey year old man trapped within his own life lester works for an advertising agency his growing dissatisfaction his job is only one of the midlife crisis he is suffering estranged from both his wife and his daughter lester starts crack under the stress his life becomes nothing more than series of mastubatory fantasies and sullen apathy carolyn burnham annette bening is the prototypical career woman homemaker she carefully tends her rose garden decorates her home the best furnishings but inside she is desperate unsuccessful at her profession as real estate agent she drives herself into states of denial and self loathing that only feed her growing resentment towards her family the third member of this antifamily is jane burnham thora birch lester and carolyns daughter young girl going through the typical stages of adolescence but having also come terms her families growing dysfunction this funny and frightening slice of life is refreshingly simple not one character is given less than is needed identify him or her some of the most telling characters are those that serve highlight other characters most notably is barbara fitts allison janney the almost catatonic wife of retired marine colonel fitts she has almost no dialogue and seems be either recovering from stroke or suffering from one colonel fitts chris cooper is an angry and frightened man his rage directed almost singularly at his son ricky wes bentley who has just moved his family the same neighborhood as the burnhams in fact they are the next door neighbors anymore detail into the personalities of these marvelously diverse characters would deprive one of the many pleasures and surprises be had in american beauty alan ball who was the coexecutive producer of the hit tv series cybil and creator of the new sitcom oh grow up has fashioned one of the most insightful and expertly tuned screenplays have hit the screen in the past ten years not one character in this rings falsely and the depth of personality in each is achingly honest and insightful the plot detailing the last year in the life of man as he tries find his own self worth is so resoundingly cliched and at the same time original as bring mind such marvelous work as the graduate or lolita kevin spacey turns in one of this years most pragmatic performances his lester burnham is an everyman caught up in the middle of life that is spiraling into old age finally unable deal the lost soul that he has become lester tries return his youth he quits his job actually blackmailing his employer for one years salary starts smoking pot fantasizes about his daughters girlfriend angela mena suvari in marvelous performance here starts working out and finally takes job at the local fast food outlet mr spaceys performance is so remarkably subtle and ingenuous that we can be certain that come oscar time we can be assured see him name among the five nominees annette bening also turns in what may be the best performance of her career carolyn burnham is woman who has become so insecure as be caught up in maintaining the facade of normalcy unable cope her growing disillusionment she forces herself maintain her demeanor driving her further and further into desperation adultery and possibly murder ms bening makes the character of carolyn so compelling as be identifiable almost anyone the slow and methodical turn from happy home maker charnel house martha stewart is too frightening express in words thora birch holds her own against the talents cast her
