jane burnham is both an innocent girl caught up in what is dysfunctional family and rebellious child ready abandon them at any moment her growing distrust and isolation from her family is something that many parents should view as warning she is the prototypical trophy child when carolyn praises her daughter after performance her cheerleading team am so proud of you honey you did not screw up once the bitterness and resentment are palpable thora birch is young actress watch praise must also go chris cooper who brings yet another angry father role life depth and resonance colonel finn is man in complete denial his military upbringing masking desire he is too repulsed even comprehend wes bentley as ricky finn is fine as the enigma the boy next door who may be more foe than friend deceitful and calculating young man whose voyeuristic proclivities mask deeper and more profound understanding of life than any of the adults around him mr bentleys performance is the one troublesome note in the that is simply because the character is such grand and complete liar that one almost faults the performance for it director sam mendes handles all of the particulars of the cast and the settings sure and composed style that is neither intrusive nor subtle scenes of carolyn walking through the rain carry an ominous fission that calls attention the emotions of the character the subtle cinematography conrad hall is wonderful capturing the season in all of it is harsh beauty fall has never looked so inviting yet depressing every nuance of american beauty begs it is audience think and examine it is that will be discussed and debated for years come and well it should as it is simply one of this years best

will hunting matt damon is natural genius for movie character that is usually death sentence it is trait associated what my brother calls too good for this world movies like phenomenon or powder forgive me for spoiling the ending but will does not die this is no formula movie in fact it is quite fresh and original it is character study more than anything and that is not surprising considering it was written two actors damon and costar ben affleck will works whatever kind of job he can get first he is janitor then he works construction offscreen he speed reads books on any academic subject that interests him onscreen he hangs out his friends picking fights in robust romanticizedhemingway fashion lambeau stellan skarsgard from breaking the waves math professor learns that the janitor will is genius special talent for advanced mathematics having confirmed he is not fluke or savant he does what he can get will into the education system he is firmly rejected finally will lands in jail for one of his fights lambeau can get him probation instead of prison time as long as will agrees therapy sessions and discussing mathematics him will barely decides go for the therapy over prison lambeau treats will like son he is proud of and amazed wills accomplishments in mathematics he encourages will and tries give him structure knowing that little discipline he could be bigger than einstein will is not really interested in academia he knows he would be the best in his field and therefore spend all of his time in an office explaining math people like lambeau he would rather work construction breaks lambeaus heart meanwhile will attends his mandated therapy sessions it is not long before he shreds all the therapists on lambeaus list will has read enough psychology know the tricks of the trade and how keep them from affecting him shrink after shrink refuses return after wills mockery lambeaus last hope is his old college roommate now psychology teacher at smalltime community college knowing that will is going try shred him too sean robin williams agrees take him on as favor lambeau and for the chance meet this next einstein true form will finds seans emotional weakness and attacks but unlike the other shrinks sean knows what he is in for and continues the sessions like foster mother fussy child sean knows that the attacks are defensive and is able take them in stride like the foster mother sean knows that time and quiet patience is the only approach robin williams is excellent in this role he is not an actor great range but in the right roles he has great depth in this movie as in awakenings there comes point when the quiet shy man accomplishes something of great personal importance and smile of pure joy spreads up his eyes williams is the only actor can name who can make an audience cry just smiling have compared will foster child and that is not entirely fair emotionally he has lot learn but he is not child he has thought about his life and made rational decisions about what he wants sean his girlfriend his pals and lambeau all help him grow but he did not start out asking for or particularly needing help his exceptional gift singled him out and those who love him kept pushing him in the right direction if had say anything bad about good will hunting is that it walks the line between drama and melodrama it is too sentimental and uplifiting for straight drama but the emotions are too subtle for melodrama it is emotionally engaging but it is not quite larger than life this is not problem per se but at times did not know quite how take it but this is relatively small complaint about very good movie good movie allows its characters learn and grow it does not just happen it takes good script good acting and good direction good will hunting has all three if you are at all inclined see it all means go

if there is one thing in common about all of hollywoods major studios it is that their productions are moving toward mainstream more and more although twentieth century fox and new line cinema have spawned subsidiaries specialize in independant or controversial motion pictures fox searchlight and fine line respectively it is obvious there is no significant movement underway promote inventive ideas at the theater so when movie like gary ross pleasantville comes along wrapped in blanket of innovative ideas and served up on platter of fine production it is welcome change of pace for all who frequent the cineplexes although the atmosphere and buzz about the movie are cheery and lighthearted pleasantville should not be mistaken for nothought movie quite the opposite is true in fact as director ross skillfully brings narrative intense and intelligent undertones the screen the story both about the joys of living life the fullest as well as the social ills of segregation captures the essence of statementmaking in the cinema not in recent memory has movie carried such weight of theme into widescale distribution and even if mass audiences fail see the ingenuity of ross work it is still testament that his picture was considered worthy enough kudos both he and his production staff for putting together this fine picture it stars tobey maguire and reese witherspoon as two nineties teenagers who through quite bit of luck find themselves zapped into fifties sitcom named pleasantville maguire as the reserved bud parker is perfect for the pseudoworld but the rebellious mary sue witherspoon is not at all made for the fatherknowsbest times it is not long before she sets the town of pleasantville on end and begins teach the townspeople in quite unlikely way what life is really like soon hues of color creep into the black and white world and while some embrace the change in the passion of realism others fear the strangeness at one end is soda shop ownerturnedpainter named mr johnson jeff daniels and at the other end is closeminded mayor t walsh and his chamber of commerce but the two sides are simply fronts for clash of ideas that soon involves the entire town fine performances are turned in all around maguire and witherspoon are effective as the leads but the true complements go out jeff daniels and t walsh in his latest and final posthumous performance daniels brings an atmosphere of awe inspiration and hope his character whereas walsh simply drips of sinister closemindedness almost the point where you can sense gene hackmans envy for daniels it is his most commendable performance of the last three years or more and for walsh it is complementary exclamation point on fine career also of lesser note is the supporting role joan allen and in viewing the entire cast works well together from start finish there is not much dislike about pleasantville and its dynamic nature makes it the perfect movie for those who want serious as well as those who do not

what do you get when you slap together movie based on story the legendary george lucas directed virtuoso director steven spielberg and starring one of the biggest boxoffice stars in the world harrison ford you get one hotfudgerockin good time that is what you get plot professorarcheologist indiana jones sets out find the longlost mystical ark of the covenant before the nazis get their grubby fingers hands on it adventures snakes romance and mucho action ensues critique astounding movie packed nonstop action stunts galore an interesting story line great oneliners solid cast catchy musical score and all the fun and adventure that you could squeeze into twohour thrill ride if you do not enjoy this then you just do not like action movies period if you are young you will enjoy its humor its cool action sequences and its grossout factor at times if you are little older you will appreciate the interesting plot line the romance and yes the mountains of adventure watching this movie made me feel like kid again dreaming and fantasizing about fighting the bad guys travelling different countries making the impossible possible harrison ford is perfect as the everyman the brains of scientist and the brawn of an outdoors adventurer and spielberg manages achieve the ideal balance of action fun adventure and humor now if you really want have good time check into this movie on the same night as its two sequels rent jug of iced coke truckloads of nachos and salsa an adventure hat and whip and prepare gag yourself into world of actionmovie heaven little known facts about this and its stars this picture was nominated for eight oscar nominations including best picture it lost that award chariots of fire but did manage win for best art direction best special effects best editing and best sound actor tom selleck was originally cast as indiana jones but was committed his hit tv show magnum i in filming the well of souls sequence the producers scoured every pet shop in london and the south of england for every snake they could lay their hands on hence there are snakes that are identifiable from many different geographical areas however once all the snakes were on set it became clear that there were not nearly enough of them so spielberg had several hoses cut into lengths and these were used as well looking closely you can tell are the real snakes and are not an early draft of the script had indy travelling shanghai recover piece of the staff of ra during his escape from the museum where it was housed he sheltered from machine gun fire behind giant rolling gong also in the same script indy and marion flee the chaos caused the opening of the ark in wild minecart chase sequence both of these scenes were cut from the script but ended up in indiana jones and the temple of doom this begins shot of peak in the jungle is reminiscent of the paramount pictures logo the same type of opening is present in its sequels jocks airplane at the beginning of the has the registration number obcpo this is reference obiwan and cpo from george lucas star wars also the hieroglyphics in the well of souls include engravings of rd and cpo they can be seen on post the right of indy and sallah as they remove the ark the script originally included long fight between swordsman and indiana his whip as legend has it actor harrison ford was suffering diarrhea at the time and asked if the scene could be shortened spielberg said the only way he could shorten it was if indy pulled out his gun and just shot the guy the entire crew laughed and that is how it was filmed when indy first falls in the well of souls and is face face the cobra you can see the snakes reflection on the glass dividing it and harrison ford also some fingerprints and stuff like that when indy is dragging along the ground hanging onto the nazi soldiers truck the ark inside you can see the pad that he is being dragged on

we run tings tings do not run we sound advice from capone paul campbell his squaddie or partner floyd winston bell jamaican shot entirely on video featuring standard cop movie plot mixed dash of john woostyled brotherhood morals and little gunplay capone tough as nails super cop gets transfer back his hometown of kingston after successfully taking down some gangsters that have broken into his home while he was his lady and killed his partner in front of him when he arrives he discovers that the ghetto where he grew up has gotten worse thanks mainly the crime boss wonie jamaican veteran carl bradshaw so named because his left hand has been amputated and replaced grasping hook capone discovers that wonie has been smuggling guns inside shipments of charity supplies for the area churches and much his disappointment also finds out his childhood friend ratty mark danvers has been helping him torn between doing his job and protecting his best friend capone must make some hard decisions in order make things right again directed deftly first time jamaican filmmaker chris browne assistant director for such american films as how stella got her groove back and instinct one hardly notices the was shot on video after while shots are handled so efficiently that they quickly take on the nuances of the aforementioned john woo films although the action is not as hyperkinetic as most of woos films are the action scenes are handled kind of flair though and eventually begin take on life of their own beyond the hong kong films that they are obviously patterned after the makeup effects are particularly good in these scenes as well flawless squib work on display from the effects team the cast is superb and listening their dialogue spoken thick jamaican accents half of have be subtitled because of their extensive use of slang just adds the interest paul campbell as the loose cannon capone essays his role perfectly displaying the right amount of menace and compassion at the right times mark danvers evokes sympathy as ratty the parttime gun smuggler who is also trying help the community building football fields and organizing block parties bring people together unfortunately carl bradshaw is given the least do and his character as the crime boss seems ineffective largely because his underlings seem run all over him but then again that could be the way his character was intended be portrayed the music in the is composed of all reggae songs and the soundtrack was produced grammy award winning artists sly and robbie who have worked the likes of the rolling stones maxi priest bob dylan james brown grace jones herbie hancock bootsy collins and carly simon among others the end credit song we run tings the group red dragon is pretty decent and carries on the theme of the movie established early on the quote that opens this review oddly enough desmond ballentine who plays the character deportee is well known as pioneer in the realm of gangsta reggae as the performer ninjaman and he does not contribute single song the that could see is virtually unheard of here in the us at the time of this writing third world cop has been put into limited theatrical release in the us coming off of sixmonth boxoffice breaking run in jamaica where it holds the position as highest grossing of all time bringing in million in jamaica is roughly us palm pictures the company that released the offbeat but entertaining sixstring samurai is the company releasing the and considering that their main focus is the dvd market can imagine that disc will be available once the has left theaters chris blackwell founder of palm pictures was also involved in the production of another jamaican boxoffice smash in entitled countryman so would say he has pretty good track record overall third world cop is pretty entertaining homage the films of john woo ringo lam tsui hark and many other action films directors from hong kong if action films are your thing and you do not mind intermittent subtitles then you cannot go wrong this the performances and the story are solid if only little cliched and the action is tight am not sure what the other jamaican films released in that country are like but apparently third world cops honors are well deserved

at first glance it appears that the home alone movies are brainless slapstick intended for those minds of year olds that is true of home alone and would bet money that it is true of home alone opening soon but home alone actually has lot going for it and the cartoon slapstick does not get in the way the mcalisters all of them are going france for the holidays four adults and eleven kids are spending the night together before heading the airport en masse the littlest kid kevin is the victim of the older kids cruelty kevins patience runs out when he learns that his plaincheese pizza has already been eaten and he is going have starve he attacks his big bully brother buzz who had been teasing him the fight disrupts the alreadychaotic dinner spilling milk and soft drinks all over the table few cousins and an uncle the kneejerk reaction is for everyone blame kevin nobody came his rescue when he was being teased but they all point their fingers when he fights back the ultimate punishment comes from mom catherine ohara who sends him up the spare bedroom in the attic for the night on his way up the stairs he tells her that families suck and that he hopes never see any of his family again that night the power goes out knocking out the alarm clocks so the mcalisters wake up in big hurry get the airport in surprisingly plausible setup kevin is mistakenly accounted for and the family heads off without him it is interesting that in subtle way his parents never noticed him missing because of their deliberate desire separate themselves from their children first they delegate the headcount an older sibling and second they put all the kids in coach while they fly first class they are twothirds of the way across the atlantic before they realize they are missing child meanwhile kevin believes that somehow his wish has come true he is finally rid of his family life is dream come true he can jump on the beds watch rrated movies eat gobs of ice cream and potato chips and dig through his big brothers secret box slowly the novelty wears off and he settles into the mundane he grooms himself he does the laundry he goes shopping bought some milk eggs and fabric softener he also starts miss his family not just for their company but for the security they bring the furnace in the basement is scary monster the old man next door is snowshovel murderer and two crooks are trying break into his house macaulay culkin is cute but he is not much of an actor still we can see that kevins character grows thanks some good direction and editing for example acting has little do the emotional impact of the scene where kevin searches out seasonal santa at night just as santa is getting in his car kevin asks the man pass on his request he wants his family back the real santa he learned how deal the furnace you turn on the lights and it is not so scary anymore he goes church one evening and there he sees the snowshovel murderer who actually turns out be nice man they talk about their fears and kevin learns that age alone does not make you less afraid finally in the last minutes kevin confronts his last fear the bandits head on literally this last act is full of violent comedic slapstick and after the movies genuine dramatic setup it is dessert it is lot of fun and it does not overwhelm the rest of the movie on the whole home alone is great holiday movie john williams original score has the sound and feel of holiday music without the disadvantage of being overplayed at the malls and the christmas setting can put you in the mood for those family gatherings but it does have its flaws the smallest problem is that culkin does not act very well as said before he is cute but repeated viewings reveal more about how columbus covered himself than about culkins insight into his character the biggest problem is that during the cartoony coda the villains threaten kevins life about five times instead of am gonna get that kid they say am gonna kill that kid some might argue that the tone is the same but strongly disagree mixing comedy specific and viable threats of murder is sociopathic fauxpas will probably never see home alone and wish had skipped home alone but do enjoy home alone almost every year do not let your impressions of the others detract from the original has much more offer than cartoon slapstick

comedy rated pg runs about starring john goodman kathy moriarty and bunch of teenagers directed joe dante and written charles hass summary lawrence woolsley john goodman brings his new horror mant premiere in key west during the height of the cuban missile crisis he hopes capitalize on the tense moment providing an escape for the town we see most of the events through the stories of four teenagers and how life affects them quick and easy review really enjoyed matinee the mixture of comedy and tension blended nicely unlike many comedies this tries and succeeds in getting past the stage of doing anything for laugh the makers of the also cared about telling an intelligent story the performances of all the principals are right on the mark particularly john goodman as the schlock master so would definitely recommend this anyone looking for light hearted yet interesting way spend couple of hours longer more detailed review beware of spoilers the primary reason enjoyed this was that while being comedy the also had an intelligent story tell too many comedies today subscribe the the notion that comedy need only make you laugh you watch the movie laugh lot leave the theatre and take nothing you matinee is not like that left the picture thinking about what would do faced the cuban missile crisis found myself wondering what would happen the characters of the but most importantly found myself caring about what would happen the characters the comedy of the centers around goodman his character and the he brings key west believe that goodman is one of the finest comedic actors in the business today he is highly expressive both physically and vocally felt he at least deserved an oscar nomination for his work in barton fink the other characters are often lost in scene him due his commanding nature however while the star goodman is actually not at the center of the the movie is really the story of the four teenagers discovering who they are and what they want against background where at any minute it could all end thought the kids reaction were highly realistic they tried block it out they tried escape from the concerns of their world unfortunately it kept creeping back in particularly the fear and the chaos of the time while the comedy centered on goodman and the drama on the teens there was great deal of overlap several aspects of the panic are shown in humorous light one example is scene where people are fighting each other for the the last cans and boxes of food in grocery store if you think about it the threat of nuclear annihilation seems hardly be the backdrop for comedy but it works here another reason like this is that like science fiction movies one of my favorite films go watch is plan from outer space note did not say it was one of my favorite movies but one of my favorite see while mant never got made many films like it were and mant serves mostly as dantes homage the bfilms he loves so again would like recommend matinee anybody looking for good humorous story this is not gag like many other comedies but an intelligent wellthought out about real people real problems told in an often hilarious way enjoy

when _star wars_ came out some twenty years ago the image of traveling throughout the stars has become commonplace image when the millenium falcon moves throughout the stars we see constellations meteor showers and cool spaceships when han solo goes light speed the stars change bright lines going towards the viewer in lines that converge at an invisible point cool _october sky_ offers much simpler imagethat of single white dot traveling horizontally across the night sky was it really only forty years ago when sputnik was launched and that before then no satellites ever existed have we become so technologically advanced that we have forgotten that it was nearly two generations ago where people stood outside breathlessly see thentechnological achievement even though it was from the russians it sounds hokey but when that scene occurs near the beginning of _october sky_ found myself caught up the enthusiasm of homer hickam played jake gyllenhaal determined make dent in the space race he becomes transfixed his desire make rocket that could fly like the best of them it is films like this that we know the ending as we buy the ticket when lovely teacher miss riley played laura dern suggests that he enters his findings into the national science fair we know exactly who is going win but the joy in like this is in the little details for example homer is clearly not the strongest student in his class if he has any strengths whatsoever it is an undeterring vision and good organizer it means that he may have lose his reputation associating the nerdiest kid in school who knows more about rocket science than he does it means that if his father forbids him shoot rockets on company property that is the entire coalmining town he must walk eight miles one way just set up the rockets will fail fail fail and fail again homers dad is played chris cooper favorite actor of mine since _lone star_ here he plays the antithesis of the character he played in _matewan_ instead of organizing union rallies he is the head of the coalminers who is constantly wringing his hands against the unions this is will be one of the great unnoticed performances of the year note how multidimensional his character is he is his sons last nemesis as one who most likely interferes his sons dreams but he truly loves his son and wants see him succeed the only way he knows how through coalmining because of his character we can see how far weve come the revolution of modern technology has allowed for us see society advanced at rate far faster than any generation before us we dont understand that there were the generations from the industrial revolution who knew of no other way raise family the paradigm was shifting under the fathers feet and he knew of no other life so _october sky_ far from being merely feelgood inspirational offers much food for thought and this is the best type of inspirational the one that you take something you btw the final image of the is just as simple is as strong contrast as the aforementioned horizontalmoving white dot against the nightsky background another commonplace image be sure but it must have been breathtaking forty years ago

warning contains what the matrix is rated for scifi violence starring keanu reeves laurence fishburne joe panteliano some may be disappointed the matrix will tell you was sat there and sat there and sat there waiting for something happen now wait wait know most of you loved it and am not saying did not like it what am saying is the first half was extremely slow now seeing the trailer it makes you think the whole entire movie is one big special effects show do not be fooled this movie has big story and big chunks of talky moments but will admit the special effects and the acting were above par deserving the rating above ok now the story well this may take while ok first of all our world we live in now is not the real world actually we live inside computer generated world known as the matrix man played keanu reeves is about find that out when is kidnapped and almost coaxed go into the real world he does so and finds out that he can do anything be anything he wants be but he has fight matrix skipping bad guy who wants send him back his own world or destroy him laurence fishburne his guide of sorts plays his character well as does keanu reeves but sat in the theatre for over and hour wondering where all the special effects were yeah there were some in the first half but not enough the trailer for this movie was really decieving making people think that this was special effects laden movie now for the second half it is explosive and saves the movie some of the special effects and fighting were breathtaking the sound the music and all the effects were effective and the last hour kept us entertained but running time of hours and minutes this movie is at least minutes too long one would have wished for better matrix but do have say did like it and was entertained

every year crowns new it boy young actor pegged for major movie stardom inheriting the mantle from last years winner matthew mcconaughey is matt damon and like mcconaughey he proves be more than just fresh young face as evidenced in two radically different projects currently in releasejohn grishams the rainmaker and good will hunting damon has his first major starring role la mcconaughey in john grisham adaptationin this case francis ford coppolas take on the rainmaker damon plays wetbehindtheears attorney rudy baylor who immediately after passing the bar exam finds himself representing the mother mary kay place of terminally ill young man john whitworth in bigleague suit against negligent insurance company while rudys and the films main concern is this case he also finds time protect young wife claire danes from her abusive husband melrose placer andrew shue in mercifully brief role written for the screen and directed coppola the rainmaker is the best grisham yet mostly because it does not take itself too seriously coppolas most notableand effectivecontribution the triedandtrue grisham formula is sense of humor about itself largely comes in the presence of danny devito as rudys unlicensed cocounsel and golden globe nominee jon voight as the insurance companys hotshot attorney the inclusion of the battered wife subplot feels rather superfluous but danes is as superb as always then of course there is damon who nicely juggles the weighty the insurance case the spousal abuse and the humorous rudys often comical naivete requirements of his role without missing beat as good as he is in the rainmaker damon showcases the depth of his talent in good will hunting directed gus van sant and written actor ben affleck and damon himself damon plays the title character will hunting troubled young construction workerjanitor at mit who also happens be supergenius in an attempt steer this brilliant young mind in the right direction an mit math professor stellan skarsgard taps his old college friend community college psychologist sean mcguire robin williams counsel the abrasive standoffish will and try help him come terms his turbulent life good will hunting is the touchyfeely enterprise its plot synopsis suggests but simply dismiss it as that would be discount the true emotional chords affleck and damons intelligent script touches even though no one and if so _very_ few people can directly relate wills burden of superhuman intelligence the insecurities he suffers are universal the material is brought life the terrific ensemble of actors williams delivers nice dramatic turn affleck hot upandcoming actor himself chasing amy turns up in warm and charming performance as wills best friend and the everappealing minnie driver shines as wills harvardschooled love interest the clear standout in the cast though is damon who bravely does not soften wills prickly nature but has such natural ease the audience that it is hard _not_ care for him so many names come and go the fluctuations of the hype machine but based on his impressive work in john grishams the rainmaker and especially good will hunting it is safe bet that matt damon is one name we will be hearing lot more of in the years come

synopsis leonard shelby pearce is former insurance investigator on the trail of the man who killed his wife leonard has only few clues the murderers identity make matters worse he suffers from condition inhibits the creation of shortterm memories meaning that leonard is always forgetting what happened just minutes earlier because of this leonard is forced rely on notes he leaves for himself memento traces the investigation back in time from its apparent culmination review memento is the sort of movie wish would written can think of no higher praise than that am envious that nolan has concocted such brilliant involved original movie as this an instant noir classic memento is virtually flawless the script is unlike any have ever seen notable achievement in these days of recycled homogeneity although the idea of starting at the conclusion of the plotline and then moving backward in time the start is not entirely new never before have witnessed it executed such flair and coherence memento is endlessly exciting and inventive rare story keeps the viewers guessing during the itself and mulling over its connotations long after leaving the theatre and it is not merely an exercise in cerebrality there is plenty of action and an unexpected dose of humour keep the proceedings lively nolans direction is equally effective never losing its crispness and clarity despite memento challenging gimmick and top everything off all the performances rise the occasion pierce is terrific as the troubled leonard moss shows great range as enigmatic natalie and pantolianos teddy achieves splendidly affable yet sinister quality memento may be the years best screenplay and is certainly amongst the top theatrical attractions of

earth is harsh unconsoling drama about the time when india gained independence from britain and the ensuing turmoil that engulfed the subcontinent people who supposedly loved the same land and the same god found themselves in bitter conflict as the country divided into factions fighting in the streets indian and pakistani muslim hindu sikh parsee the story takes place in lahore was indian before partition and pakistani afterward regardless of what its citizens might call themselves the action is seen through the eyes of lenny maaia sethna young parsee girl but it is really about her nanny shanta shanta has small circle of male admirers two of the men are suitors hasan rahul khanna hindu and dil navaz aamir khan muslim the otherssikh hindu muslimare older some are married but all appreciate shanta who is played the stirringly beautiful nandita das she also starred in deepa mehtas previous fire the first part of thematic trilogy will conclude water in an early scene the men are sitting in park talking shanta and lenny political tension in the country is growing as the day of independence nears one of the men remarks jokingly that their little group is probably one of the last places in the city where the different religions can still get along he is wrong the men make barbed little comments each other spoken like jokes but an undercurrent of fanaticism the tenor of these exchanges grows darker and more bitter as the movie progresses it is easy perceive in these squabbles the trajectory ends in mass violence and slaughter the group around shanta represents in sense united india and shanta herself the ideal motherlandone all love inspires hindu muslim and sikh live peacably together but the circle around shanta is sundered as is the state sikh is persecuted hides then flees another man is murdered the group of friends will not meet again the movie is rife images of breakage and destruction plate shattered on the floor stuffed toy torn apart an upset child and most brutally when the tension escalates into violence man is held down tied between two cars and ripped in half the opposing movement of the vehicles it is visceral and effective metaphor for country is being destroyed just as painfully the crux of earths plot is the transformation undergone dil navaz his sisters are killed in brutal fashion hindus because they are muslim dil navaz seeks solace from shanta and asks in desperation that she marry him but she loves hasan and tenderly refuses dil navazs offer the combination of familial anguish and romantic rejection twists inside him and it is easy see how he is seduced the growing mob mentality the muslim cause gives him motive vent his anger and hate despite the things he later does it is the credit of earth that it does not simply denounce dil navaz and those like him but shows how circumstances can make decent enough men do monstrous things the conclusionthe consequence of dil navazs transformationis rather abrupt the story earth tells does not end it just stops it is an appropriate finish giving us closure would have imparted at least on an aesthetic level sense of resolution of satisfaction but there was no resolution for india and pakistanthey have been at war on small or large scale for decades since the personal dramas in earth mirror the political struggles of nation it is only right that those dramas should have no terminus there is no healing be had no closure on any level despite the needless tackedon ending voiceover narration from lenny as an adult framing the story earth is in some ways an unexceptional movie it does not reinvent the wheel following instead the standard pattern of historical dramas but deepa mehtas directon is assured and the issues she addresses run deep earth does for india what movies like zhang yimous live and tian zhuangzhuangs the blue kite did for china they show us the agonies endured unremarkable people who had the bad luck be caught up and smashed in the crucible of history such films strike me as inherently valuable even when flawed they may be biased or inaccurate but they bear the weight of human hardship and this confers on them nobility and gravity other more inventive films often lack it is notable that all three movies were banned in their native countries the events shown may have happened decades ago but they still touch nerve the issues tackled in earth have particular urgency in light of the nuclear test bombings that took place last year in the near future india and pakistan may launch nuclear missiles at each other at the time of the tests had some understanding of the reasons why this might happen after seeing earth have much much better understanding

up until about year ago john travoltas career consisted of those look who is talking movies notice how they never called them look who is talented and the bomb shout was bad enough make most people scream but somewhere along the line travolta got the starring role in the tarantino masterpiece pulp fiction and his career soared once again weird how someone whose career was on par the bee gees back in would experience fame and fortune once again while barry robin and maurice gibb could do no better than straighttothecutoutbin album aptly named size is not everything and of course they learned that sales are everything but now travoltas back on the scene once again and think we all know why four words contract the devil and this has nothing do newt gingrichs contract america no satan is much more humane anyway yes travolta has sold his soul the hairy host of the netherworld how do know own the document in question amazing what you can buy at those collectors shops for few hundred dollars is not it get shorty continues in the vein of pulp fiction travolta as crime minion chili palmer he goes collect some of the mafias money from bgrade director gene hackman and suddenly finds out he wants out of the mob game and into the movie game sure ruthless criminal like him is far too honest make it in but guess that is beside the point palmer is determined get hackmans next project made so he sets out convince big star martin weir danny devito star in the movie bringing along downandout horror actress karen flores rene russo who has already had affairs hackman and devito it does not take las vegas oddsmaker predict that she and travolta will soon be hitting the sheets as well after the customary sexual tension and denial has been used in every comedy from who is the boss speechless it works in this case unlike who is the boss although it is interesting note that tony danza has signed contract the devil also complicating matters somewhat are the mobsters who have backed hackmans other films and want in on this one too along travoltas mob boss trying track him down for defecting get shorty is no means on the same level as pulp fiction despite the obvious similarities this movie does not have near the amount of originality or depth as pulp fiction but it is definitely one of the most entertaining movies have seen this year yes even better than halloween vi get shorty is my kind of movie one that mixes intelligent humor action and violence am definitely going have check out the novel it was based on are you getting this shorty

i was fortunate enough attend an advance screening for the upcoming thriller conspiracy theory this was of course big deal for me because reviewing movies is basically just hobby for me and never get chance at something like this not only did get see an advance screening was able see an advance screening of very good movie the very fastpaced stars mel gibson as jerry fletcher fasttalking witty comical taxi driver in new york city gibsons performance is terrific and his character is similar that of martin riggs in the lethal weapon films gibson again teams up richard donner as he did in the lethal weapon films and maverick and this time around the combination works even better the character of jerry fletcher is indeed unique try imagine toneddowned version of travis bickle who this time around is jittery guy knowledge of government conspiracy coverups if you can imagine that then you have basically got jerry fletcher in many ways was surprised this movie begin was surprised at how good it was do not get me wrong it is not going be accepting any gold trophies next spring but it was very enjoyable movie secondly was surprised at mel gibsons performance he provided fantastic performance the previews of this led me believe it was an allout action flick after viewing it was almost the opposite in certain sense gibsons character has an almost uncountable number of oneliners hilarious situations and his character is one that the audience tends side throughout the for instance jerrys apartment and especially his security is memorable and last was surprised at how good the plot is writer brian helgeland has created terrific story and when watching this you are left wonder if all of jerry fletchers farfetched or so they seem at first conspiracy theories are helgelands own opinions mel gibson is not the only standout in the julia roberts is very good in her performance as alice sutton the department of justice employee who cannot seem stay away from jerry fletcher who continually visits alice in hopes that she will do something about his theories he also seems obsessed and in love her but whenever he approaches her another one of his theories she shrugs him and his beliefs off continually noting that one day she is going slap restraining order on him jerry obviously determined continually seek out the truth continues research information for his next conspiracy theory will be printed in his newsletter same title as the movie although he only has five subscribers he puts large amount of time and effort into his work and publishes his next edition very soon after he does so he is abducted and tortured sinister man who refers himself as dr jonas patrick stewart after barely escaping alive jerry is forced turn the only person he can trust alice sutton the remainder of the is almost always fastpaced and full of action and suspense jerrys life being constantly put into jeopardy and more along the way the audience and alice learn more and more about jerrys life many things are explained throughout this both the characters and the audience for instance the meaning of the book the catcher in the rye and its ties assassins the reason lone gunmen have three names g lee harvey oswald and james earl ray and the real truth behind the grateful dead make sure listen closely throughout the as jerry is constantly throwing out interesting tidbits such as the above definitely when conspiracy theory hits theaters august th make sure you are standing in line see it am nearly positive everyone should enjoy this especially if you are into an actionthriller witty dialogue and numerous suspenseful situations and even if you are not you should still like this

the disney studios has its formula for annual fulllength animated features down so pat that it is hard remember one you are watching at any given moment mulan their th animated adventure is the latest case in point once again we have tale focused around strong central character female as usual disney is one of the few studios whose heroinesariel belle pocahontas and now mulanget equal screen time their heroes in recent years add the requisite love interest and wisecracking sidekick or two pep up the soundtrack handful of strategically placed show tunes an introspective number pool or looking in mirror rousing anthem cutesy montagebacked crowd pleaser pose few threats our engaging lead and tie things all up neatly the closing credits bobs your uncle better make that walts your uncle kids will no doubt go gaga over mulan or at least the fast food tieins but familiarity can after while leave grownupsthis reviewer includedwishing for little more maybe an animated feature withoutshock horror the songs for example or maybe in cheeky chihuahua called pepe longs become matador from trinidad how about simply ditching the sidekicks altogether it is not gonna happen like disneys previous entries mulan is slow make its mark the animation tends suffer from some slackness in the early going and the humorous element madcap dragon wannabe in the guise of loquacious lizard case of dry mouth courtesy eddie murphys animated vocal talents plays like an inappropriate if necessary formulawise afterthought however after about an hour everything comes together and the formula like it or not clicks highlights include spectacular cavalry charge on snowcovered pass due the sophistication of todays computergenerated imagery is hard tell from the real thing memorable showstopping musical interlude will make man out of you penned matthew wilder and david zippel and last but not least mulan herself voiced mingna wen mulan is disneys strongest female character date when hordes of huns pour over chinas great wall and threaten overthrow the imperial palace the emperor decrees that every family in the land dispatch one man serve in the imperial army since mulans father is infirm but proud the highspirited mulan steals her fathers armor and incognito signs up face the mongolian menace attracted but not distracted her commanding officer shang d wong mulan outmatches her fellow combatants in smarts wit and physical ability she is woman of the a couple of millennia ahead of her time

i had been expecting more of this movie than the less than thrilling twister twister was good but had no real plot and no one simpithize but twister had amazing effects and was hoping so would volcano volcano starts tommy lee jones at emo he worrys about small earthquake enough leave his daughter at home baby sitter there is one small quake then another quake then geologist points out tommy that its takes geologic event heat millions of gallons of water in hours few hours later large amount of ash start fall then it starts the volcanic eruption liked this movie but it was not as great as hoped was still good none the less it had excellent special effects the best view the helecopters flying over the streets of volcanos also there were interesting side stories that made the plot more interesting so it was good

disneys th animated feature retooling of the olympian legend crossed well the superman story is surprisingly soft at the center great wit great art and great villain james woods as hades lord of the underworld and local lounge act cannot quite stifle the yawns induced bland hero his colorfully monotonous sidekick danny devito as the satyrical trainer phil and largely unremarkable soundtrack none of the alan menkendavid zippel tunes are particular ly noteworthy some lack lyrical snap others need more memorable melodies boring ballads we expect but boring production numbers too so hercules is bit of long sit but you will not stay bored the highlights include nifty round of animated action herc battling cgi hydra steady stream of anachronisms somebody call ixii and pop references let us get ready rumble la aladdin and several longoverdue jabs at the mouses marketing and merchandising depart ments while not as rocksolid as hunchback it is still new world of improvement over pocohontas directed ron clements and john musker voice credits including tate donovan susan egan bob goldthwait matt frewer samantha eggar paul shaffer and as lighting bolt zeus rip torn who is having very good summer also appearing in trial and error and men in black

the computeranimated comedy shrek is designed be enjoyed on different levels different groups for children it offers imaginative visuals appealing new characters mixed host of familiar faces loads of action and barrage of big laughs including numerous gags related body functions and yucky substances apparently requisite in contemporary family films for adults it is fractured fairy tale packed rude jokes that will sail over the heads of the kids all in all shrek is snappy ride although there are couple of points found disturbing but first the basics based very loosely on childrens story shrek follows several momentous days in the life of the title character rotund green ogre voiced mike myers in that pleasant scottish accent he is so fond of using shrek is grumpy fellow living solitary life deep in the swamp until local nobleman disturbs his peace petty tyrant lord farquaad take away the awk in the middle and you have the basis of string of impolite oneliners owns the land on shrek resides he proceeds turn the ogres yard into an ellis island for storybook characters when he banishes the fanciful beings from his castle as result shrek finds himself surrounded legends like the three blind mice pinocchio the big bad wolf the seven dwarfs and the three bears name but few an enraged shrek storms the castle only find farquaad john lithgow ready bargain lord obnoxious wants become king and the magic mirror from snow white has shown him the way all he has do is rescue damsel in distress and make her his wife the mirror unveils three choices in presentation straight out of the dating game when snow white is shown the cheeky announcer purrs even though she lives seven men she is not easy farquaad selects the lovely princess fiona cameron diaz and offers shrek deal if the ogre snatches fiona from the dragonprotected lava moatfilled castle in she is held captive and brings her the throne the lord will allow the fairy tale pests move back on his grounds shrek reluctantly agrees and sets off on his quest accompanied motormouthed donkey eddie murphy determined make the green grump his best friend they finally hook up the princess only learn she is not the helpless maiden they expected meet for the matter the dragon offers few surprises as well the movie references great many other flicks from babe thatll do donkey thatll do the graduate but the lions share of the jokes come at the expense of the wonderful world of disney the publicdomain characters made into icons in various disney films take their hits pinocchio is referred as possessed toy and when shrek spies sleeping snow white in his cabin he bellows get that dead broad off the table but the biggest slams come when shrek visits farquaads royal domicile closely resembles certain magic kingdom from its souvenir stands and queue lines display of animatronic figures that sing the palace rules in relentlessly peppy tune that sounds lot like it is small world brings me disturbing point number one laughed at all the disney swipes but found the mentality behind them bit sad the acrimony between dreamworks honcho jeff katzenberg and disney big wheel michael eisner is well known for years the two companies have tried sabotage each others and video releases issuing similar competing productions on the same day and now we have katzenberg using an entire movie attack his former employer heres suggestion for the two boys grow up put the past behind you there is room in the sandbox for both of you and if you farquaads cannot play nice then go your rooms the other area found troubling came in the portrayal of lord farquaad beyond all the irreverence shrek actually has message people should learn look beyond physical appearances because true beauty lies within it is lovely notion but the betrays its own moral incessantly taking cheap shots at farquaads diminutive stature do we really need family reinforcing the idea that mocking short people is acceptable the pompous selfish behavior of farquaad is enough make him target for zingers adding short jokes is simply mean still shrek is rollicking good time the computer animation is mostly impressive although several key characters look like animated rubber squeeze toys and the human movements are often jerky the voice work is strong particularly from eddie murphy the laughs come fast and furious and the moral tainted though it may be is good one trot out clich shrek is fun for all ages parents though should remind their young ones during the ride home that taunting others because they are short tall skinny fat etc is bad thing

after watching the first ten minutes of this japanese you will never eat bowl of ramen the same way again there is scene where an old man is teaching young one how eat the soupy bowl of noodles as master would teach an eager apprentice you caress the noodles the chopsticks he says then put the roast pork on the side of the bowl and apologize it saying see you soon of course it is meant be parody but there is an earnestness underneath the silliness that makes you take it certain degree of sobriety you begin appreciate the food as not merely something you eat not something you like not something you enjoy but rather something you experience experiencing it is process engages all of the senses fulfilling each one on its own terms and weaving them so that the total is pleasure that is more than the sum of its parts trust me you really want go find noodle shop at this point juzo itamis tampopo brings the same sense of the serious parody of food the forefront making the story follow the pattern of an american western set in modern day japan stranger goro tsutomu yamazaki comes into town and finds tampopo nobuko miyamoto the proprietor of small holeinthewall noodle shop trying fend off the insults of the local strongman pisken rikiya yasuoka goro defend the honor of this woman and her noodles gets into fight the ringleader and his henchmen emerging bloodied but victorious goro finds that tampopos ambition is have shop that people would flock from far away just eat bowl of her ramen the problem is her fare is something less than popular and less than appetizing however goro agrees help tampopo in her quest and in the process they seek the wisdom of an elderly noodle expert enlist the aid of wealthy patron and make friends the former enemy this is filled many little scenes are absolute gems take for example when tampopo tries buy the recipe for delicious soup from another shop owner the price is too high but the owner of the store next door will secretly sell it her for more affordable sum tampopo meets him at his store late at night and he leads her back room she protests thinking that perhaps this man has ulterior motives but he insists just when she is about bolt for the exit he shows her small gap in the wall adjoining his store the noodle shop next door she peers through and takes notes as she watches the cook make the soup for the next day her face filled joy that can be felt the audience this scene while comical is very effective at filling the viewer sense of trepidation then of relief and discovery there is also an interesting scene where goro introduces tampopo and her son bunch of street people who despite their economic trappings are all gourmets and master sommeliers we even watch as one of them sneaks into the kitchen of restaurant and expertly prepares french omelet the scene is meant bring laugh but it also says that no matter whether people are rich or poor food is something everyone has in common and the enjoyment of food is an experience shared all there are also number of unrelated vignettes appearing throughout the help illustrate and accentuate the role of food in peoples lives particularly effective one involves wife and mother being tended in her home doctor surrounded her children she is obviously in her last hours of life her husband comes home and seeing her worsened condition demands that she get up and make dinner the viewer knows the husbands intention is not be mean he is desperate for the normalcy of he and his family has obviously been deprived and the wife making dinner is an essential part of this in near miracle the wife drags herself the kitchen and prepares quick meal then brings it her awaiting family as the family eats she looks on them and smiles preparing food for her family is joy and comfort her and for brief moment she too enjoys the normalcy then she falls over dead for moment the family is stunned but then the father yells at the children keep eating this is the last meal your mother ever made crying as they do so the family finishes the meal the scene is comical awkward moving and beautiful including the vignettes itami ran the risk of creating disjointed but surprisingly they do not interrupt the pacing of the main storyline instead they even help contribute the idea that tampopos goal of being able serve exceptional food is worthy and even noble because the parodies western the construction of the plot is fairly predictable but is still enjoyable as we watch the familiar way in the good guys come together for the final showdown in this case the showdown is against the ramen if they eat tampopos ramen soup and all tampopo knows she has succeeded it is pretty obvious what the outcome will be but when changes your whole perspective on something you consume every day of your life you can afford cut it little slack

there is an old saying that states something about leaving the best for last george lucas certainly followed that adage when crafting the original star wars trilogy return of the jedi the final installment of the series is easily the most innovative actionpacked and entertaining of the three films the dark eerie atmosphere that oozed from every frame of the empire strikes back is gone instead for return of the jedi we have good triumphing decisively over evil resolution love triangle and walking teddy bears even darth vader does not seem very intimidating this time around the arrival of the emperor an apparitionlike creature played ian mcdiarmid vader has turned into somewhat of henchman return of the jedi picks up at an unspecified time after the conclusion of the empire strikes back luke skywalker mark hamill princess leia carrie fisher lando calrissian billy dee williams chewbacca peter mayhew cp anthony daniels and rd kenny baker are on rescue mission lukes home planet of tatooine their goal save han solo harrison ford from the clutches of the intergalactic gangster jabba the hutt it is at jabbas home creepylooking stone fortress guarded hognosed beasts that most of the added special effects come into play from hysterical scene involving music group the dreaded beast outside jabbas sand barge the effects are top notch as soon as han is freed from his cryofreeze and rescued from the clutches of the evil jabba the hutt it is back outer space where the rebel alliance is about face the empires newest threat second more powerful death star that if activated could spell doom for anyone who stands against the emperor so while the fleet prepares for the final battle luke and company travel the forest moon of endor knock out the shield that defends the death star against all attacks there they are befriended the ewoks the teddy bearlike native race and luke fearing that his presence is endangering the group turns himself over vader return of the jedi has some interesting elements the scenes pitted luke against the emperor and vader are suitably tense and wellacted from technical pointofview the space battles are amazing easily hindering anything depicted in the previous films not only are there many many more ships but their speed and range of movement have been dramatically improved on one level return of the jedi is almost worth watching for the special effects in the special edition even more ships are added making the final space battle incredibly fun watch the acting in return of the jedi is stronger than in the previous films now or then mark hamill harrison ford and carrie fisher have all matured in their onscreen personas the chemistry amongst the trio is terrific as in empire billy dee williams gives us another human hero root for newcomer ian mcdiarmid plays the emperor as suitably creepy cunning and evil creature although he is not as imposing as vader was in star wars although it was great fun watching star wars and the empire strikes back on the big screen return of the jedi generates greater sense of enjoyment the spectacular new special effects the adorable ewoks the sinister jabba the hutt the evil emperor the same old millenium falcon darth vaders incredible betrayal the destruction of the new death star and the always lovable yoda return of the jedi concludes one of the greatest trilogies ever made huge bang congratulations george lucas whose innovative mind entertains us now and will continue entertain generations come

why do so many childrens films treat their target audience utter contempt too many of those who write or direct for childrens movies assume that the kids just cannot handle serious thoughtful discussions on meaningful issues the iron giant was directed and cowritten brad bird late of such animated series as the simpsons and king of the hill assumes that not only can children handle such discussions but that they can do so while being entertained at the same time the iron giant holds absolutely no contempt for the young people in the audience making it that is enjoyable for both children and adults alike hogarth hughes voice of eli marienthal is spirited young lad who lives his hardworking single mother annie jennifer aniston in small town in maine after staying up late and watching scary movies on night his mother is away hogarth treks out into the forest investigate what has stolen his antenna and ruined his tv reception he comes across giant robot vin diesel from space that eats metal for food after saving the robot nicknamed the iron giant from electric shock hogarth befriends the creature and takes him in as pet of sorts because of damage he suffered upon landing the giant has forgotten what his original mission was so he just follows hogarth around like lost puppy realizing he cannot just keep the giant in barn all the time and that the giant needs food he takes him junkyard owned dean harry connick jr an eccentric artist who assembles sculptures out of scrap iron in his spare time it soon becomes apparent that dean and hogarth cannot keep the giant secret forever because government spook named kent mansley christopher mcdonald has been brought in investigate mysterious sightings in the surrounding forest area and considers the giant threat national security he suspects hogarth knows something about the giant and takes up residence in hogarths house as lodger meanwhile the giant begins exhibit ominous behavior that suggests he was built be weapon of some kind the iron giant is exactly what family films ought be because it doesn talk down its audience the story is simple very simple about an alien being that drops out of the sky and befriends young boy it is very similar the spielberg classic t and such comparisons are actually deserved in the case of the iron giant the holds many of the better elements of spielbergs such as the ability be sentimental without turning sappy the delivers several serious messages the most important of is ones ability choose ones own fate hogarth teaches the giant go against his programming and become what he wants be hero the final sequence is touching and appropriate though will not give it away will say that very few will be disappointed the animation while not up disney standards what could be after tarzan is good enough make you forget you are watching cartoon the giant is computeranimated while the human characters are all handdrawn the oldfashioned way the characters faces are done quite well drawn realistically enough make the personalities credible but the features are exaggerated so as allow for the cartoonish expressions that provide for comic relief fine voice work is turned in young eli marienthal as hogarth and jennifer aniston is surprisingly convincing as his waitress mother harry connick jr does nice characterization as dean and really enjoyed the voice work of john mahoney of tvs frasier as an army general called in agent mansley unlike several cartoon features each character is actually developed personality rather than stereotype and is actually integral the plot rather than being superfluous comicrelief sidekick clich disney still has not ditched dean for example could have been stereotypical beatnik his character profile seems suggest that but he is presented as character real emotions thoughts and motivations even the heavy agent mansley is not villain who does bad things simply because he wants but out of his own fear and paranoia lesser animated feature would have drawn up paperthin stereotypes and figure the kids will not mind but the iron giant has clearly put little work into making the characters real and it pays off the is not only around deliver heavyhanded messages though it is also very funny and the humor is of the kind that both children and adults will enjoy the scenes in hogarth teaches the giant do certain things such as dive into pool are handled well and director brad bird clearly has sense of comic timing having worked on the simpsons for many years sequence where hogarth and mansley attempt outlast one another trying stay awake is very nicely timed and also extremely clever the even takes some jabs at americas nuclear paranoia during the early stages of the cold war satirizing the lame safety films shown grade school students that tell them duck and cover in the event of nuclear attack the iron giant has much more of satirical edge it than most family films and the edgy humor is actually quite refreshing instead of seeing people get bonked on the head we get welltimed clever gags that seem have required some imagination come up when you get right down it the iron giant is no more than the story of boy and his robot the story is so straightforward so quaint that it ultimately becomes charming though enjoy the complex plotting of noir as much as the next person when it comes family entertainment simple is the way go it is akin one of those bedtime stories your father told that had you hanging on his every word but it is not the story that sets the above others of its kind but rather the elements that go into the story namely real characters and thoughtful dialogue the iron giant has in spades

susan grangers review of the closet miramax films in this hilarious french farce shy boring accountant daniel auteil named francois pignon discovers he is going be fired from his job at condom factory lonely and distraught he contemplates suicide but then he runs into belone michel aumont an elderly homosexual neighbor who suggests sex discrimination lawsuit intimidate management as evidence belone concocts provocative photographs of pignon locked in leatherclad embrace another man and mails them anonymously pignons boss when the racy snapshots start circulating around the factory not only does pignon get his job back but he suddenly finds himself the focus of attention as an openly gay man his lusty supervisor michele laroque is so intrigued that she wonders if perhaps she could change his sexual preferences even his exwife alexandra vandernoot and indifferent teenage son stanislas crevillen drop their disdain but not everyone is enchanted mucho macho coworker felix gerard depardieu selfrighteous homophobe is stunned and repulsed when he is forced the pr director thierry lhermite grovel and court pignons friendship or risk losing his own job writerdirector francis verber artfully milks the farcical comedy as he dissects the hypocrisy of political correctness veering offtrack only occasionally into pedophilia daniel auteuil the widow of saintpierre is delightful particularly blownup condom perched on his head riding on float in gay pride parade and gerard depardieu delivers one of his most restrained and effective performances on the granger movie gauge of the closet is frankly sexual adult it is so clever in fact that is already planning remake it in english like la cage aux folles

roman emperor marcus aurelius richard harris chooses his trusted general maximus russell crowe as his successor however the emperors evil son commodus joaquin phoenix murders his father before the announcement can be made and maximus as well as his family is sentenced be executed maximus is able escape his executioners but is later captured and sold as slave proximo oliver reed proximo is looking for gladiators earn himself money he being former gladiator himself and maximus reluctantly uses his skills prove himself powerful gladiator when emperor commodus announces that new games will be held in the colisseum proximo takes his gladiators there do battle maximus sees this as his chance exact revenge on commodus gladiator begins great battle sequence between the roman army and germania and actually is able maintain interest during the now required minutes of exposition after kick ass opening sequence style of moviemaking the only downfall of the opening sequence is the editing style used it is choppy slowmotion is unsettling and distracting it is similar the opening sequence in saving private ryan but nowhere near as effective the actual gladiator battles are thrilling but also bit disjointed many times it is unclear as exactly what is going on all the audience can tell is that blood is being spilled we are not sure who is blood or who is hand though there is an instance of this earlier in the too that is disappointing it is comes when maximus escapes his executioners some flashes and few quick cuts later and maximus is free but still do not know exactly how he did it russell crowe should have become major star after his gleefully over the top role as computer generated serial killer in virtuosity for whatever reason his stardom never arrived but he should have it now from here on moviegoers should now be able say let us go see the new russell crowe movie he gets the best scene in the and one of the best moments of all recent movies when he reveals his identity commodus in the colisseum it is both rousing and chilling joaquin phoenix does very effective job of making commodus person and not just cartoon character could have easily happened commodus is conniving sneaky and whiny but phoenix never lets the character get silly it is very good and very creepy performance oliver reed died during the filming of gladiator and it is huge loss the acting world have always been fascinated reed he is one of those very talented performers who once had fine career but ended up in direct video junk during his twilight years it is ironic that this probably would have gotten him back into real movies again as he gives fun and sincere performance the is dedicated him and he will surely be missed reeds death presented the filmmakers an obvious problem as he still had scenes be completed rather than recast the role and end up reshooting great deal of footage digital version of oliver reed was created at reported cost of million dollars ironically that was probably more money than reed ever earned for single anyway this digital effect is only used in one scene that am aware of for about twenty seconds and if you are not looking for it you will not even be able tell some of the other digital effects are less convincing however and like always say noticable digital effects take me out of movie immediately it is sad that such good has these distractions movies like the fall of the roman empire and spartacus seemed do okay without the use of computer effects keep in mind that gladiator is based on real people and real events but is entirely work of fiction however it is work of fiction that is great entertainment and another add the list of damn fine flicks released in d

what great what stunning touching heartwrenching heartwarming lifeaffirming miraculous from its opening moments _life is beautiful_ walks that fine line between serious tragedy and uplifting comedy car no brakes speeds through the town and guido roberto benigni motions people move out of the way they mistake him be the fascist president traveling their town that day heil heil huh shortly thereafter the president drives through and people stare blank faces this is standard but somehow fresh and postmodern stuff the clown who is also jew triumphs over the antisemitic society in he lives granted _the great dictator_ comes mindcharlie chaplins almost masterpiece think lib benigni wrote and directed trumps gd in one essential point chaplins jewish barber gives great speech at the climax but do so he had break completely from character benigni is given similar situation he is mistaken as fascist dignitary and must explain classroom filled schoolchildren on how scientists have concluded that aryans are the superior race benignis guido stays in character and delivers the speech keeping the subject matter intact while showing the absurdity of its concept it is one of the great satirical scenes in modern cinema there are many other scenes especially in the first half are bright and loopy and funny and silly slapstick reigns and although the is subtitled there was no doubt that universal language was being conveyed and although its focus is on the courtship of guido dora played nicoletta braschi benignis real life wife silent undercurrent creeps in this is clearly racist society evidenced the aforementioned scene and others and it will soon affect him and his family the second half of the takes place five years later in an unnamed concentration camp where guido dora her insistence and their fiveyear old son giosue giorgio cantarini are deported guido seeing the horrors is desperate protect his wife and child for his wife who is separated from him he must find ways communicate her that he is all right for his son and this is the most controversial part of the he convinces the youngster that this is all one big elaborate game its rules include hiding being very quiet and learning not ask for seconds raises the big questions how do we deal pain persecution injustice on the worst level its said that tragedies bring out the best in people finding strengths they did not realize they had other times they deteriorate become overwhelmed little strength or incentive swim sometimes even people giggle in these moments as if there were vacant emotion behind them yearning for some brightness soothe their wounds benignis guido realizes this he is the clown but he is not fool he sees the slurs and the vandalism and while feeling the weight of the verbal attacks he still has the audacity see if everyone around him perhaps even the antagonists laugh his liberty is stripped but not his dignity and certainly not the dignities of those around him its obvious from the onset that here is someone who is very much against fascism and the preposterousness of an aryan nation but does so grinning joyful demeanor perhaps that is form of denial perhaps his alternate reality is all that he could muster not unlike the very different _brazil_ or perhaps this is an example of great fortitude no weapons but wit whatever his purposes is subject debate but also sure sign that this is one of the great threedimensional characters stranded amidst terrifyingly risky concept surprisingly it works it is an important footnote that this was not intended be an accurate reflection of the holocaust its not that the atrocities are trivialized far from it they dont have be broadcast and explicitly shown muster the same horrorless is more believe that benigni was cautious preserve the tone and like the theory that it is guidos alternate reality that were seeing however any criticism that this is rewriting history that the holocaust wasnt as bad as it seems is simply offtarget benignis has won audience awards at cannes at toronto and is definite shooin for best foreign language hopefully for best picture as well he has been made an honorary jew jerusalem society it swept the italian academy awards controversy notwithstanding it is one of the great films this year and as of this writing the one beat for best masterful miraculous mustsee

ingredients starving artist lusting after beautiful woman from his childhood synopsis great expectations is modernized version of charles dickens novel in the original charles dickens classic an orphan boy named pip learns about life through his friendship an escaped convict his relationship bitter old lady named miss havisham and his hopeless lifetime infatuation havishams snobbish adopted daughter estella the gist of the story is that an anonymous benefactor sends pip london for pip become an upper class gentleman pip leaves for london great expectations be groomed into gentleman so that he can one day be classy enough marry estella but life has way of complicating things pip becomes an arrogant o until he learns just who his secret benefactor is in this new version of great expectations poor florida lad named finn ethan hawke talent for drawing has an early memory of helping an escaped convict robert de niro but soon the focus of finns life becomes romance as he develops lifelong infatuation estella gwyneth paltrow an upper crust girl some psychological and emotional issues due being raised in dysfunctional environment estella was raised in wealth ms dinsmoor anne bancroft an eccentric aged and embittered manhating single aunt whose groom left her abandoned at the altar on the day of her marriage this causes estella fear the daylight of relationships but finn thinks it is just case of snobbery when finn becomes young man an anonymous benefactor sets finn up in new york the connections and publicity be groomed into famous artist finn leaves florida great expectations be successful artist so that some day he might become classy enough marry the snobbish estella what will happen all of finns great expectations opinion if you are looking for romance happy ending look no further you have found one here ethan hawke is romantic lead he romanced winona ryder in reality bites he romanced julie delpy in before sunrise he romanced uma thurman in gattaca
