now in great expectations he gets chase gwyneth paltrow railthin blonde hawke plays lovestruck earnest and unchanged finn throughout the meanwhile paltrow portrays estella as alternating between infuriating tease and ice princess estellas whole purpose is get men fall in love and then hurt them rather than become intimate anne bancroft goes little overboard as the deranged and pessimistic ms dinsmoor while robert de niro carries off the convict part suitably the difference between the classic dickens novel and this adaptation is that the dickens novel is ripe deep and timeless themes about class struggle and love whereas great expectations is more artsy less complicated story about s artist dealing lifetime tease

you have seen this moment before recently particularly troubled character senses danger of the paranormal kind when the room temperature inexplicably plummets below freezing the difference is that when it happens lili taylors nell in the haunting we do not care the hero of the sixth sense young boy named cole is rich creation and we wish nothing more than for the ghosts who haunt him take hike the seasons have changed since an expatient shot jaded child psychologist malcolm crowe willis in the comfort of his own bedroom desperate get his career back on track even at the expense of his crumbling marriage williams of rushmore malcolm councils the deeply troubled cole osment the preteen displays all the quirks of malcolms wouldbe killer scars on his body antisocial behaviour and the reluctance reveal big secret only after cole is locked in closet some bullies and hospitalized as result does he divulge malcolm in spinetingling scene that he sees dead people walking among us all the time malcolm assumes and given his profession reasonably so that cole is schizophrenic not psychic but the sincerity in coles anguished confession prevents the doctor from taking drastic measures he will instead pursue the supernatural angle becoming kind of surrogate father cole who lives his single mother lynn collette in the process the sixth sense has more in common ghost than poltergeist though shyamalan does somewhat unforgiveably crib the selfrearranging kitchen business from the latter it is far more heartwarming than frightening and the would be none the worse for wear without its few pulp shocks cole attracts the dead for reasons unknown but they are not out harm him reallythey just want be heard even if it means scaring the bejesus out of the innocent gradeschooler perhaps the apparitions seem more ghastly us at first than they really are because we are looking at the situation through the eyes of an eightyearold that is right willis for the first time in years gives up the spotlight his costar we appreciate malcolms domestic dilemma but we identify cole recalling our fears of the bogeyman or the closet monster or the thing under the bed both actors deliver immensely likable performances and their dynamic is manifest willis convinces us that he is doctor something he was unable do as horndog shrink in the overheated color of night osment is phenomenal true professional who resists mugging for the camera like some child stars too much experience in television commercials do the sixth sense atmospherically shot the silence of the lambs cinematographer tak fujimoto is actually dramaits spooky effective ad campaign is misleading only because was expecting something different did noticerather feelthe movies running time is just shy of two hours the story unfurls slowly but engrossingly its unexpected finish is definitely worth the wait am not sure said big twist ending is bulletproof but admired its audacity

has really done the whole dracula thing death no pun intended honest it is shame too because the good count was probably the most frightening out the old bmovie monsters mean come on are people really going get that scared over big green guy named frankenstein that moves at speed of five miles per hour hell no and not only was the idea of vampire frightening as hell but it also carried it kind of sensual feeling as well not commonly associated horror films and not only has the idea been done too many times but the possible exception of from dusk till dawn has not been done very well lately either this is precisely why it was so much fun for me watching the original nosferatu got go back the times when making movies even horror movies was considered an art form and not just done make cash like nowadays and that is exactly what this is art have been horror fan since was eight years old and this day have not seen any horror cover the intellectual ground that this covers let me backtrack minute when say intellectual ground do not mean that nosferatu tackles philosophical questions or anything like that just mean that in order for the work the way it was intended little bit of thinking is involved most modern slasher movies like friday the th and whatnot you can just simply sit back in your chair and be frightened the gore that is shown those movies could have been made fifth grader good makeup kit movies like this require the viewer actually pay attention and ponder what is happening on the screen you see this movie has barely any violence in it and even less blood or gore this is thinking mans slasher flick the nosferatu of the title is orlock max shreck strange hermitlike count that as the opens is looking for new home buy he employs the help of hutter gustav von wangenhein real estate salesman or something that effect who has nice home and even fiancee named ellen greta schroeder upon orders from his boss hutter treks the transylvanian mountains visit orlocks castle and speak him about his new home just happens be right next door hutters the next morning he wakes up find teeth marks on his neck not really good sign he then discovers through some reading that the count is nosferatu or vampire one of the undead that feeds off the blood of living humans but the time he pieces this together he is too late orlock has already embarked hutters hometown via boat will hutter reach his destination in time save his fiancee from the deadly clutches of count orlock the character of orlock is of course dracula the only only reason his name was changed was because this was an unauthorized account of bram strockers novel just thought that was an interesting little side note probably the only way you will get see this fine is purchasing copy of arrow entertainments digitally restored cut now available in stores however this version is quite different than maunaus original masterpiece the movie is now sporting new soundtrack band type onegative and color tinting much like the version of langs metropolis now really appreciate what arrow entertainment is trying do here bringing classic like this the attention of wider audience that might have otherwise just skipped this one but alas like watching movies the way they were originally intended be seen but that is just my bag you may like the newer more modern version better either way suggest investing your money in copy if you like what they have done it pop it in the vcr and enjoy if you are like me just do what will do during future viewings turn the color all the way down on your television hit mute turn on some bach or mozart or whatever dim the lights and prepare view what is truly one of the greatest films ever made

stendhals syndrome condition where in the presence of art person becomes engulfed in painting and hallucinates and may afterwards suffer symptoms such as depression suicidal behaviour and personality disorder grim stuff be sure but the subject of remarkable from italys master of the horror thriller dario argento boasting an unforgettable soundtrack from the grandfather of music ennio morricone the stendhal syndrome is quite magnificent return form for argento it follows his disappointing american debut trauma the patchy opera and several mediocre films he produced for young italian director michele soavi in the late based on the novel graziella magherini the stars argentos daughter asia as young roman police inspector anna manni in pursuit of brutal rapistkiller visiting florence follow up several leads she is lured the killer alfredo thomas kretschmann an art gallery favourite haunt where he hopes identify exactly who is on his tail at the gallery anna is overwhelmed painting and faints posing as bystander alfredo briefly comes her aid and having now identified his pursuer strange game of cat and mouse begins gripping story evolves and coherent one too may surprise those familiar argentos often lumpy narratives the stendhal syndrome is not simple cophuntingkiller scenario it is disturbing and often compelling study of the central characters psychological disintegration the script explores its psychosexual themes intelligence and candour perhaps too much so for more sensitive viewers but as dark as its themes are the stendhal syndrome emerges as one of the most artful and effective european thrillers of the last ten years argento is once again working in his native italy and he fully exploits the opportunities use art and architecture for both symbolic statements and as departure points for several brilliant hallucinogenic sequences effects whiz sergio stivaletti serves his director well here and the cinematography giuseppe rotunno is consistently excellent the films opening minutes segues between hallucination flashback and realtime tremendous style proof that at his most inspired argento remains one of the worlds most exhilarating filmmakers the cast is generally good though marred at times dubbing into english that renders speech all but emotionless asia argentos performance is turns risky awkward and fascinating it is difficult role and given her relative inexperience on screen she deserves applause for her efforts thomas kretschmann is chillingly effective as alfredo and marco leonardi of cinema paradiso and possibly the most gorgeous looking man in italy does okay as annas work colleague and increasingly confused love interest but perhaps the stendhal syndromes single most striking element is ennio morricones soundtrack active since the morricone has scored over films in his career and this must rate as one of his finest efforts it is mostly variation on the one theme slow circular melody for strings and wordless female vocal possessed an extraordinary haunting beauty that lingers long afterwards it is been three decades since argento and morricone worked together this is long welcome reunion if the has fault it is that the last half hour drags little and the does not quite reach completely satisfying climax but the closing scenes the stendhal syndrome has already offered us enough qualify as one of the very best films of dario argentos career note see the uncut print from japanese laserdisc if you can dubs of this version are available from various video dealers on the world wide web

close your eyes for moment if you will and imagine the sound of stephen reas gaelic brogue silky smooth and irish like pint of guinness lackadaisical naughty little schoolboy voice that flirts and gambols an acerbic singsong metered voice that evokes the startling imagery and language of anthony burgess clockwork orange voice that deliciously conjures scenes both porcine and puerile like those out of delicatessen or the tin drum imagine all of that and you will get good sense of what you can expect from the butcher boy imagine that and more neil jordans latest stars rea in more ways than one rea the accomplished irish actor most notable from his star turn in jordans the crying game contributes restrained and managed performance as da brady small town drunk in an unnamed irish community in the but it is his walltowall narration as the butcher boy of the title da bradys son francis that makes reas performance worth watching worth listening and that is only half the fun playing the young francie brady is newcomer eamonn owens and he is without doubt revelation for as much as reas voiceover permeates almost every scene of the butcher boy owens commands virtually every frame it is impossible take your eyes off him his crop of carrotcolored hair ruddy complexion and overall grubby appearance francie brady is an unlikely hero refusing be done in his alcoholic trumpetplaying father his depressive suicidal mother or the neighboring bespectacled monster known as mrs nugent fiona shaw in fact everything was ok until the nugent came town now she poses as much threat the safety and security of town bully francie and his best pal joe alan boyle as the looming commie menace the butcher boy is set at time when the fear of nuclear obliteration is first and foremost in the minds of many pigs screams mrs nugent at the brady menagerie you are all pigs it is the start of many related image after ma brady is shipped off the garage for psychiatric observation and da brady downs one bottle of whiskey too many francie finally loses grip of his fantasy world of cowboys and indians the lone ranger and other comicbook characters squealing like stuck pig francie does the likes that on the nugents living room floor and is himself whisked away very catholic remand home for boney arsed bogmen where his ever fertile imaginationand clever chicaneryrunneth over director jordans vivid treatment of pat mccabes nightmare novel produces sometimes disturbing dark comedy littered surreal touches such as sin ad oconnor playing the virgin mary it is not as outlandish as the trailers make out instead this remarkable focuses on the effects external influences have on the friendship between two boys schoolboy chums in real life allowing us empathize their plight in the presence of extraordinary behavior it is bleak and it is black but it is fundamentally very funny rea talks us through it beautifully and owens drags us though it admirably and in tandem jordans sure hand theirs are contributions make the butcher boy worth savoring

zero effect gets its title from the main character daryl zero bill pullman although we do not understand what it truly means until the very last line of dialogue in the zero is private investigator perhaps the best private investigator who ever lived at least he would like think so however he is socially inept being and eccentric in every possible way this fact certainly makes his talents as private eye even more bewildering than they already are zeros accomplice is steve arlo ben stiller normal guy who does the business side of the job he is the one who actually speaks clients and explains zeros greatness as an investigator the opening scene has steve explaining the many virtues of zeros talents soontobe client gregory stark ryan oneal it turns out that stark has lost key safe deposit box and is now being blackmailed for something that he apparently knows nothing about zero takes the case and the plot thickens his path leads young pretty paramedic named gloria sullivan kim dickens despite her luminous and seeminglyharmless presence she turns out be the one blackmailing stark through his investigations zero learns why but not without developing feelings for gloria feelings that because of his reclusive behavior are new and confusing him have no particular affinity towards the mystery genre of can idly enjoy movies about private investigators and every once in while like chinatown comes long that blows me away actually no private eye has ever reached chinatowns greatness zero effect is jake kasdans first effort as writerdirector is about private investigator that succeeds in all attempts it is an original funny and completely involving motion picture so many cliches available this genre find it amazing that kasdan avoided all of them but he did not just successfully avoid flaws he has created great here one that had me interested and fascinated from the first shot the final moment take for starters the great cast of characters pullman is terrific as zero showing comic flair that really have not seen from him since spaceballs zero is the kind of guy who seems at ease switching personalities so frequently as he does here the fact that he is an almost exaggeratedly twisted emotionally unstable man outside of his profession is not at all difficult believe pullmans performance is much more layered than it might seem at first glance and the occasional voiceover as he is going through the motions of his job are insightful and often hilarious ben stiller is also very funny individual he is the kind of comedian who makes normal lines sound funny will shoot you he says stark at one point have gun and everything his character is also welldrawn an interesting subplot involving his girlfriend angela featherstone who is not happy the extensive amounts of time he must spend away from her due the unpredictability of his job oneal also gives his character bit of depth and kim dickens last seen and underused in mercury rising gets chance show us her talent here giving gloria the realism this kind of character really needs find zero effect be an immensely funny and witty kasdans humor is of the best kind soft spoken and mostly dialoguedriven though there are some great visual jokes it is the kind of humor that is funny even after you have seen it five or six times there is one scene in zero talks about how detached he is an how that makes him such great detective what we see during this narration are various shots of him sitting on bed or standing motionlessly his hair destroyed and an utterly blank look painted on his unshaven face his eyes pointing something off camera but obviously nothing in particular cannot convey you how funny this is but what makes it great making is that it has point scenes like this are frequent and they provide solid characterization of zero as side note do not consider myself an average viewer when it comes comedy not sound elitist find things funny that many do not and vice versa there was clump of people near me in the theater laughing uproariously through this and the rest of the theater was relatively silent through most of it have feeling the humor here will not appeal everyone but there is certainly enough story and character development keep anyones interest jake kasdan son of writerdirector lawrence kasdan is only years old found this out after seeing the and cannot remember ever being so impressed maker his direction is stylish without being pretentious and his writing is mature full and developed zero effect is the kind of that will buy for my collection smart original films like this are rare as it is but this one actually has heart and soul at the end of the was involved in the characters and was satisfied the outcome and kasdans undeniable talent at such young age all can do is hope see lot more from him in the future

the long kiss goodnight meryl streep tried it and failed even pamela anderson lee made an attempt but fell flat on her wellbared assets however geena davis could very well become the first bankable american female action star the long kiss goodnight preposterous but incredibly fun action thriller directed her husband renny harlin davis plays samantha caine mousy suburban school teacher and mother whose memories only go back eight years the help of ethically questionable private detective mitch hennessey samuel jackson she slowly remembersand reclaimsher past as charly baltimore toughasnails cia operative needless say the reappearance of samanthacharly comes the appearance of an assortment of nogoodniks out erase more than her memory shane black netted cool mil for his script am not so sure if his prose is truly deserving of such hefty price tag but for what it is worth it delivers the goods like blacks previous work such as lethal weapon and the last boy scout the script juggles some impressive action scenes funny quirky dialogue the humor especially works well in this case for the story is so preposterous that the laughs help keep things from taking things too seriously but there is no argument that the more unbelievable sequences are original and entertaining as hell who can resist the sight of davis tossing her daughter from hole in her house into the nearby treehouse or chasing after car while ice skating jackson and davis make good team jackson is funny as ever as ever in fact his spirited line deliveries especially when he first appears are more than reminiscent of his work as jules in pulp fiction as good as he is the one who should benefit the most from this project is davis who shows much promise as an action heroine what makes her so effective and why she should succeed where streep and lee failed is that she does not take herself too seriously she is obviously in on the joke slyly taking jabs at herself and at the situation this is not say that she does not need worksometimes she lays on the toughness bit too thick and comes off too much as caricature but should the public embrace the and in turn the notion of kickass female davis could have found her special niche it seems as if davis and harlins first collaboration the middling pirate epic cutthroat island was just dress rehearsal albeit very costly one for long kiss in the wifehusband team hit their action stride anyone simply looking for fun escapist entertainment that requires littletono thinking will find this be morethanwelcome kiss

screen story kevin yagher and andrew kevin walker screenplay andrew kevin walker inspired the short story the legend of sleepy hollow washington irving directed tim burton starring johnny depp christina ricci and casper van dien special appearances christopher lee and christopher walken synopsis investigator ichabod crane journeys sleepy hollow investigate series of murders involving decapitation townspeople believe the spirit of dead german mercenary is threatening them cute blonde katrina and listless orphan help crane solve the mystery comments tim burton has directed number of entertaining and groundbreaking films over the years batman of course is perhaps his bestknown and led string of less successful sequels he is done biographical work on the director ed wood childrens movies nightmare before christmas and homage alien invasion movies mars attacks sleepy hollow his newest feature fans have been anticipating for while shares the similar dark and atmospheric style of his earlier work and counts among his better movies sleepy hollow quite obviously draws its inspiration from the old period horror films of the and especially hammer studios reworkings of dracula and frankenstein and american internationals series of movies based on the works of edgar allan poe christopher lee in fact star of many hammer productions over the years appears at the beginning of sleepy hollow as judge who sends ichabod crane out investigate the murders the movie also borrows from the universal monster movies of the one of the climatic scenes involves windmill and obviously takes its cue from frankenstein mention these allusions for reason seasoned horror fans including myself will smile at their inclusion in this the recent disappointments in theatrically released horror movies especially the blair witch project the most overblown turkey of the decade we needed like this not only does it have sense of history but burtons skillful use of setting and mood make this an entertaining exercise in horror the films eerie landscapes and foggy towns indeed overshadow the actors and the plot as the most noteworthy aspect of the movie johnny depp veteran tim burton actor who has appeared both in ed wood and edward scissorhands plays ichabod crane who has apparently changed occupations from irvings original story and is now an investigator depp is adequate in his role no more no less equally adequate is christina ricci who plays the love interest in the she is good witch too how cute one of the few weak parts of sleepy hollow is the wooden and cliched dialogue between the main characters the two actors however carry the movie well enough but the supporting cast is what makes this movie shine veteran actors such as jeffrey jones and michael gough who played the butler alfred in all four recent batman flicks are terrific as the aging townsfolk involved in the conspiracy depp uncovers while do not wish reveal crucial plot points can say that the storyline becomes quite confusing you have pay attention andrew kevin walker wrote the screenplay he is the one who also wrote mm and seven walker is quickly becoming one of the premiere suspense writers in and sleepy hollow certainly does not hurt his growing reputation as one might imagine from gentleman like walker sleepy hollow is quite graphic there is lot of blood and lot of beheadings this is definately not flick take the young kids lady in front of us took her two young sons see it and spent about minutes covering the youngests eyes her hand he was obviously upset the movies intense violence if you are looking for good scare however sleepy hollow is definately recommended

mpaa not rated though feel it would likely be pg for martialarts violence three movies already re released theatrically in america and at least three more on their way jackie chan is one of the newest hot properties in action adventure stardom and it is just about time for over twentyfive years jackies been starring in martial arts and action movies in hong kong thrilling audiences both an incredible grasp of acrobatics and martial arts and wonderful sense of comedy drunken master has the distinction of being the first jackie chan movie make it big this is the movie that supposedly set jackie up for big stardom in hong kong am not entirely sure why exactly in many ways drunken master is similar most of jackies other early films such as fearless hyena and ii master cracked fingers half loaf of kung fu spiritual kung fu and others in fact looking at all these early films together one gets the impression that they were stamped out cookiecutter style at rate of four six per year all using the same casts and telling very similar stories be honest think that early jackie chan movies are something of an acquired taste they are quite different from action movies as we know them in america these films tend be set in the chinese countryside in an indeterminate period sometime in the distant past fairly slow plots that often meander far afield and sometimes seem exist only for the intention of stringing comedy and fight scenes together drunken master though its plot is tighter than some is no exception as an aside drunken master was the first jackie chan movie ever saw and saw it the way it was meant be seen in movie theater in seattle as part of an asian festival at the time did not really think it was anything special but after having seen more films like it it is kind of grown on me drunken master storyline is very similar that of other early jackie chan movies such as fearless hyena and ii and master cracked fingers slacker martial arts student is taught the martial arts harshseeming master and has big fight an evil bad guy in the end formula that has been adapted put it kindly american films such as karate kid more specifically jackie chan plays the part of wong feihong aka naughty panther funloving practicaljoking kung fu student who is too good at kung fu for his own good but not _quite_ good enough after embarrassing his instructors assistant beating him roundly then beating up bully in marketplace wong feihong tries hit on pretty girl but discovers that she and her mother can hit back better than he can and is further chagrinned discover that the two women are his cousin and aunt respectively his father wong keiying is unhappy about this and is further annoyed when the father and brother of the bully show up sue for damages keiying soon institutes harsh regimen of punishment feihong does not like at all while escaping from this punishment feihong meets up drunken old man who proceeds thrash him soundly then take him on as student and thrash him some more this turns out be su huachi legendary master of drunkenstyle kung fu he assigns feihong series of bizarre tasks such as filling jugs water while hanging upside down from frame cracking walnuts his hands and other such exercises that seem like more pointless cruelty but are actually strengthening him up then when he is ready he teaches him the seven styles of drunken kung fu unfortunately the lazy feihong only practices six of them drunken master features some wonderful martial arts sequences jackie winning some fights and losing others it is been said before but will say it againthese fights do not just _happen_ they are as carefully choreographed as any ballet performance and it shows in his fights jackie often makes use of objects found in his environment benches jugs cups bowls fruits and vegetablesoften in new and surprising ways the fight scenes particularly those toward the end of the are unparallelled in most american films whether jackie wins or loses it is really something see and it is often as funny as anything too and funny is the other thing jackie chan is very very good at there is very little that is new in this moviejackie winning fights jackie getting beaten badly master jackie going through punishment or training these schticks have all been seen before in any one of several dozen similar jackie movies from the seventies and early eighties but they are still hilarious as ever likewise jackie has _great_ supporting cast many of whom were also in other early jackie films and they are often the source of plenty of hilarity on their own the really big thing about drunken master though that inspired several copycats including couple starring jackie himself and sequel fifteen years later was the drunkenstyle kung fu am not certain whether or not this is actually genuine style of kung fu but the principle behind it is imitate the wobbly movements of drunkard lull the enemy into false sense of security and it apparently helps if you are drunk while you are doing it genuine or not have admit there is just something incredibly fun about watching fellow who looks utterly sloshed wading into group of startled opponents and making mincemeat out of them before they even realize what is going on come think of it perhaps this element is what accounts for this films success over any of the other jackie films it is not just martial arts it is the kind of martial arts that makes you stop and go whoa on the negative side the cinematography in this is nothing special the stock is rather primitive the plot is often rather slow and the subtitles are sometimes extremely hard read against the background gone the wind this is not still if you like martial arts films or like what you have seen so far of jackie chan and want see more give it shot it is much more real than chuck norris or jeanclaude van damme you might very well like it another interesting thing about drunken master has do its video availability in the us drunken master is the only early jackie chan movie that know of that you can find in its original letterboxed hong kong subtitled form commercially available on vhs from magnum video in gold box for about there are plenty of other early jackie films around but these are typically either in dubbed panandscanned form or else import tapes priced for rental instead of purchase thankfully drunken master at least is available in the aspect ratio in it was meant be seen at very affordable price if you like drunken master take look at the numerous other early jackie chan films that are out there even the dubbed ones are not really _too_ bad if nothing else you can enjoy the martial arts choreography while making fun of the dialogue particularly recommend spiritual kung fu half loaf of kung fu the fearless hyena movies and snake crane arts of shaolin also the mostlyunrelatedstorywise sequel drunken master ii will hit theaters in american release sometime later this year though what its americanrelease title will be is still uncertain and comes _highly_ recommended this reviewer also for rather different interpretation of the character wong feihong who is in fact popular figure from chinese folklore have been told suggest the once upon time in china series starring jet li though have not personally seen any of them yet if you choose watch drunken master really hope you enjoy it and hope it starts open your eyes the wonderful world of asian cinema that is out there all in all give this an

well know that stallone is years old now but in daylight he does not look it daylight is great disaster movie if you have seen cliffhanger you will know stallones character already guy bad past but is in the right place at the wrong time tunnel connecting new york and new jersey has both sides collapses when group of robbers collide truck carrying very flammable toxic waste dozen or so people survive the collapses and the incinerating fireball and what fire ball it was stallone former emergency medical service man is chauffeuring rich couple around when they reach the outside of the tunnel before the explosion then minutes into the movie boom from here on the plot takes back seat and we are treated some of the best camera work and action staged most all the action is plausible and will hold you at the edge of your seat there are few melodramatic parts here but they tend work out well there is no general antagonist in this but the action and suspense makes you forget all about that daylight is great saw nonmatinee showing of it and thought it was worth every penny the characterizations are mostly flat one dimesional but they have enough in them get you care for some of the characters rob cohen dragonheart does great job this

logical time travel movies are nearimpossibility considering that the skeptics best argument against the possibility of time travel is the idea of altered realities writing script that deals this problem is an imposing task occasionally we get that does manage it terry gilliams monkeys was one such but more frequently we get films that do not much deal it at all there is one question ask in this case does the have other virtues that override the existing logical inconsistencies the terminator films made up for them exciting action back the future did it an entertaining story and the new frequency pulls off the trick strong package of its own is frequency filled plot holes yes does it matter not really the opens in october of firefighter frank sullivan dennis quaid puts his life on the line every time he suits up for his job then goes home his loving wife julia elizabeth mitchell and son johnny daniel henson the doublepronged story flashes forward where johnny now jim caviezel is all grown up and working as police detective strange occurrence the appearance of aurora borealis over new york city allows father and son communicate through the same ham radio frank used in and that john has found in the present day though both are initially skeptical of the idea john eventually takes this opportunity warn his father against his impending death in warehouse fire and he succeeds in saving frank from certain doom now flooded memories of full life his father alive john is initially overjoyed until he discovers that the changes the timeline have been disastrous serial killer that would have died has instead lived kill seven more women frank and john now must work together set things right john using the information he has gathered in the future instruct frank on what do in the past the premise of frequency is unusual and requires getting over one very important mental hurdle fully accept john and frank are the only ones conscious of how the timeline has been changed as result of their actions this is not explained you just have go it when frank does not die in fire john is the only one who remembers it differently while everyone else remembers it the new way the concept also runs into problems concerning just how synchronous the two realities and are each other sometimes franks changing the past results in something happening right away in johns world and sometimes john gets the changes ahead of time now the filmmakers might have perfectly good explanations for this and could probably come up something fairly convoluted but nevertheless logical if thought about it hard enough for example the reason john gets advance information of the serial killers murders was because the change had already happened in franks world and john is only witnessing the projection of that change but explanations are not really the point when frequency gets cooking it is riveting little thriller even if it is confusing what matters like this is if the plot makes sense in the moment and frequency works as long as it keeps moving the manages be engaging despite the logical confusion director gregory hoblit and screenwriter toby emmerich structure frequency as good entertainment establishing decent likable characters making us care for them and setting up goal be reached and conflict be resolved liked many of the creative touches the split screens allowing us see how the universe is being affected in both realities and the greater framework of baseball drive the action forward it actually uses the metsorioles world series the one that featured the amazin mets great effect frank uses johns advance knowledge of the series outcome convince his friends believe him admittedly this device may only be of interest baseball fan like myself even liked the final scene features frank and john both fighting the same man simultaneously in different time periods some may find this scene blindingly confusing as the reality shifts start coming fast and furious but it does make sense if you think about it and give the script lot of leeway and let us face it it is darn cool way end the there are enough surprises and plot twists in frequency keep you on your toes and as result the movie avoids growing stagnant the other major thing appreciate about frequency is the handling of the fatherson relationship quaid and caviezel carry off their parts easily it is rocksolid job from both actors the relationship is instantly credible because they find the human truth behind the high concept how would one react being able communicate dead relative or future descendant watching the exchanges between frank and john will give you pretty good idea of how answer that question the credibility of the human relationship is absolutely crucial the rest of the if we do not believe in the characters we do not care about the outcome of the thriller plot here we do care because we like the lead actors also liked some of the supporting cast members elizabeth mitchell gets stuck two thankless roles playing julia the doting wife and mother but still performs admirably andre braugher late of the television show homicide life on the street gives nice supporting turn as franks best friend and future colleague of john he has lovely scene in diner in he tries explain the situation julia while franks world series predictions come true before his very eyes braugher strikes the perfect facial expression here simultaneously dismayed and amused perhaps the only thing did not like about frequency is the overly sentimental coda during the cameras focus goes little too soft and the baseball theme gets carried overboard but that is only because the had already earned poignancy without resorting cheap tactics freely acknowledge that frequency may best work as guy movie since it focuses on the very maleoriented idea of fatherson relationships echoes of field of dreams can be easily heard but the underlying concept is universally applicable who would not want speak longdead parent or see how their children turn out tell me about your life son excuse me while mist up and do not call me sissy

blade is the movie that shows that wesley snipes really can live up his potential as one of hollywoods premier leading men blade is based on the comic book character of the same name and has that comic book kind of feel it it is very stylish movie and for the most part that style works very well although at few points thought was watching music video as opposed movie the ideas behind blade are good as is the basic plot of the story but at times things seem get bit muddled and the writers appear want do too many things at once that really does not take away from the story too much but it does hurt it little bit blade snipes is half man half vampire his mother was bitten vampire when she was pregnant him and as result he has many of the classic traits of vampire including thirst for human blood that must be kept under control special serum quenches his blood lust blade has spent his life hunting down and killing vampires as sort of revenge for the fact that one of their kind killed his mother but this is not as easy as it seems because the vampires in blades world are more sophisticated than the ones that you find in most films the government and other authorities know of the existence of vampires but they let them feast of the population at large because they are taking bribes from the vampires where do vampires get money well in blade they run multinational companies in order finance their vampire organizations personally thought that this whole secret corporate world run vampires be very clever idea and great addition the movie blade runs up against the evil deacon frost stephen dorff maverick in the vampire community he is not content live among humans and is convinced that the vampire race is the superior one and he means insure its superiority he has managed translate the ancient vampire scrolls that tell of the method of making him an allpowerful vampire rendering him virtually unstoppable it is up blade see that this does not transpire admittedly blade is style over substance through and through the story is relatively forgettable one but it is fun none the less the acting in blade is just about what you would expect from movie of this type this is not that is going win accolades for its performances and the actors know this the movie is played for fun and nobody seems think otherwise it is popcorn movie and no one involved has any illusions otherwise blades production values are as slick as any that you will find in your typical summer blockbuster the combat sequences between blade and his vampire targets are incredibly well done although the mtvstyle cuts did get on my nerves after while during long sequences blade is fun movie an interesting take on the vampire genre this is not the movie for those of you who like your vampires in tuxedos and living in coffins in the basement of some gothic castle what blade excels at is bringing the classic lore of the vampire into the next century fresh outlook on life very cool

the truman show paramount pictures running time hour minutes starring jim carrey and ed harris directed peter weir after long wait jim carreys dramatic debut finally makes it the big screen in case you have been asleep for the last few months the plot centres on truman burbank carrey who leads an seemingly idyllic life in the beautiful town of seahaven his life seems so perfect however because it is controlled christoff harris creator of the truman show the program burbank is unwittingly the hero of that is right burbanks life is being broadcast live the american public and seahaven and all it is inhabitants are inclosed in massive sound stage the takes the jerry springer format one step too far an idea so different it would be easy for the director and screenwriter dumb it down and appeal the lowest common denominator luckily the remains sensible enough appeal all ages yet never seems be dumb carrey movie talking of carrey he is perfect in this movie enjoying the best role in his career his character is reinforced stanley ipkiss from the mask and is completely suited carreys persona he occasionally falls into ace ventura mode shrieking and being silly but generally the audience is watching subdued carrey he is not completely dramatic like the promises however ed harris brings an extreme intensity christoff the megalomaniac creator of the show quiet and well spoken he burns an image into the viewer unfortunately he is barely in the and for the first hour dosent appear at all also disappointing is natascha mcelhones character sylvia she plays the role well but her character is sadly underwritten and is pushed the sidelines just when the audience is used her the supporting cast is excellent and the town of seahaven looks delightfully perfect so perfect it is creepy the philip glass soundtrack is also superb and is used great effect during the peter weir keeps the going clearly having fun the is far more upbeat than his previous films dead poets society and green card although it is slightly slow begin about half an hour into the pace really picks up and when christoff is introduced fully the is on roll sadly though the is practically over when the is in full steam also concerning the ending it is slightly too ambiguous was disappointing the screenwriter andrew niccol who bought us gattaca delivers an entertaining script and manages keep the plot in trim while christoffs plans keep truman in do get increasingly silly they never go over the line would have been easy for niccol do also there is some funny gags involving product placement and the people who watch the show overall the truman show is excellent entertainment certainly different from the usual crap produces it should be viewed everyone it offers something every member of the audience and you would almost certainly not come out disappointed overall rating review david wilcock you know for kids norville barnes

no in recent has left me such conflicted feelings as neil jordans harrowing humorous horrifying adaptation of patrick mccabes novel about young lad francie bradys eamonn owens descent into madness in ireland on one hand it was difficult for me become invested in francies story because he is such an unsavory character unjustifyably venting his rage at his nosy but otherwise harmless neighbor mrs nugent fiona shaw on another hand found it difficult laugh at some of francies darkly comic shenanigans because he obviously is such sick needy child having been raised drunken father stephen rea and suicidal mother aisling osullivan on yet another hand also found it difficult completely sympathize francie during his more emotional scenes because some of his for lack of better word bad deeds are so incredibly shocking in their brutality and the malicious glee in he performs them however the butcher boys power is undeniable and the as whole is unforgettableperhaps because it is so disturbing what makes it so unsettling is the francies overall winkwink yet matteroffact attitude about everything expressed in cheeky voiceover narration delivered the adult francie rea again think heavenly creatures played largely for laughs and you will sort of understand anchoring the whole is the astonishing debut performance of owens love francie or hate him you cannot take your eyes off of owens the butcher boy truly is twisted unusual that is bound make just about anyone uncomfortable in the lobby after the screening overheard one man raving about how great yet disturbing it was also heard one particularly offended woman say disgust that movie was so unfunny did not know what expect it is like something you chase for so long but then you do not know how react when you get it still do not know how react michael jordan on winning his first nba championship in or my thoughts after meeting him on november

just how inseparable is the team of sgt martin riggs mel gibson and sgt roger murtaugh danny glover let us just say that when one partner asks the other partner strip his boxer shorts and then further asks him run out into the middle of the road flapping his arms while feverishly cackling like chicken just create distraction his partner actually does it the familiar lethal weapon family is back including rene russo who is now the expectant mother of riggs child and joe pesci as the sopranalike foulmouthed former accountant who has decided become private eye new the team is chris rock also fasttalking up and coming detective trouble seems follow the two veteran detectives where ever they go and in this that is no exception even when they are just taking leisurely boat ride they somehow manage collide freighter ship we here some ominous music clues us that confrontation is about happen gunfire ensues and when it is all over the detectives want learn more about this freighter questioning chinatown crime lord although they do not know what they are looking for their inquisitiveness causes the bad guys take some action and there is plenty of action here for two movies led fighting sensation jet li whose martial arts skill is nothing less than impressive he does what he can make sure that no one finds out what they are up li is ruthless in his approach will kill anyone just make point and develops enormous disdain for the two detectives there are terrific car chases explosions and gunshot galore it is summer action recipe followed the letter and the result is nothing less than pure unadulterated summer fun but even too many explosions can get boring counter that we are treated several amazingly choreographed fight sequences jet li luckily he would rather fight handtohand instead of firing off guns meanwhile when the detectives are not reloading their guns or running from fireballs they are engaged in sophomoric banter and silly conversations that provide nice diversion from the hail of bullets everybody gets in on the shtick russo screams during her delivery the crime lord has few funny bits when he is being interrogated while being given laughing gas and pesci and rock are very funny as they go at it discussing the drawbacks of having cellular phones gibson and glover are always in sync and the moves at brisk pace get the final and terrific mano mano score one for the old guard

since the dramatic picture has undergone certain change of style now instead of emphasizing feelgood stories replete characters of noble virtues the screenplays and direction point toward human struggle and sorrow this realist tendancy can be inspiring at times as schindlers list shows most of todays mainstream drama however creates an overabundance of emoting that can turn off members of the audience that is why pictures like october sky are throwback the good ol dramas of yesteryear are such welcome relief in contemporary cinema the movie is based on the true story of homer hickam jake gyllenhaal teenager in the company town of coalwood west virginia it is wellknown fact that the only boys make name for themselves are the ones that get out of the town on football scholarships the rest grow up work in the coal mine the mine is run homers father chris cooper is not the place for homer however after watching the soviet satellite sputnik shoot across the october sky in homer feels connection the outside world as he puts it anyone in the world could look up and see the same thing did drafting two of his best friends and the brainiac outcast homer begins construct rockets the help of their history teacher miss riley laura dern and several mine workers the four are soon bound for great things october sky is skillfully crafted and most of that credit must go director joe johnston johnston whose career in the industry includes everything from directing wellknown titles like jumanji and the rocketeer down an uncredited role as death star trooper in star wars certainly knows what he is doing here he molds characters are true life and also fun watch into plot that is straightforward and robust he does not push any barriers but instead adopts conservative style of filmmaking enhances the films charm his finesse brings out elements might otherwise be lost such as the relationships between homer and various mine workers or the silent struggle between homers mother and father the cast is well chosen although the true bright spots are the supporting roles laura dern jurassic park lends strong performance in the role of the history teacher giving the boys the support and guidance they need her role is instantly likeable chris cooper the horse whisperer as homers father is less likeable even downright despicable at times but his turn here gives gravity the movie he is definitely driving force in homers life and his more humane moments give the piece certain dynamic that is commendable the script is generally cheerful projecting the boys endeavors in lighthearted manner there are moments when it becomes predictable such as the train tracks scene and there are moments when it sacrifices orginality for the need come up an emotional plot twist it highlights the essence of youth however and for its exceptional job at this it can be forgiven other missteps october sky should be success audiences although it does not have the appeal of current teen flicks like varsity blues or she is all that it certainly holds an undeniable quality that older crowds will lean towards it is welcome change the dramatic genre and one that everyone should see

a big surprise me the good trailer had hinted that they pulled the impossible off but making blues brothers movie without jake blues john belushi is such dumb idea really had no hope they replaced him just fine not john goodman he did not do much of anything but the brilliant actor joe morton who can really sing the fourth blues brother is evan bonifant who is ten this was another of my fears for the but he is really good dancer and plays mean harmonica although he may have been dubbed things that intellectually had bothered me before like no mission from god everyone being richer it not being filmed in chicago gave me no problems at all am quite pleased that there were less car pileups because they meant less music and john landis seems have lost interest in the whole thing there is few early crashes and then one huge pileup but after that it all stops it is just the music one of my problems the first is that cab calloways song is so good the actually blues brothers look dull after him but there is no problems this the music is all as good as ever tons of great musicians showing up the exception of johnny lang who cannot sing all the musicians do great job the only real problems had was the special effects these were superfluous and waste of money since the is not doing very well they could mean we have no possibility of another sequel want see the bluegrass version of riders in the sky is even better than rawhide http www geocities comhollywoodacademy remove no spam reply drive carefully but recklessly mama childs toy the only excercise take is walking behind the coffins of friends who took exercise peter otoole

after having heard so many critics describe return me as an oldfashioned romance kept asking myself going into this movie what exactly is an oldfashioned romance what made return me oldfashioned and oldhollywood was it the tunes from sinatra etc legendary singers the senior citizens in the constantly harp on was it the glamorous sophisticated feel the charisma of the two leads even now cannot say that have gotten any closer the real answer because have not see that many oldfashioned romances do not think any of the romances have seen have been classified as such leaves me the option of vaguely agreeing my fellow critics return me was oldfashioned in the sense that it reminded me of the way the younger generation perceive venerated old magic the way perceive cinnamon spice and apple cider it was traditional magical we knew it could not be too daring or have any surprising plot twists that many cynical modern romances are apt throw in it was romance told such endearing simplicity tenderness and love from director bonnie hunt that it could not help but sparkle charm despite its shortcomings the owes lot of what it has bonnie hunts direction from the very first birds eye view of chicago zooming in slowly toward the insignificant bob rueland david duchovny accompanied the return me ballad whom we can tell we are in for something sweet the scenes between the characters are endearing truthful just hint of fantasy real people do not act that way real people are not that nice we know all this and yet we want believe in these folks existence the premise itself seems have sprung out of fairytale but hunts rooting the fairytale in common chicago folk simultaneously lends credit the scenario and tinges everyday urban life hint of the ethereal everything is ordinaryyet beautifulin this from the festive little family restaurant grace minnie driver and bobs wardrobes from the eloquent notinahurry progress storyline the dainty watercolors that grace paints from the animal stars the way all the characters interact on screen the most beautiful part return me has done an excellent job of assembling together group of actors who blend in effortlessly as family the audience has no trouble at all believing that this rambunctious family actually does exist we care for them laugh them cry them we are concerned that the little boy will pick up cursing from his father whatever hunt did she brought out the naturalism in all of the actors disappointingly david alan griers charlie however much like him was the most flatlywritten duchovny here does laudable job of shaking off his fox mulder persona the help of his fellow costars rarely do we see any hint of special agent fox mulder instead we have normal guy who when he falls in love shows more delight than fox mulder will show over the span of an entire season of the xfiles duchovny who is excellent at understatement and selfdeprecation as an actor showcases his considerable comedic talent on screen minnie driver is engaging as always as the sweet innocent grace nothing but good heart offer though an unlikely pair duchovny and driver gradually warm up each other as the movie progresses while return me functions remarkably as laughoutloud comedy romantic scenic tour through chicago and tearjerker the story is set up so the ends up having nowhere develop the entire climax of the hinges on when and how grace is going tell bob that she actually was the recipient of his wifes heart we already know that there is going be happy ending we feel like we spend the entire however enjoyably in straight line going towards that point as result bob and grace click almost too quicklyyes know she is supposed have his exwifes heart and everythingit seems too effortless the main subject is love story and the family scenes love so much unfortunately are overused and distract from the turmoil of the two main characters whose story might not have that much meat after all however in the spirit of return me it will not do be too picky about how old tells its stories loved knowing that this was labor of love for bonnie hunt it shows the bottom line return me is nothing remarkable and yet its sweetness sincerity and charm might touch your heart in ways that you had not imagined

wild things is suspenseful thriller starring matt dillon denise richards and neve campbell that deals all the issues sex love murder and betrayal the setting of the is town named blue bay it consists of many swamps and slums and on the other hand rich estates owned the towns different benefactors the opens just before the beginning of senior seminar at the towns ritzy expensive high school it is here that we meet all of the core characters there is guidance counselor sam lombardo police officers ray duquette and gloria perez dark mysterious senior suzie toller and the popular head cheerleader kelly van ryan we first see that all of the senior girls are smitten the handsome guidance counselor but none more than kelly throughout the first portion of the we see how far kelly will go get sam until she accuses him of rape shortly after suzie too confesses that sam raped her as well this pushes kellys sex craving mother sandra stop at nothing until sam is convicted during the trial kelly gives teary confession of how sam raped her however it is later revealed suzie that sam never raped either of the girls it was all vengeful plan against the guidance counselor after sam is cleared kellys mother pays sam very substantial amount of cash in order for him not sue her it is then revealed that sam kelly and suzie were all in on it together it is here that the starts reveal just who is being honest each other and who has their own hidden agenda matt dillon stars as sam lombardo sam is the kind of guy that every woman would like sink their claws into and sam obviously knows it and uses it his own advantage he is not the obvious best of actors but dillon does give convincing performance however his talents seem be rendered useless near the end of the making it look as though his character has lost all of his ethics and principles although he never had many start out in the first place neve campbell who most people relate scream and scream plays blue bay outcast suzie toller suzie obviously has some serious issues deal are obvious from her first scene in the campbell is very successful this character adding the slightest bit of charm seemingly repulsive character and making her fun watch playing kelly van ryan is denise richards kelly is your typical rich sexy head cheerleader who thinks she can have any man she choses like her sexpot mother sandra one of the most interesting things about this is how it compares and contrasts the relationship between kelly and her mother denise richards still hot off the press from starship troopers gives the most interesting performance in the entire in the beginning kelly looks be paper thin character but richards adds little more spice and ultimately makes the character not only sexy but dominating as well kevin bacon gives one of his fair performances as ray duquette this character looks be one of the most boring predictable in the however it is relationship revealed between him and suzie that adds depth his story still the does not seem gain much from bacons performance only his name in the supporting cast theresa russell plays the much oversexed sandra van ryan daphne rubinvega gives an unappealing performance as cop gloria perez and bill murray shines as sams lawyer ken bowden hats off murray for adding the perfect touch of comedy the although wild things was displayed the press as being an erotic thriller the eroticism is portrayed good taste is kept minimum and focuses more on the plot and the relationships between the characters this is truly very good worth seeing if your looking for movie thick plot filled it is share of twists

minor plot spoilers in review no major spoilers are in review the previous two alien films have each had their own unique styles them the ridley scotts alien was very much stylistic suspense james camerons aliens was much more of an action and liked each separately for it was now alien is out and it is it is own in the same right that alien and aliens were unlike aliens alien requires that you have seen aliens this is very important as the story picks up exactly were aliens left off the survivors of the expedition lv are returning home after battling and beating the aliens the climactic fight scene between ripley and the mother alien on the sulaco in aliens left behind one item an egg in the opening sequence we see the egg hatch find its quarry leads fire aboard the sulaco when the facehugger is injured an leads the sulaco jettison the hypersleep tubes in an escape vessel this vessel crash lands on fury everyone in the vessel is killed except ripley the facehugger is jettisoned them and survives the crash fury is an exminingmaximum security prison when closed down some of the lifer prisoners decided stay and live out the remaining years on the planet all the prisoners are men who have not seen woman in many years ripleys arrival sparks problem the inmates as for the new haircut that ripley and the prisoners sport there is an infestation of lice on the planet being an exprison means that there is no way off the planet and no weapons so the prisoners and ripley are off face the alien on their own will not go into detail but you can guess what happens here the alien is loose and no one believes ripleys outstanding story she finds comfort in the arms of the colonys doctor yes after years ripley has sex it is not gratuitous in fact we do not even see them kiss but it is just as well sweaty sex scene would not have worked in the context of the there is lot more gore in alien in fact would guess say that there is more in alien than either of the earlier two it also sports new alien legs will not say how but it leads us believe few new things about the alien and its cycle am sure will be explored in alien sigourney weaver is back as ripley and provides another excellent performance of this character her scene during the autopsy of newt is enough garnish her another academy nomination the rest of the cast is also quite good notably charles dance as the doctor whom ripley finds momentary escape from fury alien has very distinct look this is due largely its director david fincher mr fincher who until now has only directed music videos and commercials has done an incredible job here his direction is excellent and makes this come life in ways no alien has before for mr fincher see long prosperous career ahead of him the music was also done newcomer the industry elliot goldenthal has created deeply moving score lends itself the claustrophobic setting that the alien series been set in this time the score is not so much rip off of star trek ii james horners aliens this score has choral back up at times and even lends itself the old style of ennio morricone scoring this is great score the ending alien is quite good there were times thought that would come in and screw it up but it played very nicely will not ruin the ending for you go see the consider it be much more involved than any of the other films released so far this season alien is worthy successor aliens and alien and when they make alien perhaps they will be able find yet another new direction take it in

are you tired of all the hot new releases being gone the time you get the video store wafflemovies com is dedicated finding those hidden gems that lie on the shelves everyweek wafflemovies com reviews independent and big studio pictures that deserve second chance on video here is sample review welcome sarajevo in light of americas recent intervention in kosovo welcome sarajevo is reminder of the horror america and the world ignored for years set in sarajevo and based on actual events this picture examines the human and societal casualties of war the picture opens family escorting their young bride her wedding as they make their way down the street sniper shoots the mother of the bride yet another reminder that daily life in war torn sarajevo can never escape the horror of war in this scene we meet joe flynn woody harrelson an american reporter who stops reporting help priest carry the mortally wounded mother into church joe is cocky but also good at heart as he continues carry out kind deeds for people he does not even know his fellow reporter is the british michael henderson stephen dillane michael is quickly growing tired of the horror that surrounds him and the worlds lack of interest henderson is haunted the memory of an altar boy who witnesses the mothers death as well as young girl who he finds orphaned in hospital after mortar attack on citizens waiting in line for bread he decides take action when united nations delegation descends upon the area declare yugoslavia the fourteenth most dangerous place on earth henderson begins series profiling an orphanage located on the front lines he finds children of all ages living in fear and taking care of each other the help of one adult during his visits he befriends preteen girl emira emira nuseric who serves as surrogate mother baby roadrunner he promises get emira out of harms way if he gets the chance after the un delegation leaves the country without rescuing any of the children henderson loses hope however his reporting has grabbed the attention of nina marisa tomei and her childrens aid group that helps find homes for the yugoslavian orphans unfortunately only babies are wanted for adoption so henderson pledges take emira england the group of children nina and henderson depart the front lines on dangerous escape for italy can they complete this dangerous trek through the war torn countryside and avoid hostile troops gathering up muslims for concentration camps the movie was beautifully and sensitively made director michael winterbottom and screenwriter frank cottrell boyce vividly express the societal destruction that has occurred they show the destroyed lives families that have been split up and the desolation that everyone attempts cope this is best exemplified the group of yugoslavians henderson his producer and flynn have befriended the group of twentysomethings reside in bombed out bar without lifes simplest pleasures and amenities one of them is an accomplished musician who spends his days playing the piano and promising play concert when sarajevo is declared the most dangerous place on earth like the rest of those deeply effected the war this small group tries survive instead of trying live winterbottom brilliantly intersplices scenes actual news footage give the the feel of documentary and keeps the viewer aware that many of these horrors are being carried out thousands of miles away as you sit safely in your living room the picture is also bolstered beautiful cinematography that captures the devastation of this city that hosted the olympics winterbottom and boyce also produce realistic portrayal of the reporters covering the atrocities this portrayal is much more flattering reporters than earlier wafflemovies com selection mad city we watch them struggle cover the horror while trying remain professionally detached however they are human and question the reason behind it all why no one cares and how they can get out stephen dillane is wonderful as henderson he portrays the character as an everyman caught in the middle of extraordinary events dillane avoids making the character overly heroic and preachy henderson realizes that he cannot save the world but he can help few it is wonderful opportunity for dillane after he had suffer through the denis learysandra bullock disaster two if sea woody harrelson continues prove that he is one of the finest most versatile actors of his generation harrelson plays the cocky celebrity reporter heart of gold allowing the characters caring nature and vulnerability shine through harrelson is equally adept at taking on roles as zany leading men cheers white men cannot jump as well as excellent supporting roles such as this one this ability will serve him well and give him long successful career americas involvement in this struggle comes seven years after the events of the movie take place for those who do not have full understanding of the history of the conflict the entire movie most importantly the opening scenes provide history lesson war is foreign concept most of us in america battles are fought thousands of miles away among people we have no attachment televised images of the gulf war are all the experience most of us have war this picture brings it right into your living room and makes you think outside of our own small world something we do not do enough of in america

many people dislike french films for their lack of closure while possibly shallow have often had desire for sense of epiphany or at least resolution in the films view there is no revelation in un coeur en hiver in the traditional however the is incredibly successful in its passionate dramatization of passiondenying protagonist stephane daniel auteuil stephane daniel auteuil is master violin maker he is passionless about all that surrounds him except his craft and the music his craft is responsible for producing even the relationship between he and his boss maxime andre dussollier is controlled and almost manipulated association highlighted the fact that stephane permits maxime win close squash matches in the beginning of the movie stephane is closed solitary individual and the audience is carefully left wonder about the depth of emotion behind this enigmatic man camille kessler emmanuelle beart is master violinist and the new love of maximes maxime is so much in love camille that he plans and does leave his wife like stephane camille is outwardly very controlled and reserved sacrificing all thought and emotion her violin and the music emerges when stephane and camille meet there is recognition of bonding both individuals however whereas camille submits the wild interplay of emotions she now feels for stephane stephane only admits that camille is attracted him stephane ignores his feelings for camille the audience cannot help but see is present as the movie progresses the two characters become more and more polarized in their views and emotions for one another these two people very similar approaches life initially react their new circumstance very differently stephane becomes even more rational and controlled while camille becomes more tempestuous until she almost borders on suffering nervous breakdown due the inability consummate their relationship however their approach each other is perhaps not surprising considering their vocation the audience is led believe that stephane may have been genius as violinist as well due his relationship master violin teacher however apparently he could not be violinist due his intolerance for flaws in his playing consequently stephane becomes precision craftsmen the instrument and no longer plays in contrast camille had almost given the violin years earlier however the aid of her manager she has progressed being almost one of the worlds finest successfully submerging herself her playing during the course of the movie we see both characters evolve as they struggle meet the challenge of their new emotions stephane attempts remain unchanged however we do see subtle hints of his transformation one of the most obvious is when he defeats maxime in squash the development of all of the characters many of is not included in this synopsis is incredible american movies rare exceptions have not and would daresay cannot approach foreign films in character development in its essence this movie is about the development and growth of the characters camille and stephane the portrayal of all the other characters in the movie including death is further the development of camilles and stepahnes characters am not sure why berardinelli says at times it becomes difficult determine whether stephane should be pitied or vilified and it is auteuils credit that he manages maintain this uncertainty this movie is not about judging stephanes actions as being right or wrong but about viewing their growth and accepting the characters as who they are find the ending appropriate unfortunately found the last ten minutes led up the final scene be very unfulfilling this portion of the is where the sense of closure could have been successfully accomplished unfortunately there is hurried and almost soap operatype surge of emotions from all of the characters while ravel may not be quite as accomplished as schubert or mozart ravel has his day in this the synergism of the tension of ravels music and tension on the screen is the best have ever seen the directing in this movie is wonderful the actors and actresses are excellent each playing their part great sincerity and warmth emmanuelle bearts personality is beautiful and needless say must say that emmanuelle beart herself is beautiful besides the near ending the only other criticism of the movie have is that the movie is almost too cerebral almost left the sense little happened because almost all the changes occur in the movie happen in deep in their psyches and little in their personalities or the situations they end as part of the one question am left is while they have accepted their lot has their attitude towards love changed have several possibilities believe the movie hints at but am unsure of the director is espousing in summary this movie is solely about the character growth of two characters who almost develop relationship in the process we see their attitude towards life and other people in itself do not believe un coeur is complicated movie where it does become complicated is when we juxtapose the scenes of the movie into the greater walk of life where we as americans have preconceived american notions of relationship love and people do wonder how the movie translates when viewed within its native french culture however bringing my american preconceptions enjoyed the would welcome any comments about this movie from any who have seen it

the keen wisdom of an elderly bank robber the naive ambitions of sexy hospital nurse and partnership that blossoms between the two are the fine components that make up modest little caper adventure entitled where the money is the elderly bank robber is henry paul newman famous criminal that was only recently caught he has pulled off dozens of successful heists and has probably stashed away small fortune always the shrewd thinker he begins working on plan get out of jail this involves years of studying buddhism and selfhypnosis when he is prepared execute his plan he uses what he has learned fake stroke now seemingly twitching vegetable he is temporarily transferred staterun home carol linda fiorentino is the nurse that cares for him she is very bright person good heart yet her life is miserable waste of time the most exciting thing do in town is fix cars her days at the hospital facility are spent leading wheelchair calisthenics worse she is in deadend relationship highschool sweetheart wayne dylan mcdermott they became couple because they were king and queen of the prom her this made sense long ago but now it is different story wayne seems equally bored his life but is content enough stay put waynes greatest ambition is become night shift supervising foreman carol feels as lifeless as many of the other hospital patients but she is never been anywhere else and does not see many other opportunities in life however when henry falls under her care her outlook begins change the medical reports may state that he suffered massive stroke carol however begins grow suspicious that henry may just be faking it after all maybe she can get through him and maybe she can learn something about the money that he has stashed away the opening minutes are filled hilarious attempts of carol trying bring henry back life and what are some of carols resuscitation techniques perhaps an erotic lapdance might stir his senses if that fails maybe she will try little shock therapy pushing him off foot high pier into the cold lake below when he finally comes out of his state of selftrance the movies direction changes though it remains equally if not more entertaining carol sees that henry is filled charisma and selfassuredness she is invigorated his commanding presence and refreshed his vibrancy this of course puts wayne in an odd situation henry and carols bond grows stronger when they enter into an agreement rob an armored car henry needs this heist because he is unable retrieve his original stash meanwhile this is carols ticket better life wayne is uncomfortable the situation but helps out nonetheless however his lack of commitment threatens their success the heist sequence is suspenseful well paced and casts the uneasy feeling that something
