will horribly go wrong where the money is does more spotlight newman and fiorentino than it does showcase story about nifty heist newman is the real joy of the adroitly showing that at age he is still really hot stuff he possesses sly smile displays dominating attitude and projects demeanor that is undeniably attractive fiorentino is also fun presence you root for her despite her sense of amorality sure she wants commit robbery and has little compunction about pushing wheelchairstricken man into lake but we can see that escape her deadend world she needs do something drastic two charismatic characters such as these it is hard ignore that where the money is is where the fun is

robert benton has assembled stellar mature cast for his latest feature twilight noir mystery set amid the fading stars of paul newman stars as retired detective harry ross harry has spent the last couple of years doing odd jobs for jack and catherine ames gene hackman and susan sarandon pair of married actors who have fallen from the limelight when jack sends him on routine delivery job however the old instincts kick in soon harry is wading through mystery where friendships and lives are on the line and he no longer knows who trust there are plenty of familiar faces throughout twilight in addition newman hackman and sarandon james garner plays raymond hope former cop and one of harrys best friends stockard channing plays verna harrys former partner and possibly former love interest reese witherspoon is mel the distrustful daughter of the ames and liev schrieber is her scuzzy boyfriend giancarlo esposito appears as harrys bumbling detective protigi and john spencer is suspicious police captain cast like that it is almost worth watching twilight just stargaze luckily there is more the than some sort of actors recognition ceremony twilight has solid noirish plot it may not have as many twists and turns as some of the classics but it has much more than lot of what passes for these days the major cast members all deliver strong performances as can be expected of their caliber however none of them have that little extra oomph would make them memorable the supporting cast is enjoyable if little underdrawn stockard channings character in particular is cipher there is more her character than the takes the time describe it is minor but irritating flaw solid cast and good plot there is lot recommend about twilight it is biggest flaw is actually its short running time at slim minutes there is lot of stuff that is packed into an awfully small package still the chance see newman sarandon and hackman working together is worth cramp or two

warning anyone offended blatant leering machismo had better avoid this or lots of blood guts men against men and manoetmano stuff in other words it is walter hill john milius script always picture these guys getting together and producing movie between armwrestling matches these films always contain male characters have very hard time identifying probably due the likelihood that any meeting between them and me would result in my arm being ripped off and then my subsequent death beating said limb and we got tough guys galore here drugrunning banditos the dozens all dirty and sweaty and pretty illtempered overall secret task force of army commandos who are in the area coverup supposedly any connection between the government and the drug runners and lots of shitkicking texas dirt farmers whod as soon shoot you between the eyes as look at you in particular we got nick nolte as one hardass texas ranger powers boothe as the drug kingpin michael ironsides as the leader of the secret army and rip torn as the local sheriff torn is the sympathetic figure of the group he smiles before shooting anyone as women well have never seen jane fonda or meryl streep in walter hill and at this rate doubt ever will women exist here look good comfort the man and get argued over gosh just like the old days frankly this is pretty good movie if you can accept the premise and can take the macho stuff the cinematography is excellent the cast of characters is broad and has texture the script is quite good and the lets you keep up what is happening yourself without spelling it out you appreciate that makes me have think keep up finally there is lots of sam peckinpah slowmotion shootups

accepting his oscar as producer of this years best picture winner saul zaentz remarked that his cup runneth over one could almost say the same about his muchprized rarely is the screen so overflowing potent imagery symbolism ideas and metaphors complex and literate storytelling all possessed of an intelligence that invites even demands constant scrutiny an acuity of perception and observation that must somehow yield the truth in short the antithesis of all things yet this surfeit of signals is made serve rather pale and thinly realized love story whose emotional impact is as dry as desert wind ralph fiennes is the title character an amnesiac burn victim whose gradual return memory and particularly the memory of love is the ostensible focus of the but despite the use of numerous flashbacks help put the pieces of this personal puzzle together we never learn enough about the man feel much empathy for him his emotional life before the story begins is an essential clue that remains withheld the same can easily be said for every other character in the of there are too many juliette binoche is nurse comes as close as this gets an emotional heart at least we learn early on that she is scarred the deaths of those close her and so we understand why she is eager escape the company of her comrades in order seek refuge in the convalescence of mysterious disfigured dying stranger even this information is imparted so quickly and in such cursory fashion however that it verges on the comical so many characters enjoying so little screen time the films minutes can be taxing yet there is something so captivating about the sensibility behind the camera that could not help but feel that greatness was in the air hints of it were everywhere in man who hates ownership but wants desperately possess his lover in ancient cave paintings of swimmers copied casually modernday swimmer in the sahara in the way the shifting sands of time obliterate everything more completely than world war there is enough latent meaning supply college students paper topics for years but ultimately the emotional truths writerdirector anthony minghella was grasping for were never revealed in the end was left the impression that had witnessed quite an oxymoron haunting bore bore is perhaps too strong word but after drinking in the rich production values the cup remains only slightly over halffull

a bleak look at how the boston underworld operates was based on the bestseller george higgins it is seen through the weary eyes of yearold smalltime hood eddie fingers coyle mitchum he got the nickname when mob boss in his underworld element shut the draw on his hand as punishment his current dilemma is that he got caught running illegal booze truck and faces year stretch in new hampshire something he feels will be life sentence for him since he does not think he could survive prison at his age he is also concerned that his wife and three kids will have go on welfare he could have cut deal and gotten off if he turned his boss over the a but he figured he would never live if he did that he is currently gunrunning for gang of very successful bank robbers led scalise rocco the masked bank robbers operate always first going the bank managers house and holding his family hostage and then they go the bank and force the manager open the vault for them or else his family gets it on one of the heists they kill bank officer who pushes the alarm coyles best friend is dillon boyle hit man for the mob working as bartender he is permanent stoolie for the treasury agents as an aggressive young agent named foley jordan who likes be called uncle gives dillon breathing room operate some of his lowlevel crime activities and work the bar even though he has prison record as long as he keeps getting valuable info from him on things happening the gangs the sentencing date closing in on him the already convicted coyle is out on bail and looking for an angle cut his jail time he contacts agent foley and gives him few inconsequential tips and then decides do something that goes against his grain thinking he made an ironclad deal foley get his sentenced squashed in new hampshire he gives him the place where sale of machine guns is going down knowing fullwell the young hustler keats selling the guns is lot like he was as youth and when arrested will be facing life sentence but foley tells him after he arrests the gundealer that new hampshire wants more before they take away his jail sentence they want him be fulltime informer warning spoiler follows in next paragraph the bank robbers are setup and caught in the act and the mob boss is convinced coyle did it and gives dillon the contract take care of his friend the contemptuous dillon befriends coyle and treats him steak dinner and takes him bruin hockey game while getting him boozed up coyle takes look at the young bruin star bobby orr from his upper deck seat and says be young like that and have his future he is the greatest hockey player in the world dillon then takes the drunken coyle for long drive and executes him mobstyle having kid who works for him dump the body in some bad section of boston this is great atmospheric due the realistic noir mood it sets of the hopeless situation the lowlevel criminals are in and how they are forced live fear and the uncertainty of what horrible thing will happen next the city streets are ugly the gangsters are shown be capable of any action defend their own interests whether it is betrayal or murder there is fatalistic feel about their lives something robert mitchum wears as easily as others put on hat mitchum gives this all the intensity and purpose it needs as it overcomes thin plot it makes you see the characters for what they are without any false sympathy for them mitchum is loser and that he lived so long is tribute his skills as survivor but in the end he even loses the respect he had among his underworld friends as standup guy as he wrestled his code of honor and lost even that battle

footloose has only one goal in mind reel in an audience cheesy sentiment and feelgood antics and hate admit it fell for it the movie is about teenager bacon who moves small town from the big city and discovers that dancing has been banned the local reverend lithgow he ends up falling for the preachers daughter singer and showing the whole town what the magic of dance can do as mentioned at the beginning of this review footloose is an extremely hokey and predictable teen drama there are virtually no surprises and the writing is secondrate so why did enjoy it so much for one thing the cast is great kevin bacon oozes charisma in an early role we are rooting for him right from the start and unlike most films of this genre bacon does not play him as the rebel without clue sort yes he does rebel but he is also polite when he needs be and he never broods the rest of the cast is equally impressive john lithgow seen here playing normal guy for change is playing man who would normally be flat out villian but lithgow plays him as concerned father who is trying do what he feels is best for his daughter the end of the we feel genuine sense of love and understanding between him and the lori singer character another nice touch is the music we see the parents of the kids complaining that the music they listen is filled sexual innuendos but that is not true at all the title track performed kenny loggins is upbeat and fun during the final sequence was overcome the urge get off the couch and start dancing of course soon realized that would be little pathetic anyway footloose is charming little surprise do not let the premise prevent you from watching it it sucked me in and it will do the same you

as walked out of crouching tiger hidden dragon thought myself that had had just seen great the passage of few hours tempered my enthusiasm and started pondering the question of whether masterpiece must implicitly be great piece of work and viceversa attempting make distinction may be matter of splitting hairs avoided commitment appealing etymology as the word implies masterpiece is any work embodies the skills of master as such it should suffice say that it is product of exceptional quality crouching tiger hidden dragon fits comfortably in that category crouching tiger hidden dragon immerses the viewer in an idealized world of oriental folklore the requisite blend of legend fantasy magic and mythology it is reminiscent of wagnerian epic characters might as well be halfgods greater than life purer than life stronger than life physically invincible and able accomplish superhuman feats but human soul that makes them ultimately vulnerable all the classic elements of the oriental mystique are thrown into the mix including the art of contemplation and the concept of martial dexterity as the physical equivalent of spiritual advancement the classic struggle between good and evil is the inevitable backdrop advanced masters of each and golden pupil must choose between the two it is the gifted pupil who under the influence of the evil master steals the holy grail in the form of magic sword is the focus of the conflict at the heart of the legend the elements of romance at two different levels of enlightenment pair of masters and pair of youngsters are poignantly represented the paradox of oriental restraint existing side side all consuming passion in the same breast is projected effectively the fight scenes are stunning balletic toursdeforce not be taken literally but clearly be enjoyed as superb cinematic art as are the prodigious leaps and flights from and between rooftops the martial combat at the top of swaying bamboo branches and the combatants skipping like pebbles along the surface of lake there need be no question of suspended disbelief when one is in the presence of poetry as in wagnerian opera there is substantial story line takes place at an ordinary human level yet the entire project is be accepted as work of art rooted in fantasy do not assume however that the art is limpwristed for those who are put off the art label this can be confidently recommended as engrossing entertainment at the levels of adventure action and romance there are no weak performances in this movie michelle yeoh imbues her character depth humanity and wisdom chow yon fat projects dignity and purity of heart zhang ziyi is budding superstar she is radiantly beautiful and totally persuasive in multifaceted role cheng pei pei as the evil master and chang cheng as the bandit prince acquit themselves admirably kudos screenwriters james schamus wang hui ling and tsai kuo jing choreographer yuen woping photography director peter pau and music director tan dun each of contribute quality components this extraordinary ang lee as the director coproducer and mastermind of the project gets the lion share of the credit this is destined be one of those films that everybody likes including those who hate martial arts movies do not miss it

crazybeautiful suffers from the damnedifyoudo damnedifyoudo not syndrome after spate of flighty cookiecutter teen films the romantic drama addresses alcoholism and parental loss along its love story but rather than applaud the production early reviews have dismissed it as an overblown afterschool special even worse in the wake of federal trade commission hearings that blasted the industry for marketing violent and sexual movies young people the studio got case of the heebiejeebies and forced director john stockwell reshoot scenes and cut footage tone things down needless say the filmmaker was frustrated we were trying make cautionary tale he told newsweek and we could not show the behavior we were trying caution people away from regardless the works thanks exceptional performances from its lead players and script determined transcend stereotypes crazybeautiful is quality fare good enough that halfexpected the summer movie crap police walk into the press screening and confiscate the print for failure incorporate explosions and poop jokes set in pacific palisades calif the story follows the burgeoning relationship between two teens every morning and evening carlos nunez jay hernandez takes twohour bus ride in order attend pacific high school an honor student and star athlete carlos is responsible modest and focused as he works on securing place in the naval academy all is well until he meets nicole oakley kirsten dunst the daughter of rich congressman bruce davison nicole is drunk apparently hellbent on selfdestruction carlos is smart enough recognize the danger in getting involved her but he is only human and she has the greatest smile plus as her father notes she has real knack for drawing others into her downward spiral as save the last dance crazybeautiful god how hate lowercase titles takes situations that look stale on paper and makes them seem fresh while noting the racial and social differences between the kids the screenplay dances around most of the clich there are still several mtv moments though the filmmakers make point give characters that crucial extra bit of shading that turns them into individuals instead of stereotypes and the actors take it from there cuteasabutton dunst forces the viewer share the pain beneath nicoles behavior she is credible enough that when dad urges carlos get away from her before she drags him down hoped the boy would listen as carlos hernandez is revelation hunky without looking like the product of design team the young man can really act we will see lot of this guy in the future aside from its title the biggest problem crazybeautiful is its ending wraps everything up too fast and too tidy after carefully presenting credible characters and situations the conclusion feels rushed and lazy still this is the kind of that deserves accolades from critics instead of cheap shots afterschool special my ass crazybeautiful is the real deal

everyone knows someone like giles death stuffy arrogant set in his ways and at war anything that could in any way be associated progress giles is writer but the product of his typewriter is the kind of scholarly stuff that is immediately put onto library stacks where it can gather dust until some graduate student needs another reference for his or her thesis his house looks like an immaculate museum no television microwave word processor or other technological gadgets only the electric lights betray that he is living in the twentieth century not the nineteenth this is the kind of role that could easily be turned into flat stereotype but john hurt in what is certainly his best performance in decade and possibly the most impressive of his long and distinguished career turns erstwhile fogy giles into threedimensional human being despite his tunnel vision it is impossible not like the man especially after his entire being is transformed that singular affliction no one is immune love and as giles discovers during the course of this amusing warmhearted motion picture it is possible find the object of ones affection in the most unusual places giles who is widower and recluse does not frequent the cinema but when he learns that an m forster is playing at the local theater he screws up his courage and decides go what he does not realize is that the movie house is showing two films the forster adaptation and teen exploitation flick called hotpants college ii nonplused giles ends up sitting in darkened room watching buff male and female bodies in various states of undress just as giles is about leave however he notices ronnie bostock jason priestley and suddenly it is love at first sight giles is enraptured and the moment hotpants college ii is over he beings scour stores for bostock memorabilia including teen magazines and video tapes in order watch those tapes giles must buy vcr but he initially does not realize that he needs tv use the vcr eventually not satisfied being the worlds foremost authority on bostock giles boards plane and travels long island where his idols home is located bostock is away when giles arrives but the wily englishman manages befriend ronnies supermodel girlfriend audrey fiona loewi eventually the actor arrives home and impressed giles demeanor and intelligence he begins rely on the older mans advice but while giles affection runs deep ronnies feelings are less constant love and death on long island is comedy and very funny one at that in fact for its first half the is nearlyperfect it suffers falloff once giles reaches new york and the ending its nonetoosubtle homosexual overtones is little too overbearing for the lighthearted material that precedes it in his gently satirical approach popular culture and movie stardom writerdirector richard kwietniowski adapting from the novel gilbert adair is on target in the process he not only creates truly likable and memorable character in giles but says few things about the transforming power of love even if it is unrequited from start finish this is clearly hurts movie he is in almost every frame it is role that the veteran actor must have relished because he makes giles an unforgettable motion picture figure and does so means of dialogue delivery body language and everchanging facial expressions jason priestley cashing in on his beverly hills image is surprisingly effective as the shallow ronnie he is charismatic and it is not hard understand why giles is attracted ronnie meanwhile solid support is provided the appealing fiona loewi and the alwaysreliable maury chaykin love and death on long island is many things wrapped into one social commentary it tackles the thorny issue of as pure art versus as mindless entertainment buddy picturelove story ronnie and giles have one of the most interesting relationships found anywhere on movie screen these days and fish out of water tale victorian relic giles forced into the modern world yet despite the many laughs love and death offers it never takes cheap shots it has vibrant beating heart and that makes the comedy all the more worthwhile

for many people procrastination is not problem overcome it is high art we will do just about anything put off task when the deadline for this column nears it is the only time during the week dishes get washed and the bed made and laundry done and plants watered and eventually hopefully sometimes there is breakthrough and we actually get down work amazingly it is almost always easier than we dreaded and after finishing that sense of oppressive apprehension melts away and then the next time we do it all again english professor grady tripp michael douglas is master seven years ago his first book was hit he is been working on his second short page piece since then fearful that he cannot live up the first he cannot bring himself finish it no writers block he is nearing pages no end in sight now he is having particularly difficult day the colleges annual writers conference is bringing in accomplished novelists reminding tripp that other people are finishing _their_ books during the first day his wife has left him his married girlfriend informs him she is pregnant and his agent is in town sixfoot transvestite in tow the evening our besieged writer is driving though the snowcovered streets of pittsburgh suicidal student beside him stolen jacket that marilyn monroe wore on her wedding day in the back seat and murdered blind dog stuffed in the trunk this could be pivotal point in his midlife crisis and then there is the next morning there is lot like about this movie there are no huge explosions shattering glass or computergenerated dinosaurs distract from the very real human issues grady is caught up in the curse of people who accomplish great things early in their career in the world of what have you done for me lately he knows his second book has be better than his first instead of finding out he drifts comfortable in the insular cocoon of academic peter panhood he does not have much of life and neither does his star pupil james leer tobey maguire james may be suicidal and psychotic certainly everything that comes out of his mouth is lie he makes up past of working clash anguish because the truth of wealth and comfort just is not interesting enough as the weekend progresses they are both forced fully engage life that is the question they must face comfort or real experiences the takes some interesting chances nontraditional relationships are presented as matteroffact extramarital gay interracial professorstudent here they are not judged merely choices the actors are all firstrate douglas triumphs playing against type as he spends most of his time disheveled unshaven and clad in pink womens house robe maguires disengaged alienation works perfectly here robert downey jr as gradys agent livens up his scenes director curtis hanson a confidential makes few missteps the women are underused frances mcdormand does good job of her limited role of sara gradys married lover but we never understand much of who she is the chemistry between the two of them is nonexistent makes some of the ending unconvincing katie holmes is student major crush on the professor but her character goes nowhere we never even see gradys exiting wife this is very much guys the varied relationships between the men are much more convincing than any of the others gradys alternating mentoring and rejection of james is the centerpoint of the not him and sara as the boomers age expect see more midlife crisis films catch the attention of that demographic eventually it will probably become cliche but right now we have got winner will finish this in second right now have grab some paint noticed some trim in the other room that needs little touchup michael redman has written this column for so long that he is made midlife crisis career choice

meet joe black reviewed on nov starring brad pitt anthony hopkins claire forlani in meet joe black brad pitt plays death that is all that really needs be said but nevertheless will provide the three of you that have seemingly been living in cave plot description death decides take holiday what all the rigors of soulcollecting and all and forces anthony hopkins into showing him what it is like be human death assumes the body of brad pitt and from there much trouble ensues for one thing deathaspitt falls in love hopkins daughter played claire forlani obviously this enrages hopkins because really what can death offer besides eternal damnation of course there is also subplot about forlanis exboyfriend she dumps him for pitt trying take over hopkins company meet joe black runs just under three hours have always thought that such obscene running times should be limited historical epics meet joe black is neither historical nor is it an epic though get the feeling martin brest the director desperately wants it be every single scene in the movie goes on about minutes too long and the ending takes about minutes longer than it really should severe editing job could have made this movie excellent instead of just good is what it is pitt an actor normally loathe is actually quite engaging as death believed his performance and could see why forlanis character would fall in love him have agree roger ebert though who found it hard believe that an entity that is been around for all time would not know what peanut butter was that has nothing do pitts performance of course but it is little distracting hopkins gives his usual excellent performance he is able portray the angst of man who knows he has very little time left without making him an obnoxious whiner and in her first major studio role claire forlani is surprisingly good she has sweet tenderness that allows the audience instantly root for her so meet joe black is good movie hampered it is ridiculous running time had the been cut an hour or so have no doubt that would be calling it one of the best movies of the year in this review

call it touched demon gregory hoblit is fallen is serial killer movie an unusual horrific twist if marketed properly this could have crossover appeal for both those who appreciate supernatural tales like the prophesy and those who crave grim dark thrillers like silence of the lambs and seven in fact there is even little twin peaks be found here albeit the lions share of the weirdness distilled out remember bob the biggest failing of fallen is that although it is consistently interesting it is not always as edgy and suspenseful as one might hope serial killer elias koteas has been on the loose in philadephia but detective john hobbes denzel washington the noblest man on the police force has brought him justice now during his last hours on death row awaiting his inevitable date the gas chamber the mass murderer cryptically tells hobbes what goes around really goes around shortly thereafter he begins sing time is on my side as he is taken on his last walk minutes later the state of pennsylvania has carried out the execution and edgar reese is dead but for hobbes the nightmare is just beginning because reese was not normal psychopath he was the host body for mythical dark angel named azazel and reeses death azazel is free hop from body body murdering and wreaking havoc at will only hobbes and pretty female theology teacher embeth davidtz have an inkling of what they are up against the rest of the cops including hobbes partner jonesy john goodman lou james gandolfini newcomer the department and lieutenant stanton donald sutherland do not have clue and as result they are in mortal danger as depicted hoblit primal fear and cinematographer newton thomas sigel philadelphia is dark dreary place gothic city rather than modern one no skyscrapers or other monoliths of current architecture or technology are shown the most famous landmark appear is not the liberty bell or independence hall it is genos steaks shadows and night scenes abound the days are cloudy and unpromising this is the kind of setting where it is easy believe that fallen angels walk among men fallens plot is brimming potential not all of is realized somehow would have expected more frightening tale emerge from something this kind of premise but the level of terror like that of gore is kept in check nevertheless there are several creepily effective scenes as the spirit of azazel moves from body body when people bump against each other on crowded city sidewalks the also boasts chase sequence of kind that can best be described as unusual of the several dozen actors play azazel the best is far elias koteas exotica crash who despite only being on screen for about ten minutes gives fantastically charged performance john goodman also seems be enjoying himself although his role for most of the is relegated that of burly sidekick sadly however these two are the only ones who excel everyone else including denzel washington is boring washingtons flat performance is the most disappointing surprise of the it is not that he is bad per se but he is not very interesting there is no real sense of vulnerability or desperation in the way he portrays his character and that keeps us distanced however slightly from hobbes as circumstances become progressively more dire for the cop and as his lifeordeath chess game azazel approaches the point of checkmate expected be more on the edge of my seat than was washingtons subdued approach is part of the reason for this never felt sense of urgency however at least washington was believable is more than can be said for embeth davidtz schindlers list and donald sutherland be fair the flaws in their characters are not all actingrelated neither stanton nor gretta milano are wellwritten that said however there is nothing inspired about either davidtzs or sutherlands work both appear be sleepwalking their way through the parts as if they know that their contribution the is one of advancing the plot rather than developing multidimensional individual narratively fallen has few glaring weaknesses although the plot proceeds convoluted gamelike structure it uses denzel washingtonsupplied voiceover overexplain matters at times this is actually helpful and it has use beyond the obvious but there are occasions when ponderous lines like like the night sometimes you come face face yourself become little hard swallow in addition fallen is saddled the same kind of disgustingly bland generic theology embraced numerous movies and tv shows like touched an angel however despite the negatives am still recommending fallen on the strength of its complex plot and especially its ending loved the final scenes are startling audacious and unexpected it is not often that plot development takes me surprise the way this one did at time when most movies fall apart in the last ten minutes fallen manages buck the trend and redeem itself this is not great motion picture but considering how bad most january releases are it is reasonably entertaining way spend two hours and whatever you do do not walk out on the before the end credits have begun roll
